title: Cheap and skimpy
text: Do not waste your time coming here. They tend to be very skimpy when it comes to your food. I paid for two beef, cheese & rice burritos which the cook put about 5 pieces of rice in each burrito! I called to speak with the manager and he said it was a mistake (yeah right) and that he wouldn't charge me for rice on my next order! He should've been offering two new burritos, if that's the best you can do, I will not be back! Also, they limit you on the salsa to go, you only get one per burrito and it's only a teaspoon.  Terrible and cheap! Try other places that believe in giving you your money's worth.

title: Nice Place with a View
text: Good food at reasonable prices. the menu is large, breakfast all day. i had the chile relleno, it was ok, a lot more breading than i'm used to, out weighed the small chile inside.  probably a regional take? . my wife had huevos rancheros and liked it very much. the building is a bit older but has a great view overlooking Quail Lakes.. pleasant service, was very busy with take out.

title: Great Service
text: Service was fast & efficient. Food was hot & tortilla  fresh and flavorful. Shrimp salad was fresh & tasty. Beer was ice cold. View was great.

title: Decent Mexican retaurant caters to locals
text: Nice local restaurant.  I was from out of town and it seemed like I didn't get as much attention as those who were local.  The food was pretty good and the overall experience was much better than the large chain Mexican restaurant a few blocks away.  Will visit again if in town.

title: Stockton's finest
text: I recently visited Stockton visiting  family and friends after being away for 10 years a must have is Arroyos  restaurant. I have been a loyal customer since the 70's and have followed them when they relocated. Yes the food is that good,the homemade  tortillas fresh salsa available in medium and hot. This food is made with love of three generations. I recommend  the combination plate with the beef taco,chili relleno and beef enchilada,the gravy is good enough to jump through a plate glass window without breaking it. Over the years I have tried every dish at least twice and have  come to this choice.If your in a rush try the beef,bean and cheese burrito filling and fast made with love.I have been to thousands of restaurants all over the world tried cuisine in Mexico and Arroyos is 5 star in satisfaction and taste bud joy

title: I enjoy the Vegie Burger
text: Just tell them to be sure to include the onions and pickles.  The regular burgers are yummy also and the ice cream cones are a real deal.

title: Cold food
text: I must give up coming to this location!  They take the order so far from the pay window, approx 40+ cars in line.  By the time I get my hamburger it is COLD!  I have mentioned to order takers, no response from them.  If only, they would take orders when maybe 10 cars ahead! I give up!

title: Excellent
text: Excellent In-N-Out Burger. Reasonably fast and very friendly service. I see no point in the Drive-Thru. Cars were lined up on to the main road. I walked in, ordered, and was served within 6 minutes.

title: In N Out is always GOOD
text: In N Out is always GOOD Really good fast food And it is always fast and good Best burgers,, I always asks for them to make my fries very crispy

title: good food
text: Good food affordable prices and friendly service floors always filthy i seen a bum right out front of their door he wasnt eating so he had no bussines being there I really like their food so i give it a five.

title: Not very good patio closes early
text: Patio closes at 6 pm why so early nice outside it's a beautiful evening July 9 th 2025 5:09 pm patio closed at 6 pm young man said sorry closing patio. I said you close at 9:30pm why does patio close so early doesn't get dark til 8 pm I'm a business owner and this is unprofessional. shortsalesmit@gmail.com Frances Bazan

title: Embarrassing Customer Service
text: At about 1:30 this afternoon I visited the store on March Lane with my wife and got a cup of coffee I sat in the lobby for one hour drinking the coffee and I decided to get a refill I went to the register and asked the lady at the register whose name I don’t know to give me a refill but to my surprise she told me that I was not sitting in the lobby so she told me she couldn’t give me one I told her a couple of times that I was sitting in the lobby but still she didn’t believe me she went in and asked a colleague in the back room and the colleague confirmed that I came earlier and I was sitting in the lobby That was very embarrassing A manager came and apologised about what happen I felt so embarrassed that I used to visit that store everyday but not anymore My name is Jihad Basma and my phone number number is 2093199098

title: Cold
text: Coffee was bitter and service was ok. Anti-2nd amendment. Pastry was too sweet & just so-so. Clean & neat.

title: I love the feeling of welcomeness
text: Man awesome employees here and surprisingly young employees and so patient and respectful here. Absolutely loved how fast the drive threw was to. All around 100 stars!

title: Great Latte
text: We ordered 2 latte's off the app and when we pulled into the store everything was ready on the counter. Super service.

title: My parents had gone there for years!
text: We drive from Turlock to have a great meal! Food is always excellent!  Homemade desserts if you can order before they  run out! We always enjoy  ourselves all seasons of the year! NEVER A BAD EXPERIENCE!!

title: Go! You won’t be disappointed!
text: We had heard about this place recently and had to check it out. We were not disappointed. The food was exceptional and the service outstanding. Love the homey vibe of the place and the decor.

title: Never rated a business so low in my life…
text: We were enjoying some food and a drink earlier this evening and upon attempting to order a fernet to finish off our meal,  the bartender asked who was driving and wouldn’t let us place the order. No one was drunk, we were peacefully enjoying our treats, I hadn’t even drank 20% of my drink. She may have been going through something personal because when I asked her name, she raised her eyebrows, swung her head, and raised her voice to say, “Would you just like to talk to the manager?!” We accepted the offer, but regardless, will never return. So sad. When we first arrived and ordered our initial drinks, the patrons that left the seats we took were bragging about drinking a whole bottle of Don Julio 70 between the two of them along with the same bar tender. At that point, the bartender accidentally took our full drinks and dumped them. So we mentioned the error and she supplied replacements. As I said, I didn’t drink mine and my husband finished his by the time of her episode. The manager explained they had just had some ABC training and they were buckling down. This would be entirely understandable. However, the bar tender’s  judgement was misplaced and targeted. That, in addition to her horrendous decorum, has destroyed the establishment’s rapport with us.

title: Great Steak!
text: The pricing is about right for the proportion size of what you order. The atmosphere is an older style mom'n'pop restaurant. The staff was real good and professional. The location is more towards the outskirts of Stockton and seems to bring in a lot of locals. The wine list has a few local wines from Lodi and a few others. The wait times could be improved, but overall a great place to dine.

title: It was fun
text: Menu was varied, local wines & beers. Staff was pleasant and helpful. Food tasted good and plenty of it. There was a short wait on Saturday night, but not terrible. Place was a bit noisy for our tastes, but we are in the "senior citizen" category. Not really unusual for a "sports bar" atmosphere.

title: Good food and excellent server
text: Hot and delicious food. Excellent server—Sam Decent-sized booth Music TOO Loud Bathrooms need cleaning and attention.

title: They're Trying
text: Some interesting sounding appetizers enticed us to check this place out. Furikake fries: unusual Japanese spices served with two uncommon sauces, quoth the menu.  Blah.  Flavorless.  Sauces seemed mostly like ketchup with a bit of BBQ sauce and a mayo.  Unconsumable. BUT...the wood oven baked Khachapuri was quite tasty, although it could have used a much bigger dose of garlic and butter.  Again, unusual, with, of all things, a soft egg yolk proudly in the center.  Now, HOW this item appeared on what is a pretty standard fare menu is anyone's guess. The "Ora" king salmon was perfectly cooked and served on a plentiful bed of mixed vegetables.  Would be enhanced with some balsamic glaze, and that could be served in a cup on the side. The pineapple crisp dessert was another item that sounded great but whose execution left lots to be desired.   Topped with a rubberized piece of pineapple that could have served well as a drain closure.  Ice cream was OK, but they left the crisp off the crisp.  Oh, well... Pleasant, helpful, and attentive service personnel. Limited and not outrageously priced wine and beer offerings; easy free parking. Restroom could use some policing.

title: Everything delicious
text: Recommended by the Courtyard by Marriott front desk, I had a nearly perfect sumptuous dinner at Market Tavern.  Loved the choices of by the glass wines.  My Duckhorn Merlot was delicious!  Was in the mood for steak, and the kitchen totally delivered. I decided to eat in the bar as a solo, and they had good sports choices on multiple TVs. The bar was doing a fine business.  Portions are very generous.  My ribeye steak was perfectly cooked medium rare, exceptionally tasty, and a perfect accompaniment to the wine.  It came with two side dishes, great steamed broccoli and garlic mashed potatoes.  Amazing flavors!  Again all portions were huge! Highly recommend this restaurant and so pleased to experience it during my one, and possibly only, visit to Stockton.

title: Sunday roast dinner
text: A Sunday night, few places open, so we booked on spec. Sunday sirloin roast was excellent, perfectly cooked, with good veg and Yorkshire pudding

title: Always fresh and tasty.
text: Always friendly and a nice menu with very fresh ingredients. We came several times in the past and ordered the Salmon BLT. Salmon, crispy bacon, nice sauce on a brioche bun....delicious and served with choice of salad or fries. The salad is very fresh with crisp lettuce, cherry tomatoes and just very good. When you don't see the Salmon BLT on the menu (recently no longer listed), don't fret. Just ask for it and they will make it up for you. It is delicious. My wife also has had other sandwiches and they are all fresh and good.

title: Very noisy. not very Japanese
text: The noise level mood to be mentioned first. We practally had to scream to talk to each other. Service was good with lots of staff. One person, possibly the sushi chef or restaurant owner was Asian. The rest of the staff and the cooking style had a big Mexican influence. We had a tuna with avocado and jalapeño roll. Also spicy ramen. I liked it but had indigestion afterwards which is a first for Japanese food. The tempura was very greasy. I do not recommend his restaurant.

title: Great Service
text: Wanted try new place & enjoyed my meal here. Had spicy tuna & it was D-lish!! Edamame was perfect & beer was cold. Will return.

title: Wonderful spot for memorable sushi!
text: Wait staff not very attentive, ran out of water twice had to ask for more. Was not warned how Spicy the three spicy rolls I ordered were-if there’s a jalapeño next to roll be warned it’s hot, had a hard time finish rolls, food was excellently prepared and fresh! Highly recommend this place for sushi and appetizers were big and unique.

title: Lunch with a Dear Friend
text: My friend chose this place for us to meet for lunch.  I loved the Teriyaki Salmon dish I ordered.  The atmosphere was great, too!

title: Sushi!
text: If you love sushi then you’ll love Cocoro!  Great and Authentic sushi and Japanese cuisine for anyone who loves this type of food, can’t go wrong!

title: Prime Table is the best.
text: First time visit. Ambiance was very nice. Shauna was our server and she greeted us with a smile. She was knowledgeable, and kept our drink glasses were always filled. She bagged our leftovers individually, labeled and dated them. The food was incredible. We had their prime rib and it was impressed.

title: Excellent experience
text: We had an amazing Thanksgiving dinner here. Not one person in our family had a single complaint about the food or service. The food was delicious and the service is incredible.

title: High-priced excellence
text: The food here is amazing. Everything prepared to perfection. The baked potato was huge and the steak was cooked perfectly. The only issue is the price is astronomical. The porterhouse steak was $110. Table surface was superb.

title: Nice evening
text: Small, comfortable, a tad dark inside.  Great efficient service, nice bar selection, and we enjoyed the shrimp cocktails and prime rib. Good portion cooked to perfection. Sides were also good. You get what you pay for...

title: This restaurant has slipped.
text: This restaurant has slipped since the last time we visited. Both food and service leave much to be desired. Two different steaks were still quite good, but a Caesar salad on the menu with Little Gem lettuce was ordinary romaine and in two “cut it yourself” slabs. Service was lackadaisical, wave and wave to get your server, drinks wrong, wrong steak sauce. Large slice of roast beef looked nice, but why swimming in a deep pool of beef broth? That is not “au jus”. The Japanese fries are just OK, most steak places have better, crispier, or matchstick, etc. “Loaded” baked potato was certainly that, if you are into a thousand calorie smothered vegetable. Curiously meager wine list with few cabs, the preferred steak wine of many people. So all and all if you’re looking for a NY or Las Vegas steakhouse experience, this is not even close.

title: Good spot for lunch
text: On a whirlwind tour of San Francisco for visiting relatives, we stopped here for lunch.  It was a lovely afternoon, and we really appreciated the view of the sea lion docks and bay from the dining room.  Service was wonderful, very friendly and attentive.  Our food was good.  I had the salmon burger with fries.  It was quite tasty.  We also tried the pulled pork sandwich, very good.  Prices were reasonable for touristy San Francisco.  I would return next time I'm playing tourist in the city.

title: Pier 39 Pier Market
text: Delicious sea food if you like sea food you must try here. Very kind waitress, clean, and good price. You can share a plate

title: Sadly not a good experience
text: Visiting Treasure Island for the first time in 50 years . Had heard so much about the new development and a new waterfront park , had to visit . Took the ferry from San Francisco and it’s just a 10 minute ride with spectacular views.  An employee on the ferry told us about Mersea Restaurant and Bar and its unusual building of recycled rail cars . The restaurant looks like an indoor outdoor restaurant with fabulous views . It’s not a regular sit down restaurant , you order at the counter and your food is delivered to your table .  We ordered two Fish and chips and one taco plate . The fish and chips were so sooo  greasy , so greasy that  they had to place napkins under the fish to absorb the grease . I have never had Fish and Chips brought to my table with a side of napkins under the fish before , the fish was flaky but had no flavor because of all the grease . The Fish and Chips are served with lemon and a curry tartar sauce that didn’t sit well with the fish at all . Who ever thought of that combination  should shelve it . .. the serving of chips from one order to the other was very inconsistent . My table mate received 6 chips under her fish and I received about 12 . What gives ?? My other table mate who ordered the tacos said they were just below average and wouldn’t order those again if he returned . He is Hispanic and disappointed that these taco were actually recommended . The salsa was commercial bought and not  homemade as you might expect from a restaurant that is touted as original . The indoor ambience is just what you might expect of a stripped down rail car… boring. The employees are friendly but distant and they never check up on you . If you want water you get it yourself . The island needs more options as Mersea is just an average restaurant with mediocre food . The food does not come out at the same time one table mate received her fish and chips 15 minutes before the next food arrived …. Forget the 4 and 5 stars !  The island is in a food desert unfortunately .

title: Fantastic San Francisco Lunch Spot with Top-Notch Hospitality
text: We came here with a large group to celebrate a team member's promotion, and even though we hadn't given the restaurant a heads-up (on a busy Friday as Fleet Week was kicking off, no less!), the owner and her team couldn't have been more accommodating. The owner and her team welcomed us warmly, found space for our group, and made sure everyone was comfortable and well taken care of throughout the night. The service was attentive without being rushed, and you could tell they genuinely cared that we had a great experience.  They even brought out additional umbrellas and helped move them around to protect us from the bright sun that day. The atmosphere was lively and inviting--exactly what you want for a celebration--and the scenery, with that one-of-a-kind San Francisco backdrop, made it even better. A big thank you to the staff and owner for turning what could've been a logistical headache into a wonderful, memorable lunch for our team! We'll definitely be back.

title: Delicious brunch & friendly vibes!
text: Everything was delicious, fresh, and exquisitely presented, and I had the best breakfast here. From the minute we arrived, the personnel made us feel very welcome and very nice. Beautiful interior decor, ideal for unwinding before a full day of city exploration. I'm eager to return and would highly recommend!

title: Above
text: Another amazing experience today. Had tofu tacos and a latte. View of the bay from my seat only a few yards from the west shore of Treasure Island. And as always the staff was so friendly and helpful to this senior.

title: Special place to eat and drink on Treasure Island
text: Love, love this place for either personal or business. The west-facing restaurant has the prettiest view of downtown San Francisco imaginable. Food is creative but not fancy; reasonable prices, friendly staff. Eat indoors or out. And it's next to the new Treasure Island Park.

title: The most popular burger on the West Coast
text: In-N-Out Burger is to San Francisco and the West Coast what White Castle is to Chicago and the Midwest. It has been serving quality burgers, fries and shakes since 1948, when it established the first drive-through hamburger stand in California, in Baldwin Park, a Los Angeles suburb. Since then, In-N-Out Burger has opened 424 locations in nine western states. I stopped for lunch at the In-N-Out Burger location at 333 Jefferson Street in the Fisherman's Wharf and North Beach/Telegraph Hill neighborhoods. Open from 10:30 to 1 a.m. Sunday through Thursday and 10:30 to 1:30 a.m. on Friday and Saturday, it offers two versions of its signature burger that has satisfied customers for over 75 years. I ordered a double meat burger, two pure beef patties with lettuce, tomato and onions stacked high on a freshly baked bun and a double-double with two cheese slices, two beef patties, lettuce, tomato, onions and house spread on a toasted bun. With French fries and a chocolate milk shake.and

title: A well drilled operation and good food. And inexpensive
text: Although not particularly a fan of burgers we gave this place a try. The visit was made better as we managed to get a table. With the volume of customers that isn't guaranteed. The quantity and quality of food was very good. Watching the throughput of customers and speed of operation [very slick] was impressive. And obviously very popular as one early evening we saw the queue [line] from order counter to door and some yards down the street.

title: Clearly recommended
text: Whilst the ambiance is not the best - a bit too busy and acoustically unfavourable) I clearly recommend to go as the food is extra tasty, the service perfect and relaxed-friendly at the same time.

title: Perfect Asian fusion experience
text: Benu is an over the top Asian fusion restaurant in downtown San Francisco.  The meal is a prix fixe experience with 3-4 pre—meal appetizers.   Then the menu is superb, it includes pheasant, lobster, quail and abalone.   Dessert is a yuja sorbet with chocolate swirls.  The service is the best ever - everything was done perfectly and every dish was explained perfectly.  A good wonderful dinner and experience.

title: Fantastic Asian cuisine
text: Benu was fabulous. I had rarely visited a fine dining Asian restaurant but all the food here was genuinely faultless. From a plump sea urchin starter to a delicious fish dish to delicate desserts, the kitchen clearly knows how to create elegant and flavourful dishes. This was one of the best Michelin starred restaurants I've been to. The restaurant is led by Corey Lee, who for a long time was the head chef at Thomas Keller's 3 Michelin-starred restaurant, 'The French Laundry' in Yountville.

title: 3-star yes - but no glow
text: Is Benu a 3-star restaurant?  For creativity, intelligence, dedication, flavours and sheer brilliance of the individual dishes, the answer is yes.  But I walked away feeling somewhat empty.  Reflecting on it, I think the dishes were individually brilliant but as a whole, it did not convey a sense of a journey or a story.  Modern Cali-Korean food is fine but where is it going?  And the service is not consistent and it was akin to a bistro service.  For the sort of cash Benu is asking for, the front of house needs to be improved significantly.  If this restaurant was in France, it would have lost 2 stars for the patchy service.

title: Best of the best
text: This is the, not one of, but the finest restaurant in the country.  It's every bit as creative as a 3 star restaurant in France.  Corey Lee's melding of local ingredients with Asian fusion sauces, marinades and soups are so brilliant.  It is costly as one would expect a 3 star Michelin to be, but worth it.  The service is perfect, attentive without being cloying. I cannot recommend it more highly. We've lived in France many times, and I feel that we're blessed to have such a treasure locally.

title: A Classic San Francisco Dining Experience
text: We had a memorable dining experience with our friends.  We were greeted by name as we arrived for our reservation. Sherry ushered us to our table.  The wait staff was efficient, attentive, yet unobtrusive.  The Sommelier, Aaron recommended the wine pairings for our selected dinner menus (all different choices for the four diners). All the pairings were superb.  We truly enjoyed the meal and the wine.  I highly recommend this restaurant for a special occasion evening, or any evening when you want to have a memorable dining experience.

title: Flawless dining experience
text: We were blown away by the food, service and ambiance in this legendary spot. It took a while for us to get here but it was worth the wait. Service from Aran was exemplary, so genuine, friendly and knowledgeable. Food was stunning from Scallops to Lobster risotto to steak and lamb dishes. Full of subtle flavours and all very generously portioned. The cheese selection was heaven!! We have been lucky to eat in quite a few starred restaurants including several in Edinburgh and London some of which are owned by Gordon Ramsay. What I can promise is that the food at GD blew the others away no contest. Get your act together Michelin and return the star pronto.

title: Great Evening
text: We have been here a few times and always enjoy our evening.  This time we came for an anniversary and it was special.  Great food.  Great Service.  No complaints about the most important elements of a restaurant.  My only small issue (and cause for four rather than five stars) is the proximity of the tables.   There were two tables on either side that were extremely close so that we had to listen to the conversations of both parties all night.  Not perfect for an anniversary situation.

title: Still A Star
text: Over 7 years since my last visit and this wonderful restaurant still does not disappoint. All the elements  - service, ambiance, meal - were harmoniously excellent. In particular, my filet and chocolate soufflé were both amongst the best I have ever had. This is now my official  "Go To" in San Francisco.

title: French Classic Intimate Ambiance
text: We've been meaning to come here for a while and finally made the leap. So glad we did! We figured the only way to better understand San Francisco's culinary fine dining history was to trace it right back near the start. Chef Gary Danko was among the early wave of James Beard Award winning chefs in San Francisco and later became part of the first generation of Michelin-starred chefs in the city once the Michelin Guide began rating San Francisco restaurants. I've read some Yelp reviews calling his food "old school". After our experience there, I'd say it's more of a throwback to the golden age of fine dining. You won't find trendy hyper-local experimental cuisine with designer eatable floral pedals in mini Japanese pottery and expensive foam that pretends to be flavor. Instead you'll find a rolling cheese cart, white tablecloths, impeccable service and sauces that use classic French techniques (béarnaise, fumets, veloutés). All paying homage to classic French cooking. The menu offers 3, 4, or 5-course prix‑fixe menu with ample choices in each category. We chose the 3 and 4. We enjoyed every dish. Stand Outs: Roast Lobster with Potato Purée, Edamame, Peas, Asparagus, and Tarragon Jus - Tender lobster, nicely seasoned and comforting potato purée and velvety tarragon jus. The Glazed Oysters with Osetra Caviar. So good! I could've eaten 3 more. Plump perfectly cooked oysters topped with a generous amount of Osetra caviar nestled in a silky leek fondue and a light lettuce cream. Buttery but not rich and with a wonderful briny ocean finish. Filet of Beef with Potato Gratin, King Trumpet Mushrooms. Tender and juicy that paired perfectly with the bone marrow béarnaise. The Horseradish Crusted Salmon: We had questions - how is a "horseradish" crust so airy and fluffy? Then we consulted with our server who spilled the beans. It's the Egg Whites folded in with the horseradish.  Add a tangy grain mustard sauce to balance the rich salmon, and you've got an old-school French combo. IMHO, in today's flavor landscape, mustard doesn't get enough love. Let's talk dessert!! Pastry Chef Killian Guillotin grew up in Brittany, France, and  cut his teeth in top French kitchens before sharing his magic here. The Baked Chocolate Soufflé with two sauces. Light as a cloud with just enough rich-sweetness to say dessert's in the house. And don't get me started with the vanilla bean crème anglaise and Belgian chocolate sauces. Worth every calorie!! Is Gary Danko old school? Maybe. But in the way your favorite vintage wine is old. Complex, full bodies, and full of finesse . Happy Eating!!

title: Great experience
text: It was a great experience I went there with my family and we love it. It was amazing hospitality and super fresh food. Highly recommended

title: peaceful place
text: great relaxing place to have a morning coffee with a fresh pastries free wifi and friendly welcoming service. thanks..

title: Cute spot for an early dinner
text: My husband, daughter and I visited for an early dinner. Staff were super friendly and helpful & the food was delicious. We will return!

title: Nice
text: Great drinks. Good croissants. Bagel was chewy, but good. Nice location. Open good hours. Friendly staff.

title: HORRIBLE
text: Overpriced, horrible food and customer service.  They make their own hours and open/closed whenever they pleased.

title: Calming and amazing!
text: I got the black & white cookie for dessert and it was great! The quality of their service was amazing because they gave out dishes to your table. The interior was also very calming and dim (but not pitch black) and vintage-like. They had a variety of many foods for different times (breakfast, brunch, lunch, dinner, dessert, and drinks). I suggest you go here with your friends for a nice chat or small meal!

title: Quality food in a down at heel area.
text: Pause Cafe was a surprise highlight on our whistle stop weekend break in New York. We arrived there 11.30am we both ordered the sandwiches, me chicken & avocado salad & my son had bbq chicken sandwich, we drank their lemonade. We sat outside, it was a beautiful sunny morning, the area does not look up to much. However the food was really tasty, very nicely presented and good value. We would both highly recommend Pause Cafe as a venue with good quality food.

title: Cosy and perfect
text: Great avocado toast, hot chocolate to die ! The bagels too are good! We would be back again! The washroom too was very clean and beautifully decorated. Yes, we noticed ;)

title: EXCELLENT on every level
text: Fantastic Moroccan flaired food!! Really got down to the coffee. Try the SHAKSHUKA! And sons of those incredible baked goods! One more bathroom would make the place perfect! But honestly it's Terry dammed perfect. Shout out to the friendly staff who are competent and knowledgeable.

title: Avoid this place
text: I visited Nusr-Et in Istanbul and had an excellent experience, so I was expecting something similar from this branch — but it fell far short. The service was very poor, and the meal was wildly overpriced. The staff lacked professionalism and attention, which made the entire experience disappointing. Management should seriously address the service quality. Overall, I felt scammed. Not recommended at all. Avoid this place.

title: Overrated
text: When we arrived we had to wait for our table which we didnt mind and was told to wait at the bar, but this was soooo busy and struggled to get to the bar. Kids sat at the bar too which we didnt like. Got our table which was near the bar and had people banging into us. My partner asked the woman at the reservations desk if we could move to the other table of two which had just been set up and got told if we want to wait an hour and  a half for a new table then we can but otherwise we had no choice but to sit there!!!! We was not happy about this as she was rude with it. Our server was lovely couldnt fault her (didnt catch her name) and the food was average. Once we got our bill we was shocked at the price as we have had nicer and better service for less.

title: Great food let down by chaotic service
text: Great location, light and airy and terrific food. However, the service was shambolic - like a modern day Fawlty Towers. My guest and I were given different menus - one the correct lunch menu and one the incorrect menu. Two separate members of staff took our drinks orders and neither order turned up. It was a great ambience for a business lunch and I loved the food. However, it is the poor service that I will remember most. Especially when I also ate in Manhattan cafes and lower budget restaurants where the service was exceptional.

title: Disappointing special occasion
text: Firstly the food was excellent. We had the set menu Steak Tartare and Striploin (fatty but to be expected) and Sticky Toffee Pudding. We thoroughly enjoyed the food, there was a nice busy ambience and feel to the restaurant. We were close enough to a window to have a view of the park. Visiting from England and Abu Dhabi we were celebrating my daughters 21st birthday. Every other place we have been to in New York have acknowledged this and we have loved the welcoming feel. The Bluebird dinner was the real big event for us and we were soo disappointed with the service. We were greeted with a ‘Yes’ I almost wanted to apologise for being there. The maitre d walked away without speaking to us - we kind of figured we should follow! Most restaurants begin with a Good Evening and Welcome at the very least. A waiter asked if we wanted water (we later noticed everyone else having tap water) and swiftly brought a bottle of still. No smile, no niceties, no welcome. Next our server came to us, perfectly amicable and perfunctory but no introduction or welcome. We ordered our food and drinks. Food came very quickly as starters were both cold. I asked a waiter if we could have our drinks, he explained they were busy. I explained this was a special occasion and so far it had been less than special. To his credit a few minutes later the drinks appeared. We received our steaks and the manger noted we had no steak knives, which she quickly corrected. Mains cleared and deserts promptly brought out. When we had finished our desert our server asked if we wanted anything or just the check! By this time I was totally incensed. Let alone feel this was a special occasion, we were now feeling an inconvenience and she just wanted us to leave. 250 dollars for 2 - I at least expect to feel welcome. Perhaps I am wrong to expect a little more personalised attention at a restaurant of this standard. Clearly it is just a get them in and out and take their money business model. I did not leave a tip and funnily enough no one asked me if everything was ok for me to put my thoughts across at the end of the evening. A shame that such a special occasion will be tainted by a lack of attention and personal experience.

title: poor afternoon tea for a restaurant with London in its name
text: I didn't want to complain about this, because the staff members were all so great.  But our afternoon tea was overpriced and poorly prepared.  Nothing seemed to have been created in-house; the pastries were gummy and the chicken curry was unrecognizable.  The tea was made from a tea bag and only one was offered.  The view was stunning, of course, but it is difficult to have what feels like an elegant experience when the table top is so sticky.  Alas- very poor value and a big disappointment.

title: Mediocre
text: Came for dinner and took almost 10 minutes to locate the place. Really tucked away upstairs. On a Monday night, the restaurant was pretty dead - we were one of 4 tables. Albeit, the view from our table next to the floor to ceiling windows was lovely. Food was ok, overpriced for the basic offerings and portions. The Caesar salad was an interesting take and was probably the highlight of our meal. Our server was very friendly and accommodating but really focused on closing time/pushing us to order.

title: Groups get overpriced quotes
text: I understand that restaurants may be desperate to get  people to return back to their venues due to COVID but that should be all the reason for exemplary service.  I reached out to Bluebird for a group reservation for 14 professional women celebrating women's month. Due to the group size the planner mandated that we have the $75 prix fixe menu. 1st Issue: planner did not ask which appetizers, entrees and desserts we wanted to choose. 2nd Issue: if I ordered the appetizer, entree and dessert a la carte, the most expensive items totaled $67. Why is the prix fixe more expensive than ordering the same items a la carte? I informed the planner I want to sub out the meal options she chose for more appealng items on the larger menu. 3rd Issue: Bluebird priced the prix fixe with the new options I chose at $90. Meanwhile the most expensive items still totaled $67 if purchased a la carte! I complained and the planner said the upcharge is to ensure everyone's food comes out at the same time. That's bizarre! Is she implying Bluebird is not used to handling groups?  And why is there a $63 administrative charge in the contract?? Essentially Bluebird tried to charge $23 more per prix fixe meal per person plus the $63 admin fee equating to a $385 upcharge. Disappointing and poor service for a restaurant that I perceived as prestigious!!

title: Not Worthy of Michelin Star
text: I have long since disregarded Michelin ratings as reliable indicators of quality restaurants.  Such is the case of Artiete which has been awarded 1 star for multiple years although totally undeserving in my opinion.  Wife and I arrived 6:15pm last Saturday night and requested one of the many empty outside tables.  We were told they were all pre-reserved and were ushered to a table in the darkest area of the restaurant that already resembles a dungeon.  The hostess begrudgingly moved us to a more acceptable table.  As others have noted, the background music, which included Latin Rap, was oppressively loud.  We ordered the grouper and snapper dishes and both lacked taste and were otherwise undistinguishable. When the server asked our likings for dessert, I ordered flan and coffee.  The server indicated the coffee machine was broken and coffee was not available.  In over 70 years of restaurant dining, I never experienced a restaurant not being able to serve coffee.  So we left unfulfilled noting the outside tables were still vacant 1 1/2 hours after we first arrived.  $24 cocktails and limited expensive parking are further reasons one should patronize alternative restaurants.

title: Truly Unique and Delicious
text: This was the best restaurant experience my wife and I had in a while.  The experience was top notch from arrival to departure. Service was friendly, helpful,and attentive. Food was imaginative, beautifully cooked and presented.  Every dish, from amuse bouche to dessert had interesting flavors, quality ingredients, and lovely presentation. No dish was like anything we’ve had anywhere else. This is a kitchen with a truly unique (and delicious) point of view.

title: Barely worth the price
text: Oyster appetizer was really good. Chicken and snapper entrees were 5 out of 5s. Atmosphere was 5 out of 5. Our friends got the duck and really liked it. I thought it was tough but am not an aficionado. Service was 5 out of 5.

title: Amazing food great service.
text: What an amazing food. Authentic without any compromise. The Tacos are a must, we ordered a second portion and the Mai’s with wild crab is simply the best dish I had in a long time. This combined with an amazing service made this the best dinner during our trip in Miami. Thank you

title: Avoid…don’t be thrown by Michelin star!
text: Drinks took 20 minutes to get and they arrived only because we had to remind them we ordered them. Food was simply awful. The leek dish did not taste like leeks at all. Not sure what was inside the tortilla. The presentation is ugly. We ordered four dishes and left after two…90 minutes later…yes service was that bad! Skip this restaurant and go to Kokos down the street!

title: Complete miss - not Michelin Star worthy.
text: I was definitely let down by this Michelin Star restaurant. I expected higher quality food than what they are serving. I am allergic to cilantro, so I asked for the guacamole to be prepared without cilantro - apparently the chef told the server that the guacamole is premade so making a guacamole without the cilantro was not happening. If this is a Michelin star restaurant surely the chef behind the scene should be more than capable to make a guacamole without cilantro quickly and without hesitation…. but no… apparently this was too challenging for them - or maybe it was just laziness, I don’t know! After that I ordered the Al Pastor tacos, which were basic at best. The meat was dry, the tortilla was bland, and the taco itself lacked flavor. My husband ordered the egg tostada and that had far too much salt. On top of this they had us sat outside in the dead heat with leaves blowing all over our table and food off of the umbrella above. We chose not to order mains and left to find another place to dine. Disappointing. Surely if they keep up this they will not earn another star in the future.

title: Ignore the low ratings!
text: The low avg rating isn’t correct in our opinion. A few things: - This isn’t a Mexican restaurant. It’s meso-American centered around different types of corn. The head chef and all the kitchen staff are Colombian. - As expected for a Michelin starred restaurant, it was very inventive and we found almost every dish incredible. The flavors were complex and the presentation was amazing. The only exception was one dish (the catch of the day), which was too salty in our opinion, but that was an outlier of the 8 dishes we tried. The highlights were the tacos al pastor, smoked trumpet mushrooms, crab arepa, and carnitas. - The service was on point. Quick, friendly, and knowledgeable.

title: A food lover treat !
text: I’m not sure where to start! This is an exceptional restaurant from all aspects. Mexican food with a twist! The creativity and innovation in each plate we tried was beyond expectations. Lots of flavor with Mexican roots mixed and combined in a creative way. A wonderful culinary experience that explains why this gem earned one star Michelin. Needless to say that this restaurant is located in the vibrant coconut grove area. Staff was very friendly and service was great. Strongly recommended for food lovers!

title: Best Street Fajitas Ever!
text: My husband and I stopped in during our road trip to Key West. We sat outside and watched the beach and ocean while eating street fajitas and taco burgers. After we ate lunch we walked across the street to the beach and went down to the water.

title: Horrible
text: Horrible waitress pushed me to get the most expensive plate that I didn’t want. Very rude about it. And said couldn’t change it cause food was already making it. Absolutely never again. Food was also ehh

title: Riff of Miami not nice
text: I hope you read my review before you eat and not after as i did. Food average Told Happy hour ..but 2 beers still cost € $25 for 2 beers. Service 20% and we were shouted at tat we had to pay it. Not a good example of how to treat customers in your town AVOID AVOID AVOID. This has left a very bad impression of your town and your restaurant. Rip off

title: Expensive, pushy, uncomfortable experience.
text: Food was good, but way overpriced.  Server was very pushy and tried to get us to order things we didn’t want, would come back and try to get you to agree to getting more things she would suggest you should get. Guys standing and just watching the tables and telling staff to keep pushing stuff on patrons. Felt very uncomfortable and couldn’t get out fast enough. They also add 20% service fee to your bill and then the server asked for a tip also, said the other was for the kitchen staff, not her.

title: Over priced, poor quality and rude staff
text: The food was essentially poor quality and overpriced bar food. The happy hour only applied to the ridiculously large sugary drinks. The waitress was obnoxious and acted like a salesman. Visibility annoyed we didn’t order more than drinks and a few appetizers to share for a party of three in the early afternoon. Was overly pushing large portioned entrees and the large drinks to the point of uncomfortable dining. Hovered when signing the bill. Don’t go here!

title: Worst experience in Miami
text: Don’t look to the dress code, they are accepting people with sport trousers and you can see people directly came from gym. The man at the entrance knows nothing to choose the people. Gipsy kind of people are inside the place. After entering to the restaurant we’ve waited 30+ minutes at the bar for our reserved table to be ready which we reserved a month ago. When we were waiting we ordered cocktail and had the worst cocktail ever! Decoration is nice (only good thing of the restaurant) but the sound system is horrible as you only hear sub frequencies and cannot understand the music + noise of the people inside make it a jungle. Food is worse than average. You can have better chinese and japanese food even on the street. We ordered a bottle of wine and had just 3 quarter glasses from it and the waiter asked for more wine as he lost the bottle. Then we asked him to find and he found it after we pushed him to! We had worst experience in Miami!!

title: Regular
text: Very nice property to take pics lol Went for my friends birthday . We had to wait a couple minutes before being seated as it was full even though we had reservations.. Food was ok nothing over the top At the end of the night we had some good pics

title: Avoid here at All Costs
text: This McDonald's is One of the Worst Ones I have Been to Yet. I Ordered online before I left My Hotel, and 10 Minutes after I left, I Arrived. But I had to Wait 58 Minutes before They Finally Told Us we Needed to Ask for our Order. This Stupid McDonald's did not say when your order was ready, you had to Ask for it. This Took up 50 minutes of my time. 1 Star, Never Coming to this One Again.

title: Prioritize my bladder!!!!
text: Hello, I regret  to inform you that your staff needs to be engaged in coaching, due to the lack of attention to a female and I needing to use the restrooms after multiple attempts to utilize them. I was ignored by the first female and was given a puzzled look that they can't be opened. After I went around to seek attention from the other staff she rudely stated both bathrooms are not available, after I asked why she said " they just are ". I asked to see what would cause them to be unusable but could only feel discriminated as she added no urgency to the issue. She then asked if I was management to even request to see the inside of the bathrooms. As a LONG TIME CUSTOMER. I suggest to keep your client based loyal to address this issue as it leaves a bad image on the franchise. I left feeling "I didn't have it my way ". And that's just a bowl movement. Thank you for your time and I hope this matter has been addressed the next time I pass by the store as I will try to obtain pictures of the staff reluctant to assist. Best regards, JJ.

title: Ask for my ID because my order was $53 I 48 years old and not one has ever ask me for my ID at Mc Donald.
text: purchase 53 dollar in food. The store manager came up to the register and told me he need to see my I.D. I told him why do you need to see my I.d. Yandi the manager said its for my protection to see my ID. I ask if this is store policy. The manager said yes its store policy to ask for I.D. for any thing over 50.00 dollars. I said im almost 50 years old and Ive eating at Mc Donalds all my life and ive never heard of Mc Donald asking me for I.D. The manager was rude, argument, and nasty. I ask to see the store policy. He refuse. I told the manager that I bet your policy only applies to people that looks like us. 345 NE Second Ave Miami Flordia 33132 02-05-22. 10:05am number 307 Please review camera asap

title: Worst Ever
text: This was the worst McDonalds ever. Long lines, long waits, cold food and terrible service. Long lines and waits were due to the most disorganized and useless crew working. This place needs to fire everyone and do some training in management and service. Don't do it and find somewhere else to eat.

title: Miami McDonald's?  Rude, Dirty, Horrendous
text: Most of the McDonald's in this town are rude, dirty and horrendous, and this one is no exception.  Make you wonder why people would even buy food here.

title: Good but not deserving of a Michelin star IMO.
text: Went just last week.  Hadn't been in years.  Heard they got a Michelin star.  I have to question that a little having dined at Mich star restaurants.  They walk you thru the kitchen to the bar if you are early.  Could be cool.  But I'm not sure this is a wow you kitchen.  Then the bar and the most UN-Michelin thing I've seen.  Two of the guys ordered bourbon neat.  I think it was Blantons so a good one.  Both glasses were filthy.  Disgustingly dirty.  They pointed it out and the bartender simply poured the bourbon from the dirty glasses to two cleaner ones.  Not new pours.  NOT Michelin.  He tried to wipe the rim of my dirty wine glass with a bar rag as is in "a rag that was used to wipe the bar".  I asked for a new glass.  Once in the dining room, the food is good.  The team wait staff arrangement not as much.  Haphazard and disorganized.  Gumbo  had good flavor but was really just a brown roux gravy w nothing in it.  The boudin stuffed quail was good.  Maybe the ratio was too boudin forward.  And the dessert soufflé was a great take on a bread pudding that was made light w a nice layer of meringue.  They stress "jackets recommended".  Go all or nothing.  It wasn't the norm and the plastic perma inflated birthday "balloons" were a little Chucky Cheesy for me.  All in all....good.  But Michelin?  Not at all compared to others.

title: Perfection!
text: This is worth the extra effort to go.  It was perfection from beginning to end.  I couldn’t decide on the soup so our waiter brought me a trio of samples of the three on the menu.  So thoughtful.  We were there for jazz brunch on Sunday.  Great value for the price.  Be sure to walk the neighborhood afterwards.  So gorgeous.

title: Fantastic birthday celebration with family
text: We celebrated my husband’s birthday and the experience was phenomenal. We have dined at Commander’s once before but we brought our two teenaged kids with us this time. They enjoyed the experience as much as we did! I called ahead to confirm this was a birthday celebration, so they made note of my husband’s name. When we arrived the host immediately wished him a happy birthday by name. Each person that interacted with our table wished him a happy birthday. We had impeccable service throughout the evening. The service staff are a well-oiled machine! We had an incredible meal and it was a special way to celebrate!

title: Unforgettable
text: First time to New Orleans, and chef mentor and foodie Sensei insisted i go to Commander's Palace...he was not wrong, great ambiance, amazing service, although in New Orleans...southern hospitality is alive and well!. My server Joe from Honduras with his team Travis and Gwen, served me and treated me like a southern gentleman. Had the turtle soup and gumbo, perfect flavors and so rich. Had a braised short rib Appetizer on a fried pork skin with cream/sauce...perfect bite to prepare my pallet for my main. Pecan Crusted Fish with crab and finished with their infamous bread pudding soufflé. I was on cloud 9. food was amazing, wanted to lick my plate. I'll Always make time to visit Commanders Palace when i visit Louisiana in the future. hats off to the chef. Exquisite experience.

title: As good as you would expect
text: Grand dame of New Orleans restaurants. Services a 5+. Food is a solid 4. Pretty and elegant and reasonably priced for an amazing experience.

title: Good food, poor service
text: Unfortunately we have to give this restaurant three stars, despite the delicious food. We sat at the bar because we did not have a reservation. Bar staff, two young women working at Pesche each for one year, were unfriendly and surly, offering poor service and even to our surprise, rude comments. We ordered several appetizers and a whole redfish, but received zero service after a food runner brought the entree. We were ignored at the bar, asked several times for a drink but did not receive, and experienced very bad, unwelcoming service from these bartenders. We would not return, despite the extremely well prepared food. Thank you to the chef. Bartenders required more training and certainly a lesson in courtesy and manners.

title: This IS New Orleans
text: This is what I hoped New Orleans food would be. The gumbo had astonishing depth. Great big and briny local oysters.  Ground shrimp spicy noodles were perfectly balanced and not too hot, and high quality fried fish with a tasty sweet beer sauce.   A must in NO.

title: Overhyped and overpriced
text: Very average food. Much of the seafood plater was over salted or mushy. The other small plates we had (fried oysters, crab capellini and ground shrimp with noodles) were either bland or over spiced. I tried to order a bottle of white wine (the list is very overpriced) and the first bottle ended up being a red that was listed on the white menu and the second couldn’t be located. Service was good but the food was poor and well below New Orleans seafood standards.

Oysters were good, but the Tuna quality was terrible. It had white strings inside that were chewy. Couldn’t even cut it with a knife. It wasn’t just mine as my coworkers tuna was also like that. So many better places to get fish in NOLA, especially at 36 dollars. Won’t be going back.

title: Go else where….
text: Very expensive for what you get…. Had far better food for a lot less whilst in New Orleans, You are paying for the name…. Very loud live music, can not talk to one another it’s that loud….

title: No soap in the toilets!!!
text: An amazing collection of memorabilia and superb drinks, what a shame it is let down by basic hygiene standards!! A notice is displayed in the toilets instructing staff to wash their hands but how can employees or customers wash their hands effectively when there is no soap in the ladies toilets other than the disabled toilet!! Shocking!!

title: Food was very good but service needs some work
text: When we entry the restaurant no one greeted us or said anything to us. Few minutes later, we were told to follow him. I was not impressed with the service but the food was very good.

title: Predictable food, not the best service!
text: At the Hard Rock Cafe in New Orleans, the atmosphere is typical of the chain, but the experience was marred by unfriendly service; we only saw our waitress a couple of times. We chose this restaurant specifically for a fresh salad, as options on Bourbon Street tend to lean heavily toward gumbo, jambalaya, and étouffée, which wasn't what we were craving in the heat. Fortunately, the Cobb salad and southwestern bowl were both delicious and hit the spot. Despite the service issues, I would consider visiting again for the food.

title: What's not to like?!
text: We had lunch here - very nice. It's located in the heart of the French Quarter - stairs to climb if you want to view the area from above (and who doesn't? LOL) but also seating available on ground level if stairs are too difficult for you. Nice menu selection. Our server was very friendly. I had a shrimp 'po boy sandwich - it was good. My husband scored - he ordered the red beans and rice - dang - it was beyond delicious! Really enjoyed it. The bar drinks were good. Our total for the po boy, red beans and rice - two hurricane drinks was $76. A bit pricey - but you're in the center of the action and have a great view. Glad we went!

title: Popped-in for lunch and a couple "Huge" beers....
text: Stopped on Bourbon St. (not my favorite locale) at Cornet.  Had the Chicken Alfredo pasta dish, superb!  But the better surprise was meeting the bartendress, Miss Nina.  What a treasure!  Has lived around the US (although originally from NOLA) and returned here.  The food was exceptional, the locals nice, and Miss Nina wonderful.  This is on my stop-list whenever I'm in NOLA now...

title: Dylan the doorman was amazing!! He brought us in with good energy n gave menu and wonderful goodbye!! He needs a raise n
text: 5great job by Dylan he did a great job by bringing us in and then also brought us menus and gave me the best goodbye ever he needs a raise

title: Perfect dinner spot
text: This was a perfect dinner spot after the show at Preservation Hall Jazz. We ate upstairs and would have enjoyed the balcony but skipped it because of the rain when we were there.

title: Outstanding food 15% grat with no service
text: I would love to come back because food was absolutely delicious and flavorful, I don’t agree on a 15% grat when I server only took our order never returned to table at all. Even had to go to bar to get to pay tab so we could leave. Hope service becomes better.

title: In New Orleans with family and friends. Have always wanted to try Mulates.
text: The food was excellent. I recommend the key lime pie. There was live Zydeco music. Or waitress was very pleasant and knowledgeable. I will return.

title: Live music, fantastic menu
text: Stopped by at lunch to review the menu and returned at supper with a party of 8 immediately seated, drink orders were fast, salads were fresh. Seafood platter was adequate for 2 to share. Cajun live band was amazing and lively. Server was friendly, smiling. Laughing and engaging. When we earlier called for reservations, the hostess said “no need for reservations baby” to my boyfriend and he got a kick out of it. The place is huge! Plenty of seating.

title: Great seafood restaurant
text: Duy N was our server, he was very helpful in recommending good food from the menu. We ordered the seafood platter and it was delicious and perfect for 2 people. The service was great and we will definitely be back.

title: Cajun authentic experience
text: Great place for lunch, probably for dinner too, also very central, besides the famous French Quarter. One of my good memories from New Orleans.

title: A wedge of happiness.
text: My family came to this cute restaurant for dinner. The service was excellent!! The food was very delicious and the live music was very good! We ordered some fried gater. I took a bite of it and had to spit it out lol. Probably just psychological. My family liked it. I ordered the Wedge salad and I really liked it.

title: Excellent restaurant choice near Fisherman's Wharf
text: Pier Market Seafood is located on the waterfront about halfway down Pier 39. The tables look out to the waterfront for a lovely dinner setting. My wife and I enjoyed a delicious ceviche appetizer and then salmon and cioppino entrees, followed by two desserts that included ice cream on the side (we are ice cream junkies!). Service was professional, and the prices were very fare for the quality and setting. We would certainly return on our next trip to San Francisco (we go about every ten years!).

title: Mersea Magic!!
text: Great tasty food, spectacular venue!!! MeeSun and staff are fantastic and so friendly!! It’s a family atmosphere. Outdoor spaces for the kids, bocci ball courts, putting green. Best view of SF, the hidden gem!! Take the Ferry from SF Ferry Building (10 minute ride) walk to Mersea. Take the ferry back to SF and call it a night or continue the party!!

title: Coconut Grove favorite
text: War a spectacular restaurant.  The ambiance is fun and classy, the service impeccable, the prix fee menu ample and such a value and the food eland drinks delicious.  Such a treat.

title: Best restorant in Miami
text: I have to write another review for Sexy fish. The only restaurant in Miami that has a smoking section with gold ashtrays. Rating 100/10. The dessert was perfect

title: Commanders Okay, but Antoine’s was Astounding
text: Commanders Palace was good, but it doesn’t compare with the variety and tastefully compared menu at Antoine’s.  It was our first time at both restaurants this trip, and we much preferred Antoine’s, no comparison.  Antoine’s was more pricey, but you get what you pay for.

title: Commander’s Corner
text: My husband and I were visiting New Orleans from Virginia. I took my husband to lunch for his birthday on November 12th. Our reservations were for 11:30 we arrived around 11:15 and we were first to arrive. So at 11:30 we were taken to our seats.  We were seated at a table with balloons as there were other tables that had balloons.  Service was impeccable and the food was outstanding but as my husband and I looked around the room we both noticed that as two Afro Americans we were seated or placed in the back in the corner while the rest of the room began to fill up with Caucasians, some regulars and some visiting tourists .  This was our second time in New Orleans and second time at Commander’s Palace.  This experience made us very uncomfortable and showed us that somethings just won’t change.

title: First Time Couldn't have Been Better!
text: Our and our friends first time at Commander's Palace!  Service was amazing... a coordinated team effort lead by our waiter.  Food was also amazing with all 8 of us more than happy with every course leading to deserts that just blew us away.  Finally, a manager (one of the family) , who had been making sure we were enjoying our meal, invited us to see the open kitchen and wine cellar, topping off an amazing evening!

title: Awesome Restaurant—a Must go
text: Must admit it was a little noisy but the Atmosphere is lively, busy and bustling and we enjoyed the vibes. Sat at the bar. Barrett was great bartender. Offered great menu suggestions. Food was phenomenal and included raw oysters, catfish, crab claws, capellini and crab, and tuna crudo.  Mother of Pearl cocktail paired nicely with our food. Strongly recommend and Definitely plan on returning.

title: Nice bar/restaurant right on Bourbon
text: We really liked this place.  We didn't eat there, but it was a great bar/restaurant right on Bourbon where you could watch football without the overpowering music.  The staff and manager were great to talk with.

title: Get the shrimp and grits
text: We visited on a Wednesday evening in November and it wasn't busy.  We had the best shrimp and grits.  Full of delicious flavor and large shrimp.  Good service and live music.  I wish I had more room to try the pie.  Next time!

title: Peleau
text: My first time eating here, the food was ok .  To much oil in the dish made it greasy.    they give a generous portion you can share with at least three people.                          The owner very nice and polite and welcoming.

title: Good good
text: This was a pretty cool restaurant with an authentic feel! My grilled chicken was okay, I needed extra sauce to enhance the flavor though. My friend had the jerk chicken and she said it was delicious. Our waitress/bartender was really nice and helpful. The location is spacious and I loved the decor as well. The strip mall means plenty of open parking! I will definitely return!

title: Great Food; Extremely Hot!!
text: I love Jamaican food and so we went to their new location in Stockton on Pershing.  The Jerk Chicken was so good but unfortunately it was also unbearably hot.  I know Scotch Bonnet peppers will take your head off and I wish they could make a more moderate version of Jerk Chicken without so much heat.  I really want to eat this dish but neither I nor my husband can stand how hot it was.  My husband is a real champion when it comes to eating hot food; he's not wimpy like me.  He says he can't eat that dish again either.  I hope the owner will read this review.

title: HArd to find but worth the effort!!
text: It's all about the food-and this place has some wonderful authentic delicious food!!!   I am from the Caribbean &  most restaurants think if you put a fried banana on a plate that will make it Caribbean food...no not true!  The Caribbean is a a melting pot with complex cuisine...Spanish, French, African, Indian, Dutch, Portuguese, influences.  The Breadfruit Tree is Caribbean food.  Louis the owner was so friendly- the food was delicious.  I thought I was "home" and my grandmother was in the kitchen. We started with a rum punch...but this wasn't any old rum punch...this was a really West Indian Rum punch...tastes so good but packs a punch!!!  We had the food served family style & we ordered the sweet fish, curry, jerk chicken, peleau...OMG everything was delicious!!!! The menu changes daily so you have to read the chalkboard...I was hoping for Roti...but it wasn't on the chalkboard.  However, Louis did tell me if I call ahead he'd make sure it was on the menu the next time I came by. Service was good- drinks arrived quickly- food took a little time...but if you go with good company the wait won't matter, because it's worth the wait!!! They are open seasonally so call ahead if its not boating season...if the weather is good they may be there.  I can hardly wait to go back...I almost forgot save room for desert- the chocolate bread pudding tastes just like my granddad's bread pudding & I only like my granddad's bread pudding...Louis is an amazing chef....and I LOVE his bread pudding!!! Just remember it may be hard to find this place if you are driving in and not sailing in...but it's worth finding!

title: Great place for a party
text: We had the whole restaurant to ourselves for a birthday lunch. All of my guests raved about the food and the service. I had left the food selection up to Louis, the owner, and he chose well - seafood peleau, pork loin tender enough to cut with a fork, and coq au vin, also tender and delicious. The food was plentiful, and also included salad and dessert. Lunch was served hot and on schedule. We brought our own wine and paid a small corkage fee. Louis was great to work with during the planning stage, and always replied quickly to my phone calls, texts and emails. Wonderful experience all around and we will be back. Oh, and the location is very cool, too. You almost feel like you are really in the Caribbean.

title: Absolutely Wonderful
text: My fiancee, Marie and I eat there all the time. The food is outstanding, the service is excellent and the homemade flour tortillas are just like abuelita (grandma) used to make. We love this place.

title: Restaurant
text: The best restaurant  in Stockton ca food serves is amazing customer severed is great too me and my family’s favorite spot

title: Great food!
text: This is our go-to location for Mexican Food. best in Stockton! This is located downtown. They make the best flour tortillas.

title: The Best Mexican Food Around
text: The food is great!  The amount of food is amazing.  Take your appetite with you.  The menu variety is excellent.  I love this place!

title: Huge portions and very tasty food overcome the dingy dining room
text: I was born in Stockton, but left in 1970. I remember eating at Xochimilco Cafe as a child very fondly and was looking forward to revisiting a very  old friend. The food was well above-average and the portions were enormous. I ordered the two tostada plate, choosing guacamole and chicken. Both tostadas were built on hot, freshly-made tortillas and were heaped with cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, and sour cream. I enjoyed them very much. Rice, beans and fresh, hot flour tortillas were also served and were delicious. My companion ordered a three-item combination plate, that, as it came with Chile Verde and Chile Colorado, was really a 5-item plate. It was an absolutely enormous platter of food. While she ate only a small percentage of it, she proclaimed it as delicious. The dining room hadn't changed very much since 1970, and the downtown Stockton location is far from attractive.  But the food made the trip worthwhile.

title: Catering services
text: They provide excellent food for a large group of people and always please everyone.  They have never disappointed us and have been around for years. It is vibrant in the restaurant, and a lot of people enjoy going in to eat. Their food is very delicious!

title: Authentic Greek Food
text: This is a large restaurant been in Stockton for a long time. The food is always good very fresh, very authentic Greek food. The service is very fast and attentive, its only open for lunch but during the week is a very busy place with all the business around. There is parking in the back and the restaurant will validate your ticket. It is a very good value for your money.

title: Amazing Greek Cuisine
text: Yasoo Yani has a great menu - the Gyros salad is the bomb and the pita bread is so fresh and delicious!!

title: Original Greek Food
text: This is a very old restaurant in Stockton but very busy lunch crowd, the service is old style but very friendly the food is very original an fresh we always get the same Nick’s salad.The menu is pretty big. Good value for your money.

title: Downtown Take-Out
text: I'm typically downtown in the late afternoon only a couple of times each year.  When that happens, I often stop at Yasoo Yani to bring food home.  The wait time is only about ten or fifteen minutes.  Food is hot, good, and not too expensive.  If you want Greek, this is definitely a good place to go.  Kabob wraps are very good, as well as the lemon-rice soup.  They did not include feta in my order, though, which I requested and paid for.

title: Great Burgers By The Marina
text: This place is one of the best in the area not only for the burgers but for the location. It's located right along the marina so if you sit outside you get the added bonus of a great view. The cheeseburger was really good. It was decent size and had a good taste. The garlic fries were also good on the side. Their menu is fairly large with many different choices for breakfast and other types of sandwiches for lunch. Overall a great place to eat not only for the food but also for the view. A very relaxing place to eat.

title: LOVE THIS PLACE
text: Its a great place, great food, great atmosphere!  I love sitting outside on a Saturday or Sunday morning and enjoy my French Toast and a cup of coffee or a mimosa.  I like to sit and watch the boats, it is so relaxing!

title: Great Breakfast
text: Great breakfast with delicious food. Friendly staff and clearly a local favorite. Nice location on the marina for land and boat access!

title: Simple Fresh Delicious
text: Parking is good. Property is clean. Service friendly. Menu simple. Food is hot and fresh. Noise level medium to high. Prices fit what is served. Burgers fries onion rings shakes all good. Cooked to order served hot to the table. The area is nice and relaxing. Good value

title: Burger, Shakes and the Delta.
text: I think everyone in Stockton has to know that if you are coming back from a long day on the Water, you gotta refuel and finish off your Day over at Bob's Marina. You can get a massive burger for a pretty decent price as well as a pretty nice shake (best flavor is chocolate). Idk what else to say, this place is iconic for any Delta goer. Make sure you are hungry before heading over.

title: Rooftop nights
text: My first time here, i was invited at the rooftop for the Motown nights every Thursday. Very good, decent and behaved crowds.  Opens 7-10.  Definitely for someone who is a Motown music fan.  We danced the night away.  Drinks are priced reasonably.  One big bonus is the very, very nice sunset view.  Gets really really busy by 8:30. This placed has started putting Stockton on the map again.  Downtown has been so sleepy in the past few years.  I hope this will go on and on. Four stars for I saw some little kids in this very adult venue.

title: Great if you are on a diet because nothing is edible
text: Big place no customers...first bad sign.  The salad had way to much dressing on the witty lettuce and the apples were mushy.  The bread was stale and could not eat the main course.  Sad but no chance they will be in business long

title: Great food
text: We arrived at 5:15pm and were surprised that the place was entirely empty.  Thought maybe we had made a poor selection and that the vacant diner was a bad omen.  NOPE:  within minutes the place was so packed there wasn't a vacant seat!  Lucky to have parked when we did. We both had the Mediterranean Salad (split one between us) and the Baked Salmon with Brussels Sprouts and Roasted Potatoes.  Fabulous and flavorful!!  Then enjoyed a simple scoop of vanilla ice cream for dessert and off to the concert. I'd definitely go again!

title: Blessing in disguise!
text: My husband called and made a reservation at Bella Vista to celebrate my birthday.  When we arrived at the restaurant, it was closed for a private party!!!  Seems to me the restaurant needs to do better training.  Needless to say, we were not really excited to eat there after reading Yelp reviews online.

title: Ummmmm! Like an Italian grandmother's sauce!
text: I LOVE fettucini sauce--IF it's done right. So many restaurants make a white sauce (at least that's what it tastes like) and pour it over the pasta. I don't order it any more without tasting first. Heather, our Bella Vista waitress, brought a sample to me and, when I put my spoon in it and lifted, the sauce was thin. I thought, "Oh, no. Another lousy sauce. And then I tasted. OUTSTANDING! The best fettucini sauce I've had since cooking a recipe given to me by some Italian grandmothers years ago. Nice place, nice people, GREAT FOOD!

title: A Stockton tradition…
text: It’s nice after having been away for over a decade to eat at one of Stockton’s most reliable Mexican restaurants: Cancun.  Very friendly and fast-moving staff with all the classic, tasty fare.  I got the chicken enchiladas.  Fun, open space a short walk from most downtown places of importance.  Support this legend of downtown!

title: A good afternoon’s bottle of wine!!
text: We spent a good afternoon drinking a bottle of house white wine in Stockton’s only Mexican restaurant and bar in central California in America on our drive from Los Angeles to San Francisco. A good bottle of wine, ok atmosphere and cleanish lavatories.

title: Great Value
text: Not in the best area of town, but the food was authentic. Been eating Mexican food since I was born and I know and appreciate authentic tasting food. The enchilada sauce was so good, I ordered a small cup of it and poured it over my beans and rice too! The chips were fresh from that day and the salsa had just the right amount of heat for my tastes. I would recmmend this to anyone.

title: Not bad for authentic.
text: Has changed a lot over the years, but not bad.  Too much gravy, and gravy mixed with too much flour.  Service was slow considering the amount of patrons...not many either time.  Overpriced for the quality.

title: Over priced dog food.
text: Gravy with tamales? Wth... gross, over priced dog food with gravy, weirdest combo I've seen. I feel robbed I paid, and will never ever come back. To make things worse they have a comedian here that doesn't fit a nice Latino restaurant.

title: Great German food near Stockton
text: After shopping at the Fruit Bowl market in east Stockton, we decided to go another mile out on Waterloo Road and have an early dinner at the German Guys restaurant.  What a nice find! It wasn't crowded that Sunday mid-afternoon, so we were seated immediately.  The waitress was friendly and patient as we looked over the sizeable menu.  Our party started out with a bread-time appetizer (sausage, cheese, bread, and saurkraut).  Then we all settled on pork schnitzels:  two hunter (jaeger) and one Berlin (which had a sort of a Doener sauce on it).  The Berlin schnitzel was quite appealing and had a different and interesting taste to it.  We could choose two side dishes out of a page's worth of them in the menu.  The spaetzle turned out to be surprisingly good, as were the croquettes (a cousin to tater tots).  The schnitzels were all good-sized -- two of our party ended up taking half of their schnitzels home in a box. Dinner for three came out to about $75, before tax and tips, which wasn't too bad.  Note that German Guys does add 3% to the bill when payment is made with a credit card. There is free parking around the building, which itself is actually not all that large. Overall, the meals were really good, and we definitely will see about visiting again when we're next in town.  One of the staff remarked that they were thinking of moving closer to town, and your reviewer can't help but think that would be a good idea.  It shouldn't take a long drive in order to enjoy German food as good as this. 8-)

title: Awesome place!
text: Staff are friendly! Good food! Good beer!! This place is amazing.  Haven’t try the 2 liter challenge yet but getting there.

title: Slice of Germany in Stockton?
text: We were in the area for the day and delighted to find this German restaurant for dinner. I'm not super familiar with German food, but we thought the schnitzel, sausage, and potato pancakes were especially tasty. Great beer on tap, too, and they let you sample for free. We had so much fun. Highly recommend!

title: Reminiscing about German food
text: We were told about this restaurant by friends. We were disappointed in little ways. Husband thought his cordon bleu was a little small. And possibly from a frozen food box. The salad was good and so was the red cabbage. My sauerkraut with mushrooms was not as tasty as I thought it should be. I thought there should be some pork flavor in it to tone it down. My fish fillet was breaded and crispy. I didn’t expect it to be breaded. The fish was good in itself. The staff were were very nice. It was crowded for a Sunday afternoon. I expected to reminisce to an Old town German quiet place with old German music quietly in the background. This place is youthful and lively!  The beer looked good!  We will continue looking elsewhere.

title: Neat find!  Good food.
text: This was a neat find.  There is indoor and outdoor seating.  We sat outside & the server pulled up a heater for us when it started to get a little chilly. We ordered Cordon Bleu, & Schnitzel.  The Cordon Bleu was delicious!  The side I ordered was Spatzle & it was a little dry. There are a ton of combinations that you can customize your entrée with. We also ordered a pretzel for an appetizer, and a Bee Sting for dessert.  Both were good.

title: Farm-to-table with an elegant twist
text: Passing through Sacramento on an Amtrak layover, we were drawn to the Grange for it’s unusual menu. Farm-to-table with an elegant twist! The options featured a unique combination of flavors and ingredients- persimmon and sweet potato sold me! And each dish was more amazing than the next. As we were traveling, we just ordered appetizers and were completely satisfied with everything. Of course we had to have the sweet potato and persimmons side. Both ingredients sweet, but not in competition with each other, while the miso added the perfect punch. The roasted beer with smoked halibut mousse appetizer was divine. Beets were cooked perfectly, the buttermilk dressing a perfect complement, but the trout roe added the pop. We also ordered the grilled chicory salad, a bitter and tangy partner to the previous plates. But the shrimp carpaccio was out of this world. Fresh, fresh, fresh shrimp, pounded flat and cut into a rectangle, made a base for the pile of excitement on top: pickled persimmon, radish, furikake, crispy rice, and chili crunch. Yes indeed, farm to table over the top. Then there was the service. Our server Xandra was efficient, friendly, and attentive without being overbearing. Even the bus boy Kameron offered excellent service. The place filled up while we were there, but we may as well have been the only guests - we never needed for anything during our very pleasant visit. Highly recommend this sophisticated yet down-to-earth restaurant in the Citizen Hotel downtown. Wish I lived in Sacramento!

title: A little oasis after a bad day!
text: We enjoyed everything about this place! The ambience, the architecture, the decor, the seating, the food, the wine and the service!  We had the farm greens salad and the buttermilk dressing was amazing.  Then the papardelle and the risotto.  Both delicious. Kekoa was our server and he was just the perfect mix of intelligence, humor, knowledge (everything from the risotto to the jazz playlist) and discretion.
