End of a horrible travel day for us that was all but forgotten as we soaked up all the goodness of this restaurant/bar.  We will be back.

title: Too loud
text: The food was very good. The service was excellent. Thank you so much Ben G and Cameron for the excellent service The only complaint and for us it’s huge because it ruined the ambiance is how loud the restaurant is. We were yelling at each other to be heard over the noise

title: Excellent business lunch
text: A group of us had an early business lunch around 12:30 - they kept our glasses full and service was quick and friendly, Food was delicious too. I had the salad which was fresh and tasty. Could add steak, chicken or salmon to the salad for protein. A little on the expensive side but delicious food and good service.

title: Don’t hesitate -  visit The Grange soon!
text: We plan time to come here every time we are in Sacramento. The food, service and ambiance are all excellent! Even when we order something like a classic breakfast, it’s amazing. My brunch frittata was just delicious!!

title: Clap and bow at every bite
text: This is an experience in dining like no other! I have dined here 4 times since 2008. We always had unique savory food in small bites coupled with an entertaining chef. Cuisine masterpieces are presented like a show. Bravo! Standing ovation!

title: Thank you!
text: This was just the loveliest freakin' experience. I brought my wife here for a (belated, because it takes awhile to get a reservation!🤣) birthday dinner, just the other night. I've rarely experienced such a warm, welcoming and pleasant atmosphere. It really was just like a dinner party. Every single person in this place seemed to be having a blast. The food was wonderful, of course (when I die, let it be by drowning in a pool of white truffle sabayon). What really made the difference though? The complete lack of pretension or stuffiness. This place is run and operated by a group of folks who clearly love the heck out of what they do. You can tell they're like a family. I simply had a wonderful time. That's it! I would happily go back and cannot wait for the opportunity. I am a father of two. I do not get nights out. I do not have a life. Not really. I am very thankful for the staff at the Kitchen for giving us another lovely memory and another dining experience to look forward to repeating. Thank you!

title: Disappointing and unreliable service, night ruined!
text: We used to LOVE The Kitchen as our go-to for special occasions, but after last night's disappointing service, we won't be returning ever again. We ordered seconds of 3 dishes, followed up asking for the status, and at the end of the evening was told the kitchen was closed, so they can no longer prepare the dishes we requested. They blamed it on new staff they're training, but that's not an acceptable excuse for a Michelin star restaurant! If I wanted unreliability and poor service, I would've had dinner at a fast food restaurant instead. They also changed policies and no longer allow you to take your leftover bread or chips home. Does it end up in the trash? Feels like a huge waste. If you hire new staff, please train them appropriately, or find new staff that can deliver a basic level of service in a restaurant such as submitting orders. The whole night was ruined by this experience and our 10 year anniversary is now a giant disappointment.

title: One of the most fun Michelin star restaurants In Sacramento CA
text: Amazing experience. Very engaging chef and staff. Love the ideas that you can walk around interacting with the chefs and the repeat of what we like. So much food and all so good, 3 of us had one repeat and it was so great. The cocktail pairing was interesting, something to try at least once. I had the mock tail pairing and it was fun. A lot of wines and liquor that you don't see in other places. It's not your typical quiet and reserved atmosphere, it is fun, energetic ambiance. You can cook next to the chefs and help prepare the food if you want to see how that feels. You need to book 4 months ahead and have some flexibility with your dates because the reservation is gone within minutes.  Definitely recommend and will go again, next time will try to get the experience preparing the food.

title: Beautiful presentation lacks substance and taste.
text: The presentation is outstanding, the food looks incredible unfortunately it lacks taste. My second time there and last. The best item wasn't on the menu,  the amuse bouche. It was a mushroom soup and fantastic. Also delicious, the Dungeness crab crepe. The Cauliflower starter was disappointed as was the diakon radish dish. Both looked incredible but didn't taste so. The pasta dish with truffle was twofold. The pasta was delicious BUT the copious amount of truffle the chef grated onto each plate not only looked disgusting but tasted disgusting. I have been to Italy,  we love truffle. My husband is a chef. We weren't sure what grade of truffle we were eating but not on par with the French Laundry. The main dish, a beef roll of sorts was tough and chewy. The desert,  a cherry cheesecake another disappointment. I will give them the chocolate chip cookies and tiny cappuccino cream puff, both delicious. The wine list is outrageously expensive and the choices lacking. I suggest you pay the corkage and bring your own wine. Spending $500 on a dinner for two that looked pretty and listening to an arrogant loud, screaming chef all night....not worth the money in my opinion.

title: Nice and friendly staff, good clean room
text: We stayed here for one week as a stop on a longer trip with two small children. The service was great and the staff was very child friendly. The food was really tasty and had something for everyone in the family. Menu is reasonable priced.

title: Great Breakfast Spot
text: Our favorite neighborhood breakfast place has reopened!!!  Our breakfasts were delicious and service was fantastic.

title: Worth The Effort To Find This Neigborhood Cafe
text: ‘The Taste Above’ is a neighborhood café/restaurant in an “out-of-the-way-shopping-center” that serves great food.  The Pocket Area of Sacramento is a lovely diversified community and A Taste Above is an example of that diversification.  From Asian, Hawaiian, Italian, Portuguese to Philadelphia the small menu has a little bit for everyone, including a vegan menu that includes the popular Impossible Burger (The Beyond Buger) with fries (it can be ordered with a gluten free bun!).  My partner and I both ordered the Impossible Burger, and I had the GF bun. We stuffed ourselves silly on these huge burgers and couldn’t get enough of the delicious fries.  We noticed other customers were saying similar things about their meals.  All in all, The Taste Above, is worth the effort to find tucked away in the Pocket Area.

title: Awesome Food, Awesome People
text: Stopped in today for lunch.  The people were super nice and very accommodating for my handicapped brother.  We ordered and sat down.  They brought our soft drinks to us.  After a little while out came my brother's "club" sandwich on Dutch Crust which he loved.  His garlic fries looked so good I had to try them.  Terrific.  I had heard about the "A Plate Above" meal and had to try it.  It came out and to my surprise it actually looked bigger and better than I had expected.  My three items were Kalbi short ribs, Teriyaki beef steak, and deep fried shrimp all serve on a bed of white rice with a side of mac salad.  It was a fantastic meal for only $13.95.  I could only eat half before getting full.  We were checked on at least twice to see if we need anything by a smiling young lady.  Once the boss came out to tell us about the deals they are having for vets on Veterans Day.  He was all smiles too... as were we.  I live 50 miles away and I may become a steady customer!

title: Great neighborhood spot to grab a bite
text: We have eaten here several times for a Hicks meal or dessert.  This restaurant has a wide variety of delicious food from hamburgers to Asian stew over rice.  Plus they have specialty coffees, ice cream and baked goods.  There is something on their menu to satisfy everyone’s palate.

title: Excellent brunch
text: We went there for brunch before a matinee, expecting a coffee shop. Boy were we surprised. The decorations are charmingly rustic, the server we had was very friendly and helpful. The food… ah yes, the food. It was superb. I had a porchetta hash with eggs, one of us had the chillaquilles, and the third of us had eggs Benedict, with porchetta. All were pronounced excellent. We’ll certainly be back after discovering this treasure.

title: Consistently delicious food made with seasonal ingredients, tasty cocktails, and great service!
text: I’ve been here 6-7 times now over the last year, at least twice by myself just for the kale salad. I’ve brought out of town guests here as well as local friends and it’s been consistently delicious: the meal, the cocktails, and the service (we love Spencer!)…and we’ll keep coming back!

title: Tried again, same result
text: I understand the job market, but one waitress for the whole restaurant ?  Just don’t.  Host/manager should have been helping on every table.  Food is meh at best, hash browns were cold mushy sticks.  French toast without syrup, dry af.  Eggs Benedict dry af.  No jam for toast wtf.  One bread opy, really.??

title: FAIL FOR DINNER FOR 4
text: We had appetizers- the brussels sprouts were burned, not charred. The beet hummus had no beet taste at all. The pork belly was okay, but not as good as we have had other places in the past. The salmon tartare was so off that I took one bite, then could not eat anything else. It was horribly not okay. The spaghetti bolognese was cool to cold for the 3  of us that had it. It's really a shame. We love cute little places but the kitchen staff has to deliver. The bar was fun, the drinks were good.

title: Solid all-around great place
text: I've been in the Hook and Ladder a few times in quick succession since discovering it a few weeks ago, and so far they do everything very well. Interesting double-quonset hut shaped building on the outside with a roomy yet sound-damping interior. It even has an English pub-style snug. We've tested it out on a Friday night and it doesn't get too loud even when all the tables are full, which is a wonderful discovery in this city of hard-surfaced, vaulted-ceiling, roaringly loud bars and restaurants. The cocktails are excellent, the food also. A relatively small menu which I approve of: its focused on few but well-chosen and excellently executed items with a range of prices, all reasonable. Special bonus for those of us: solidly delicious gluten-free entrees. The wait staff are competent, pleasant and clearly like working there. This is looking like our brand new old reliable!

title: We weren’t expecting much judging from the outside
text: But Franco the owner was sooo amazing. Ferrying us around when we needed help. He looks like an old grizzly Italian. But he smiles and is so friendly. There is a picture on the wall of his dad in 1940 working behind the bar. Franco’s son works there too. They all look alike - and unfortunately smoke! The food is good. Fresh and interesting. Our room was large and light. Loads of hot water. Nothing posh. But comfortable. And clean. Italy at its best.

title: The place to Stay in san Quirico...
text: By that I mean that it is the ONLY place to stay in the village. We weep on a walking tour so only stayed the one night. Rooms are quiet and big but the beds are below par. We had a terrace but the access to it was covered in pigeon poo so I don't think anyone had been in the room for weeks. On the shower there is an odd plastic plate, take this out before showering, it is deadly! We ate down stairs and it was very nice. Breakfast was "OK"

title: A welcome surprise
text: When we got to San Quirico and saw the town, the main square, and the outside of the hotel, we were prepared to be disappointed. It's a small town, there's a gas station in the center of the piazza, and if you're looking for the hotel - well, the sign mostly indicates the restaurant: Ristorante La Vecchia Fonte. In fact, you have to enter the restaurant, walk through to the back, and say you have a reservation in the hotel. The friendly and helpful (though somewhat English-challenged) staff take you upstairs and show you your room - the rooms are bright, clean, and usable, with views overlooking the piazza or the town. It's a 15 minute (or so) level walk to the historic abandoned town of Vertozza nearby; otherwise, there's not much to do in San Quirico. We had dinner in the hotel's restaurant (Very good!) and breakfast (included) in the back of the restaurant. The promised WiFi didn't seem to connect in our room - but this is often the case in Italian hotels in our experience.

title: Won't be going back..
text: Very underwhelming.  The two-hostess standing outside the front door led you to think it will be great service.  Very wrong.  Your seated, and everything is just dropped off, menus, etc.  The food was dropped off and the server just turned and left.  She would rush by the table periodically not bothering to check.  Midway she came rushing by, wearing a black mask and black latex gloves and yelled ALL GOOD?!?! and gave two thumbs up and she rushed buy.  Two hamburgers, two soft drinks (no refills) plus tip was $75...this place has the sound of a death rattle...

title: Don't do it
text: Overpriced and underwhelming! Service was ok but the food was less than mediocre.  My son and I had nachos and a couple of Philly cheesesteaks.  The bill was $100 after tip.  Yikes! Never again...

title: Exquisite haute cuisine with impeccable service and wonderfully prepared dishes.
text: Exquisite haute cuisine with impeccable service and wonderfully prepared dishes. The restaurant's decor is modern and chic, creating a relaxing atmosphere perfect.

title: Excellent customer service, very tasty food, very good location, it is a nice place, very familiar, you have to visit it
text: Excellent customer service, very tasty food, very good location, it is a nice place, very familiar, you have to visit it

title: Cold food
text: I must give up coming to this location!  They take the order so far from the pay window, approx 40+ cars in line.  By the time I get my hamburger it is COLD!  I have mentioned to order takers, no response from them.  If only, they would take orders when maybe 10 cars ahead!   I give up!

title: In N Out is always GOOD
text: In N Out is always GOOD  Really good fast food  And it is always fast and good  Best burgers,,  I always asks for them to make my fries very crispy

title: Not very good patio closes early
text: Patio closes at 6 pm why so early nice outside it's a beautiful evening  July 9 th 2025 5:09 pm patio closed at 6 pm young man said sorry closing patio. I said you close at 9:30pm why does patio close so early doesn't get dark til 8 pm  I'm a business owner and this is unprofessional.  shortsalesmit@gmail.com  Frances Bazan

title: Embarrassing Customer Service
text: At about 1:30 this afternoon I visited the store on March Lane with my wife and got a cup of coffee I sat in the lobby for one hour drinking the coffee and I decided to get a refill I went to the register and asked the lady at the register whose name I don’t know to give me a refill but to my surprise she told me that I was not sitting in the lobby so she told me she couldn’t give me one I told her a couple of times that I was sitting in the lobby but still she didn’t believe me she went in and asked a colleague in the back room and the colleague confirmed that I came earlier and I was sitting in the lobby  That was very embarrassing  A manager came and apologised about what happen  I felt so embarrassed that I used to visit that store everyday but not anymore  My name is Jihad Basma and my phone number number is 2093199098

title: Never rated a business so low in my life…
text: We were enjoying some food and a drink earlier this evening and upon attempting to order a fernet to finish off our meal,  the bartender asked who was driving and wouldn’t let us place the order. No one was drunk, we were peacefully enjoying our treats, I hadn’t even drank 20% of my drink.  She may have been going through something personal because when I asked her name, she raised her eyebrows, swung her head, and raised her voice to say, “Would you just like to talk to the manager?!” We accepted the offer, but regardless, will never return. So sad.  When we first arrived and ordered our initial drinks, the patrons that left the seats we took were bragging about drinking a whole bottle of Don Julio 70 between the two of them along with the same bar tender. At that point, the bartender accidentally took our full drinks and dumped them. So we mentioned the error and she supplied replacements. As I said, I didn’t drink mine and my husband finished his by the time of her episode.  The manager explained they had just had some ABC training and they were buckling down. This would be entirely understandable. However, the bar tender’s  judgement was misplaced and targeted. That, in addition to her horrendous decorum, has destroyed the establishment’s rapport with us.

title: They're Trying
text: Some interesting sounding appetizers enticed us to check this place out.  Furikake fries: unusual Japanese spices served with two uncommon sauces, quoth the menu.  Blah.  Flavorless.  Sauces seemed mostly like ketchup with a bit of BBQ sauce and a mayo.  Unconsumable. BUT...the wood oven baked Khachapuri was quite tasty, although it could have used a much bigger dose of garlic and butter.  Again, unusual, with, of all things, a soft egg yolk proudly in the center.  Now, HOW this item appeared on what is a pretty standard fare menu is anyone's guess. The "Ora" king salmon was perfectly cooked and served on a plentiful bed of mixed vegetables.  Would be enhanced with some balsamic glaze, and that could be served in a cup on the side. The pineapple crisp dessert was another item that sounded great but whose execution left lots to be desired.   Topped with a rubberized piece of pineapple that could have served well as a drain closure.  Ice cream was OK, but they left the crisp off the crisp.  Oh, well... Pleasant, helpful, and attentive service personnel. Limited and not outrageously priced wine and beer offerings; easy free parking. Restroom could use some policing.

title: Everything delicious
text: Recommended by the Courtyard by Marriott front desk, I had a nearly perfect sumptuous dinner at Market Tavern.  Loved the choices of by the glass wines.  My Duckhorn Merlot was delicious!  Was in the mood for steak, and the kitchen totally delivered.    I decided to eat in the bar as a solo, and they had good sports choices on multiple TVs. The bar was doing a fine business.  Portions are very generous.  My ribeye steak was perfectly cooked medium rare, exceptionally tasty, and a perfect accompaniment to the wine.  It came with two side dishes, great steamed broccoli and garlic mashed potatoes.  Amazing flavors!  Again all portions were huge!  Highly recommend this restaurant and so pleased to experience it during my one, and possibly only, visit to Stockton.

title: Very noisy. not very Japanese
text: The noise level mood to be mentioned first. We practally had to scream to talk to each other.   Service was good with lots of staff. One person, possibly the sushi chef or restaurant owner was Asian. The rest of the staff and the cooking style had a big Mexican influence.  We had a tuna with avocado and jalapeño roll. Also spicy ramen. I liked it but had indigestion afterwards which is a first for Japanese food. The tempura was very greasy.   I do not recommend his restaurant.

title: Fantastic San Francisco Lunch Spot with Top-Notch Hospitality
text: We came here with a large group to celebrate a team member's promotion, and even though we hadn't given the restaurant a heads-up (on a busy Friday as Fleet Week was kicking off, no less!), the owner and her team couldn't have been more accommodating.  The owner and her team welcomed us warmly, found space for our group, and made sure everyone was comfortable and well taken care of throughout the night. The service was attentive without being rushed, and you could tell they genuinely cared that we had a great experience.  They even brought out additional umbrellas and helped move them around to protect us from the bright sun that day.   The atmosphere was lively and inviting--exactly what you want for a celebration--and the scenery, with that one-of-a-kind San Francisco backdrop, made it even better. A big thank you to the staff and owner for turning what could've been a logistical headache into a wonderful, memorable lunch for our team! We'll definitely be back.

title: French Classic Intimate Ambiance
text: We've been meaning to come here for a while and finally made the leap. So glad we did!  We figured the only way to better understand San Francisco's culinary fine dining history was to trace it right back near the start.  Chef Gary Danko was among the early wave of James Beard Award winning chefs in San Francisco and later became part of the first generation of Michelin-starred chefs in the city once the Michelin Guide began rating San Francisco restaurants.   I've read some Yelp reviews calling his food "old school". After our experience there, I'd say it's more of a throwback to the golden age of fine dining. You won't find trendy hyper-local experimental cuisine with designer eatable floral pedals in mini Japanese pottery and expensive foam that pretends to be flavor. Instead you'll find a rolling cheese cart, white tablecloths, impeccable service and sauces that use classic French techniques (béarnaise, fumets, veloutés). All paying homage to classic French cooking.   The menu offers 3, 4, or 5-course prix‑fixe menu with ample choices in each category.  We chose the 3 and 4.   We enjoyed every dish.   Stand Outs:  Roast Lobster with Potato Purée, Edamame, Peas, Asparagus, and Tarragon Jus - Tender lobster, nicely seasoned and comforting potato purée and velvety tarragon jus.  The Glazed Oysters with Osetra Caviar. So good! I could've eaten 3 more. Plump perfectly cooked oysters topped with a generous amount of Osetra caviar nestled in a silky leek fondue and a light lettuce cream. Buttery but not rich and with a wonderful briny ocean finish.   Filet of Beef with Potato Gratin, King Trumpet Mushrooms. Tender and juicy that paired perfectly with the bone marrow béarnaise.   The Horseradish Crusted Salmon: We had questions - how is a "horseradish" crust so airy and fluffy? Then we consulted with our server who spilled the beans. It's the Egg Whites folded in with the horseradish.  Add a tangy grain mustard sauce to balance the rich salmon, and you've got an old-school French combo. IMHO, in today's flavor landscape, mustard doesn't get enough love.   Let's talk dessert!!  Pastry Chef Killian Guillotin grew up in Brittany, France, and  cut his teeth in top French kitchens before sharing his magic here.   The Baked Chocolate Soufflé with two sauces. Light as a cloud with just enough rich-sweetness to say dessert's in the house. And don't get me started with the vanilla bean crème anglaise and Belgian chocolate sauces. Worth every calorie!!  Is Gary Danko old school? Maybe. But in the way your favorite vintage wine is old. Complex, full bodies, and full of finesse .   Happy Eating!!

title: Cute spot for an early dinner
text: My husband, daughter and I visited for an early dinner. Staff were super friendly and helpful & the food was delicious.  We will return!

title: Cosy and perfect
text: Great avocado toast, hot chocolate to die ! The bagels too are good! We would be back again!  The washroom too was very clean and beautifully decorated. Yes, we noticed ;)

title: Avoid this place
text: I visited Nusr-Et in Istanbul and had an excellent experience, so I was expecting something similar from this branch — but it fell far short. The service was very poor, and the meal was wildly overpriced.  The staff lacked professionalism and attention, which made the entire experience disappointing. Management should seriously address the service quality.  Overall, I felt scammed. Not recommended at all. Avoid this place.

title: Disappointing special occasion
text: Firstly the food was excellent. We had the set menu Steak Tartare and Striploin (fatty but to be expected) and Sticky Toffee Pudding. We thoroughly enjoyed the food, there was a nice busy ambience and feel to the restaurant. We were close enough to a window to have a view of the park.  Visiting from England and Abu Dhabi we were celebrating my daughters 21st birthday. Every other place we have been to in New York have acknowledged this and we have loved the welcoming feel. The Bluebird dinner was the real big event for us and we were soo disappointed with the service. We were greeted with a ‘Yes’ I almost wanted to apologise for being there. The maitre d walked away without speaking to us - we kind of figured we should follow! Most restaurants begin with a Good Evening and Welcome at the very least. A waiter asked if we wanted water (we later noticed everyone else having tap water) and swiftly brought a bottle of still. No smile, no niceties, no welcome.  Next our server came to us, perfectly amicable and perfunctory but no introduction or welcome. We ordered our food and drinks.  Food came very quickly as starters were both cold. I asked a waiter if we could have our drinks, he explained they were busy. I explained this was a special occasion and so far it had been less than special. To his credit a few minutes later the drinks appeared. We received our steaks and the manger noted we had no steak knives, which she quickly corrected. Mains cleared and deserts promptly brought out.  When we had finished our desert our server asked if we wanted anything or just the check! By this time I was totally incensed. Let alone feel this was a special occasion, we were now feeling an inconvenience and she just wanted us to leave. 250 dollars for 2 - I at least expect to feel welcome.  Perhaps I am wrong to expect a little more personalised attention at a restaurant of this standard. Clearly it is just a get them in and out and take their money business model. I did not leave a tip and funnily enough no one asked me if everything was ok for me to put my thoughts across at the end of the evening. A shame that such a special occasion will be tainted by a lack of attention and personal experience.

title: Truly Unique and Delicious
text: This was the best restaurant experience my wife and I had in a while.  The experience was top notch from arrival to departure.  Service was friendly, helpful,and attentive.  Food was imaginative, beautifully cooked and presented.  Every dish, from amuse bouche to dessert had interesting flavors, quality ingredients, and lovely presentation. No dish was like anything we’ve had anywhere else. This is a kitchen with a truly unique (and delicious) point of view.

title: Ignore the low ratings!
text: The low avg rating isn’t correct in our opinion. A few things: - This isn’t a Mexican restaurant. It’s meso-American centered around different types of corn. The head chef and all the kitchen staff are Colombian.  - As expected for a Michelin starred restaurant, it was very inventive and we found almost every dish incredible. The flavors were complex and the presentation was amazing. The only exception was one dish (the catch of the day), which was too salty in our opinion, but that was an outlier of the 8 dishes we tried. The highlights were the tacos al pastor, smoked trumpet mushrooms, crab arepa, and carnitas.  - The service was on point. Quick, friendly, and knowledgeable.

title: A food lover treat !
text: I’m not sure where to start! This is an exceptional restaurant from all aspects. Mexican food with a twist! The creativity and innovation in each plate we tried was beyond expectations.  Lots of flavor with Mexican roots mixed and combined in a creative way.  A wonderful culinary experience that explains why this gem earned one star Michelin.  Needless to say that this restaurant is located in the vibrant coconut grove area. Staff was very friendly and service was great. Strongly recommended for food lovers!

title: Riff of Miami not nice
text: I hope you read my review before you eat and not after as i did. Food average Told Happy hour ..but 2 beers still cost € $25 for 2 beers. Service 20% and we were shouted at tat we had to pay it. Not a good example of how to treat customers in your town AVOID AVOID AVOID. This has left a very bad impression of your town and your restaurant.   Rip off

title: Worst experience in Miami
text: Don’t look to the dress code, they are accepting people with sport trousers and you can see people directly came from gym. The man at the entrance knows nothing to choose the people. Gipsy kind of people are inside the place.  After entering to the restaurant we’ve waited 30+ minutes at the bar for our reserved table to be ready which we reserved a month ago. When we were waiting we ordered cocktail and had the worst cocktail ever! Decoration is nice (only good thing of the restaurant) but the sound system is horrible as you only hear sub frequencies and cannot understand the music + noise of the people inside make it a jungle. Food is worse than average. You can have better chinese and japanese food even on the street.  We ordered a bottle of wine and had just 3 quarter glasses from it and the waiter asked for more wine as he lost the bottle. Then we asked him to find and he found it after we pushed him to!   We had worst experience in Miami!!

title: Prioritize my bladder!!!!
text: Hello,  I regret  to inform you that your staff needs to be engaged in coaching, due to the lack of attention to a female and I needing to use the restrooms after multiple attempts to utilize them. I was ignored by the first female and was given a puzzled look that they can't be opened. After I went around to seek attention from the other staff she rudely stated both bathrooms are not available, after I asked why she said " they just are ". I asked to see what would cause them to be unusable but could only feel discriminated as she added no urgency to the issue. She then asked if I was management to even request to see the inside of the bathrooms. As a LONG TIME CUSTOMER. I suggest to keep your client based loyal to address this issue as it leaves a bad image on the franchise. I left feeling "I didn't have it my way ". And that's just a bowl movement. Thank you for your time and I hope this matter has been addressed the next time I pass by the store as I will try to obtain pictures of the staff reluctant to assist.   Best regards,  JJ.

title: No soap in the toilets!!!
text: An amazing collection of memorabilia and superb drinks, what a shame it is let down by basic hygiene standards!!  A notice is displayed in the toilets instructing staff to wash their hands but how can employees or customers wash their hands effectively when there is no soap in the ladies toilets other than the disabled toilet!! Shocking!!

title: HArd to find but worth the effort!!
text: It's all about the food-and this place has some wonderful authentic delicious food!!!   I am from the Caribbean &  most restaurants think if you put a fried banana on a plate that will make it Caribbean food...no not true!  The Caribbean is a a melting pot with complex cuisine...Spanish, French, African, Indian, Dutch, Portuguese, influences.  The Breadfruit Tree is Caribbean food.  Louis the owner was so friendly- the food was delicious.  I thought I was "home" and my grandmother was in the kitchen. We started with a rum punch...but this wasn't any old rum punch...this was a really West Indian Rum punch...tastes so good but packs a punch!!!  We had the food served family style & we ordered the sweet fish, curry, jerk chicken, peleau...OMG everything was delicious!!!! The menu changes daily so you have to read the chalkboard...I was hoping for Roti...but it wasn't on the chalkboard.  However, Louis did tell me if I call ahead he'd make sure it was on the menu the next time I came by.  Service was good- drinks arrived quickly- food took a little time...but if you go with good company the wait won't matter, because it's worth the wait!!!    They are open seasonally so call ahead if its not boating season...if the weather is good they may be there.  I can hardly wait to go back...I almost forgot save room for desert- the chocolate bread pudding tastes just like my granddad's bread pudding & I only like my granddad's bread pudding...Louis is an amazing chef....and I LOVE his bread pudding!!!    Just remember it may be hard to find this place if you are driving in and not sailing in...but it's worth finding!

title: Huge portions and very tasty food overcome the dingy dining room
text: I was born in Stockton, but left in 1970. I remember eating at Xochimilco Cafe as a child very fondly and was looking forward to revisiting a very  old friend.  The food was well above-average and the portions were enormous. I ordered the two tostada plate, choosing guacamole and chicken. Both tostadas were built on hot, freshly-made tortillas and were heaped with cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, and sour cream. I enjoyed them very much. Rice, beans and fresh, hot flour tortillas were also served and were delicious.   My companion ordered a three-item combination plate, that, as it came with Chile Verde and Chile Colorado, was really a 5-item plate. It was an absolutely enormous platter of food. While she ate only a small percentage of it, she proclaimed it as delicious.   The dining room hadn't changed very much since 1970, and the downtown Stockton location is far from attractive.  But the food made the trip worthwhile.

title: Rooftop nights
text: My first time here, i was invited at the rooftop for the Motown nights every Thursday. Very good, decent and behaved crowds.  Opens 7-10.  Definitely for someone who is a Motown music fan.  We danced the night away.  Drinks are priced reasonably.  One big bonus is the very, very nice sunset view.  Gets really really busy by 8:30.    This placed has started putting Stockton on the map again.  Downtown has been so sleepy in the past few years.  I hope this will go on and on.  Four stars for I saw some little kids in this very adult venue.

title: Great food
text: We arrived at 5:15pm and were surprised that the place was entirely empty.  Thought maybe we had made a poor selection and that the vacant diner was a bad omen.  NOPE:  within minutes the place was so packed there wasn't a vacant seat!  Lucky to have parked when we did.      We both had the Mediterranean Salad (split one between us) and the Baked Salmon with Brussels Sprouts and Roasted Potatoes.  Fabulous and flavorful!!  Then enjoyed a simple scoop of vanilla ice cream for dessert and off to the concert.    I'd definitely go again!

title: Neat find!  Good food.
text: This was a neat find.  There is indoor and outdoor seating.  We sat outside & the server pulled up a heater for us when it started to get a little chilly.   We ordered Cordon Bleu, & Schnitzel.  The Cordon Bleu was delicious!  The side I ordered was Spatzle & it was a little dry.   There are a ton of combinations that you can customize your entrée with.   We also ordered a pretzel for an appetizer, and a Bee Sting for dessert.  Both were good.

title: A little oasis after a bad day!
text: We enjoyed everything about this place! The ambience, the architecture, the decor, the seating, the food, the wine and the service!  We had the farm greens salad and the buttermilk dressing was amazing.  Then the papardelle and the risotto.  Both delicious.  Kekoa was our server and he was just the perfect mix of intelligence, humor, knowledge (everything from the risotto to the jazz playlist) and discretion.  End of a horrible travel day for us that was all but forgotten as we soaked up all the goodness of this restaurant/bar.  We will be back.

title: Too loud
text: The food was very good.  The service was excellent. Thank you so much Ben G and Cameron for the excellent service  The only complaint and for us it’s huge because it ruined the ambiance is how loud the restaurant is. We were yelling at each other to be heard over the noise

title: Great Food. Fun Spot!
text: Loved the vibe and our server.  The food was excellent!  The Western Burger was so yummy and  the shoestring fries were amazing. We love the Thai Salad a bunch!  Just really good food and fun!

title: Subpar at best
text: I don’t understand where all these great reviews are coming from, but don’t be fooled like I was. First of all, the service was subpar. We asked our server repeatedly for a baby booster seat and she never brought it, so I finally had to get up and look for where they were kept. She also didn’t bring the juice we ordered for our toddler till the end of the meal. Have you ever dealt with a thirsty toddler? Not good. Also, we ordered bottomless mimosas and only got one refill, after asking repeatedly for it. Our glasses were empty most of the meal. Now the food. We ordered eggs Benedict and the eggs were hard boiled, served over stale bread with just a little bit of hollandaise. It was gross. The only good food was the side of bacon we ordered for our toddler. Overall this was by far the worst restaurant experience I have ever had, especially because it ruined Father’s Day for my husband.

title: Conveniently near hotel
text: We came here for a light dinner after check-in at the Marriott Residence Inn right across the street. Liked the clean exterior curb appeal. There were patio seatings. The interior with high ceiling was welcoming. We settled into a quiet, comfortable booth in one section of the spacious dining room. Enjoyed the draft BlueMoon. The dishes we ordered: Mac & cheese, cornbread, onion soup, Caesar, poached salmon spinach salad, mixed green salad, and shrimp scampi were all quite average. Service was good.

title: Poorly Trained and/or Lazy Staff
text: A group of 6 had dinner New Year's Eve, and we were extremely disappointed.  The wait staff could have cared less about the level of service provided, and most of our food was mediocre at best.  We ordered an appetizer of loaded tater tots...yes, folks, tater tots...no one thought to bring small plates for us to use, and we were probably lucky to have napkins and utensils.  Salads were delivered at the same time as our entrée's, which is not a big deal, but the table became very crowded and we felt rushed.  My wife's entrée never arrived; we gave the waiter a few minutes before asking him to go find it, and again, it never arrived.  He seemed shocked that we gave up and wanted the item removed from our bill.  The waiter never asked if we wanted a second round of drinks...it's New Year's Eve, and he doesn't think it's a good idea to offer another round of expensive drinks?  He did ask if we wanted dessert, but by that point, we were done with him and Cafeteria 15L.  The waiter was tipped appropriately for the amount of service provided, which was half of our normal tip.  I have no need to return to this place, and given the number of negative reviews about service, ownership should be embarrassed.

title: A hidden treasure
text: This restaurant is a hidden gem. It’s like a little bit of New York with wonderful atmosphere. The liver and onions is the best

title: Excellent service, food, and ambiance!
text: This restaurant was excellent! Small restaurant with great ambiance. Owner is wonderful… professional with a sense of humor. He comes to your table and tells you the extensive menu.  The food was out of this world! We had crab cakes, caprese salad, crusted salmon, rib eye, and key lime pie!

title: 1st Time Visit, in Love with it
text: We went there two weeks ago and honestly fell in love with it. I'm a foodie, scratch kitchen guy, the food was wonderful. Salmon was tender enough that it melted like butter. Ambience was old school Little Italy. It is our new favorite.   As to the service, our service was great, but it was old school. Nothing is very fast. It seems only the owner takes orders and so you wait for him. This is an experience. If you're not ready to order a drink/ app, it was the kind of place where you might wait 10 minutes and then they will check in again-- not 2 minutes, This isn't fast casual. Dinner is the event.

title: I wish we had a better experience
text: I dont typically like writing bad reviews because I feel like people nit pick too much, but we truly had such a bad experience here that we didnt even order dinner(apps only). The servers are very rude and I dont think they even realize it. We felt ignored even though we were in the middle of the restaurant. They didnt ask if we were finished and cleared food off the table before we were done. There was even a hair in one of the bites. We paid and left as soon as we could. The food was good, but hold the hair next time. Although really, there wont be a next time.

title: Unique experience with terrific food and showmanship owner
text: Wonderful lamb loin, swordfish, salmon and veal.  Loved food creatively presented and delicious.  Best mashed potatoes ever.  Moderate wine prices and attentive service.  A Sacramento gem.

title: Expecting Better
text: We arrived early for our reservation and we were seated quickly.  It was not very busy as it was a Wednesday night, but maybe a bit too busy for the limited waitstaff. The atmosphere was nice.  Not too noisy but a good sound and the kitchen is visible from the restaurant.  The food was a little disappointing.  We had several sides and the pork chop and they all seemed to be lacking flavor, they would good but we were expecting a bit more.  The service was good considering the waiter was handling quite a few tables.

title: Gem in Midtown.
text: Excellent vegan tasting menu and I’m not Vegan! Friendly service.  Vegan and non vegan menu options.

title: Top dinner experience in Northern California.
text: My wife had wanted to go here for awhile,  since she is a vegan and they vegan options. She couldn’t decide among the various choices, so I suggested the two person tasting menu. They created and vegan masterpiece. The variety of flavors was amazing. Some of the offerings were among the best food I have ever had, vegan or otherwise.  This place is a gem and we had one of the best dinner experiences ever! We did not have wine with dinner, so if that is important, check out the wine list ahead of time. Our only complaint was that there was too much food, but that was erased when we enjoyed a nice lunch of left overs the next day. Finally, for those who love meat, as the name suggests, they have many other choices besides vegan. Try this place and I bet it becomes a regular dinner spot for you and your loved ones.

title: The atmosphere was better than the food
text: This restaurant was picked based on good reviews but those people must be more interested in the atmosphere than the food.  The location is good (though there is only paid parking nearby) and there are a lot of shops and restaurants that can be walked to from here.  It was lively but not too loud inside.   However, the food was rather expensive for what was received.  The food was good but not exceptional.  We ordered a pizza and the side of carrots.  The serving size of the pizza was good but the serving size of the carrots was small considering the $15 price tag on a side dish.

title: The waitress was great. The salad was tasty but they should call it asparagus salad not Nicoise!
text: Their salad Niçoise salad. It had no tuna. It had crumbled eggs instead of sliced boiled eggs, little olives. The only nice thing was the pickled red onions and the asparagus. They claim they don’t add tuna because it’s a vegetarian restaurant but the sell duck ragu and bergers. Go figure!

title: Very disappointed, not worth the trip
text: We went for a birthday celebration and was very disappointed in the slow service and lack of knowledge of the server. order chilled seafood platter, steak and lobster and oyster rock fellows, the steak came first and waited a while before the chilled seafood plater came out and the oyster appetizer never came before our meals. the oysters on the chilled plate had lots of sand and shells in it and the steak was so so. The manager asked how your dinner was and told him of the problems and he did not say sorry or make any adjustment. All in all very disappointed birthday celebration

title: LOBSTER ROLL!!!
text: 10 out of 10!  We had a late lunch here. We initially were sat next to a really loud group. The hostess was really nice about moving us to a different spot when I asked. We had shrimp ceviche which was good. I had a lobster roll which was so delicious. It was a little different with no Mayo but so so good! The bread was warm and soft. My husband had the lobster Mac. It was very decadent and pretty heavy so it could serve 2.  Our server Luis was very friendly and attentive.  There was guy playing a guitar with an amplifier which at first was a little loud but seemed like they turned it down a bit. I really enjoyed his music. Lots of covers and Latin guitar. Will be back, would recommend!

title: Never again, they’re lazy and lousy…
text: The service was terrible. I ordered my food online and I arrived after the time it was supposed to be ready. It wasn't ready when I got there and the lady from the bar was running around asking questions. She finally came to me and asked what I had ordered. I showed her my receipt. She left and came back after like 7 more minutes and let me know that it will be like 10 mins until my order was done. I asked if they just started on my order and she said yes. The worse customer service ever. She didn’t try to make up for their wrong doing or anything. She left me sitting at the bar for 20 mins and asked if I wanted a water. Crazy right? I know.. My food comes out and she hands it to me and tells me to have a goodnight… I’m irritated so I’m just like whatever. I’m really appalled at the lack of customer service here. Then I’m at my car sitting and a Asian lady, whose been eating at the bar for most of the night not assisting and just answering questions, came to my car with like 3-4 more people and said the tab wasn’t paid. I said okay, let me pay it but your employee said bye and goodnight so don’t try to make it like it’s my fault. Y’all dropped the ball tonight and the only thing you could do was come to my car disrespectfully about this bill. And I told her that she should be taking money off got the inconvenience but she didn’t want to hear that. She blamed the kitchen. I told her that is not my problem because it’s not. And I told her I would not be coming back. Too much money to spend on gold where people are rude and don’t know hot to correct their wrongs.

title: Best taste Seafood in town !
text: We’re inviting by friends to check on this Seafood Restaurant. We were surprised by the food!! Great food 🥘 Good service !!  Definitely will Be back😘

title: defamation of character
text: I came into station 16 today as I always do because this is one of my favorite restaurants to visit. My alcoholic beverage was watery and I sent it back. general manager RJ ( who refused to give me his real name who was rude) start talking stuff stating every time I come in here it's an issue and the last time I had an issue with the server. Mind you he was the server I complained about before he became general manager because when he was a server he had the same nasty attitude and I complained to his manager at the time and I'm sorry if a server is being rude to me im going to let upper management know that is my right and if my food comes out not good or cold as a PAYING customer I have a right to have them remake it never was rude always respectful. The fact that he stated this false accusation in front of other customers and staff badgering my character (that's defamation of character which my friend I was with recorded this) he made me feel so humiliated, uncomfortable and he embarrassed me! When I asked to speak with the chain of command he refused and stated with a smart gesture and said "he's the general manager and he's the last of the chain of command and if the owners want to call me they will and that's if the owner feels like calling me" and he will let them know it's always an issue which is very much false and I feel he's making this up to cover up his wrong doing and to retaliate against me for when I complained on him. Not only did he humiliated me but defamation of character, I will be taken this further more legally. The disrespect and attitude was uncalled for and very unprofessional and I will be taken actions all the way. Mind you I haven't been here in months because I had kidney surgery (life threatening) and was fighting for my life and came out to celebrate life and this how I'm treated. Run back the cameras and you will see how I was treated and how he humiliated me in front  of staff and customers because he wanted to retaliate. By him being a general manager he should of conducted hisself way better and professionally. He is in place to defuse any issues not make them worst and not to be rude or retaliate against me because he was complained on and now taken this personal. He approached my table with the smart remarks and my friend had me asked him again what he said so we can get it on recording and he did.

title: We weren’t expecting much judging from the outside
text: But Franco the owner was sooo amazing. Ferrying us around when we needed help. He looks like an old grizzly Italian. But he smiles and is so friendly. There is a picture on the wall of his dad in 1940 working behind the bar. Franco’s son works there too. They all look alike - and unfortunately smoke! The food is good. Fresh and interesting. Our room was large and light. Loads of hot water. Nothing posh. But comfortable. And clean. Italy at its best.

title: The place to Stay in san Quirico...
text: By that I mean that it is the ONLY place to stay in the village. We weep on a walking tour so only stayed the one night. Rooms are quiet and big but the beds are below par. We had a terrace but the access to it was covered in pigeon poo so I don't think anyone had been in the room for weeks. On the shower there is an odd plastic plate, take this out before showering, it is deadly! We ate down stairs and it was very nice. Breakfast was "OK"

title: A welcome surprise
text: When we got to San Quirico and saw the town, the main square, and the outside of the hotel, we were prepared to be disappointed. It's a small town, there's a gas station in the center of the piazza, and if you're looking for the hotel - well, the sign mostly indicates the restaurant: Ristorante La Vecchia Fonte. In fact, you have to enter the restaurant, walk through to the back, and say you have a reservation in the hotel. The friendly and helpful (though somewhat English-challenged) staff take you upstairs and show you your room - the rooms are bright, clean, and usable, with views overlooking the piazza or the town. It's a 15 minute (or so) level walk to the historic abandoned town of Vertozza nearby; otherwise, there's not much to do in San Quirico. We had dinner in the hotel's restaurant (Very good!) and breakfast (included) in the back of the restaurant. The promised WiFi didn't seem to connect in our room - but this is often the case in Italian hotels in our experience.

title: Comfortable Clean Overnight Stop if you are on a car trip
text: Interesting concept for those driving.  self checkin with your car ( but we had help) the garage door opens and also one at your room.  prive into your personal garage and them close the dorr and walk up the stairs to your room.  Its a very nice room with a spa and lovely bed - but no refrigerator :-( .  THey have great room service from a corridor that runs behind all the rooms.  Great if you dont have teh need to go out and walk around.  Its in a commercial area so car is needed to get there and to go out to stretch your legs and explore in any case.  We would stay again but we were only there to sleep and have a bite.

title: Jeju Spirited Garden
text: Well worth a visit if you're in Jeju, South Korea.  Sang Bum Young pictured here,  is the creator of this Bonsai garden. It had taken him 57 years to create.

title: lipa noi april 2011
text: hi i stayed at the littel pearl for seven nights in april this year two weeks after the floods and i was amazed at how cleaen and well organised the resort was .appel the thai landlady and her husband made me morn than welcome .the bungerlow i stayed in was right next to the beach . the b/fast was good  all in all it was a fantastic stay  made better by fantastic owners

title: My new favorite go to restaurant! (Veg)
text: I have been meaning to try Mother for a long time--wish I did sooner! So excited to find an amazing delicious vegetarian restaurant such as this--so far my favorite between Sac and SF! I had the hummus pita with nut burger add on side and broccolini adobo and all was so delicious and nutritious and filling! I am a big eater and couldn't finish it all so have enough left for a snack later! A great deal considering the quality, satisfying portions, the best nutrition--not to mention pure enjoyment. The salad garnish with the hummus was so exceptionally tasty and fresh and the portions were generous and the pita was made in this unique sort of delicious almost crackly translucent but still pita-ish way that is not like a dry pita cracker. It was all outstanding! They don't even have a good place like this in SF--I think it would be really successful in SF...  The folks there were super nice as well.

title: Just right
text: This vegetarian food actually tastes like something. The chili was excellent, with lots of fresh ingredients that worked well together. The two other dinners were quite good as well. This place is relaxed and unpretentious.

title: Perfection
text: Fantastic!  I stopped by this awesome place for lunch after a long morning at the State Capitol.  For lunch, I had the chicken fried mushrooms and vegan cookies.  My lunch was perfection.  Everything was extremely flavorful. I enjoyed my lunch outside and people watched.  Mother is a must.

title: Disappointing!!!
text: I wanted a side dish of hummus & pita.  Not possible, could only order flat bread with hummus & greens on top ($14).  There was Maybe 4 tablespoons of AWFUL tasting hummus on top of DRY, over cooked, stale flatbread (too tough to chew).  I ate most of the greens & left the rest.  Took a while to get my order before I had to dash back next door to the Crest to make it to a movie.  The gnocchi was DRY (packaged? 2 days old?) but the pesto sauce was good.  The ratatouille wasn't cooked enough. Not impressed.

title: Groovy food
text: I am not a vegetarian, but do enjoy vegetarian meals.  This place seems to try a bit too hard to be "cool", at least in my opinion.

title: Amazing burgers and great drinks
text: Amazing goat cheese burger and great beer. The hazelnut cappuccino was also incredible. I already know I'm getting the lamb burger when I come back.

title: Order to go???
text: Love the food - never missed yet on the three times that I have been there.  The only problem is the lack of sufficient parking. Most of the street parking require resident stickers or are limited to 15 minutes or 1 hour at the most.  Parking lots holds 8  (?) cars? Go with someone with a resident parking sticker.

title: More, I want more!
text: Wow I am glad I found this place.  I was in town, we were all hungry. I saw this place out of the corner of my eye and something told me to pull in. So I did and I was super happy with the quality of the food. Although the salmon could have been cooked about 2 to 3 minutes longer, the flavors and the veggies totally rocked. I WILL BE BACK !

title: Brunch by the Park...
text: TY, TY, TY!!!!!  For being awesome, being opened and being SO TASTY!!!!!  Hubby and I had some business Downtown and we were looking for an awesome brunch spot!!!  OH MY GOODNESS, the Bergen Benedict and Creme Brule  French Toast were FABULOUS with lattes!!!  Simply the TASTIEST!!!!! <3

title: Wonderful Breakfast/Lunch
text: My husband and I went for lunch today and it turned out that they were still offering breakfast too! So I had their breakfast California burrito, which was excellent. It came with the best pico de gallo I have ever had and also came with a small side of fruit and there was also what looked like Italian dressing, which I didn’t use because the burrito really didn’t need it. This plate  could easily be shared. Also had their freshly squeezed orange juice, delicious.My husband had the fish and chips and he said it was outstanding and the fries were really good. It also came with tartar sauce, an aioli and bbq sauce. This restaurant is a little pricey, but for the quality of food you get it’s worth it.  This place also has a great variety of different types of burgers and an extensive list of craft beers on tap. Such a great restaurant!

title: Big, comfortable and cheap.
text: I really liked this hotel. The room was HU-GE. Two big single beds, a desk, wardrobe, huge TV, and big bathroom. Very clean and cheap. I recommend it definitely. Service at the front desk was great too. It is not a 5-star so don't expect luxuries, but for a 2 star it's very good.

title: Awesome front desk
text: The staff at front desk is outstanding. Especially Tatiana, and her associate. They adjusted our 3rd party booking like true professionals.

title: Customer service at its best!
text: Truly a historic gem (circa 1925) restored to modern day convenience. Good amenities in a great location.   Perhaps the best part was my experience at breakfast this morning. The standard Holiday Inn Express offerings were very well prepared (e.g., perfectly moist and appealing scrambled eggs) and the attendants distinguished themselves by their continuous checks and attention to detail like wiping up spills. However, the MOST REMARKABLE service I witnessed was when one of the two attendants noticed a guest (walking with a cane) needing assistance as he served his plate from the buffet. She respectfully approached him and offered her help. It was spontaneous kindness and true customer service at its best!  Both my day and my trip were made better by seeing the above (while also enjoying a tasty, filling breakfast)!  I will be back!

title: November Stay
text: Staff were very nice and hotel was very clean. I think the pictures make the rooms look bigger than they truly are- they do say it that rooms are small and cozy- it is truly SMALL AND COZY. Small that 2 people can barely walk at the same time. If you are clear on that you will have a fabulous stay- if you skip over that detail (like me) you may be confused. Aside from the small rooms they do offer a nice breakfast. The hotel is close to everything- trains, food, convenience stores and the casino. It is the perfect location for a visit to Chicago.

title: Hard pass, good location
text: Booked 4 nights stayed for 2. Have stayed in various HIE here and in Europe and you know going in the rooms will be smaller, basic but functional and nice. These rooms were small and considering it was renovated not functional at all. There are so many ways to maximize a small space but that was not done here. They were nice to let us see 2 other rooms and choose after our initial room. Good location, Front desk lady helpful and nice.

title: Cheap, tasty and quick
text: Cheap, tasty and quick. Can’t go wrong with Kiplings. Very nice.!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Good stuff
text: Best curry in the country , authentic, homemade curry. Absolutely the most friendly staff you can meet. Worth it’s weight in gold this place

title: Excellent
text: Excellent service, Mathew made my little boy very welcome. Food was amazing ! Best curry had in a long time . We will definitely be back

title: Will be returning
text: We hadn’t been to Kiplings for a few years, but were glad we did. Good variety of food and really delicious. We had starters and mains. Don’t normally appreciate popadoms, but the dips were great and we kept them to use them with our meal. It was super busy (at the weekend), but the staff were still really attentive. Will be back!

title: Perfect food and fantastic service
text: Just been back to Kiplings for another meal and as the last visit the food was absolutely delicious, the service was first class and we weren't rushed we were able to sit and enjoy our meal. Very nice friendly staff and they were very attentive. We can't praise this place enough. Best Indian meal we've ever had. A great big thank you to all the staff. 😄

title: Quiet Oasis on the river-front and Exceptional Service
text: We stayed at this lovely, relaxing and unassuming hotel for 3 days and could not fault the exceptional service provided by all the staff, especially the main host Hemasiri who always presented with a smile, was honest, super friendly, warm and helpful. No request went unheeded and the rooms are well sized, comfortable and cleaned to a high standard.  Although a few general updates wouldn’t go astray, the hotel grounds with the river front felt like a tropical oasis away from the hustle and bustle of life. The lunch and breakfast portions were huge and delicious.   Hotel Hemadan  is outstanding value for money and a hidden gem. We hope to return in the not too distant future.

title: Quiet pleasant two day stay.
text: A lovely quiet family run hotel with very helpful staff. It's an older rustic building with a clean room comfortable bed with a mosquito net.   Nice garden a large water monitor came for a visit whilst I was having my breakfast the food both dinner and breakfast was good.  Great value for money.

title: A tasty Chinese diner in this cosy restaurant.
text: This restaurant is locatedin the main shopping street of Roden. We arrived at about 18 o'clock, there were a number of take away custommers and we were the only guests in the restaurant area. We choose to sit near the window. The friendly waitress showed us the menu and served a good strong green tea and a flavourful jasmin tea. We ordered Prawn crackrs, Fu Yong Hay with large Prawns and Mi Fan with Siu Yok (roasted Pork) and Cha Siew (sweet roasted pork) . The dishes were prepared in the Chinese way and  tasty, as per my Chinese wife. We recommend this restaurant.

title: Open on Mondays, good fortune!
text: Not much open on Mondays so we were glad Good Fortune wasn’t closed. We decided on an Indonesian Rijsttafel for 2. Lots of food and it all tasted good. Some of the little dishes were not as Indonesian as I had hoped more Chinese cuisine influenced. Over all the dinner was good and plentiful. Not too pricey either. Service was very friendly.

title: An wonderful experience
text: A wonderful experience. It is very expensive, but you know that before you get there. We had the abridged menu; couldn’t eat a 10 course meal and would not want to pay the much   But the meal was fantastic and the friendliest, most helpful wait service. The wagyu was the best ever.  And the desserts were extremely good and different. If you want an excellent, interesting meal and can afford it, go there.

title: Best part of my trip to San Fran
text: Fantastic, food was incredible, but what stood out was the service and friendliest staff. I dined solo sat at the bar, and the bartender was extremely welcoming and chatted to me throughout my meal and gave great recommendations for my stay in the city, despite having a busy job of making all the drinks for the restaurant. Cocktails here were also fantastic!

title: Great date night!
text: We went last night for the abbreviated menu and it was delightful.  Perfect service that was both professional and playful.  The smell alone is worth another star.  The food was sublime and the wine pairings were different but matched beautifully.  The chef came by and visited with us and he was lovely.  Beautiful room and a gorgeous kitchen.

title: Splendid Saison
text: What a splendid meal at Saison. An innovative and tasty set menu with many standout dishes and presentation - lobster tartare, uni, white truffle pasta, duck etc. I would probably skip the wagyu supplement next time since i’m not a fan of wagyu generally   Service top notch and friendly as well  The kitchen tour was a plus  9.5/10

title: Exceptional all around
text: We went to visit our kids. Saison experience was beyond expectations. Staff game us exceptional service. Food and drinks were well presented and delicious.

title: You will NOT find cliché menu offerings here!
text: I researched both State Bird Provisions and The Progress and we selected The Progress for our dinner while visiting San Francisco for 2 nights. We love restaurants that are trying new things and The Progress delivered! We shared 5 dishes and then ordered two desserts, and we enjoyed every morsel. It was enough food for me, but my husband was still a little hungry when we left (he grabbed an apple back at the hotel) so perhaps we should have ordered another dish or even the duck—which was a lot of food but looked crispy and spectacular. Our favorites were the Tuna Crudo and the dramatic Brown Butter Seaweed Noodles, but truly everything was delicious.  This is a special occasion experience, so it is pricey, but its worth it to sample innovative  and sustainable food. I am not posting food pictures because mine did not do the food justice due to the lighting, but the presentations were lovely and creative.

title: A must go place in San Francisco
text: Very very interesting and creative menu, great wines, good service, nice atmosphere, great place to share plates and try new food combinations, much more interesting than the average restaurant menus

title: Phenomenal flavors!
text: Phenomenal flavors! My husband and I always enjoy experiencing different restaurants when we travel and this was our favorite food of the trip by far. Flavors were complex & interesting while remaining balanced - I had so much fun tasting every bite of the meal. Highly recommend!

title: World Class Food
text: I must write something short about this excellent establishment. Food and service world class, innovative, original and presented with an artistic touch. No pretentious airs. Michelin still deserved. Lighting a but low to read the menu so the prices were a bit of a surprise -  that's life in California.

title: Great food, great staff and a different experience!
text: There were 4 of us and one person could not tolerate garlic and our server really helped to determine the dishes that were free of it and which ones could be modified. I knew we were in a great restaurant ! Lots in the menu to choose from and the concept was to share the plates. We decided to do that but we also chose to have one as our main dish each. All the dishes were fantastic and too many to individually comment on. My main was the black cod and it was very good. I also had a bite of the pork chop and it was rich in flavour, moist and actually heavenly.  Overall a great culinary outing ! Well done!

title: Fantastic brunch spot
text: This was probably our favourite meal in San Francisco… great range of brunch options and fantastic friendly service- highly recommend

title: Bad mussels ruin experience!
text: This restaurant is in a beautiful area of SF!!!  Gorgeous old homes and buildings!  Amazing!!!    The service was very good and we loved that it is a tip free restaurant.  Awesome that they provide a great work environment for their employees.    The portions were huge!  Especially the pork chops!!!!  Also the cheese from the selection of 3 cheeses appetizers,  2 of the 3 were huge chunks of cheese.    Most of our food was amazing and very delicious.  But my sister and I had the PEI mussels that were very off and made me almost throw up.  We couldn’t eat them.  We told our waiter at the end of our meal, as he asked how the food was.  He told the cook and the cook said they were fresh, bought that day and tasted fine.  Too bad for us!  Charged full price .  Not that we were expecting them to remove the charge but since neither of us could eat them we would have thought there would have been more than a “too bad!”  It left our experience less that delightful.

title: Best family style food for group brunch.
text: We were here for a wedding brunch in the back and the staff couldn’t have been more accommodating. The food was excellent and we all enjoyed the brunch tremendously.

title: Staff Attitude
text: My first and last time dining at this restaurant. Our server was great but one staff that was working at the backyard was rude and nasty. She was annoyed when I was standing by the door of the restroom which I must say they have a very small place. She kicked me out by saying "step outside!" What an attitude treating their customers. We like exploring French restaurants in San Francisco but this will be out of our list and will not recommend. Disappointing!

title: First rate, highly recommended
text: Highly rated French restaurant, with an exceptionally high quality menu. Prices are reasonable for the excellent quality and service tips are built into the prices you see on the menu.

title: Well preserved
text: A nice little building out in the middle of nowhere. It was quite complete with a ground floor and courtyard and a story above that with rooms you could go in. It’s astonishing how old it is and it is one of the best preserved of the desert castles. You can only get there by car, lots of hotels do tours from Amman.

title: Isolated and enigmatic- a good addition to a 'Desert Castle' tour
text: Not much to see and not a lot is known about the site. It is thought it was a caravanserai. While named 'Qasr' (castle) the towers are solid and the slits in the walls unsuitable for arrows but useful for ventilation. I visited as part of a tour group- one of 3 sites visited under the 'Desert Castles' label as half a day trip.  The ride from Amman to the Qasr/s is flat desert and military sites with the occasional camel to spot and the 'castles' are easily spotted from the road. Each has their own point of interest. You can explore the many rooms of the caravanserai, peek out into the desert, imagine the travellers who may have journied here, consider how different the location must have been in less arid days. A lonely location- not something to make a special trip to on its own, but as part of a tour of similar structures it is a nice day out.

title: Wouldn't do again
text: I recall my wife and I not liking this stay at all. Didn't really love the area. The dining area seemed a bit small and cramped and the breakfast quality was one of the worst I've had in a hotel in a while, and that's saying something these days. Microwave orange cheese processed stuff is gross.

title: Great hotel stay!
text: Microtel is conveniently located near Mohegan Sun casino.  The hotel is quiet, very clean and comfortable. Staff are always friendly.

title: Ok I guess
text: Good place,  just wish the tv had a channel guide so we did not have to scroll every channel to find something to watch and we had to get a new key card every time we came back to our room!

title: Disappointed
text: The afternoon staff was very pleasant, room was clean. Went for breakfast 10 min before they shut down and housekeeper had the only face and attitude, giving us the side eye. Rushing my partner and I so she can turn everything off. To me that was very disrespectful as we paid almost $275 the night to stay there for a concert at Mohegan Casino.

title: A clean room to stay in
text: I always trust Wyndham and for good reasons. The hotel was very well kept. Very clean room. The front dest staff were very sweet and helpful and they were very attentive during breakfast. Definitely recommend it.

title: Exceptional knowledge provided, kindness and a very professional crew.
text: Unforgettable experience. The knowledge shared by sme’s was invaluable. The world needs Crow Canyon!   The expertise and educational opportunities provided by the center was exceptional. I highly recommend trips with Crow Canyon often.

title: Archeological Research Program (ARP) at Crow Canyon
text: I recently completed my fourth Archeological Research Program (ARP) at Crow Canyon.  The three previous ARP programs I've participated in were all mostly archeological digging.  I wasn't sure what to expect with the site survey program, but it was a great learning experience as the first part of the archeological process.  The week flew by as I was having fun and learning a lot.  The Crow Canyon instructors even slightly changed our itinerary because our group had so many questions about the entire process for site, so we had extra lab time to go over the lab processes.  I would definitely recommend the ARP program or any of the other programs Crow Canyon offers for furthering your adult learning on indigenous history.

title: Wet Behind the Bear's Ears
text: Week long educational outing with a small group that was really educational and fun.  Seeing Bear's Ears National Monument for the first time was breathtaking.  The depth of knowledge from the scholars and coordinators on the excursion was very helpful.  Our native cultures are still alive and well and we all should explore while we have the opportunity.  Crow Canyon respects our Native American lands and wants to preserve and share with everyone.

title: Week long travel with Crow Canyon in Southwest
text: I have travelled with Crow Canyon more than 8 times; mostly in the Southwest. I would label this travel adventure travel.  You are in a small group with at least two scholars, one an archeologist and one a related field.    I have learned so much and had access to so many archeological sites I would not otherwise be allowed to visit.  The trip leaders are full time employees who are very professional and experienced.  These trips are unique learning experiences.  Additionally, I have developed many lasting friendships with other persons I have met on the trips....we all share common interests  which adds to our own experiences.

title: World Traver favorite vacation
text: I expected the scenery and the sites to be amazing, but was not prepared for the professionalism and passion of the staff!  Without exception all staff members engaged with participants to educate and make feel welcome!

title: Awesome front desk
text: The staff at front desk is outstanding. Especially Tatiana, and her associate. They adjusted our 3rd party booking like true professionals.

title: Customer service at its best!
text: Truly a historic gem (circa 1925) restored to modern day convenience. Good amenities in a great location.   Perhaps the best part was my experience at breakfast this morning. The standard Holiday Inn Express offerings were very well prepared (e.g., perfectly moist and appealing scrambled eggs) and the attendants distinguished themselves by their continuous checks and attention to detail like wiping up spills. However, the MOST REMARKABLE service I witnessed was when one of the two attendants noticed a guest (walking with a cane) needing assistance as he served his plate from the buffet. She respectfully approached him and offered her help. It was spontaneous kindness and true customer service at its best!  Both my day and my trip were made better by seeing the above (while also enjoying a tasty, filling breakfast)!  I will be back!

title: November Stay
text: Staff were very nice and hotel was very clean. I think the pictures make the rooms look bigger than they truly are- they do say it that rooms are small and cozy- it is truly SMALL AND COZY. Small that 2 people can barely walk at the same time. If you are clear on that you will have a fabulous stay- if you skip over that detail (like me) you may be confused. Aside from the small rooms they do offer a nice breakfast. The hotel is close to everything- trains, food, convenience stores and the casino. It is the perfect location for a visit to Chicago.

title: Hard pass, good location
text: Booked 4 nights stayed for 2. Have stayed in various HIE here and in Europe and you know going in the rooms will be smaller, basic but functional and nice. These rooms were small and considering it was renovated not functional at all. There are so many ways to maximize a small space but that was not done here. They were nice to let us see 2 other rooms and choose after our initial room. Good location, Front desk lady helpful and nice.

location_title: Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse (San José)
title: Beware
text: This hotel needs to come into the 21rst centurary. The staff are friendly but do not speak any other language than Spanish with any conviction, so brush up on your Spanish. The handyman needs to be sent in to complete outstanding work, such as toilet seat, wash hand basin not fixed to the wall. No parking at all and  it is a lottery to find a spot. Never accept room 5 as it is next to the reception and you get all the noises of people chatting at all times of the night. Also misterious old women appears from no where, but generally likes to watch the TV.

title: Pass it by . Better places close by to enjoy for the $$ .snooty pretend manager .Pass it by . promise
text: Save your $$$ for a more welcoming place... not a place to spend your $$ at . Shameful manager . shamefull  . thanks for the great wines ..But just by the product any other way . NOT A NICE PLACE TO ENJOY FOR REGULAR FOLKS. manager made sure of that and now can't even leave a message for the family.... Sad ...

title: A wonderful winery and restaurant!
text: A wonderful winery with a great restaurant. Very beautiful inside. Friendly staff. Great to go up the stairs and look down from above into the giant barrel rooms! A very special place.

title: Don’t miss it!   Wonderful experience.
text: Amazing service from Austin!  Great wine recommendation.  The food was outstanding.  I loved the pasta course.  Wish I could have that every day!  Not our first or last visit to this wonderful restaurant.

title: amazing
text: wonderful delicious kosher food and wine decent covid policy good service and not pushy to buy a case of wine although many guests do I would go back again as soon as I can

title: Wide range of excellent wines
text: One of the things my wife and I like about Herzog Winery is that they make a wide range of wines, all of which are good, and at a wide range of prices.  The range of wines allows a different tasting experience each time we visit.  On this visit, we particularly liked the Sauvignon Blanc, which is not sharp, and the Choreograph, which is a field blend of ten varietals, but the Malbec was among the best wines we've tasted -- and we've tasted in over 200 wineries in eight states.  Occasionally we encounter a wine that evokes an intense pleasurable response, and this Malbec was one of those.  It would be hard to find a better wine at the price, and it would be even harder to find a better wine at twice the price.  Note that the winery is closed on Saturdays for religious observance, but it's worth the effort to fit it into the schedule on another day.

title: Great service with a lovely view
