text: ES is a very friendly restaurant with great service, delicious food and a lovely view of the harbour in Turunc. There is a nice selection of local and western dishes to choose from and the steaks are very good. Highly recommended.

title: ANOTHER GREAT MEAL
text: Another year,another visit,my wife and I and two friends,visited tonight,we were shown to our pre booked table by Mehmet,we had a great view of the harbour and village,we had free homemade bread and a dip to start,followed by chicken in bacon sauce and chicken & salmon in almond sauce,which is exactly what we had last year,and as last year,both were excellent as was the service. Maybe the best meal so far!

title: Worth visiting
text: We are regular visitors to the resort but had never had a meal at this restaurant before. As we were staying at the accommodation this time, we naturally tried the food.  We were not disappointed. The portions are generous and the quality outstanding.

title: BEST MEAL SO FAR!
text: My wife and I have been visiting TURUNC for many years,if fact we stayed at the Es for a month 10 yrs ago,but we have not visited the restaurant for a few years,we went tonight,to be met by Mehmet,who was there 10 yrs ago, We booked a table the night before,tonight we a free starter of homemade bread and an olive oil dip,followed by chicken in bacon sauce and chicken with salmon & almond,both meals were excellent as was the service and great views and good value for money,we both said the best meal of our month long stay,we will be back

title: Brilliant. Best steak ever.
text: This restaurant has lovely view of the harbour from the terrace. The staff are very attentive and friendly. All areas pleasant and very clean. The food was delicious the best steaks we have had during our holiday, husband enjoyed the mash potatoes 😋 nice change from chips.

title: Unable to gain access to the church
text: We were not able to enter the church. The campanile is historically important since it was built in 1833, the first year that Christians were allowed to replace or rebuild their churches.

title: Nothing left to see
text: Church of Saint Menas of Samatya also called as Agios Minas Church in Turkish is a Greek Orthodox Church in İstanbul.İt is located in the district of Fatih,in the neighbourhood of Kocamustafapaşa (historical Samatya) and it lies inside the walled city.Very easy to reach at by public transport like buses and tram and then a short walk.Presently it is also difficult to locate it and not in a good shape to see.Not recommended.

title: Hotel Elfriede is a little gem!
text: Hotel Elfriede is a small and very cosy garni hotel in a perfect location in Serfaus close to slopes and the subway. It is placed on a small hill with beautiful view over the valley and the town. It has a convenient car park right in front. The Panorama room on the 1st floor we had was spotless - clean, fairly large with a nice bathroom and large balcony.  The staff is very nice and polite and the owner is both friendly and professional - always available and ready to help. The B&B option is quite convenient because residents are allowed to prepare meals in the kitchen in the afternoon if they don't want to dine outside. The restaurants, bars and shops are within a short walking distance down to the main street.  The wellness area is fairly small but very intimate with Finnish sauna, Turkish Bath and Kneipp pool available.   I would strongly recommend this place to anyone looking for a reasonably priced and cosy B&B accommodation in the centre of Serfaus.

title: Beautiful rooms in excellent location
text: We spend two nights as a weekend trip and are absolutley satisfied with the friendly host, big rooms,with balconee and fridge, fast wifi and a tasty breakfast buffet.  The location in the middle of serfaus is super, and as it is not located at the main street it is also quite.

title: Don't order curries from the buffet menue
text: Ordered food from the buffet menu for my husbands birthday party. Was horrified to find that the curries were just cause with no meat. Phoned round all the guests incase it was just me that got no meat but all said that there wasn't any in the curries. I was mortified. Phoned to complain and was told manager would phone me next day. Stil waiting for the call but guess it isn't coming any time soon. Was a valued customer of 13 years. Won't go back. Con artists!

title: This restaurant doesn't pay minimum wage.
text: Not a food review but an employer review. My daughter had a trial shift and they offered £5 per hour whilst training and £8 per hour on training completion. As they are EVERYONE knows there is a national minimum wage which for a 21 year old is £12.21. Please consider whether you want to patronise an establishment that is clearly in breach of law and is exploiting our young.

title: SCAM
text: Such a SCAM!!! Had the worst experience. So the food was delicious and no problem with that. Me and my friend went to the restaurant for food and drinks. There was no drink menu in the restaurant but not a problem as we were only getting soft drinks. We had 4 drinks all together (coke pints) and we got a HAND WRITTEN bill that our drinks were £20. While ordering we seen the waitress put a can of juice in a pint glass and filled it with ice. I’m sorry but £5 for a can of juice. That £20 could easily go to another meal. Honestly gutted as the food was great but I went to call the restaurant and I was told I was saving money apparently by getting a pint. Really disappointed overall with everything and won’t recommend

title: Mince
text: The worst of the worst, absolutely gash. The staff are useless. Holding up cash to buy a simple carry out and ignored for 20 minutes.

title: Great place for a meal.
text: We first went to Rangoli as we were given a voucher and this was our third time going back again. 4 of us had the pre-theatre menu which has great choice and ample portion sizes. Our friend had the a-la-carte and his portion size was massive. The quality of the food was excellent and the service, as always, was great and all the staff very friendly.

title: Went down hill with non existant service and not so good food
text: Went down hill big time.  Used to make the 90 mile run many times a year but this time really was the last ever.  waited 15 minutes to order drinks and that took another 15 with no coffee refills ever.  Food wasn't what it used to be and there was no service at all.  Then we had to wait 20 minutes to get our check and another 15 at the cash register.  Sad to see a once great place slide so bad

title: Nothing to write home about
text: It was OK but not worth the hour drive. We were stuck at a half table at the door. Everytime the door opened, we got all that cold air. The butter was rick hard. The food was barely warm. Our server Mark was efficient and friendly. Meh.

title: Huge breakfast
text: We’ve been here several times over the years and it’s always been great. Portions are huge and easily splittable. My wife and I split an omelette and along with the potatoes and toast we couldn’t finish it. Service was great. Our server was very friendly, helpful, personable, always there with more coffee, and didn’t rush us. We were at a family gathering so our server knew we had a lot of talking and catching up to do. It was a great experience and we’ll be back again.

title: Good Brunch
text: We came here for brunch on a Sunday.  We had the stuffed french toast, gyro omelete, crepes, corned beef hash skillet and sophia's skillet and  coffee.  4 people  and the bill with tip was $91.  Not a cheap place for breakfast/brunch, but the serving size was big and the quality was pretty good.

title: Not good food
text: Fritatta was awful. Staff didn't try to correct situation. My husband's meal was also dissapointing and he was immediately sick and in need of a rest room. We will never go back.

location_title: Shake Shack – Madison Square Park (New York)
title: Wine tasting
text: Amazing wine and knowledable staff! Visited here with my family and really enjoyed our time here!! Highly recommended

location_title: Shake Shack – Madison Square Park (New York)
title: Fabulous TIME as always!
text: Canada Berries has professional and knowledgable staff who are friendly and customer service oriented. They patiently waited on my friend and I and introduced 9 different types of wine for us to taste and informed us what types of food goes with each fruit wine, and the health benefits of each fruit. The wine is delicious, I really liked Blueberry and Raspberry wine. The location is also a great meeting space with a second floor which hosted an investor presentation that I attended last year. It is spacious and got a big TV with tables and chairs so it was perfect. I also attended a Chinese New Year festival several years ago there with over 1,000 people in attendance with lots of live entertainment under big tents with proper stage, and lots of vendors. It has a big parking lots and it's all free so it's a fantastic venue. I highly recommend this winery. I have given out many of their wine as gifts, and people really like it!

title: Great service with a lovely view
text: ES is a very friendly restaurant with great service, delicious food and a lovely view of the harbour in Turunc. There is a nice selection of local and western dishes to choose from and the steaks are very good. Highly recommended.

title: ANOTHER GREAT MEAL
text: Another year,another visit,my wife and I and two friends,visited tonight,we were shown to our pre booked table by Mehmet,we had a great view of the harbour and village,we had free homemade bread and a dip to start,followed by chicken in bacon sauce and chicken & salmon in almond sauce,which is exactly what we had last year,and as last year,both were excellent as was the service. Maybe the best meal so far!

title: Worth visiting
text: We are regular visitors to the resort but had never had a meal at this restaurant before. As we were staying at the accommodation this time, we naturally tried the food.  We were not disappointed. The portions are generous and the quality outstanding.

title: BEST MEAL SO FAR!
text: My wife and I have been visiting TURUNC for many years,if fact we stayed at the Es for a month 10 yrs ago,but we have not visited the restaurant for a few years,we went tonight,to be met by Mehmet,who was there 10 yrs ago, We booked a table the night before,tonight we a free starter of homemade bread and an olive oil dip,followed by chicken in bacon sauce and chicken with salmon & almond,both meals were excellent as was the service and great views and good value for money,we both said the best meal of our month long stay,we will be back

title: Brilliant. Best steak ever.
text: This restaurant has lovely view of the harbour from the terrace. The staff are very attentive and friendly. All areas pleasant and very clean. The food was delicious the best steaks we have had during our holiday, husband enjoyed the mash potatoes 😋 nice change from chips.

title: Well preserved
text: A nice little building out in the middle of nowhere. It was quite complete with a ground floor and courtyard and a story above that with rooms you could go in. It’s astonishing how old it is and it is one of the best preserved of the desert castles. You can only get there by car, lots of hotels do tours from Amman.

title: Isolated and enigmatic- a good addition to a 'Desert Castle' tour
text: Not much to see and not a lot is known about the site. It is thought it was a caravanserai. While named 'Qasr' (castle) the towers are solid and the slits in the walls unsuitable for arrows but useful for ventilation. I visited as part of a tour group- one of 3 sites visited under the 'Desert Castles' label as half a day trip.  The ride from Amman to the Qasr/s is flat desert and military sites with the occasional camel to spot and the 'castles' are easily spotted from the road. Each has their own point of interest. You can explore the many rooms of the caravanserai, peek out into the desert, imagine the travellers who may have journied here, consider how different the location must have been in less arid days. A lonely location- not something to make a special trip to on its own, but as part of a tour of similar structures it is a nice day out.

title: Wouldn't do again
text: I recall my wife and I not liking this stay at all. Didn't really love the area. The dining area seemed a bit small and cramped and the breakfast quality was one of the worst I've had in a hotel in a while, and that's saying something these days. Microwave orange cheese processed stuff is gross.

title: Great hotel stay!
text: Microtel is conveniently located near Mohegan Sun casino.  The hotel is quiet, very clean and comfortable. Staff are always friendly.

title: Ok I guess
text: Good place,  just wish the tv had a channel guide so we did not have to scroll every channel to find something to watch and we had to get a new key card every time we came back to our room!

title: Disappointed
text: The afternoon staff was very pleasant, room was clean. Went for breakfast 10 min before they shut down and housekeeper had the only face and attitude, giving us the side eye. Rushing my partner and I so she can turn everything off. To me that was very disrespectful as we paid almost $275 the night to stay there for a concert at Mohegan Casino.

title: A clean room to stay in
text: I always trust Wyndham and for good reasons. The hotel was very well kept. Very clean room. The front dest staff were very sweet and helpful and they were very attentive during breakfast. Definitely recommend it.

title: Exceptional knowledge provided, kindness and a very professional crew.
text: Unforgettable experience. The knowledge shared by sme’s was invaluable. The world needs Crow Canyon!   The expertise and educational opportunities provided by the center was exceptional. I highly recommend trips with Crow Canyon often.

title: Archeological Research Program (ARP) at Crow Canyon
text: I recently completed my fourth Archeological Research Program (ARP) at Crow Canyon.  The three previous ARP programs I've participated in were all mostly archeological digging.  I wasn't sure what to expect with the site survey program, but it was a great learning experience as the first part of the archeological process.  The week flew by as I was having fun and learning a lot.  The Crow Canyon instructors even slightly changed our itinerary because our group had so many questions about the entire process for site, so we had extra lab time to go over the lab processes.  I would definitely recommend the ARP program or any of the other programs Crow Canyon offers for furthering your adult learning on indigenous history.

title: Wet Behind the Bear's Ears
text: Week long educational outing with a small group that was really educational and fun.  Seeing Bear's Ears National Monument for the first time was breathtaking.  The depth of knowledge from the scholars and coordinators on the excursion was very helpful.  Our native cultures are still alive and well and we all should explore while we have the opportunity.  Crow Canyon respects our Native American lands and wants to preserve and share with everyone.

title: Week long travel with Crow Canyon in Southwest
text: I have travelled with Crow Canyon more than 8 times; mostly in the Southwest. I would label this travel adventure travel.  You are in a small group with at least two scholars, one an archeologist and one a related field.    I have learned so much and had access to so many archeological sites I would not otherwise be allowed to visit.  The trip leaders are full time employees who are very professional and experienced.  These trips are unique learning experiences.  Additionally, I have developed many lasting friendships with other persons I have met on the trips....we all share common interests  which adds to our own experiences.

title: World Traver favorite vacation
text: I expected the scenery and the sites to be amazing, but was not prepared for the professionalism and passion of the staff!  Without exception all staff members engaged with participants to educate and make feel welcome!

title: An wonderful experience
text: A wonderful experience. It is very expensive, but you know that before you get there. We had the abridged menu; couldn’t eat a 10 course meal and would not want to pay the much   But the meal was fantastic and the friendliest, most helpful wait service. The wagyu was the best ever.  And the desserts were extremely good and different. If you want an excellent, interesting meal and can afford it, go there.

title: Best part of my trip to San Fran
text: Fantastic, food was incredible, but what stood out was the service and friendliest staff. I dined solo sat at the bar, and the bartender was extremely welcoming and chatted to me throughout my meal and gave great recommendations for my stay in the city, despite having a busy job of making all the drinks for the restaurant. Cocktails here were also fantastic!

title: Great date night!
text: We went last night for the abbreviated menu and it was delightful.  Perfect service that was both professional and playful.  The smell alone is worth another star.  The food was sublime and the wine pairings were different but matched beautifully.  The chef came by and visited with us and he was lovely.  Beautiful room and a gorgeous kitchen.

title: Splendid Saison
text: What a splendid meal at Saison. An innovative and tasty set menu with many standout dishes and presentation - lobster tartare, uni, white truffle pasta, duck etc. I would probably skip the wagyu supplement next time since i’m not a fan of wagyu generally   Service top notch and friendly as well  The kitchen tour was a plus  9.5/10

title: Exceptional all around
text: We went to visit our kids. Saison experience was beyond expectations. Staff game us exceptional service. Food and drinks were well presented and delicious.

title: You will NOT find cliché menu offerings here!
text: I researched both State Bird Provisions and The Progress and we selected The Progress for our dinner while visiting San Francisco for 2 nights. We love restaurants that are trying new things and The Progress delivered! We shared 5 dishes and then ordered two desserts, and we enjoyed every morsel. It was enough food for me, but my husband was still a little hungry when we left (he grabbed an apple back at the hotel) so perhaps we should have ordered another dish or even the duck—which was a lot of food but looked crispy and spectacular. Our favorites were the Tuna Crudo and the dramatic Brown Butter Seaweed Noodles, but truly everything was delicious.  This is a special occasion experience, so it is pricey, but its worth it to sample innovative  and sustainable food. I am not posting food pictures because mine did not do the food justice due to the lighting, but the presentations were lovely and creative.

title: A must go place in San Francisco
text: Very very interesting and creative menu, great wines, good service, nice atmosphere, great place to share plates and try new food combinations, much more interesting than the average restaurant menus

title: Phenomenal flavors!
text: Phenomenal flavors! My husband and I always enjoy experiencing different restaurants when we travel and this was our favorite food of the trip by far. Flavors were complex & interesting while remaining balanced - I had so much fun tasting every bite of the meal. Highly recommend!

title: World Class Food
text: I must write something short about this excellent establishment. Food and service world class, innovative, original and presented with an artistic touch. No pretentious airs. Michelin still deserved. Lighting a but low to read the menu so the prices were a bit of a surprise -  that's life in California.

title: Great food, great staff and a different experience!
text: There were 4 of us and one person could not tolerate garlic and our server really helped to determine the dishes that were free of it and which ones could be modified. I knew we were in a great restaurant ! Lots in the menu to choose from and the concept was to share the plates. We decided to do that but we also chose to have one as our main dish each. All the dishes were fantastic and too many to individually comment on. My main was the black cod and it was very good. I also had a bite of the pork chop and it was rich in flavour, moist and actually heavenly.  Overall a great culinary outing ! Well done!

title: Fantastic brunch spot
text: This was probably our favourite meal in San Francisco… great range of brunch options and fantastic friendly service- highly recommend

title: Bad mussels ruin experience!
text: This restaurant is in a beautiful area of SF!!!  Gorgeous old homes and buildings!  Amazing!!!    The service was very good and we loved that it is a tip free restaurant.  Awesome that they provide a great work environment for their employees.    The portions were huge!  Especially the pork chops!!!!  Also the cheese from the selection of 3 cheeses appetizers,  2 of the 3 were huge chunks of cheese.    Most of our food was amazing and very delicious.  But my sister and I had the PEI mussels that were very off and made me almost throw up.  We couldn’t eat them.  We told our waiter at the end of our meal, as he asked how the food was.  He told the cook and the cook said they were fresh, bought that day and tasted fine.  Too bad for us!  Charged full price .  Not that we were expecting them to remove the charge but since neither of us could eat them we would have thought there would have been more than a “too bad!”  It left our experience less that delightful.

title: Best family style food for group brunch.
text: We were here for a wedding brunch in the back and the staff couldn’t have been more accommodating. The food was excellent and we all enjoyed the brunch tremendously.

title: Staff Attitude
text: My first and last time dining at this restaurant. Our server was great but one staff that was working at the backyard was rude and nasty. She was annoyed when I was standing by the door of the restroom which I must say they have a very small place. She kicked me out by saying "step outside!" What an attitude treating their customers. We like exploring French restaurants in San Francisco but this will be out of our list and will not recommend. Disappointing!

title: First rate, highly recommended
text: Highly rated French restaurant, with an exceptionally high quality menu. Prices are reasonable for the excellent quality and service tips are built into the prices you see on the menu.

title: Overrated restaurant
text: Quite disappointed tbh. Nothing special; service was fair but not great. I had a Calle Ocho Special sandwich, the bacon was almost inexistent it was a joke. It comes with french fries, I asked to change with another side I was told I could not when it’s just fries…coming with a sandwich so clearly it is possible, they just didn’t want to. The fries were not even good or fresh they look the same as at McDonalds. Plantains were okay but I’ve had better they were not even hot. The only great thing was the cafe cubano.

title: We liked it
text: We got mahi in garlic sauce with yellow rice and plantains and it was delicious.  A busy restaurant but we weren’t rushed out.  Hope to go again.

title: Versailles Restaurant
text: We went to the Versailles Restaurant to sample their legendary Cuban sandwich.  Cuban Sandwich Recipe -  roast pork, ham, Swiss cheese, pickles, and yellow mustard, pressed inside Cuban bread until the bread is crispy and the cheese is melted  It was delicious!

title: Delicious
text: Ordered via doorsash. Everything was delicious.  Empanadas and cubanos were very good. Highly recommended. Check order, ours was shorted a cubano but plenty of food for our family.

title: DIRTY ROACH CRAWLING
text: WENT TO THE BAKERY MIDDAY. TABLES WERE DIRTY AND STICKY. MANAGER THAT DAY WAS A SHORT HAIRED BLONDE LADY TOTALLY OBLIVIOUS TO REGULAR CUSTOMERS SKIPPING IN LINE NOT GETTING A # AND FOLLOWING THE PROTOCOL ESTABLISHED BY THE RESTAURANT, MAKING OUR WAIT LONG. THE PASTRY CASEMENT LOOKS DIRTY AS WELL. WHEN WE FINALLY SAT DOWN AFTER WIPING DOWN OUR TABLE WHICH THE MANAGER SAW US DO AND DID NOT EVEN APOLOGIZE FOR THE FILTHYNESS, WE SEE A GIGANTIC ROACH CRAWLING ON THE WALL. WE THREW OUR FOOD AND LEFT THE ROACH CRAWLING ON THE WALL FOR THE NEXT PATRON. GROSS!

title: Better than ever
text: Absolutely the best, hands down…never disappoints… the staff are even better than the food and that’s saying quite a lot! Ginou and Victor are so wonderful, warm, & kind and made us feel like royalty…it’s the one place you shouldn’t miss for a special time in Miami

title: Excellent Flavor
text: The service was highly attentive and the food items that we had the watermelon salad and the lamb meatballs were both really creative and tasted excellent. I recommend it for this. It’s also extremely close to high-end shopping and strolling around.

title: How to say something nice ??
text: Just OK at the Best Ordered a Beer and got Pig Ears Reordered drinks  Before dinner drinks The drinks arrived after dinner Food  Ok … Not Great Or Outstanding  Waste of time and money for a mediocre meal Will not be back Thank you for reading Bob😀

title: Miami Cost is Cray Cra
text: Hmm.   All I can say is "when did everything get so expensive"?      This is not a Michael Schwartz issue,     this is a Miami issue.      Happy to have spent $125 on two dishes of pasta and two glasses of rose for a lunch.     Still wondering---- how did everything get so expensive?

title: Relaxed meal in a comfortable ambiance
text: No wonder Michael's gets good reviews. It's simply good all around. We enjoyed their Mother's Day brunch. It was full and busy, yet we were not rushed. The place was loud because it was full, but not uncomfortable. The service was great, among the best in Miami. My husband's brother ordered the lamb ribs. Our daughter had the pasta, requesting no spice ... there was spice. So those 2 switched and enjoyed. My husband and I had the steak tartare - truthfully, we've had better, but this was good. When we asked about the item left off of our order, apologies were profuse and we were offered a dessert - icing on the cake of a memorable Mother's Day. It's not often that Miami restaurants recogize mistakes - Michael's lives up to its reputation - thank you.

title: Disappointing Value
text: We ended up paying an absurd amount for dishes that simply weren’t worth it. As the photos show, the presentation and portion sizes were underwhelming, and the overall experience didn’t justify the price. The only redeeming quality was the meat. Unfortunately, that alone doesn’t make up for the poor value for money.

title: What a rip off, the worst food and service I have ever had!
text: The server took over one hour to serve us, the food tastes terrible.  The place is dirty and we saw a roach.   The owner happened to be there and offered to serve us himself with this weird salt routine he does that I found creepy, then served my friend directly with his knife a price of burnt meat.  I would never go back, The price was outrageous! They won’t last long, I prefer Capital grill or even la carreta to this dump.

title: Truly Outstanding Beef
text: This was our second trip to Miami and our second time dining here. We greatly enjoyed our pre-dinner cocktails, served by Marshall (a delightful bar tender who shared some great information about the city). For dinner, we had the sliced sirloin Wagyu and the sliced Wagyu filet mignon. Both were some of the very best meat we have ever had. While pricey, I can honestly say it was worth the cost.

title: Barton G’s should be ashamed
text: This restaurant was once spectacular, just like their website touts but now it is extremely old and worn out.  The food is basic.  The service was fine but management didn’t care.  I was expecting Hollywood and Disney and all I got was a traveling carnival.  No wonder they are closing

title: Barton G will exceed your expectations with Gusto
text: If you are looking for an out of the ordinary dinner experience, Barton G is your place. Located in an adjacent street to Alton road. Its unassuming entrance does not give out what a gem is waiting for patrons. The reception was warm and inviting. They sat the 8 us of us fast and with a smile. Our host for the evening was Ronaldo and he was fantastic. The "experiential cuisine" was palpable and exhilarating. Every dish, from drinks, appetizers, entries and desserts we a work of art in themselves. The dishes were delicious and full of rich flavors. We were celebrating a birthday and it is a perfect place to have such celebration. Overall an A+++ experience.

title: Reservation request not honored
text: Why make a reservation when they don't honor your request. My husband's 50th birthday dinner was ruined.  After seeing the reviews, I am so glad I didn't waste my money on this place.

title: Bad service
text: The drinks where awesome very good, but the food took very long and when they started bringing it out it was 1 plate at a time . It was 3 of us by the time I got my food it had been about 15 minutes after my wife her food was cold so was my daughter's, the experience was horrible.

title: Barton G. Get better!
text: It was the coldest night in the year so far for 2025 and they had all the doors open when we got there and we asked if we could be seated four out of our nine people were present. The restaurant was empty the major D told us that we could not see while the bartender and another person told us that we could I asked to speak to manager Nori. She’s the most unprofessional person and was very rude to the maître D and to myself when she came out front and explicitly told us no, in a very rude fashion. She chastise her employees in front of customers, which is very inappropriate. Within five minutes we were shown to our table which I found to be very confusing after she made such a harp on the fact that it was Policy that that could not happen. I ordered the short ribs and found aluminum foil in the middle of my meal and was explained to me by my waiter Dino that that’s common because they wrapped them in aluminum foil when they’re cooked. My son got two doubles of Jamison and was charged $150 plus an additional $48 charge called neat and well. Because he ordered them without ice he asked the waiter to explain it to him. He could not the manager came out. He had a beard never knew his name, but after arguing the same thing as the waiter he eventually took the additional $48 off . Come on Barton G yes things are unique, but this is way out of hand. You have in my opinion become too big for your britches get it right.

title: Joyful
text: Quick service and anticipation. I really loved being served in the mornings by Luis Balboa. In the Devon day he already knew what I wanted

title: Not what it used to be, but the food is still good
text: My wife and I had dinner at Ola last Sunday during a visit to South Beach. We've been to Ola many times before, starting in 2012 (see my previous reviews), and for many years it was our favorite South Beach restaurant. They've moved twice in that time, and this was our first visit to their current location at the Gates Hotel. Our last visit was 5 years ago. While the food and service is still very good, the overall experience is not what it used to be.  Ola is the hotel restaurant for the Gates Hotel. The new space is much smaller and more casual than the previous one, more of a lounge setting, without any of the ambience of the previous locations. I tried to make an online reservation via Ola's website, but it showed no availability so I contacted them directly. When we arrived around 7pm, the restaurant was mostly empty, and it remained that way during our entire meal. The only visible staff were our server, the bartender, and a couple of buspeople, who all provided very good service. It was a bit warm out, so we sat inside.  The Ola website doesn't have their menu online, but I found one on the Gates Hotel website. The online menu is very similar to the one we remember, but the actual menu was much more limited. Many of our favorite dishes, including the empanadas and smoked fish tacos, are no longer available. They still have their tasty Colombian rolls, but they now charge $3 each.  We both had Caipirinhas, which were very good. We started by sharing the Hamachi Nikkei Ceviche, which we've had before, and it was a tasty as we remember. For dinner, my wife had the fish of the day, branzino, and I had the Roast Cuban Pork, which I've had before. Both dishes were very good. We also each had a Colombian roll, which were as good as ever. We didn't have dessert.  The prices were on the high side, but typical for the area. Like most South Beach restaurants, Ola adds a 20% service charge to the menu.  While the food is still very good, there are many great restaurants in the area to choose from, so I don't know if we'll return to Ola, given the limited menu and lack of ambience.

title: Not the old Ola
text: Used to really enjoy but just had a very disappointing lunch.  The ceviche was far too acidic, overpowering the fish, and the shrimp overcooked and tough.  Fortunately the mojitos were very good

title: Affordable Latin fusion
text: Great place for a Latin fusion cuisine. Ceviches are to die for! Cuban empanadas are delicious 😋 drinks great and Albert the host manager a GEM !

title: Great drinks by Sabina
text: This place is always fun to come back to. I enjoy my time at the bar usually and servie by Sabina is great! She is a very lovely lady and always good to talk to.

title: Relaxed Fine Dining
text: We chose Hells Kitchen for our one year anniversary. We walked in and were welcomed, escorted to our table and given a drinks and sushi menu. Soaking in the atmosphere you cannot help but notice a quantifying array of pitchforks. I asked a server how many they were but that will remain a mystery.   We then met Caesar- a brilliant server for relaxed fine dining, clearly knowing his role inside out. I would describe him as attentive, cheerful, upbeat, helpful, and incredibly on the ball which led us feeling extremely relaxed and excited for the evening ahead. He initially let us get settled, and once we had chosen the wine he suggested some food.   The wine we went for was a Sauvignon blanc 2022, in the Grgich Hills of Napa Valley, costing us $85, after checking vivino, it was only marked up $20.   We also had complimentary bottled spring water from Tuscany.   To start with we had octopus, tuna tartar, and the wagyu and pork meatballs.  The octopus had been charred, accompanied with delicious sweet tomatoes and potatoes. As someone who doesn’t like seafood and has tried octopus before and haven’t been keen, I would’ve finished the plate.  The tartar was flavoursome, beautiful, and fresh. The corn chips were salty to balance the flavour.  The meatballs were the best meatballs I have ever eaten. The meat was incredibly tender and soft, and seasoned perfectly with herbs. The tomato sauce rich and deep in flavour. .   We chatted and admired the kitchen, had are drinks topped up whilst waiting for our mains. Our glasses were never empty. Our servers were extremely attentive.   They arrived, we both ordered the signature Wellington, with the potato puree, brussel sprouts and macaroni and cheese.   The presentation of the Wellington was simple yet elegant. I just stared for a minute not knowing how to tackle it.  I picked up my knife, pressed it lightly onto the Wellington and my jaw dropped in disbelief. The tenderness of the beef was just wow. I softly cut into my wellington with a smile on my face. I only managed half because of the richness, but that’s my problem, not the wellingtons.  On the drive back I ate the other half like a pork pie and it was equally magnificent.   Sprouts were very rich and crunchy, I couldn’t have sat there and smashed through a bowl of it.  The mac and cheese was slightly underwhelming. It wasn’t ’knock your socks off that’s good Mac and cheese.’ The potato puree was creamy, elegant and yum.   The stars of the show were the Wellington and the starters.  Caesar kindly took an anniversary picture of us, gave us the bill ensuring there is no rush to leave.   We left just before 10 after an amazing 2 hour dining experience, and had a walk in the local area - a lovely part of downtown Miami.

title: Excellent experience for my birthday in Miami
text: Amazing food with the best mac & cheese and potato puree sides I've ever tasted! Location is very beautiful with lots of fairy lights, plants and high rise buildings outside. The staff were attentive, friendly and upbeat. Stylish modern restaurant with great cocktails, I ordered the 'Message from Gordon', The steak was cooked to perfection and we had the best time. Thank you for an amazing birthday experience ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: Poor
text: very disappointed; for these prices I would expect a much better experience: as the last couple to seat of our group we were never given a wine list or asked if we would like a drink; the bread on the table was pre-sliced and brought in from Publix; the 8 Argentinian shrimp for $57 were very over cooked, a travesty; curry sauce to go with it was mediocre; dessert ice cream was good, soft serve comparable to dairy queen or Andy's in Chicago.  I just think for these prices the experience and quality should be much better; won't be going back.

title: horrible bar rip off be careful
text: We have been to ALL of the Cipriani all over the world.  From Venice to London NY and Miami.  The bar tender is clueless.  My husband asked for a glass of Amaroni, he replied he didnt have a glass of that particular wine.  So, he suggested, "Price Blind" Super Tuscan he had behind the bar.  My husand said yes, the waiter took our glass of wine to the table, still have NO idea how much the glass of wine was assuming under $40.  He orders 2/3 more glasses of the same wine..we get the bill and the 6 OZ crappy pour was $90 dollars a glass!!!!! The bar tendar is a clueless piece of crap, who should have suggested a bottle of wine at the bar in lieu of a $90 half 6oz glass of wine.    Be aware at this bar, the bar tender and managmenet are a bunch of clueless, unaware  pigs.   The manager on duty, Marco was kind enough to give us the credit for each $90 glass back on our Amex, we declined the offer.   That isnt the piont.  The point is the bar tender is bad bad representation of the front line of this restaraunt!

title: Subpar
text: Arrived to be seated near a birthday party going. While it wasn't the birthday party's fault, I think the party should have been held somewhere away from regular diners. They were loud and celebrating which was expected but again why have a party of 30 ppl in the center of a restaurant? After the party, the clean up consists of hitting the pillows loudly, moving furniture, and carrying long wooden tables over the heads of diners while we ate- (extremely dangerous) The food was subpar, (ordered the curry shrimp, salmon was the end of the fish with brown parts under, ravioli was like 12 pieces, the side (spicy yellow rice was hard). The food was not to Cipirani standards NYC or Dubai location. The view-  obstructed by plastic wrapped windows and no seating in a the patio space. The restaurant was cramped, tiny tables, low back chairs. I think the restaurant could have so much potential. Go to Casa Tua in Brickell for better Italian food and bypass this Cipirani. This location should be closed.

title: Modern Italian
text: Torno Subito delivers a truly creative dining experience, with dishes that showcase high quality, sustainability, and outstanding presentation. You can clearly see Massimo Bottura’s influence in the innovative approach to traditional Italian flavors.  The portions are a bit small, which might leave some wanting more, but the attention to detail in every bite makes up for it.  The neighborhood is rough and still developing—it feels unsafe at night. Hopefully, things will improve soon.  One suggestion: the staff should speak more Italian. Some try, but it’s minimal. A stronger Italian presence would enhance the authenticity of the experience.  Expensive.

title: Excellent
text: The restaurant is exceptional from the decoration, atmosphere, service and food.  However the only thing we didn't like was that our waiter made us place the complete order.  We wanted to order the appetizers and first couse and then wait to see if we want it to have a second course.

title: Maximo!
text: Amazing experience! Every plate a different surprise, my favorite was Cia Modena and the e Tortellini. Also, Gian Luca was a wonderful waiter who guided the whole experience.

title: awesome  motel
text: this place is great  the innkeeper calls if your late   he leaves a bbq with propane full  balcony for smokers kitchenette  is fully stocked so you dont have to go out to dinner we pack dinner and breakfast  great coffee shop downtown and restaurants also  clean and quiet

title: Spooky entrance reminded me of the Bates Motel.
text: The ONLY motel in town, You must drive through a one lane alley and down a slope to the parking area, then climb metal stairs to access checkin. The room was musty, but otherwise a clean kitchenette. The manager provides Tim Hortons coffee and donuts in the AM.

title: Very Clean, Amazing Staff!!!
text: I rate this motel a 5 for the following reasons:  Yes it is outdated and older that is true but the room was spotless, the location, unbeatable and the owner is absolutely FANTASTIC and extremely accommodating, helpful and sincere.  When you consider the value for the money it is a 5.  We could have stayed at one of the other hotels in Kemptville for  $309.00  each night, making it a $650.00 plus weekend. At checkout our grand total for the weekend was $158.00 .  I did NOT notice ANY smell in the hallway or the rooms as a matter of fact when we were leaving which we were late checking out and he never said a word about it all the rooms were being cleaned , aired and linens and towels being changed. We WILL definitely be back to stay here again. Like I have written it is not the fanciest in the area but all considered it was a TERRIFIC stay.  Thank you so much to the owner operator for a wonderful visit. Sandy and Rodney Campbell

title: Extremely, extremely outdated
text: The man at the front desk was very friendly, but besides that, there wasn't much that was great about this motel. I was a little scared at first, but was assured from people around the area that it's a safe place and town to stay. The motel is extremely, extremely outdated. The towels are very old and the pillows are very, very flat. Breakfast was advertised at the time of my booking this motel, but there wasn't any. This is budget friendly for sure, but that's probably the only plus regarding this motel.

title: Noisy on street
text: Kind staff at check in didn't make up for the smell in the hallway and room. Bed very hard, and despite being told at reservation time we would have a room at the back, we were put into a room on Clothier St. which we found to be extremely noisy. Very little perceived value at the rate of $95.

title: Definitely not recommended
text: We were excited to come and dine here, we were on time ,our reservation was made a month in advance ! Our table was not ready so we were seated on the bar. Here at the bar is where our "fun" started & ended!  Lucy was our bartender , to say that she was rude and not interested to be there is an understatement! We were discussing options what to order,I wanted to order desert , and Lucy rolled her eyes and "scream shouted" that we both need to order at the same time and to better take our time(mind you at this point we are technically not even seated) We got our desert, and the desert was actually really good , it a shame that we won't try it again or eat there ever again!  We simply decided not to seat at the table and we just left.. There are many aspects to dining regardless that the foods seem like it was going to be good, it is simply not enjoyable to be have that energy while you dine! For Michelin star restaurant this is the poorest service that I have seen ever while dining! Absolutely not acceptable

title: Excellent!
text: The food is very, very good and the atmosphere and service excellent. I came back after several years- and found the inventiveness and quality very good still.

title: Unsavory Boia De
text: Disappointing experience at Boia De.  We were looking forward to eating here.  My husband's parpadelle alla lepre was average, my  scallops sott-olio were tepid, not savory to the taste.  We did have a great bottle of wine from their wine list while we waited and enjoyed the chicken liver & foie gras pate, but this is not a Michelin star restaurant.   We are foodies and have had great meals here and abroad.  This was substandard, not worthy of a visit..

title: The worst anniversary in history
text: We arrived on time, perhaps slightly early for our reservation and were aggressively and very inhospitably treated by the 3 Three hostesses that were clearly not busy and more importantly not at all interested in us having a wonderful anniversary.  We waited over an hour at the bar and lounge and were given NO attention or updates whatsoever.  I have never been treated in such an inhumane fashion, the very worst I have ever undergone in my 35 years of dining at Miami's hottest/trendiest establishments.  Such a sad, sad, very sad end to what should have been a wonderful evening.

title: Services!
text: This is a must go to restaurant. The service is excellent. All the waiter and waitress’s helping each other. The food was so good. It’s beautiful place along with outstanding services. I set back and watch how everyone help each other. From taking dishes out each other hand, off tables that didn’t belong to them. It was like a well rehearse play. Great job everyone!

title: Simply amazing and awesome!
text: We were very excited to eat at Carbone in Miami after being regulars of the New York City location. The ambience is very familiar also very different and unique. It was an absolutely incredible meal and everything was done with perfection. We sat outside on the patio and had a nice evening, Miami breeze and our waitress was attentive and helpful on while not overselling each other high restaurants in Miami certainly do.

title: Another great dining experience.
text: We were able to eat here again pre- cruise after a visit a few years back.   We were seated promptly at a nice table.  Service as before was exceptional as was the food. The portions are huge, so we  shared some appetizers and the veal parmigiana.   Everyone was  very professional and I love the decor.

title: Strong Across the Board
text: Based on the reviews, I came in with low expectations yet the overall space is very impressive with very high-end, unique decor. The menu is unique and comprehensive. You can eat family style or individual servings. Our server was really good. We were attended to across the board by three layers of staff, and to top it all off our table of seven all thought the food was exceptional. The calamari were some of the best we’ve ever had. The bread service was incredibly impressive. The lobster risotto was delicious and the desserts were all top-notch.

title: Best Place to Stay in Southern Pacific Costa Rica!!!!
text: We've traveled all of Costa Rica, nearly 40 trips ( actually, it's 39 trips throughout the country ). The Ballena Coast is our favorite locale, and Many's House is by far, our favorite place to stay. Menachem, is a very attentive  host, and the accommodations are much like home. You will rest comfortably between the ocean, and the rain forest. Many's website, fails to do him justice.....THIS IS THE BEST LOCATION IN SOUTHERN PACIFIC COSTA RICA.........PERIOD!!

title: Amazing view and family friendly accommodations
text: If you want a more remote but stunning view then you must stay at Many’s House. You will experience an amazing view of the ocean, gorgeous sunrises and sunsets, plenty of jungle sounds and scenes from howler monkeys to chattery patriots and Toucans, and more. It’s a lovely private oasis from the hustle and bustle of town. Our family of four stayed in the Villa Rustica and had a great time. The pool was perfect for cooling off after a long hot day and the grounds are perfectly maintained. Many offers all the necessities and checks in daily to make sure you have everything you need! We will definitely be back. Thanks Many!

title: Magic Place
text: If you plan to spend time near Marino Ballena, don't miss Many and his houses. Fantastic view for a bay, some minutes drive to the beach, parrots, hummingbirds but... I recommend especially to talk with Many. Unforgettable...

title: Stunning view at home away from home
text: I have travelled all over the world and have stayed at amazing places but I would have to say that Many's house is my favorite. The actual house is cozy and has everything you need including a lovely shower and toilet where you can flush the toilet paper!! There is air conditioning if you need and a fully stocked kitchen so you can cook at home an there is a beautiful pool to cool off in.The view of the ocean is stunning and every morning we woke up to the sounds of birds and howler monkeys. Many himself is an amazing host. He was always around if we needed and when we ran into some difficulties he was right there to help us. By the time we left we felt more like friends than renters. I highly recommend this place for your stay in Uvita.

title: Quaint and Homey - good deal if you don't demand luxury
text: The place is privately owned by the family which resides on premise. They are warm and helpful. The rooms are large, yet a bit outdated. It is well located in the center of town. It could use help with the upkeep but other than that it is a great place for the price. They also offer a good price on buffet & entertainment. The price includes breakfast.

title: Fantastic brunch spot
text: This was probably our favourite meal in San Francisco… great range of brunch options and fantastic friendly service- highly recommend

title: Bad mussels ruin experience!
text: This restaurant is in a beautiful area of SF!!!  Gorgeous old homes and buildings!  Amazing!!!    The service was very good and we loved that it is a tip free restaurant.  Awesome that they provide a great work environment for their employees.    The portions were huge!  Especially the pork chops!!!!  Also the cheese from the selection of 3 cheeses appetizers,  2 of the 3 were huge chunks of cheese.    Most of our food was amazing and very delicious.  But my sister and I had the PEI mussels that were very off and made me almost throw up.  We couldn’t eat them.  We told our waiter at the end of our meal, as he asked how the food was.  He told the cook and the cook said they were fresh, bought that day and tasted fine.  Too bad for us!  Charged full price .  Not that we were expecting them to remove the charge but since neither of us could eat them we would have thought there would have been more than a “too bad!”  It left our experience less that delightful.

title: Best family style food for group brunch.
text: We were here for a wedding brunch in the back and the staff couldn’t have been more accommodating. The food was excellent and we all enjoyed the brunch tremendously.

title: Staff Attitude
text: My first and last time dining at this restaurant. Our server was great but one staff that was working at the backyard was rude and nasty. She was annoyed when I was standing by the door of the restroom which I must say they have a very small place. She kicked me out by saying "step outside!" What an attitude treating their customers. We like exploring French restaurants in San Francisco but this will be out of our list and will not recommend. Disappointing!

title: First rate, highly recommended
text: Highly rated French restaurant, with an exceptionally high quality menu. Prices are reasonable for the excellent quality and service tips are built into the prices you see on the menu.

title: good for just stay
text: average hotel with no many facilities to make fun or luxury stay  food is good  rooms wide and clean  staff helpful but not so kind  position is away from downtown   it was good stay by the way .. all time spent outside

title: Horrible experience!!
text: The rooms were not clean, and broken glass were collected from kids swimming pool. In addition to very impolite receptionist and catering staff. The worst food ever, and my wife fall off broken seat in the restaurant.

title: hotal closed
text: on booking our holiday to this hotel over 3 mouth ago we arrived at the hotel on the 7th December 2014 we were meet and  was told the hotel closed and had been for twelve days. Was told we would be taken to sister hotel which  was 30 minutes away after waiting for an hour to be transferred to the sister hotel on arrival we were given cold food so not very happy we then went to bed and awoke to find the hotel was not very nice we decided not to stay and had to pay to go and stay in another hotel which was the oriental resort far better hotel.

title: Perfect place to kick back and chill
text: Me and my boyfriend went back to this hotel after a previous visit. 2 years ago. The hotel is mainly occupied by Russians and Egyptians, which is perfectly fine for us because we spend more time outside of the hotel than we did in the hotel. The food is ok and the chefs are willing to provide you with an alternative if you do not like what they have cooked. The staff are all lovely and the room was decent (they gave us the same room as the first time). Overall a nice chilled place.

title: Never again
text: On pulling up to this hotel we could tell it wasn't going to be our perfect holiday. First of all the neon lighting sign was out. As we entered the hotel reception we were greeted by what seemed to be a very miserable hotel manager. After a lot of faffing about with a man that could only speak very little English we finally got to our room. As we arrived late there was some 'fresh food' bought up to us. This wasn't fresh and it seemed to stay in our room for 3 days after we arrived. We decided to have a drink in the bar which I'm pretty sure is a makeshift bar with the bar staff not being able to speak English to the point where we had to pour our own drinks. I won't ramble on to much about how awful this hotel is, but the restaurant was filthy, the rooms were unclean, the pool side was horrendous with empty cups laying everywhere so it was heaven for the flies.  The restaurant which does seem to cater for the Russian guests. We did complain to our rep. The manager offered us an alcarte menu which still would be prepared in the same kitchen which we did ask to view before hand and was very quickly dismissed. If your looking for cheap and cheerful I wouldn't bother wasn't your money because it is far from cheerful!

title: Very nice coffee
text: The best coffee in the city, keep going.. beautiful furniture, nice view. Espresso was quite good, the staff were polite ..

title: Fast and hot
text: I love the cappuccino in there it always ready hot even when I order it as delivery through their phone number or presto delivery app

title: Fantastic
text: Great location and coffee. The owner is a friendly guy who loves to host his guests. The cafe has a nice atmosphere, with great art work around.

title: Coziness
text: Nice cozy place for studying or working remotely and setting appointments. Has free internet, bathroom acsses close to the mosque

title: Outstanding in every way
text: We had such a wonderful dinner at Lark.  Our server, Tessa, was so sweet and accommodating.  And the food was delicious.  My wife and I shared the fried oysters and then we each ordered the spaghetti with crab.  Both were absolutely incredible.  We finished with the Peanut butter Panna Cotta which was also delicious.  Highly recommended.

title: Sophisticated, relaxed and quality.
text: What a great night out. The ambience was perfect for us, high end yet relaxed and a bit dressy. The food was superb. We started with the mackerel and asparagus which were both perfectly cooked and delicious, light and fresh. I had the agnolotti and my husband had the Iberian pork. The agnolotti was perfectly al dente and the flavors were fresh,  balanced and very tasty. The pork was flavourful and tender, and the service was wonderful. I rate this an A+. It just all came together for a relaxing Night with wonderful food.

title: Best in Seattle!
text: Easily the best food I have had in the last 10, 20 maybe even 30 years. No exaggeration. My wife and I each did the four courses and were able to sample 8 dishes between us. My favorite was the chilled mussels. It’s like eating a symphony of taste. The rabbit croquettes were outstanding. The crème brûlée cake and the three cheese desserts are both outstanding. Service? So professional. We took our time eating and they treated us like kings. Did I mention the breads? Wow!!!

title: Very Nice Dinner
text: I would like to have given this restaurant 5 stars. The interior space is really lovely and special. Our server as well as the hostess were extremely kind and helpful. We loved the hand crafted cocktails too. For an appetizer we ordered the Hamachi Crudo with shaved fennel and it was superb. For dinner I ordered the Wild King Salmon and my husband ordered the New York Steak, both dishes were overly salty and we were a little disappointed for the price paid. For dessert we had the Blood Orange Sorbet which was delicious.

title: Meh...Cool location, food sounded good but underdelivered.
text: We had the duck and the cauliflower steak with the soy sauce ice cream for dessert.  Portions were small and the food tasted less than fresh.  Not worth the reasonable-sounding prices though.  Our server was very nice and attentive. The soy sauce ice cream was wonderful!  We were there with reservations right at opening (in an empty restaurant), still the manager was unwilling to let us sit in one of the seats with a view of Seattle. I'm assuming those seats were somehow spoken for, but still frustrating. No wait time for us.  The dining room was quaint and comfortable.  Overall, their concept sounded intriguing, but this place was mostly a letdown.

title: Very talented chef
text: The dishes were all excellent and full of flavor while having a great visual element as well. The leek soup had a wonderful unctuousness. The duck breast was perfectly warm,  soft, and the fat rendered; wholly satisfying with a light glaze. The fish was a flaky Branzino with a skin just crusty to add to the earthy flavors of the foraged mushrooms. The sake selection was outstanding. We really enjoyed the dining experience. There were multiple families with active small children on a Saturday night though.

title: Beautiful Food with a View in Mt. Baker
text: When I think about the term “fusion” as applied to restaurants, it often strikes me that it is misused, misunderstood, or both.  What passes for fusion in many restaurants is having more than one cuisine represented on the menu.  To me, true fusion is achieved only by combining more than one cuisine or technique in a single dish.  In the Seattle area, no restaurant accomplishes that better or more consistently than Iconiq.  Chef Toshiyuki Kawai, born in Osaka, Japan, and trained in French techniques in the kitchens of the late great Thierry Rautureau (among others), prepares what at first glance appears to be French food.  However, after sampling his food, it quickly becomes clear that there are subtle Japanese influences in almost every dish.  My most recent meal at Iconiq demonstrated this very well.  I had just 3 courses and a glass of wine.  My first course was cured salmon over a bed of white asparagus mousse.  The mousse was delicious, with a firm, pudding-like consistency, and it complemented the salmon beautifully.  My main was locally caught Neah Bay black cod, grilled exactly right so as to crisp the skin and provide a white flesh that was firm enough not to be gelatinous (an issue sometimes with cod) without overcooking.  The cod was served over wonderful white beans and other vegetables, some of which appeared to be pickled but lightly so, as well as fingerling potatoes and a tomato-yuzu broth.  Delicious!  For dessert, I had a scoop of soy sauce ice cream, accompanied by candied walnuts and compressed Fuji apples.  I have to admit that sounds a bit weird but I have come to trust Chef Kawai and he recommended that I try it.  I am very glad I did.  It was a delightful combination of flavors and textures and very refreshing.  In addition to providing some of the most creative and delicious food in town, Iconiq’s position on the west side of the Mt. Baker Ridge affords the restaurant some very nice views of the Rainier Valley, the downtown skyline, and even a piece of Elliott Bay.  The place is gourmet and high-end but always warm and inviting and never stuffy.  I highly recommend Iconiq.

title: Hidden gem with delicious flavors
text: The place is tiny and unassuming. I was surprised that the chef both attended front of house and the (open) kitchen. The food and wine were delicious. The octopus was tender and perfectly seasoned. The fish main was perfectly cooked, although I felt the endives were a little too bitter. Dessert was light and refreshing. Food choices are a bit limited, but everything tried was really good. Service was friendly and attentive. So why 4/5? I think some kinks still need to be worked out. It would make sense to hire at least one waitstaff to better tend to the customers. Will be back!

title: Amazing Hidden Restaurant...with Excellent Food
text: This food here is amazing.  We loved everything on the menu. We ordered to go here a lot during the pandemic because it was delicious.  However, we had never gone into the actual restaurant until recently. It was an absolute delight. The owner/chef is there to make sure your food is done to perfection. The ambiance is casual/elegant.  It is a true Seattle gem.

title: Great brunch and service
text: Cute little French bistro. We went for Sunday brunch (tip:get there really early if you want quiche!)... The beet salad was an excellent starter, as was the boiled eggs over mayo.  We had the charcuterie, the croq madame, and a really good soup, and some goat cheese beignets.  Outstanding food and service.

title: Not impressed
text: I was expecting a great French Experience but instead was served average food by people whom appeared as they rather not be there.   Waited 10 min to be seated, despite having a booking, and as mentioned, service was slow.   Approximately 9 tables of 4 inside and about 4 outside.  3 full time people serving plus someone in the bar but not a happy crew.   And when the bill came, 20% tip was already calculated in.  Not the option provided to tip what you felt relevant. And then the audacity to suggest more.   I wouldn’t go back.

title: Don’t forget dessert!
text: This quaint French bar was highly recommended by the wine merchant at Western and Pike Wine Shop and we are so glad he did!  The place is busy with a few tables outdoors, inside and at the bar. My husband enjoyed the falafel with salad and found it totally satisfying. I ordered the red pepper soup…it was delicious with just the right amount of kick. Table service included a chewy baguette with butter. We treated ourselves to the chocolate mousse for dessert-WOW!  Velvety dark chocolate mousse served along side a portion of perfectly whipped heavy cream. A single order is large enough to serve 2-4. Great wines to choose from. This is a great break in the day for a delicious meal.

title: I wouldn’t recommend Le Pichet unless you don’t mind indifferent service. I
text: Le Pichet has such a warm, charming atmosphere, it feels very cozy and cute, the kind of place that makes you want to linger. The rotisserie chicken was outstanding: moist, flavorful, and one of the best I’ve had.  What took away from the experience, unfortunately, was the service. The server wasn’t friendly, and I believe the owners (an older gentleman and a lady with glasses and bold red lipstick) came across the same way. While we were still enjoying dessert and a digestif, we were given the bill early because there were people waiting for a table. To be clear, this wasn’t a case of us occupying a table without ordering, we had spent over $200 for two people that evening. We sat down at 7pm and we already got the check (without us asking) at 8.30pm..  Overall, while the food is delicious and the venue itself is lovely, the hospitality left a lot to be desired. I wouldn’t recommend Le Pichet unless you don’t mind indifferent service.

title: Delicious dining in a cute cafe
text: This little bustling French restaurant reminds me of a European Cafe. My friend and I so enjoyed our dinner at Le Pichet. We are vegetarians:  We had a mushroom crepe, an asparagus salad, and the seasonal dessert and were very happy.  The staff was very busy and very helpful. Because the cafe is very small, the diners sit very close to each other which makes it almost impossible to NOT have conversations with the next table. As visitors to Seattle, it was fun meeting the couple at the next table who lived there.

title: Excellent but not a cheap date...
text: Although their monthly menus are supposedly different, we found after checking their website for a number of months after dining that they were understandably quite similar. Nonetheless, we would expect the same high quality offerings on every menu. The dining experience, even for Seattle which has become overrated, was indeed excellent but not a cheap date. The fixed menu at $175 per person became substantially more costly after adding the recommended sake pairings. However, as you can see from the photos which we have chosen to post, that the sake selections were particularly memorable. Enjoy!

title: Anniversary Dinner
text: We were very excited to have dinner at Wa’z because our son took his girlfriend there for their anniversary and said it was amazing. The food was fabulous!  Every plate felt like a piece of art. Chef, and his team, was friendly and polite, as you would expect from a Japanese restaurant. We shared a Saki tasting, which was plenty for the two of us, and we loved the beautiful saki cups. Each one was so unique. Our only criticism is that the meal felt really rushed. We were seated at 8pm, served 10 courses and were done by 9.30!  We sat at the chef’s counter, and everyone was served each dish at the same time, so it wasn’t just that we were eating fast. It was an expensive evening, so I would have liked to linger.  On the bright side, we were given a little bouquet for our anniversary.

title: Outstanding!
text: The kaiseki dinner at Wa'z is one of the best dining experiences I've had. Service was attentive and each course as well as the paired sakes were explained. If Seattle had Michelin stars, this restaurant would be on their list.   We were lucky to sit at the counter and were able to watch as dishes were prepared. There were eight courses that were paced well over about two hours. For me, the highlights included Copper River salmon sashimi, wagyu that melted in your mouth, grilled eel, and tuna nigiri, but each course was fantastic. The chef and other staff spoke to us about the provenance of the food as well as providing stories/history on why we were eating certain items.  At $600+ for dinner for two (including alcohol), this is a special occasion restaurant, but the experience was worth it.

title: Hospitality and seafood excellence
text: For a special occasion dinner, this restaurant and staff exceeded my expectations. We went mid week, counter seating. Staff attentive and provided nice little extras like a hook for my handbag, a lobby coat rack, warm, wet hand towels. Chef owner Hiro himself cooked and served. We indulged in a paired sake tasting with the meal and it was educational and tasty. The food was excellent, seafood melt in your mouth, and quite varied for late winter, some sourced from Japan. Hiro provided context for each course, how it related to the overall theme of the meal. The atmosphere was easygoing, organized, courses timed nicely, I could not have asked for a better dining experience.

title: Authentic Kaiseki Course Dinner in Downtown Seattle
text: Wa'z offers Michelin level kaiseki cuisine, which is an artistic and traditional style of multi-course cooking from Japan, probably Kyoto.  The January 8 course menu was highlighted by a dish with New Year offerings of kazunoko (herring eggs), datemaki (rolled egg dish), grilled fish and a sashimi roll. This course meal progresses with sashimi and other types of seafood. A5 Wagyu is featured twice.  The white miso ozoni was very good and in middle courses, the Chef serves a sampler of pressed sushi and aged tuna nigiri.    If you choose counter seating, you can see the Chef and his colleagues at work.  The preparation unfolds before your eyes and it made me appreciate how much skill is involved with the presentation.  The dinner lasted 90 to 100 minutes and my group left fully satisfied.

title: Exceptional knowledge provided, kindness and a very professional crew.
text: Unforgettable experience. The knowledge shared by sme’s was invaluable. The world needs Crow Canyon!   The expertise and educational opportunities provided by the center was exceptional. I highly recommend trips with Crow Canyon often.

title: Archeological Research Program (ARP) at Crow Canyon
text: I recently completed my fourth Archeological Research Program (ARP) at Crow Canyon.  The three previous ARP programs I've participated in were all mostly archeological digging.  I wasn't sure what to expect with the site survey program, but it was a great learning experience as the first part of the archeological process.  The week flew by as I was having fun and learning a lot.  The Crow Canyon instructors even slightly changed our itinerary because our group had so many questions about the entire process for site, so we had extra lab time to go over the lab processes.  I would definitely recommend the ARP program or any of the other programs Crow Canyon offers for furthering your adult learning on indigenous history.

title: Wet Behind the Bear's Ears
text: Week long educational outing with a small group that was really educational and fun.  Seeing Bear's Ears National Monument for the first time was breathtaking.  The depth of knowledge from the scholars and coordinators on the excursion was very helpful.  Our native cultures are still alive and well and we all should explore while we have the opportunity.  Crow Canyon respects our Native American lands and wants to preserve and share with everyone.

title: Week long travel with Crow Canyon in Southwest
text: I have travelled with Crow Canyon more than 8 times; mostly in the Southwest. I would label this travel adventure travel.  You are in a small group with at least two scholars, one an archeologist and one a related field.    I have learned so much and had access to so many archeological sites I would not otherwise be allowed to visit.  The trip leaders are full time employees who are very professional and experienced.  These trips are unique learning experiences.  Additionally, I have developed many lasting friendships with other persons I have met on the trips....we all share common interests  which adds to our own experiences.

title: World Traver favorite vacation
text: I expected the scenery and the sites to be amazing, but was not prepared for the professionalism and passion of the staff!  Without exception all staff members engaged with participants to educate and make feel welcome!

title: Very disappointed, not worth the trip
text: We went for a birthday celebration and was very disappointed in the slow service and lack of knowledge of the server. order chilled seafood platter, steak and lobster and oyster rock fellows, the steak came first and waited a while before the chilled seafood plater came out and the oyster appetizer never came before our meals. the oysters on the chilled plate had lots of sand and shells in it and the steak was so so. The manager asked how your dinner was and told him of the problems and he did not say sorry or make any adjustment. All in all very disappointed birthday celebration

title: LOBSTER ROLL!!!
text: 10 out of 10!  We had a late lunch here. We initially were sat next to a really loud group. The hostess was really nice about moving us to a different spot when I asked. We had shrimp ceviche which was good. I had a lobster roll which was so delicious. It was a little different with no Mayo but so so good! The bread was warm and soft. My husband had the lobster Mac. It was very decadent and pretty heavy so it could serve 2.  Our server Luis was very friendly and attentive.  There was guy playing a guitar with an amplifier which at first was a little loud but seemed like they turned it down a bit. I really enjoyed his music. Lots of covers and Latin guitar. Will be back, would recommend!

title: Never again, they’re lazy and lousy…
text: The service was terrible. I ordered my food online and I arrived after the time it was supposed to be ready. It wasn't ready when I got there and the lady from the bar was running around asking questions. She finally came to me and asked what I had ordered. I showed her my receipt. She left and came back after like 7 more minutes and let me know that it will be like 10 mins until my order was done. I asked if they just started on my order and she said yes. The worse customer service ever. She didn’t try to make up for their wrong doing or anything. She left me sitting at the bar for 20 mins and asked if I wanted a water. Crazy right? I know.. My food comes out and she hands it to me and tells me to have a goodnight… I’m irritated so I’m just like whatever. I’m really appalled at the lack of customer service here. Then I’m at my car sitting and a Asian lady, whose been eating at the bar for most of the night not assisting and just answering questions, came to my car with like 3-4 more people and said the tab wasn’t paid. I said okay, let me pay it but your employee said bye and goodnight so don’t try to make it like it’s my fault. Y’all dropped the ball tonight and the only thing you could do was come to my car disrespectfully about this bill. And I told her that she should be taking money off got the inconvenience but she didn’t want to hear that. She blamed the kitchen. I told her that is not my problem because it’s not. And I told her I would not be coming back. Too much money to spend on gold where people are rude and don’t know hot to correct their wrongs.

title: Best taste Seafood in town !
text: We’re inviting by friends to check on this Seafood Restaurant. We were surprised by the food!! Great food 🥘 Good service !!  Definitely will Be back😘

title: defamation of character
text: I came into station 16 today as I always do because this is one of my favorite restaurants to visit. My alcoholic beverage was watery and I sent it back. general manager RJ ( who refused to give me his real name who was rude) start talking stuff stating every time I come in here it's an issue and the last time I had an issue with the server. Mind you he was the server I complained about before he became general manager because when he was a server he had the same nasty attitude and I complained to his manager at the time and I'm sorry if a server is being rude to me im going to let upper management know that is my right and if my food comes out not good or cold as a PAYING customer I have a right to have them remake it never was rude always respectful. The fact that he stated this false accusation in front of other customers and staff badgering my character (that's defamation of character which my friend I was with recorded this) he made me feel so humiliated, uncomfortable and he embarrassed me! When I asked to speak with the chain of command he refused and stated with a smart gesture and said "he's the general manager and he's the last of the chain of command and if the owners want to call me they will and that's if the owner feels like calling me" and he will let them know it's always an issue which is very much false and I feel he's making this up to cover up his wrong doing and to retaliate against me for when I complained on him. Not only did he humiliated me but defamation of character, I will be taken this further more legally. The disrespect and attitude was uncalled for and very unprofessional and I will be taken actions all the way. Mind you I haven't been here in months because I had kidney surgery (life threatening) and was fighting for my life and came out to celebrate life and this how I'm treated. Run back the cameras and you will see how I was treated and how he humiliated me in front  of staff and customers because he wanted to retaliate. By him being a general manager he should of conducted hisself way better and professionally. He is in place to defuse any issues not make them worst and not to be rude or retaliate against me because he was complained on and now taken this personal. He approached my table with the smart remarks and my friend had me asked him again what he said so we can get it on recording and he did.

title: Hotel Pool Not Included in Nightly Rate; 28 euros / day. Old & loud Rooms
text: I suggest staying somewhere else. I'm very disappointed with this hotel. It says it's a 4.5 star hotel offering a pool and sauna, but guess what they tried to charge me 28 euros to use the pool! I only spent 2 nights and I was mostly exploring the area during the day, so the day I checked out I wanted to use the amenities before flying out. Check out is 10:30am, I checked out of my room earlier so cleaning could have a hesd start. Little did I know, I was no longer considered a guest and couldn't use the gym. They argued with me that the pool is not included, yet as you can see from the photo, it's part of the main amenities. I understand paying for massages etc, but access to the hotel pool. This is a first for me and I travel all over Italy half of the year. The rooms are also outdated so besides having a place to park your car that's the best thing about the hotel in my opinion.

title: Obviously not in the Hospitality business
text: Where do i start the hotels facilities cant be faulted if they would let you use them,  We where a wedding party of 30 plus guests an on our arrival we where greeted to moody reception staff who told us the restaurant was closed and so was the bar which was fine as we went searching locally for any bars or restaurants close by , days 2 is when we where greeted by the owners father we will call him rod Stewart having roid rage , i found him to be the most unpleasant hotel staff member i have ever had the misfortune of meeting a more  aggressive , unreasonable, rude person , who constantly stalked all guests through out there stay , being kicked out the spa saying its closed till 10 oclock only to find he has let others guests in from 8 , locking both terraces to our guests while we are in 38° weather , after us letting them know the air-conditioning in the rooms where playing up , guests trying to book facials in the spa an being told they have no staff but they will
