supply the cream if they want to do there own facials which i find laughable, being escorted to bed by rod on arrival back to the hotel every night our party arrived back , locking the hotel up completely at 11 oclock at night so no one can leave or enter which is a huge fire safety issue , on checking out at 11am on our final day all the guest where told that they could store there luggage in the luggage room till our pick up at 6pm on doing this we where again informed that all facilities where closed to us considering we had 8 children in our party an it was 39°  terrace was closed pool an spa where closed too which i find appalling, after airing our issues with the owner after searching for him all week , he checked the  cctv an saw that our treatment was wrong an gave our group free prosecco an opened up all facilities to us , on going to get outr luggage we found rod going through the guests suitcases which is something none of our guests have ever witnessed or encountered in all there years of travelling all over the world , this hotel has all the facilities an promise to be an outstanding hotel but is completely let down by all staff through out the hotel not once did we see a staff member smile , be helpful or show any hospitality throughout our stay on emailing the owner with my concerns i was given the reply sorry you think the hotel is ran like a prison but its not a brothel , that reply back saying it all about this hotels managing or lack of  Rod Stewart ruined our stay!!!!!!!

title: Toro
text: Went for sushi which was good. Seated quickly and service was efficient. The place has a nice location across from the water with a parking lot.  We enjoyed it overall however it may be positive to tidy up and refresh the dining room.

title: FRESH SUSHI
text: Fabulous family owned restaurant, has been in the village for many years.  Wonderful variety of food, all of it well done and fresh.  My ONLY go to place in the area.  Highly recommend!!

title: Good food, good value
text: First time visitors for take out. Wife had the non-spicy grilled salmon salad which came with rice, kimchi and marinated cucumber slices. Quite good. I had the dumpling soup (wantons were super velvety) and steamed Shumai (steamed shrimp dumplings). Both were very good. Can't wait to go back and try the sushi.

title: ALWAYS SATISFYING
text: Because I only order Tempura dishes or fried anything,I always have a small house salad.This salad is always crisp,fresher than fresh and served with a wonderful ginger dressing. I love this restaurant as did my much more adventurous friend who dined with me several months ago. The service is always friendly and professionally attentive. I do wish  the lighting was a bit softer.Other than that, a lovely place to dine.

title: A++ Korean Restaurant
text: Toro is a family owned restaurant that serve many delicious Korean dishes; in addition to Sushi and other popular Asian dishes. The food and service is always good, and reasonable priced. I highly recommend going there for lunch / dinner.

title: Good value, good breakfast
text: A nice business hotel near Takamatsu station and art museum that is about a ten minute walk away.   Excellent breakfast brought to your room in the morning.   Laundry is on 8th floor via stairs from the 7th. 500 for wash and hr of drying.   Just missing charging plugs for electronics.   Lobby is on second floor.   Friendly and helpful staff.

title: Food was mediocre.
text: Food was mediocre and portions tiny. Wagyu beef and chicken skewers were chewy and very salty. Tempura cauliflower and dumplings were ok.

title: Check your bill
text: I was really disappointed with my recent visit to Sampan on 10/27. The food itself was delicious, but when I got home and looked over my receipt, I realized I was charged for two meals instead of one for several items. I double-checked to make sure it wasn't something I ordered by mistake--it definitely wasn't.  I am not sure how this is even possible since only one item of each was delivered to our table.  Is it a scam???  The total amount overcharged was $109.   I tried calling and emailing the restaurant to sort it out, but haven't been able to get a response yet. Mistakes happen, but overcharging a customer and not fixing it right away doesn't leave a good impression.   Please double-check your bill before you leave!  I hope management sees this and reaches out so this can be corrected.  Table 54

title: Asian fusion in downtown Philadelphia
text: Tasty food late in the evening. We had flown in for the work conference. Not everything’s open late on Sunday evening, so our choices were more limited. This is in a very vibrant area of the city with lots of people still walking around after 8 PM. The food choices were good. It is sort of served family style in that they bring a bowl of the entrée, rice, etc and you share it at the table.  The menu was small, but the food was tasty. Servers were responsive and helpful. It’s a small restaurant and a little bit loud, but I would definitely return again.

title: Unstuffy culinary hotspot
text: We came here for dinner while visiting friends who live in the area, and had a wonderful meal!  The ambiance is upscale and trendy without being stuffy, and it was very clear that this is a culinary hotspot. The staff were professional and friendly - our waitress was very helpful when we were struggling to decide what to order. The crispy duck, salmon satay, tempura cauliflower, and the general tso soup were outstanding! We ended up not leaving anything for leftovers, which doesn't generally happen with us. We'll definitely come back the next time we're in town.

title: Consistent excellence
text: This was our third visit to this always busy restaurant. The food was again excellent. Our wait person was excellent and provided valuable advice. Every dish was special and will return again soon!

title: Very good food, service
text: My husband and I made a last minute reservation. The only option on the app was outdoor seating. When we got there, outdoor seating looked comfortable even on a chilly fall evening but we were surprised to be offered the option of indoor seating which we accepted. The food was excellent, arrived quickly, and the service was very good. I also appreciated that the noise level wasn't bad. We'll gladly come back next time we're in town.

title: Cozy restaurant near Washington Square.
text: We were in town to celebrate my wife's birthday. We tried this restaurant on a recommendation from my boss. The food was delicious. I had the Branzino and Broccoli, my wife had the Roasted Chicken and Gnocchi. We shared the the Chocolate Pudding cake which was delicious also. My wife really like the bread plates on each table. Each plate was different from the next and look like someone went searching thru some antique shops to pick them out. We ate inside because it was a little to windy to try the patio but it looked really and cozy.

title: Best roasted potatos ever!
text: Beautiful place. Went for brunch. Food was great although my eggs could have been warmer. Service was good and friendly but as the place filled up—our reservation was at opening time—our waitress disappeared. However, really enjoyed it and would visit again.

title: Farm to Table Excellence
text: Perhaps the best meal I had in Philadelphia. Very large restaurant with big patio and several inside dining areas plus a large bar. Well appointed and elegant but still warm and welcoming atmosphere. We enjoyed a meal of roasted cauliflower with coconut curry, garbanzo beans and quinoa. Along with lamb bolognese Pappardelle with whipped ricotta. Their chive and cheddar biscuits are to die for.  Wine options are well chosen and multiple by the glass offerings

title: One of our favorite spots in Philly!
text: We live 50 miles from Philly. We were going to be in town for a show at the Walnut Street Theatre, celebrating our anniversary. I made reservations at Talula's Garden due to it's proximity to the theater. I believe this was our third or fourth time dining there. I had the Roasted Chicken with Gnocchi and my wife had the Handmade Ricotta Ravioli. To say they were both good would be an understatement. My wife usually never finishes her entree (she did), and it was the absolute best chicken I have ever eaten (anywhere). The only thing that would have made it any better would have been a nice piece of crusty bread to lap up the sauce, as licking the plate would have probably been in bad taste! Outstanding experience from start to finish.

title: Most enjoyable evening!
text: Loved this place. Beautiful space, efficient, friendly, upscale service, good food—somethings were outstanding, others just ok. The menu is incredibly varied and original. It’s prix fixe, but gives you several options to choose from. Portions are generous and they keep bringing you little extras, so pace yourself!

title: Perfection.
text: We have traveled a great deal, including in the Middle East, and we eat well and often.  Nonetheless, we count this as one of the top five meals of our lifetime.  Everything was outstanding: beautiful, delicious, colorful, expertly prepared.  Very well trained waiting staff that were efficient, polite, but not at all snooty.  Nothing was hurried but everything was perfectly timed.  Portions were generous (as were dishes we did not order or pay for but the waiter thought we'd like).  The only con: we ate too much.  We would have kept eating but our belts wouldn't let us.  Zahav is worth a 2.5 hour drive from NY.  It's just so good.

title: Incredible experience
text: What an incredible experience! There were flavors I'd never tasted before and everything they brought to us was delicious. Go hungry, because they bring an extraordinary amount of food. Our server was well-informed and prompt, and the service was very good. The braised lamb shoulder is their signature dish and should not be missed. I'd rank this among the top five meals I've had in my life.

title: From Unforgettable to Just Fine—A Bittersweet Return to Zahav
text: Our second visit to Zahav was highly anticipated, as our first experience two years ago was nothing short of extraordinary. Two years ago, we were blown away--not just by the incredible food but also by the warmth of the experience, with Executive Sous Chef at that time, Joe Howard, personally bringing out a few dishes he was working on. The sheer amount of food, the flavors, and the hospitality made it one of the most memorable dining experiences of our lives. Naturally, we knew it would be hard to recreate that magic, but we were eager to try. Securing a reservation is no easy feat, but we managed, and while the experience wasn't bad by any means, a few things dampened the excitement. The biggest disappointment was our seating. Instead of being in the vibrant main dining room--where you can see the kitchen in action, the bar buzzing, and the laffa bread being made--we were placed in a separate room on the outskirts. Unfortunately, this space lacked the energy and charm that makes Zahav so special; it felt more like a standard cafeteria, stripping away a big part of what makes the restaurant's atmosphere so unique. The menu had also changed, and we opted for the Tayim menu. While everything was good, it lacked the "wow" factor we had experienced before. In some cases, the descriptions of the dishes were more impressive than the actual flavors. Additionally, while our first visit left us completely full, this time, the meal felt smaller. To be clear, the service was great--attentive, professional, and even including an extra salmon tartar and lovely extra dessert for our birthday. There was no particular fault in any one aspect, but together, the little things added up, making this visit fall short of our high expectations. That said, we're still giving five stars, with the hope that Zahav will return to the unforgettable experience it once was.

title: Amazing
text: Amazing dinner. Definitely need reservations. Need to start early to get them as well. It is a set menu that will be $90. Very inventive with interesting combinations of flavors. Hummus was some of the best ever! Dessert really blew our socks off with the fennel sorbet and the carrot cake. Wow. Just wow. Takes about 2-3 hours to dine.

title: Busy, delicious to-go options in the heart of downtown Philly
text: Crowded and bustling, between the tight fits amid the narrow aisles, you can find some amazing greasy-spoon lunch options frequented by tourists and locals alike.  There are several great options for cheesesteak and various Asian fare.  Best to get anything to-go, though, because tables are hard to come by and packed in tightly together where they do exist.

title: It was walking into a ToysRus store
text: I had read many reviews online and asked staff at my hotel all the food market. It was a 10-15 walk from my hotel and walking to the Reading Terminal Market was like walking into a toy store and not knowing what toy you want buy first.  There was so much  choices  of food available.  After walking round the market for around 10 minutes looking to see what I fancied I eventually chose a vender and had my first Philly cheesesteak.  Delicious, will defo go back again before I leave. Must do place for a visit.

title: More cities should have a Reading Terminal with its excellent regional food choices and great prices
text: I love coming to the Reading Terminal Market with the great selection of food stalls and the sights and smells as you walk around. I love their selections and the interaction between the locals and tourists when people are ordering.   Some of my favorite places to eat in Philly are here with Dutch Eating Place, Beilers Bakery and Bassetts Ice Cream. When Carmine’s was open, that used to be my favorite place for Cheesesteaks. After a meal, I like to walk around and look at the food displays. Everyone merchandises their food so nicely.  Don’t miss a visit here when you are visiting Philly.

title: Definitely recommend
text: Stop here when visiting Philly. Large variety of foods to choose from. Plenty of shop to look for souvenirs. Definitely with visiting especially if it’s your first time visiting.

title: Def worth a visit!
text: Well if you can’t find some food here, there is something wrong with you. All the local stuff you would expect plus bundles of ice cream, fresh meats and cheeses, and chocolate.  Well worth an hour of your time.

title: A big disappointment
text: The food was acceptable, but nothing memorable. We ordered three portions of black caviar, yet what we received were small sandwiches with only a couple of grains of black caviar on each; the rest was red caviar. The staff explained that they were “almost out” of black caviar, but we were still charged the full price. We chose not to make a scene at the time, though in hindsight, we should have said something.

title: Beautiful spot, poor experience
text: The atmosphere and location are fantastic.  My rating is low due to mostly to the service. We went due to a large discount offered by the new service inKind. While paying, we were told they don’t accept inKind. I showed their website which had a large pop-up saying they do, but the bartender said she doesn’t know why that’s on the website because they don’t accept it. In the end, I wound up spending double what I expected to. I understand mistakes, but the staff showed no interest in trying to resolve the situation - it felt like just a shrug.  On the food, I liked the plating a lot. I felt a few dishes could do with more salt (the mushrooms and potatoes particularly), but this is easy enough to adjust at the table so not a big deal. My favorite was the deviled eggs, followed by the mozzarella beignets.

title: Pretentious - Trying to be like Top Chef food and misses the mark.
text: The chef tried very hard to be a Top Chef style chef mixing and maxing various flavors together, but badly missed the mark. Instead of complimentary flavorings and seasonings, each dish tasted like a jumble of mess. For example my escargot was in a sauce that totally hid the flavor of the snails and even the small surprise of sweet bread cubes was barely noticeable. My rib eye sauce completely hid the meat and even the four small but lovely sweetened carrots and the mushrooms were tasteless. The deserts were a mix of flavors that did nothing for each other. Even their popcorn cheese cake which sounded great was little more than a deconstructed mess. Not a single dish highlighted its main ingredient from the rib eye to rabbit to scallops to halibut. The additions subtracted and there were no clean flavors to be found anywhere.  Now we were a party of 6 and that means service will be a little slow, but it was more than a little slow and getting 5 of the 6 appetizers at once, but waiting 17 minutes for the 6th was inexcusable. It should have been comped. Everyone else was already done as my daughter-in-law insisted we not wait.  When you're spending close to $600 for dinner the servers should know who gets what, but they didn't, although at least for the main course, all came out at the same time.  Finally, they knew we were there for a birthday, but other than the server saying happy birthday nothing was forthcoming, not even a single candle on one of the desserts we all shared.  I couldn't possibly recommend the restaurant to anyone.

title: You just need to go!
text: When I tell you that the food in this place, and the service, are top-tier and impeccable, I state that with no exaggeration. You have got to go to this restaurant! The standouts for me were definitely the rabbit and the apricot and raspberry tart topped with lemongrass ice cream. Words cannot express the delectable meal you will experience!

title: Simply Philadelphia's Finest.
text: I've eaten here 5 times. Each time the meal has been perfect and the service simply outstanding. It's my go to fine dining experience in Philly.

title: Fresh, fast and delicious.  Highly recommend for a dependable meal.
text: I first found this restaurant during the worst of the pandemic through Grub Hub.  For delivery it is one of the best I've ever used, but I've also picked up numerous times.  The food is always fresh, the salads are large and delicious, I love the pork ban mi and the broth for the Pho is unique (chicken based).  Very found of the pot stickers as well.    I've tried most of the menu and while I like some more than others based only on my particular taste.    The service is personal and attentive to detail.  I have tried eating in yet, but now that things are open again, I think today might be the day.

title: Will be back!!
text: Super super friendly service by the owner.  I felt so welcomed. The lunch I had - a pork banh mi - was a new flavor profile for me and really delicious and affordable. So many things on the menu I want to try - I’ll be back.

title: Small restaurant, but BIG on taste/dining experience...
text: Was in Philly visiting my son and he said we couldn't leave without eating at Bistro Southeast.  He discovered this restaurant last year when he moved to the area.  He said he'd never been disappointed and we weren't either!  The food was so fresh and the service was excellent.  I ordered the salt and pepper shrimp, my son ordered the spicy curry shrimp, my daughter ordered summer rolls and the rice bowl with chicken; we also ordered thai sweet chili wings and sweet potato fries to share.  All very delicious!!!  If visiting Philly, be sure to stop by this jewel of a restaurant.

title: Great for crab and other seafood!
text: This is a casual Vietnamese BYOB restaurant that serves very good standards like pot stickers, excellent chicken wings with different preparations, and some combination seafood/corn/sausage/potatoes dishes steamed in a bag and suitable for 2-4 people.  Of course there are also noodle bowls with various choices of meats.

title: Delicious dining experience with friends
text: This restaurant was recommended by friends.  A group of us went here for dinner on a Friday night.  This is a byob so we had brought some wine with us. This is a small restaurant but we were able to get seated.   We started with the bistro southeast salad and the Thai chili and Spicy curry wings both of which were excellent.  The wings were Korean style and the salad was served with house made dressing available for purhase.   We shared the seafood combination which was crawfish, fish, clams and lobster boil served with corn and potatoes.  Overall a great experience we will be back soon.

title: Nice cozy Resturant
text: the atmosphere was nice and cozy  , sea food is cooked very well and the service was really nice and friendly . it is a BYOB restaurant

title: Just OK
text: We had heard lots about this restaurant while we were visiting our son and decided to go there on Valentine's Day. No reservations, BYO, cash only, but we were able to walk into a table. Atmosphere was fine, not as loud as others have complained, but the food was very average. Some might say the chef was expressing subtle flavors and letting the seafood speak for itself, but my wife and I (both self-confessed "foodies"), found everything very bland. I had the grilled fish of the day and she had the seafood pasta, and neither was memorable. The most flavor we found was in the veggies that accompanied my fish. Would I go back? Only if someone else was paying.

title: The original
text: The octopus is the best that I have ever had and the three piece order of soft shell crabs was so good that I ordered one more crab.It is BYOB and cash only. My daughter  ordered octopus to go. Little ambiance. They do not take reservations, however, there is a bar across the street where you can wait and they will call you.

title: Not like the original on S 3rd
text: My wife and I took my parents out for a special occasion and I was excited to bring them to the second location of one of my favorite restaurants. We figured that the parking would be more ample in Northern liberties and we would try out the new digs.    First the good news, we were seated right away and the food was very good. That is the end of the good news.  Now for why I do not recommend going here.  The acoustics inside of the restaurant were terrible and it was very hard to hold a conversation without yelling. When placing the order we were informed that vegetables and rice and other accompaniments, which come with a standard platter at the Original location, are all sold separately here.  The food then was brought out and was on all different size plates, none of which made sense given the higher cost.  If sold separately here why would the portions be smaller?  The food was very good, like the original location, but we will not return based on how they’ve decided to set their menu, the smaller portions and the loud interior.  To me it’s also a matter of principle that if there are two restaurants by the same name located within 3 miles of one another that. they should have the same menu or it should be indicated that it is a different concept.  This left a bad taste in my mouth.

title: Sooo deliciously and yet disappointing!
text: I so looked forward to coming to this location, Ignored as much as possible the crazy noise that I as well as my friends had to yell at our server who could not hear our order... Loved the food but the service was truly unacceptable ! There was NO ONE who looked responsible enough to get their attention, to acknowledge our needs. At the end, our server was eating dinner and we could not get her or any one's attention ( the place was at that point pretty quiet). our friend had to walk up to her to ask for a refill...  Hate giving a small tip ( Which we did not...hope the chef got some acknowledgment) when the people responsible to do the hiring do not take ownership of this so vulnerable business!

title: Very poor server (waitress).  Bad enough the ruin the entire restaurant experience.
text: Horrible…horrible service. Our server was slow and just not that great. And the one other server kept on bumping into my chair all night. I didn’t want to say anything out of fear they would contaminate our food.   And the portions are small. But that is a small issue compared to dealing with the laziest, most unwelcoming server I’ve ever met.

title: Great Group Dining Experience
text: We were a group of ten on the morning after our daughter's wedding. The staff at a.kitchen were helpful from the moment we asked for a reservation, a few weeks before -- coming up with a three-course prix fixe menu that accommodated everyone's tastes and dietary needs. The service was attentive, the pace was leisurely, the noise level low enough so that we could all talk....and the celebrated natural wine list was as good as we expected. We couldn't have asked for a better morning-after meal or a more thoughtful presentation. We look forward to visiting for drinks and dinner on another visit to Philadelphia.

title: Excellent
text: Came here for dinner with my Philly family - food was excellent  - very nicely prepared & presented!  Great service - would highly recommend to anyone visiting Philadelphia.

title: No reason to go anywhere else
text: If this was the only restaurant in Philly, I would be all set. No reason to go anywhere else. a.kitchen has been consistently exceptional for years. Incredibly good food. Always interesting and very good wine. And the staff and servers here are great; welcoming and always accommodating.

title: A Wonderful Dining Experience
text: Enjoyed a. kitchen a number of years ago, and I recall having an excellent meal. Dined there again this evening, and was blown away by the attentive service, warm atmosphere and amazing cuisine.  Paul & Jess at the bar were excellent hosts, offering dining recommendations, taste pairings, checking in, and generally ensuring all their patrons were well-served.  The dishes were original and delicious, thoroughly satisfying. One of the best meals I’ve experienced in the past decade.  Highly recommend!

title: Excellent Tapas Spot
text: Was excited to see this tapas place near our hotel, especially as my colleagues had never tried tapas before. The standards (patatas bravas, pan con tomate, croquettes) were all great. The pork belly was so good we ordered it twice. Would come back again for sure.

title: How to ruin a great meal with bogus charges...
text: Let me explain my 2-star ratings by listing the pros and cons of my experience. I dined here with my girlfriend for our anniversary and it was a mixed experience for sure.  Pros: the food and service (by Katie) were 5-star as both were excellent, some of the best tapas I've ever had. The entire 5-course meal was excellent.  Cons: 1) If you're going to order the 5-course or chef's tasting menu DO NOT make a later reservation. We came in at 8:30, ordered the 5-course option and by our 2nd course we were the only table left and the staff was cleaning up around us making us feel very uncomfortable, like we were holding them up from closing. 2) Review your bill VERY carefully because there will be odd charges on it. First off, we were charged $70 for a bottle of wine listed for $65 on the menu. Secondly, we were charged a $13 "beverage tax" on the alcohol. When I said to the manager, "so between the sales tax and the beverage tax, you're taxing us twice on the alcohol, right?" He replied "yes". The Phila. beverage tax is intended to sweetened drinks like soda, energy drinks, etc. and is NOT intended for alcohol. We dine in Phila all the time and we've NEVER been charged such a silly charge. We were also charged $8 for using a credit card (which was already on the bill before we even paid). What if we paid with cash? When I told the manager that it's illegal to charge a fee for using a debit card and showed him proof on my phone, he merely looked at me. So we basically paid an extra $25 for nonsense after dropping $250 there.   Will we go back? No we won't. As I said the meal and service were fantastic but feeling rushed when you've ordered a multi-course meal and then being nickel-and-dimed with illegal charges basically ruined an excellent meal and our anniversary dinner. This is especially disappointing given that this is a Townsend Wentz restaurant.

title: Beware of charges on your bill...
text: First off, the food was amazing and the service fantastic which makes the rest such a shame.  1. If you make an 8:30 reservation DO NOT choose the 5 course option or chefs choice. You will not have time to fully enjoy the experience.  We weren't even at desert when the place was empty and everyone was cleaning up around us and the bartender left. The music got louder and we were told that if we were uncomfortable we could wrap up the final courses to go. If at the end you still plan going. Keep your choices Ala carte and not so many. 2. We get the bill. Now like most trusting people who aren't expecting to get ripped off we would have just paid but because our server forgot to add our bottle of wine (no problem, these things happen) I decided to look at the check to make sure the rest was right. First thing I see is the beverage tax. In Philly the beverage tax is applied to sweet drinks and energy drinks NOT alcoholic drinks. We did not have what the tax is intended for. We were also charged an $8 credit card fee. With this one-how did they know I'd use a charge card? What if I paid with cash. That aside I did use a DEBIT card. A debit card is the same as cash and cannot be charged a fee. We even googled these things when speaking to the manager to say hey, we're not making this up! When you say to a manager "you're taxing us twice for the bottle of wine?" and he says "YES", there's a problem.  He even removed the beverage tax. (The manager was great and unless the owner would prefer he lied and look stupid,  he did his job) at this point I wasn't going to argue the credit card charge, though he was aware that it was wrong, these people don't make the big money and wanted to go home. This is a Townsend Wentz restaurant. We have eaten at Townsend as well as Amano. We couldn't recall if these charges were applied there in the underhanded way they were applied here but again, we're people who trust and don't expect to get ripped off. I'm thinking the owners are putting their bets on that. Honestly, of the many, many restaurants we have dined at in Philly, this was a first. My son-in-law is a chef and restaurant owner. He'd never risk his reputation by putting a beverage tax on alcohol served or charge the customer $8 for the use of a debit card (let alone put it on the bill before knowing how the customer is paying).  Yes, the food and service was fantastic, so if you're ok with $25 in taxes-the majority of which should NOT be charged-and the knowledge you're being taken advantage of...Townsend Wentz will give you that.

title: Flavor party in every bite
text: One of the best restaurants ever! If you enjoy flavor and creativity and great service, this place hits all the marks! The chefs choice tasting menu was fantastic!

title: So so experience
text: Flavors are nice. Rations sizes  are tiny.  Octopus overcook and cold  Nice atmosphere in a snail place  You shall book your visit

title: Disappointed This Time
text: So I went to Warmdaddys for the first time last year in May. Food was good enough, but I especially liked the skillet mac and cheese and the cornbread. Went back on Tuesday expecting at least the same quality or better. Sadly, I was highly disappointed. The greens mixed with cabbage was watery, mushy, and flavorless. The yams were watery, the catfish was flavorless and didn’t seem like fresh fish. I’m thinking it was bagged. And the star of my first visit, the mac and cheese was dried out and flavorless! I will say the turkey wings were AMAZING!   Another thing worth mentioning is the 18% gratuity was charged without our knowledge. There was only two of us and the bill was $65, so adding gratuity wasn’t standard. When I asked the server about this, she informed us that it’s automatically added on certain nights.    After this experience with the food I probably won’t be back

title: WE LOVED EVERY SECOND!
text: Warmdaddys was AMAZING! The food was SO delicious, and Tanqueray Hayward + Band absolutely killed it with their performance! The Skillet mac n cheese and fried chicken were to die for. Can’t wait to go back!

title: Thanks for a good time.
text: Came in from NY for Dinner and a show. The service was excellent and accommodating. The restaurant is located in a good area around a movie house and street vendors.  Inside, outside and Balcony sitting. The entertainment was excellent and the food was prepared with love and tradition.  We had a Blast and will return. If you know wine don't order it there.

title: Customer service A+
text: Came for Sunday brunch and to hear live music. Was not disappointed in any way. The food was delicious, my favorite was shrimp and grits, candied yams, so good, and the customer service was on point. We sat at the bar ( place was crowed and I can see why :) ) and the bartender Stacy, was very pleasant, drinks were just right. Want to thank Yvette, the manger, for taking the time to ensure our time there was special, she was very friendly and attentive and we truly appreciated, we had such a good time.

title: 50th Birthday Celebration
text: This was my first time going to Warmdaddy’s although I had known about this place for awhile.  So when it came time to plan my hubby’s 50th with friends and family, I thought this would be a great venue.    The planning with the coordinator/contracts person was ok. I found that I had to reach out quite a bit as opposed to the other way around.  However, it all came together very nicely.  They allow you to decorate your tables, with some exceptions. The pre-selected food menus to choose from were great as well as the drink packages.  The costs were pretty much as expected and reasonable for 18 people.  There is the entertainment charge for the live band which is a separate cost. And although the coordinator/contracts person wasn’t very personable in person, the contract was ok and she was a pleasure over the phone.   The food was really, really good. My pre-selected menu of choice included an appetizer/starter of Cajun Catfish Fingers, Gumbo Ya Ya, or Country Caesar Salad (although it appears that we ended up with Garden salad instead as our salads didn’t have the homemade cornbread crouton that I had heard so much about).  Our main dish choices were Southern Fried Chicken, Bar-B-Q Atlantic Salmon, or Braised Beef Short Rib with mashed potatoes and Smoked Turkey Collard Greens + Cabbage.  The dessert of choice was the Caramelized Pineapple Bread Pudding (absolutely sinful 😊). We all really enjoyed the meal so much so that we had attendees order extra dishes from the regular menu to take home.   The live band was enjoyable.  We all got to groove to some of that good, soulful music.  Not the music from today, but the music that has stood the test of time and generations.   All in all, it was a great and most memorable celebration and I’m sure hubby and I will return.   Note:  Warmdaddy’s could use some updated table and chairs, however. The tables are showing quite a bit of wear and some are uneven.  If I didn’t decorate the table tops, it would have been really dull and a little unsightly.  I know they are bringing in the “dough” so spend a little and update the decor.

title: Dinner in Philadelphia, PA
text: Came here for dinner Saturday night—had reservations so we were seated right away.  Cute small restaurant.  The bar area seems pretty energetic but we sat in the dining area.  Started off with Half Dozen Pink Moon Raw Oysters—so delicious!  Also tried the Roasted Oysters which were overloaded with breadcrumbs I could barely taste the oyster underneath—also has a spicy kick to it as well!  For entrees, we tried to Bucatini Cacio E Pepe and Mafaldine Alla Vodka—both pasta dishes were generous portions and overall were pretty good!  No issues with our cocktails and service was great.

title: Beyond Great Experience Wilder Philadelphia!
text: 2/26/25 Year End Celebration work lunch in semi-private space upstairs. Exceeded our expectations on all fronts! Food, staff, service, beautiful space. Worked closely with Brett who owns Wilder with his partner Nicole. I let Brett know that is was wonderful and we cannot wait to return for another work event and to bring family and friends.  Thanks for everything Brett!

title: Fun, relaxing, and pleasant. This is a great place to dine with your wife, family, or friends. It has a great ambiance feel to i
text: Me and my wife loved everything about this restaurant from the atmosphere,service, and the dishes. My wife ordered calamari, which was cooked to perfection. I ordered a cocktail called the South Philly, and it was really refreshing. we also ordered their pull apart rolls with softened butter it was warm and soft. And for the main course, we ordered a couple of their seafood dishes

title: Perfect Spot in Rittenhouse SQ
text: Food was exceptional. Staying in Center City / Rittenhouse SQ and Google Best Restaurants near me turns up lots of options. This place did not disappoint. Fig & Ricotta salad plus their Rotolo pasta dish were just right. Certainly give them a try. Had no reservation, I just sat at a bar side table, it was a Sunday however.

title: What a disappointment; they missed the mark on nearly everything.
text: We really wanted to like this place.  We live nearby but have never been.  We made a res for 1:45 (late for brunch). The place was 1/2 empty but we were seated at a table for 2 at a banquette squeezed between 2 noisy groups and very close to the front door which brought in icy air.  I looked at a long expanse of empty tables and asked if we could sit over there and was told no; they were expecting a big party.  Note:  the big party arrived one hour later when we were ready to leave.  Also 2 other couples arrived and were seated in the forbidden zone. Okay that was #1.  Then no wait person showed up for a longish period of time: #2: no water; no welcome.  Menu was okay.  We both ordered a different version of a salad with grilled salmon. Mine included a poached egg. #3 poached egg arrived hard boiled. I asked for a replacement t and they did bring me a softly poached, runny egg.  We waited a ridiculous amount of time for someone to refill our iced tea. #4: food was mediocre.  Edible but no where near the quality anticipated based on the prices.  I do not recommend this place and would not go back.  Plenty of far better places a short walk away.

title: Do not go here
text: They are so unfriendly and so stuck on themselves. We could not get out of our RV spot because the way they did the roads and they’re blaming us because we drove over the grass. We have a 45 foot coach and that’s the spot they put us in where we could not get out. The woman came out yelling at us screaming so unprofessional. There’s a kind way to handle things and there is a bad way to handle things and this woman handle things extremely poorly. They have all these rules here and I am so unhappy with this park I would keep going. There’s other nice parks in the Durango area.

title: Terrible experience at expensive and over-hyped restaurant
text: One of our worst dining experiences ever. This fancy speakeasy has no name on the door, just a gold plaque with a rose on it. You have to ring the doorbell when you arrive and a secret panel opens in the door for the host to speak through. I found it on a list of “cozy and romantic” restaurants with great reviews. It is very dark, with bookshelves, and mismatched vintage plates (which fit the décor I guess, but I would have expected something more minimal.   It is very popular and by the time we made a reservation (on a Thursday night), the only available time was 8:45pm. This was already late for our preference, but we thought we’d try it since everyone raved about it. We arrived early at 8:30pm to see if our table was ready. They said it was not, and the people currently seated had just ordered dessert. They recommended we get a drink nearby and they would text us when the table was ready. We waited at our hotel lobby around the corner, thinking it wouldn’t be that long. We received a text at 9:06pm that said “Your table is now ready at Alpen Rose!” When we arrived a few minutes later, we rang the bell again, only for them to tell us it was still NOT ready. There was a rowdy party of 5 guys also at the door that were taken in before us.   It was almost 9:30pm by the time we were seated. Starving, we ordered oysters Rockefeller. Being so late we asked if we could put in our entrée orders but was told that “the chef likes to course it out”. We were surprised by (who we assumed was) a manager bringing us a complimentary appetizer of tuna carpaccio, however I do not eat raw fish. She left with it and came back to ask if we would like shrimp cocktail instead (which my husband is allergic to). We imagine they were trying to make up for being late, but never asked our preference. She finally brought out a wedge salad, like it or not (which was good, even though I don’t eat bacon).   It was very noisy and we were right on top of the people on either side of us – not romantic at all (the space is very small, seating maybe 40 people). The only good thing were the drinks (we had No. 3 and 21). Vegetables and starch sides do not come with the main dish, you must buy them separately (the asparagus was large but tender and tasty). I ordered the branzino, which she said would have some bones but were large and in almost every bite. We were shocked that my husband’s $56 filet was so tough it was hard to cut! Two small dessert bites showed up at the end of the meal, but they did not make up for the poor performance at this price point.   We were seated next to the noisy guys who came before us, so in the end we tried to make the best of it, joking and trading photos with them and being entertained by their drinks covered with smoke, massive Tomahawk cavemen bone steaks, and flaming baked Alaska with a sparkler. Maybe at 50 we are older than the typical crowd, and now we know not to make a reservation that late (especially when the times are not honored), but a pricey establishment like this should know better how to space out their reservations. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone, even given the hype.

title: There are much better choices for a 300 meal.
text: First time here, won’t be back. Dry aged is the house specialty and they didn’t get it right. I ordered the dry aged rib eye medium rare. First time out, the meat was a true medium. With appropriate apologies, they cooked another. This came out a true medium rare. However, there was so much char on the meat, I could not taste the subtle taste of a $78 piece of meat. Okay, not happy, but we wouldn’t come back. We were offered a free dessert. Now, at the table adjacent to us, the couple ordered a filet medium rare. Theirs too came out grey. And, like ours, the char was so heavy they said it over-powered the taste of the meat. Finally, our complimentary dessert. It’s prime peach time and they had warm peach pie with ice cream. It had a huge puff pastry crust that had no flavor. And worse, the peach cubes were cold, hard and tasteless. In the middle of peach season. Top all this off with tables so close together that when the server was pouring our neighbors wine, their ass was right in my face. Literally, right there. The only redeeming feature was the cocktails and whisky list. This was our third try of restaurants in this chain. Thy Mary and Pearl Oyster House was okay, but The Oyster House is much better. The Giusseppe restaurant was average; Villa Di Roma is a better choice. And Barkley Prime far outshines Alpen Rose.

title: Cannot wait to come back
text: Fabulous !! It was wonderful ! 2 couples - started with the seafood tower ! Perfection - but so do not miss the bone marrow toast - we each had a little something different - cannot wait to come back !!!!

title: Ambience the best - Food subpar
text: Ate there last night. Great ambience and decor but one of the worst steakhouses I’ve been to as far as food goes. Got a NY strip Pittsburgh medium rare, it was about an inch thick if that and very tough to cut. The creamed spinach side dish was served in what looked like a coffee cup - very small portion. Been to all the steakhouses often. The food here just doesn’t compare to any of them. Sorry.

title: Overrated
text: Everything was edible. But thats about it. Scant hollandaise on the eggs benedict, ham costs extra. Salads were drowning in dressing. Just, not overall impressed. Vegetarian friendly but bit more limited if vegan.

title: Waiter
text: Jake was a fantastic waiter.  We usually look forward to George.  In this case Jake was a pleasant replacement.  Food always excellent.  We have been coming here since Fare opened.  A fantastic neighborhood restaurant.  A must “give it a try”.

title: Skip it. Touristy and overpriced
text: I’ve been walking past it for a few years and my sister wished to try it on her birthday. Dirty martini was made with black olives. Huh? And for $15! Sent that back. Flatbread was room temperature. Sent that back. What I won’t do is go back. Save your $$ and go elsewhere.

title: Delicious food served cold….
text: Fare is a cool restaurant with some pretty awesome food.  Only problem is that I’ve been there twice and both times my entrée was served cold.  I just don’t understand how a restaurant could do that.  Don’t they have a person to ensure meals are hot and immediately served when prepared?  Fix that, and you get a 5 from me!

title: Wouldn’t recommend
text: I went to FARE with my sisters for the first time ; I was excited to try the food ! The customer service was TRASH and the food wasn’t that good either ! We literally waited for the check for 20mins . The server was really rude ! I had to say it twice

title: Outstanding Place for Breakfast/Brunch
text: The Dutch has changed a bit since some of these pictures.  It has upgraded the atmosphere, and the food continues to be outstanding. The wait staff is fast, friendly and efficient.  We had a egg white omelet and 3-Egg breakfast.  I recommend the sausage; its some of the best I've have had in a while (but spicy).   Great local place, quiet and good for talking.

title: Stick to the ribs brunch but inconsistent
text: Came here for weekend brunch.  Right in the heart of east passyunk, it’s a popular place. Its theme is Amish influence which is nice for brunch.  On the one hand. My Amish bologna eggs Benedict with cream chip beef and was super yummy and our lattes were perfect.  But my wife’s Avacado toast was really too basic for the price.  Also the service felt young and untrained and very inconsistent.  So we drop a star for that inconsistency.

title: Day in Philly
text: Interesting little place in the heart of South Philly. we went with several very different items, The Veggie Dutch, the Lebanese Salami and cream chesse omelet, and the truffle mushroom omelet.  All was good and different and will come back to try the great looking pancakes! Service was a little slow as it is a small place and two front staff members. The bar out front takes a lot of space , if it was nice out, we would have sat in the outside space out front.

title: Casual and Comfortable
text: I love a spot where I can day drink with a glass of spritz or some equally light and lovely cocktail. This is a comforting neighborhood spot, serving nice sized portions of simple food using very good ingredients (the roasted mushroom omelet is super). Service is attentive without being obnoxious or overbearing and the guests range from families with toddlers to older couples to work colleagues enjoying a break together.  Would happily take anyone there for a good meal and the pleasant atmosphere

title: Dinner at The Dutch
text: Since The Dutch moved closer to my home I was eagerly anticipating a meal in this wonderful location. And I was not disappointed in the least. Nor was my ever crankier partner, who has narrowed his range of acceptable food choices to only a few items; which makes dining out a bit tricky. This is a well done nicely thought out casual menu served up in a light filled corner location with lots of windows, perfect for people watching.   For dinner, our party of four started with 3 appetizers, charred shishito peppers, some truffled Parmesan fries and small bowl of pickled vegetables. All were perfect finger food bites to go along with some really stellar cocktails- loved the Singing Fountain. For entrees, a double cheeseburger proclaimed excellent., a generous entree sized Cobb salad, zucchini spaghetti primavera, a light offering of summers best veggies and a chicken gravy - a sort of savory Dutch baby with egg sauce etc. Two desserts of a blueberry tart and some malted milk ice cream with homemade peanut brittle,  completed  the evening along with some delicious coffee and espresso.  For dinner, with moderate drinking and three courses  I would figure on spending $60 -75 per person with tax and tip. Though it would be quite easy to have a lovely meal here for half that price.   We are all looking forward to our next visit for breakfast/lunch.

title: GREAT DAME OF BROAD STREET
text: This restaurant was our go-to for Thanksgiving, prior to the pandemic. Every year, we would come for the luscious all-you-can-eat buffet. This year, we returned & it was great to be back! As always, the food was outstanding. (This year, they even had a duo that provided live instrumental music.)   We did encounter an issue with seating. We asked to be moved to a different room & our request was denied. A screaming baby kept us from fully enjoying the experience.

title: A bit of a disappointment
text: Having been recommended this as a treat for brunch we were looking forward to our visit.  Aware that most hotel lifts need a card to make them work we asked at the front desk and they just told us to go up to the 19th floor.  We went up as far as the 14th where a customer got in the lift and we started to descend again.  Luckily this customer used their room key to press for the 19th and once everyone got out in the lobby we went back up again.   The young lady serving was very polite and friendly but was on her own and the two people who were behind the desk did not attempt to help her.   We ordered starters and a main and after a half hour wait all the food came out together.  The main was warm but not hot as was the starter the toast had been hot at some point but was definitely cold by the time it got to us.   Having said all that the restaurant looked stunning, the food when it finally arrived although a little cold tasted good and the price was not unreasonable it’s just a shame that the customer experience was not what we would have expected

title: Wonderful Happy Hour at Bellevue!
text: Very elegant setting with welcoming and attentive servers.  The happy hour wine, crispy Brussel sprout medley, Parmesan truffle fries were all delicious!  Background music streaming from Spotify - various artists "Summer Barbeque"  was so much fun families of multiple generations felt compelled to jive along !  Please view the submitted photos that capture the essence of the lovely XIX BAR LOUNGE.

title: Lounge Has It All
text: Nicely crafted and creative drinks, delicious food served up in a historic and beautiful setting, with stellar views over the city. I enjoyed their cheeseburger as well as several other items during our stay at the Bellevue; all were excellent. They offer a sweet happy hour which includes some drinks and some food. The service is impeccable, but also very welcoming and friendly. I enjoyed the drinks, food and ambience so much, I kept going back; it was that great.

title: Pleasant place for drinks and dessert
text: During our stay, we stopped by the XIX lounge for drinks and dessert.  My wife and I were each treated to a generous pour of a good chardonnay, which had just a bit of residual sweetness.  We also shared a portion of the chocolate mousse, which was very satisfying.  Prices are a little on the high side, but that's to be expected when you're in a classy location like the Bellevue.

title: Love it here!
text: My sister and I started going to this venue at the beginning of 2025 and have since become regulars.  The food is fantastic, the staff are incredibly kind and welcoming (from the front door to the wait staff) and the entertainment is over the top. The jazz artists they manage to get are the best!   I cannot wait to see what 2026 brings to this fantastic venue.  And a shout out to the emcee Mr. Kenny - he is a very cool person.

title: A Hidden Gem with Soul: SOUTH Restaurant & Jazz Club, Philadelphia
text: We originally had reservations at Osteria, but after a surprisingly cold welcome, we decided to walk out and try our luck elsewhere. Just down the block, we found SOUTH—and what a serendipitous switch it turned out to be. Despite having no reservation, we were seated at the Chef’s Table, which gave us a fascinating view into the workings of the kitchen. Watching the culinary team in action added a whole new layer to the experience—impressive, precise, and full of energy. Our server, Bryn (Taylor/Tay), was exceptional. She knew the menu inside and out, offered thoughtful recommendations, and made us feel genuinely welcomed. Her warmth and professionalism elevated the entire evening. We started with drinks: I had the watermelon sangria—refreshing and perfectly balanced—and my husband enjoyed a classic sweet tea, which was just right. For appetizers, we chose the Spiced Shrimp Deviled Eggs and Bayou Chicken Gumbo. Both were flavorful and comforting, with just the right amount of Southern flair. For entrées, we had the Charleston Shrimp & Grits and the Eastern Shore Crab Cakes. The shrimp and grits were creamy, bold, and beautifully seasoned. The crab cakes were delicate yet packed with flavor—no filler, just fresh crab and thoughtful seasoning. The atmosphere was lively and elegant. Though we weren’t seated in the jazz room, we could still hear the music drifting in, adding a soulful backdrop to the evening. The vibe was festive, with guests clearly enjoying themselves. SOUTH strikes a rare balance: upscale without being pretentious, soulful without being heavy. If you're looking for a place that delivers great food, warm service, and a touch of magic, SOUTH is it. We came in disappointed and left delighted.

title: Great music and food and friendly atmosphere
text: I came for dinner and the Jazz show in the parlor. I have been here before and each time the music is incredible and the staff is impeccable. It’s a little close quarters in the listening room for the Jazz, but it doesn’t matter cause everyone is there to listen to the music and are very friendly. On my latest visit, I enjoyed the shrimp and grits and since my spice level tolerance is low I was thankful it wasn’t too spicy. Overall, a great experience and I overwhelmingly recommend South! And the unscripted jazz series!

title: Visited twice, that’s enough, too busy for a relaxing time
text: Nice spot, parking close by, reservations needed for dinner, show. Dinner pricey for what is served. Nice atmosphere. Seafood disappointing. Oxtail, Mac n cheese good, cornbread very good. Wait staff good but busy. Music a bit too loud, seated in back but still loud.

title: Visiting Philly for first time bad experience at restaurant
text: I visited Philly for the first time apparently this restaurant has a dress code. I was told I couldnt be seated because my pants were considered sporty. The hostess suggested I go shopping and purchase new pants. In terms of customer service this restaurant gets an F. The hostess could have handled the situation better. She could have apologized for the confusion and offered for me to return the next day. She was very dismissive no type of compromise. A deer without headlights. Its a shame as a black owed business and a person of color myself that is the experience I had. I would never recommend this restaurant to anyone that is visting Philly.

title: Skip if possible
text: Just was going to get an order and take it back up to my room no big deal right…..well guess the young lady bartender did not think so.  I was told you’ll have to wait “I only take care of people that are dining or drinking in” as a whole 2 people were at the bar area and no one eating.    The gentleman came out and took my order.  I just got a burger and substituted for a salad.  The food was not bad but I basically got a burger salad.  No separate container for the salad and dressing so everything was just mixed together.

title: So-So
text: The resturant was clean and service was good. The breakfast were okay although too much lemon on my avocado toast and my husband's toasts were burnt and eggs undercooked. Another morning our breakfast was amazing. I'm not sure if there are different cooks but quality of food is a bit inconsistent.

title: Avoid if you can
text: After trying to find parking around Gus' or Pat's for cheesesteak and it was too cold to eat outside (food would have been cold by the time we got to our hotel) we checked into the hotel and then went downstairs for dinner. The restaurant has nice ambiance but that is the nicest thing I can say.   There was one server and there were 2 other tables with guests. We ordered and waited and waited. Finally the food arrived. My friend ordered quesadilla and I ordered pasta. The friend asked for salsa (what quesadilla comes without salsa?) and the server said they were out and would have to check. I asked for a spoon to go along with my pasta because I am Italian and always use a fork and spoon. An update on the salsa and a spoon never arrived. How do you run out of store bought salsa (doubt they would make homemade)????? My pasta was not really that hot and I should have sent it back to be warmed up but then thought I might not even see the dish again. The server "served" everyone else and checked in on them but TOTALLY ignored us. Unacceptable. There are MUCH BETTER options nearby and we should have done that but my friend was "hangry" - lol. My friend was on a different flight from me and had no food options were I was in First and got a meal. Thank goodness since if I was hungry too, I would have been angry and then "hangry".

title: Avoid avoid
text: Not good. One employee is host/server/bartender and most of the time was nowhere to be found. The bar was out of tonic. My avocado toast was basically a brick topped with that avocado stuff that is squeezed out of a tube and a few cherry tomato halves. Awful. Husband’s burger came with cheese even though he ordered it without cheese. No one to ask to fix it, so I walked back to the kitchen door and tried to call to someone. No answer. A long time after that, the host/server/bartender finally emerged and took care of it. As we tried to pay the bill, we were told that the restaurant doesn’t take Visa. Wyndham can do better than that.

title: Nice Service! Delicious Breakfast!
text: Very delicious scrambled eggs with bacon and fries. Very good Coffee and Juice. Thank you Monica for the nice breakfast service.

title: Exceptional Experience
text: This was my third or fourth time dining at Friday Saturday Sunday, and I think it gets better each time! The detail to every aspect of the food preparation is evident, along with the variety and uniqueness of every dish.  The servers are very approachable and extremely knowledgeable about every dish. The meal starts with seasonal snacks and progresses through vegetable tastings and a variety of proteins.  The meal ends with a dessert or two that in a perfect ending to a magnificent culinary experience!  I visit Philadelphia solo and never feel awkward or out of place dining by myself at this restaurant.  This is definitely a very upscale restaurant but pulls that off without being pretentious or snobby.  The upstairs tasting menu dining room is cozy yet comfortable.  I really can't say enough about the restaurant!  It is expensive, but should be thought of as an experience more than just a dinner.  In my opinion, the quality justifies the experience.  An added bonus to the tasting menu is the great wine and cocktail selections.  Friday Saturday Sunday really cares about it's patrons.  I look forward to seeing the hostess when I walk in, as she remembers me from previous visits.  That's pretty amazing considering the number of people that walk through that door.

title: Deserving 3 Michelin Stars***
text: Wow! This was the best tasting menu of our lives and we have traveled all around the world. We have been to places with more courses and more creative presentations. However, ranking purely on taste, Friday, Saturday, Sunday is our new number one. Every dish was scrumptious and the service was first rate! We loved the chef’s use of textures with complex flavors and just the right amount of crunch. We can’t wait to come back with other friends and family!

title: Exceptional Experience
text: This was my second time at Friday Saturday Sunday.  It's definitely a restaurant for a special occasion!  The tasting menu is pricey but in my opinion well worth it.  I experienced eight courses of unique and delicious dishes, each served by amazing servers who could explain the intricacies of the dishes so well.  Although this is definitely a high end restaurant, it never feels stuffy or pretentious.  I dined alone and was made to feel comfortable and as special as if I was with an important group.  Starting with the seasonal snacks to the halibut dish, pasta, and steak, each dish was immaculately prepared and served.  Dessert was an amazing chocolate cake, a vanilla type custard/ice cream, and an extra chocolate coated piece of heaven!  I did not choose the optional wine pairing, but instead enjoyed one of their cocktails, an Orange Catholic.  They are known for their cocktails as well and this one was amazing!

title: Stellar dining experience
text: Wonderful vibes the moment we walked in. We were told there was a dining room upstairs, but my wife and I sat at the bar with friends. Although it was a sober night for me, the rest of my group ordered one of the cocktails from the menu that was expertly crafted by a friendly mixologist named Paul. The playlist set the tone for a fun Friday night and the volume was a perfect level for conversation and in seat dancing. This place is a hot spot with folks waiting up to an hour or more to dine at the bar, and frankly, the food is more than worth the wait. It is a culinary delight with high art presentation. It really engaged the five senses, yes even sound; I could hear the crisp of the skin as I bit into the roasted chicken. A rich sensory experience. I have so much more to say about the food, but I invite you to try it out for yourself. We will absolutely be back here.

title: Fabulous Super Stupendous
text: This restaurant is nothing but amazing. There are no other words. The tasting menu was full of foods that I would not typically eat yet I ate everything, In fact I relished everything. The subtle lasting taste of each course was memorable, and the transition to dessert was also quite impressive. The food was absolutely sumptuous. We were fortunate enough to have a very experienced server and he was also terrific. At one point my wife and I were not quite sure about one of the courses and the waiter very clearly said, try it, and if you still don’t like it, we will find something else. We tried it and we loved it. Every course was better than the next. Bravo!

title: Not Great but very inexpensive
text: At first glance this hotel seemed to be well-located, as it is right at a busy 4-way intersection with a rotary and pedestrian bridge outside. That is, until you actually explore and find that there's nothing worth visiting around there. Yes, lots of stores and some restaurants, but really none of note. The hotel itself is pretty old, and in disappointing condition given that it is managed by a 4-star airline. My room door, wooden and creaky, had to be forced shut. Lighting in the room was laughably crooked, no minibar, no free bottled water, furniture very dated, bathtub missing stopper. Room control panel near the bed is difficult to figure out (i.e. no English), even for a seasoned traveler. The check-in staff were friendly, but when I checked out I couldn't find my key they charged me 30rmb for it. In the States I usually keep my keys but in China many Chinese hotels demand return. No big deal, but 30rmb is steep compared to the room price, which is actually the best thing about the hotel. There's also free internet and surprise surprise HBO. It was dirt cheap at under $30 a night, so based on that I am giving this 3 stars rather than 2.

title: Good place for wings
text: This is for the location on Beechmont ave. It’s been a few years since I’ve been to this location. We were there on a Saturday evening and it didn’t appear to be really busy, but steady. Our order of  wings were hot and done just right as were the onion rings. They had plenty of help and our waitress was attentive at the right times. So we had a really good experience. My only knock is this, it’s rather noisy to the point of making conversation a little tough.

title: Best Chain Wing Restaurant
text: Always satisfied with the wings!! Always fresh, never dry, and plenty of sauce!! Custom service is also a 5 star.

title: They have great blue cheese!
text: I am not a boneless wing person but the boneless wings here arenot a heavy breaded chicken nugget! They have a wide variety of sauces and flavors. Another one of my favorite things is the cauliflower wing!

title: My favorite wings
text: We’ve never eaten in the restaurant , normally we get our food to go. We were seated quickly and there seemed to be plenty of help. They took our drink order and then our order. Our food came out reasonably quick considering how busy they were. We were there Saturday early evening, all college football on all the screens. All in all I would definitely come back again. If there’s a drawback for me is how noisy it is, but I anticipated this and I’m not dinging the place for this.

title: Awesome Buffalo Chicken nachos
text: First visit and definitely not the last. We never went here because our thinking was it was just like all the other wings chains with a similar name. WRONG. We like this place. It will be a regular place for us. The nachos were so good - with real chicken. My husband got a burger. He is very picky about burgers but said he liked it and would order again. We sat at the bar and had a good time talking with Sarah. She made our visit fun.

title: Harding Presidential Sites
text: We had a great visit to the Warren G Harding Presidential Library and Memorial. The Library (aka Museum) is quite small compared to other presidential libraries, but does a good job telling the story of Harding's short presidency. Tours of his home are only offered on the hour, so we had to miss that, but did take photos from the outside. We also visited the Harding Memorial in the cemetery, which was quite impressive. If you're passing by Marion, Ohio, take a break from your drive and stop by to see the presidential sites.

title: We watched a short film at the museum prior to the tour
text: Our guide was Theodore, he did an excellent job sharing his knowledge of Warren Harding and Florence- marriage, campaign and presidency. The tour started on the porch where his Porch Campaign took place. The house furnishings are over 90% original. NO Pictures allowed which is sad for my personal journey ablum. The museum has nice exhibits with a couple audios. Enjoyed watching the pictures taken on the Voyage of Understanding tour to the western states and Alaska. Purchase tickets on-line because we were shocked how the first 3 tours were fully booked. We changed our itinerary to make a late afternoon tour. Large parking lot. Restrooms on site.

title: Museum and House Tour Make this a fun Visit
text: A visit to this presidential library comprises three potential activities.  First, there is an hour long tour of his house.  Second, the main building includes a small exhibition of his time as President.  Lastly, a mile from the library is his memorial.  We spent just under two hours here.

title: Learning at the Warren G. Harding Presidential Sites
text: Great trip. We arrived at approximately 9:30 am and made our way towards the entrance of the museum. After paying the admission fee, we received a quick overview of the site and went on our way. We opted to view some of the outdoor exhibits first, which included the guard house and press house. The press house contained multiple informational plaques about President Hardings wife and her contributions to society. After viewing the press house, we made our way to the front porch of the house, where we waited for the 10 am guided hour tour to begin. There were guided tours of the presidents former house being held every hour throughout the day. The guided tour of the house was very informational, and the tour guide took us from room to room, while pointing out interesting features and artifacts out for display. The tour guide told us several personal stories related to the Hardings time at the house. The guided tour lasted roughly 1 hour.  After viewing the house, we went back inside to view the main exhibits. We opted to watch a short documentary about President Hardings life and some of the trials and tribulations he faced during his time as President. There were multiple informational plaques out for display, many of them quite text heavy, that went into detail about Hardings upbringing and roots as the owner of a newspaper company in Marion. The plaques also talked about election day, and several of the policy’s Harding implemented while in office. The last section of the museum dealt with his death and some controversial issues that surrounded his presidency. There were multiple artifacts out for display in the museum, along with short video clips that related to President Harding's time in office.  Tip: I recommend spending 3 hours here if you truly want to see everything.

title: Worth the visit!!!
text: I was very impressed with the Warren G. Harding Presidential Sites.  We took the tour of his house, and listened first hand from the tour guides all about when Harding gave speeches on the "front porch".  The house is stunning and is 90+ percent original from years ago when Warren and his wife Florence lived in the house.  The tour guides can answer any questions you have off the top of their heads.  The  Library & Museum was finished in the spring of 2021 and they have a nice gift shop in there too.  They spared no expense in the construction of the building - it is beautiful!!!!  If you are a history buff, this is a must do.

title: Must try Yemeni food!
text: This is a really fun place to try right in the heart of olde city on chestnut street.  Dense small dining room.  Exceptionally friendly service.  Very unusual menu and flavor profiles than any other place in Philly.  We shared all our dishes family style so got to try a lot.  Portions were very big. We had both signature chichen dishes.  Both were a bit dry and didn’t pop with flavor. The lamb haneeth though burst with flavor and the Yemeni egg and cheese might be the sleeper standout on the menu.  The hummus and falafel was a yummy app.  Prices are a bit high across the board. A must try but not a must repeat.

title: Mouthwatering Mediterranean Cuisine
text: This review is two fold!  I have been here previously and had dinner!  I was with a group and the food was delicious and service was wonderful!   I had an idea to cater lunch for our team and wanted a diverse menu and I remembered what a great experience I had at Malooga, so I called to work on items that I felt would be tasty and yet affordable for a group of 15-20 people!    Let me tell you…I had grape leaves (slight tanginess that was lovely), two platters of Hummus (Some of the best I’ve had in a long time) and Pita Bread, Shawarma Wrap, Falafel Wrap and kebab Wrap!  The wraps were a big hit and super yummy!   Coordinating this event was done in a helpful and efficient manner!  The customer service was great from beginning to the delivery and I followed up afterwards to offer my enthusiastic feedback!  I am eager for them to open in the Narberth area!  Check out Malooga …it is a must try!

title: Highly Recommend!
text: We checked out Malooga as small group (4 people) and decided to basically family style everything.  We got their Adventure Platter to start (which happened to come easily divisible by 4). Love the grape leaves.  Loved the hummus.  The falafel was also quite tasty. So, clearly I recommend it. From there, we split the Haneeth & Mandi Duo, which resulted in plenty of leftovers even after we all had our fill. The lamb was a clear winner, although the chicken was surprisingly full of flavor as well. Sorry, we didn't save room for dessert this trip, however, we did enjoy some chai if you are considering a hot drink.  Enjoy!

title: Chicken falling off the bone
text: We ordered two chicken dishes, grape leaves, and rice pudding. We were very excited for the meal and arrived a bit early for our reservation. Chicken mandi and chicken kabsah were fabulous, the chicken was so tender and delicious , and the rice was unique and flavorful. I love rice pudding, which had pistachio on top! Service was timely and the staff are pleasant and knowledgeable. A+ all around!

title: RUN DONT WALK  !!!
text: Run don’t Walk !!! Oh my gosh, this restaurant is amazing- super - terrific. A pan Middle Eastern mix of incredible dishes that are expertly executed in a casual cosy ambiance. Perfect for an afternoon out.   We were a family group of 10 people and we ordered like 15 different dishes. Each and everything we chose was 5 star delicious !! Excellent portions and kind lovely service from Liam who could not have been more accommodating with our boisterous multi generational group.  Thanks Liam and thanks Malooga !!  We loved it 🌟

title: Birthday Celebration
text: We celebrated my wife’s 70th birthday.  The staff was very accommodating to the group.  The scenery was very appealing inside and out.  The marina situated just off the patio decking was nice.  The food was outstanding!  Treat yourself to a wonderful meal at the Point!

title: Fun night out with friends
text: The Point D.C. has lots of potential.  The menu is varied, the location is amazing, and the decor is great.  The service could use some improvement.  Pros -  Menu - lots of great choices, even for those who don't eat seafood Food - came out HOT, which meant it was freshly cooked Decor / ambiance - fantastic Location - right on the water, excellent view Seating - inside or outside seating was available  Cons -  Service - slower than expected Server - was nice, but wasn't attentive

title: Charming staff with a lovely view
text: We had an absolutely lovely dinner here for our first night in Washington. It was a birthday trip for my dad, and the staff were so welcoming. Even the manager came over to wish him well, he was a gentleman and we enjoyed chatting to him while enjoying the view.   We were surprised it wasn’t busier but sounds like a lot of people don’t know it’s there, so highly recommend as the only thing that would have been better is more people for the atmosphere!

title: Great Experience
text: The food was great.  We sat outside and they had the fire pit going, which set off a nice ambience.  And our server Greg was very attentive and recommended the crab stuff Cod, I’m glad he did because it was excellent.

title: Top quality
text: Lovely food at  fair pricing served by professional staff. Would definitely recommend instead nearest similar outlet such as Mira.

title: Great restaurant
text: What a lovely restaurant.. attentive staff, great atmosphere and FOOD!  Lots of it and perfectly cooked..  Grilled lamb (which was like a casserole) with rice, hot meze platter, lamachun,  and flat bread with dips. A glass of wine and a beer. At £50 it was  great value too!

title: Restaurants closed!
text: Booked a table for a birthday meal. When we arrived they had  decided to close the restaurant. Didn't bother to call us to let us know. Wasted journey.

title: Rushed
text: Very quiet but welcoming atmosphere. Varied menu and good value but food very average. Even though it was quiet they seemed in a hurry to get us out as they brought the main course before we had finished our starters! Very awkward as we had to make room for lots of plates and were then asked to keep the same cutlery for the main. Not sure if we are slow eaters but they then tried to clear out plates before we had finished the main. Once we decided we did not want a dessert they brought the bill rather than ask if we would like more wine or coffees. When we left the restaurant was empty on Saturday night, do people know something we didn’t?!

title: Affordable Turkish Meal
text: There were 4 of us who dined in this restaurant. We were the only customers which could be because it was 2 days before Valentine’s Day. I could not fault the service. The food was well presented and cooked healthily. I enjoyed my chicken shish but would have preferred to have it marinated as I’ve experienced elsewhere. The price was reasonable including the wines on offer.

title: Average
text: The food here wasn't great. It's by the kilo but, overall average. I also have seafood allergies and it was clear that although I stayed far away from the seafood it must have been cooked in the same pan or handled with the same utensils because by the time I left I was a walking rash.

title: Cheap ok food
text: You pay per the weight of the food you take the more you take the more you pay.  Big choice of all kinds. Sushi. Soups. Salads. Grilled meats and so on.  Just ok not more

title: Food Experience for Foodies
text: A dinner absolutely worthy of a Michelin Star. Food was unique, creatively prepared and delicious. The wait staff (primarily Evan) were attentive and friendly. Co-owner Jill visited tables. A lively vibe with a mixed crowd.  Extensive  wine list in addition to curated pairings. The Lion’s Mane Mushroom was amazing, presented in a thick cut, steak-like format and tasted much the same. I could be a vegetarian after eating it!   For those who previously offered criticism of: Price:  Check out similarly starred restaurants and  you’ll appreciate their price point.  Noise:  Yes it’s lively but we had absolutely no issues carrying on a conversation and discussing the creative preparations  Included Gratuity:  Really folks??  Where have you been for the past few years?  Who doesn’t give a 20% gratuity for good service and more for great service? Great job Team Tail Up Goat!!  We will highly recommend to others for a fun and delicious foodie experience in DC.

title: Nice treat
text: I first visited Tail Up Goat in 2019. It was astounding. Tried to visit last year but without a reservation, and ended up at their excellent sister restaurant. This year, we made reservations.  Great meal. The format has changed in the years since my first visit. Now, if you dine in the dining room, you must order the complete pre fixe menu… and some of the food is raw. I didn’t love that. But overall a delicious meal, nicely paced.

title: Left poorer, but still hungry
