text: We had been trying to get a reservation here for ages and were really disappointed by our experience. There were a couple positives -- staff were lovely and Audrey's wine pairing, while poured with a stingy hand, was well planned and full of interesting choices.   The food was the real dissapointment. First, there just wasn't enough of it. We left hungry and got fries on the way home. Not what you want paying more than $500 for dinner. The food ranged from pretty good -- the rockfish, the blue cheese puff -- to pretty bad -- under seasoned and dry pork belly (like how do you even make pork belly too dry?). Nothing we ate was memorable in a good way.  We've been to a lot of Michelin star restaurants and I have no idea what happened here. Is the chef doing Paleo? Give us some pasta or a potato or something more than tiny slivers of fish and radishes for all this money. I know everything is more expensive these days but a dinner like this shouldn't leave people hungry.

title: If you love extreme noise and a rude waiter, this is a place for you
text: If you love, extreme noise, extremely loud music, and very tight seating arrangements, this might be the very place for you. Furthermore, if you’d love to be contradicted by a waiter in a most rude manner, this might also be perfect for you. The food was fine, small portions, big prices, but tapas restaurants seem to be like that anyway. That is not the point. When I asked for pulpo asado (octopus) they brought fried breaded calamari. Even an elementary school kid the difference between squid and octopus. The extremely rude waiter contradicted me when I mentioned that this was not octopus, it was calamari. Octopi do not have rings!! Squid have rings and octopi have tentacles with suction cups. It was so obvious to the point of pathetic that it was funny how the man was dead set on contradicting us and in the most rude fashion. If I were the manager, which we did not contact because we didn’t want to make a scene, this guy would have been in the street right away. When I confronted him and asked him why we got calamari instead of octopus, he said “the chef knows what he’s doing thank you” and he left the table in a huff. Obviously we are not coming back nor our large groups of friends.

title: Crowded, super noisy and garlicky
text: They pack the restaurant with so many people one can hardly breathe in there. Food is very good but terribly garlicky. They also charge a lot for each mini plate they offer… using the tapas system they get you into ordering many overpriced small garlic bombs. All in all we do not go back although we live nearby as the hassle of being jammed into the noise restaurant is not worth the food.

title: not my favourite
text: Very crowded, tables really close together - music so loud that you could not talk to your partner - tried several appetizers but we were not overwhelmed. Would not go again.

title: Left in 30 minutes
text: VERY loud with tables literally about 4-6 inches apart.  You could hear everything neighboring tables were saying but very little of your partner's comments.  I like a dry white wine with Mediterranean food but none available (excluding two bubbly options). Only one vodka brand available so you are limited to cocktails (mainly rum) or beer. While we left in about 30 minutes, flat bread pizza was overcooked by had good flavors and the octopus was tough but again, had a nice flavor.  Big crowd so appears popular, but we will not go back - too many other great options out there.

title: Top Top Tapas
text: We went with some local friends who have been multiple times and it was possibly the best Tapas I have had. Amazing knowledgeable staff who could not enough to help. Food sensational. So much flavour. We loved it.

title: #1 North End Italian
text: Best Italian food I’ve ever had including Italy! Everything we had was incredible and the service was first class. I was quite worried as we couldn’t get a reservation but walked up and got there early. Will be on my list for my next Boston visit!

title: Wonderful dining experience
text: Great experience from ambience to service and food. Visited with friends and loved all of our selections: Tuna Cannoli, Halibut, Steak, and Bone Marrow. Our drinks were mixed perfectly and table service was impeccable.

title: Worst Dining Experience
text: I called ahead and was told outdoor seating is available on a first come first server basis.  Upon arrival I was greeted by a bearded gentleman in a sports coat who informed me that outdoor seating was not available for at least 30 minutes despite the fact that I could see three empty tables.  When I informed him that I would be happy to wait he told me to go ahead and leave and come back in 30 minutes and if a table is available at that time, he would let me know.  He was very condescending in his tone the entire time.  Since they were booked for seats at least 2 weeks out I decided to stay so I could experience the food.  I ordered a pasta dish and it was absolutely delicious.  The waiter was pleasant.  I plan to return back to this restaurant multiple times and leave similar feedback if I have a like-kind experience.

title: Romantic Dining
text: The food here is exceptional, all their pastas are made in house. Everyone enjoyed their meals. My only negative comment is that the restaurant is located in a historic house and the rooms are tight. The chiavari chairs were not comfortable. Next time I will opt for the outdoor seating which looked delightful.

title: Delicious and delightful
text: We dined outside in the courtyard which was delightful on a beautiful August night. Our waiter was very attentive without being intrusive. The dishes come out at a leisurely pace so don’t be in a hurry. My white was picked by my server and was spectacular. The sourdough bread was great. I lived the pasta duet starter. We both had filets which were so tender and perfectly cooked.

title: Pay a lot for OK Food
text: We’ve eaten at Mistral multiple times over the years.  If you want a nice room for a special occasion, it probably fits the bill.  But for its high prices ($98 for a 1/4 lamb rack for example and wine prices that are typically 3x retail) we expect a bit more.  Bread was excellent.  Appetizers good (tuna tartare and tomato soup); but my duck was overcooked and quite tough this time — it’s a dish I’ve had there multiple times and the last 2 it’s been sub-par.  My husband’s entree was fine but not impressive.  Profiteroles for dessert were ok, but the ice cream was only Ok, a bit icy and not very creamy.  Wines by the bottle range from expensive to ridiculous in price.  It’s a solid but not very imaginative list.  The Italian section had a good Chianti for only 2.5x retail — most wines were 3-4 times retail (and not ones they’ve been cellaring for years).  But we left disappointed for the second time and will not be returning.  Much better food available elsewhere in Boston, and if you’re willing to pay super high prices, you’ll be better satisfied somewhere like La Padrona where the prices guarantee excellent food and the wine list is far more interesting (as long as your focus that night is Italian).

title: Good food and service
text: We had dinner with a group of friends while visiting Boston this month.  The service was good and the food was even better.  Everything we had was delicious...the mussels, sole, filet, and desserts were all great.  We would eat there again on our next trip.

title: Dissapointing experience
text: The restaurant is beautifully appointed but the general feeling of our group was that the prices were way too high and that the food did not justify them. The steaks and duck were truly delicious. However the rack of lamb for $95 was ordinary and a ripoff. The waiter described “very large” rib chops but instead they presented a bare plate with 3 puny chops. They tasted fine but were ordinary. The salad was drowned in a balsamic that was so acidic that it was difficult and unpleasant to eat. It was also just a pile of lettuce thrown into a bowl with a few minute mushrooms.  I’d think carefully before trying Mistral agsin

title: Decent food but lacks flair
text: Went to Mistral after some friends recommended this restaurant. Menu is nice but the prices are insane. Not that we are “too cheap”, but $98 for lamb is a bit steep. Our appetizers and entree were average in quality but nicely prepared. Our waiter was very good however this place is very busy, loud, and has minimal flair.

title: Overpriced
text: Wasn’t impressed with this place only went in for a drink. Had two local beers and one vodka was charged $46. Couldn’t even see receipt it was so light and didn’t get a proper receipt. Sent instagram msg but didn’t get reply. Complete rip off

title: Wooden beamed authentic pub near Boston Common
text: Great atmosphere with low wood beamed ceilings creating an olde world pub feel. Lots of great beers on tap. Food is good pub grub. Not a lot of gluten free options but the loaded nachos were delicious. Our server suggested a half portion: great call!! It was huge!!

title: Best pub in Boston
text: Best bar I’ve found in Boston so far. I’m travelling for work as a solo female and may have tried a bar or two (or more) along the way. The staff here are wonderful, location is great with an outdoor sun trap. Loving the people watching and the history that surrounds the pub. Strongly recommend and thank you to the staff.

title: Nice simple place.
text: We had a table outside in this relatively quiet street. Good club sandwich and fries. Excellent salad. Nice evening with the family.

title: Date night with my Bride
text: Excellent staff and service.  Our meal was amazing.  Seafood tower blew our mind.  The GM and head Chef came over to thank us for our visit.  Great touch!!!

This lovely restaurant welcomed us with a big friendly smile and as we were shown to our table there was a beautiful hand drawn card .. made by one of the servers ,( wish I could remember her name ) with silver stars sprinkled on our table . What a welcome !!! Myself and Grandaughter   ( from the UK ) were visiting my son who is currently living and working in Boston and it was our first time in the beautiful city . He booked it as a special evening and it certainly was . The  bread basket with whipped butter was delicious … The Calamari starter was huge and so glad we shared it , my salmon and asparagus risotto was cooked perfectly.  My Grandaughter had spaghetti with clams ..first time she has had this and said it was amazing ,   my son had the a 16 oz steak .. we were so full but  I desperately wanted to try the key lime pie so we shared one portion and so glad we did , schamazing !!! as it’s so popular we got almost the last one .. it is homemade by one of the bar staff .. who makes 3 of the deserts on the menu .. it is  truly divine … we had an amazing experience there all due to the the Manager and the wonderful  server Julie .. Julie has been there 25 years and a truly outstanding waitress , they do really look after you and made our special trip to Boston  a truly memorable one. I had tears at the table when seeing all the effort they had gone to .. never have I experienced such joyful moments with lovely people working there . Thankyou  for the lovely thoughtfulness in making the card and  the warmest welcome ever !!! We will never forget you all !! 💖

title: Terrific All Around Experience!
text: Birthday celebration with myself and my best friend for her upcoming 60th!   Made the reservation online, you were asked if it was for a special occasion, and I said yes for a birthday, and there was a place for comments and I requested a table instead of a booth and when we got there, they knew exactly what we were looking for and seated us accordingly. There was also a small happy birthday sign on the table with some happy birthday confetti around the candle on in the center of the table.   The staff from the hostess to the weight staff, were all outgoing and customer oriented.    We got the Caesar salad, shared a shrimp cocktail, shared lobster mac & cheese. One of us got the ribeye, and one of us got the fillet.    Everything we had was exceptional.   The flavors were spot on, and the portions were generous. The shrimp cocktail came with four jumbo shrimp, which were truly jumbo.   After the salad and the shrimp, we managed to each eat a little bit of the mac & cheese and some of our steaks. We took the rest home for leftovers.   We also ordered a piece of carrot cake to go. The carrot cake was OK and the portion was ridiculously large. The carrot cake is the only not great part of the experience, but certainly not a showstopper.    I would certainly go again.

title: Won't go back
text: Went for my wife's birthday. The lobster bisque was excellent and that was all. The waitress talked me into getting the whole steamed lobster. The claw tips were tender but the rest tasted uncooked and like rubber. My wife did not like her shrimp and the scallops were not cooked. So much for the Birthday dinner !

title: Relax and enjoy the Palm
text: I absolutely love this restaurant! Every time I’m in Boston I make my pilgrimage to the Palm. The food is amazing and the staff is At Olympic Gold Medal level. I could eat there and know I’m in for a joyous occasion!

title: Very chic and tasty
text: A rainy day in Boston… lunch among colleagues… nice atmosphere…locals mostly and a few tourists carrying discrete shopping bags… try the chopped salad, maybe the best I had in a very long time…then some salmon… superb… a good Chablis… a cute coffee… and back to work… views are nice from there even if it’s rainy…excelent choices and a very good wine list, very attentive service and a nice location, closed to the park…

title: Eat better for half the price in little Italy
text: On the plus side, the roof top location is spectacular and the staff are very courteous and attentive but then there’s the food. I can honestly say I have never paid so much to be so underwhelmed. The food though well presented lacked the simple subtle flavours of authentic Italian food. The essence of Italian cooking is to make a few simple ingredients sing, the overall impression of our meal at the Contessa was bland, under-seasoned and definitely not singing. If the garlic and rosemary potatoes don’t taste of garlic or rosemary, there’s something wrong. We ate for half the price, with twice the flavour in little Italy

title: Brunch Review Only
text: This review is strictly about brunch. We paid $200 for two omelettes, two juices and two coffees. The service was good and the atmosphere was nice and it’s very pretty and the view are wonderful but honestly it’s breakfast. How on earth do you pay $200 for eggs? And the sides come out massive like you are at a steakhouse and a little overdone. We are staying in the hotel and it is a very nice place but I don’t think we would eat there again.

title: Wonderful dining experience!
text: My husband and I dined at Contessa during a recent weekend in Boston. We stayed in the Newbury, so it was very convenient. We were seated next to a window where we had an amazing city view. Their butternut squash carpaccio was one of the best dishes I ever had. I enjoyed it so much that I failed to take a photo! My branzino was also very good and my husband enjoyed his lobster pasta. Overall, it was a fabulous dining experience!

title: Perfect !
text: One of the most beautiful restaurants I’ve been to. Perfect rooftop location and great atmosphere.. Drinks and food were outstanding. This was my favorite dining experience on my trip to Boston. I will definitely be back.

title: Delicious Pasta and Great Atmosphere”
text: Had a lovely dinner at Grotto during our time in Boston. We had the chicken parmigiana pasta and the pasta bolognese — both were full of flavor and really satisfying. The atmosphere was warm and welcoming, the service was friendly, and prices felt fair for the quality. A great little spot for a relaxed Italian dinner.

title: Dining experience out the window
text: I was in the restaurant industry for a decade bw 2000-2010.  It was all about customer service, timing the meals properly and the dining experience. I was front and back of the house. I let it slide that this place did all bottled cocktails??  Bc I was so excited to see my friend. But no bar to make a proper drink-noted. Then upon arrival…..we were notified that there was a reservation 1.5 hours later so essentially “don’t hurry but hurry up.”  Slightly off putting but We agreed and got back to our bottled Negronis. Then not even 10 minutes later, another staff member came by and asked if we made any decisions. We hadn’t yet. She then told us “we just want to make sure we’re on the same page that there are people coming at 7:30.”  That was it. Bill please?  We were done. Timing tables is a bogus thing that happened in the hospitality industry. Until these folks figure out how to manage it better?  Don’t bother.

title: Worth a try
text: We needed a last minute reservation for a larger party and there was not much available in the North End so we decided to try this place on Beacon Hill. It's in a basement so don't be surprised when you arrive. I had the scallops and they were very good.  The rest of my party enjoyed their food as well. While efficient, the staff was not very helpful or friendly.  We asked for a couple of suggestions in regards to the food and did not really receive much input. A bit more of a welcome would have put a much better spin on this place for us.  It's worth a try though as food was good.

title: Check your bill!!
text: Food was good. Service was not. I was overcharged. And it took stuff forever to make an adjustment. After 20 mins of waiting they brought exactly the same bill. Hoping I won’t notice??? Finally after another 10 mins it was corrected.

title: Best Bolognese Pasta Dish
text: Best bolognese dish I have ever had. My young son and I were able to get a table on a Sunday night without reservations. Even though I visited the Italian North End several times Grotto on Beacon Hill was the best restaurant of the trip. It is small and quaint.

title: Delicious and easily accommodates dietary restrictions
text: Very good food, wine and service.  Staff was happy to make accommodation for vegetarian and vegan choices.  Highly recommend the tuna crudo, blood orange and arugula salad, gnocchi, strozzapreti, lumache, risotto and peach sorbetto

title: One of Boston's best!
text: We love this spot, and always feel lucky when we can get in. Everything is superb, from drinks, to service, to desserts. GET THE DESSERTS!!! What?! They're only like $5! Get all of them! ALL OF THEM! Soooo good! Why are they only $5?! What costs $5 these days?! Anyway... this is a special place with exquisite food, and we are so lucky to have it in Boston! "Counter seating" is sub-optimal, I will say. (We do love watching the faces of all those being led there. You've never seen a smile deflate so fast.) So hold out for a real table or a seat at the bar. Both will be worth the wait!

title: Decadent Italian small dishes
text: The menu is full of very well prepared Italian plates for sharing.   Dishes were a hit and served hot out of the kitchen - the polpette meatballs were savory and flavorful, and we loved the polenta, squash, clams, gnocchi, bucatini and balanzoni.   Perhaps the rigatoni was the only unimpressive dish we would pass on next time.   The tiramisu is decadent and enough to share across 4-6 people!   Tart cherry sorbetto was a serious treat!!   Our server was welcoming and attentive, very familiar with the menu and recommended an excellent wine.  They do tack on 3% kitchen admin - not to say the kitchen was any less than superb, but we are beyond unusual circumstances of Covid.   Consumers prefer simplicity and transparency and it would come off well to price the menu as you need to.

title: Venetian Italian Small Plates
text: We were a party of 8 and did the special tasting menu for $65 pp. I don’t eat beef or duck so a few of the dishes were not for me but the group overall enjoyed most of the plates. Many items were off menu, but not all. We started with beet arancini (yum!), then a liver mousse ball, meatballs (the most traditional Italian of the dishes), followed by rainbow carrots over ricotta with sugared ginger, bacalao on toast, tuna crudo (our least favorite), clams with grilled bread, two pasta dishes and a panacotta, fig, peach tuile dessert! Yes, that’s more than 8 but we got an extra dish or two ! The service was very nice and the restaurant is great looking. Very special meal

title: Good but garlic everywhere
text: The food and the service are good. But so much garlic everywhere…drinks were also good. I would go back but not my first choice.

title: Busy, delicious to-go options in the heart of downtown Philly
text: Crowded and bustling, between the tight fits amid the narrow aisles, you can find some amazing greasy-spoon lunch options frequented by tourists and locals alike.  There are several great options for cheesesteak and various Asian fare.  Best to get anything to-go, though, because tables are hard to come by and packed in tightly together where they do exist.

title: It was walking into a ToysRus store
text: I had read many reviews online and asked staff at my hotel all the food market. It was a 10-15 walk from my hotel and walking to the Reading Terminal Market was like walking into a toy store and not knowing what toy you want buy first.  There was so much  choices  of food available.  After walking round the market for around 10 minutes looking to see what I fancied I eventually chose a vender and had my first Philly cheesesteak.  Delicious, will defo go back again before I leave. Must do place for a visit.

title: More cities should have a Reading Terminal with its excellent regional food choices and great prices
text: I love coming to the Reading Terminal Market with the great selection of food stalls and the sights and smells as you walk around. I love their selections and the interaction between the locals and tourists when people are ordering.   Some of my favorite places to eat in Philly are here with Dutch Eating Place, Beilers Bakery and Bassetts Ice Cream. When Carmine’s was open, that used to be my favorite place for Cheesesteaks. After a meal, I like to walk around and look at the food displays. Everyone merchandises their food so nicely.  Don’t miss a visit here when you are visiting Philly.

title: Definitely recommend
text: Stop here when visiting Philly. Large variety of foods to choose from. Plenty of shop to look for souvenirs. Definitely with visiting especially if it’s your first time visiting.

title: Def worth a visit!
text: Well if you can’t find some food here, there is something wrong with you. All the local stuff you would expect plus bundles of ice cream, fresh meats and cheeses, and chocolate.  Well worth an hour of your time.

title: Harding Presidential Sites
text: We had a great visit to the Warren G Harding Presidential Library and Memorial. The Library (aka Museum) is quite small compared to other presidential libraries, but does a good job telling the story of Harding's short presidency. Tours of his home are only offered on the hour, so we had to miss that, but did take photos from the outside. We also visited the Harding Memorial in the cemetery, which was quite impressive. If you're passing by Marion, Ohio, take a break from your drive and stop by to see the presidential sites.

title: We watched a short film at the museum prior to the tour
text: Our guide was Theodore, he did an excellent job sharing his knowledge of Warren Harding and Florence- marriage, campaign and presidency. The tour started on the porch where his Porch Campaign took place. The house furnishings are over 90% original. NO Pictures allowed which is sad for my personal journey ablum. The museum has nice exhibits with a couple audios. Enjoyed watching the pictures taken on the Voyage of Understanding tour to the western states and Alaska. Purchase tickets on-line because we were shocked how the first 3 tours were fully booked. We changed our itinerary to make a late afternoon tour. Large parking lot. Restrooms on site.

title: Museum and House Tour Make this a fun Visit
text: A visit to this presidential library comprises three potential activities.  First, there is an hour long tour of his house.  Second, the main building includes a small exhibition of his time as President.  Lastly, a mile from the library is his memorial.  We spent just under two hours here.

title: Learning at the Warren G. Harding Presidential Sites
text: Great trip. We arrived at approximately 9:30 am and made our way towards the entrance of the museum. After paying the admission fee, we received a quick overview of the site and went on our way. We opted to view some of the outdoor exhibits first, which included the guard house and press house. The press house contained multiple informational plaques about President Hardings wife and her contributions to society. After viewing the press house, we made our way to the front porch of the house, where we waited for the 10 am guided hour tour to begin. There were guided tours of the presidents former house being held every hour throughout the day. The guided tour of the house was very informational, and the tour guide took us from room to room, while pointing out interesting features and artifacts out for display. The tour guide told us several personal stories related to the Hardings time at the house. The guided tour lasted roughly 1 hour.  After viewing the house, we went back inside to view the main exhibits. We opted to watch a short documentary about President Hardings life and some of the trials and tribulations he faced during his time as President. There were multiple informational plaques out for display, many of them quite text heavy, that went into detail about Hardings upbringing and roots as the owner of a newspaper company in Marion. The plaques also talked about election day, and several of the policy’s Harding implemented while in office. The last section of the museum dealt with his death and some controversial issues that surrounded his presidency. There were multiple artifacts out for display in the museum, along with short video clips that related to President Harding's time in office.  Tip: I recommend spending 3 hours here if you truly want to see everything.

title: Worth the visit!!!
text: I was very impressed with the Warren G. Harding Presidential Sites.  We took the tour of his house, and listened first hand from the tour guides all about when Harding gave speeches on the "front porch".  The house is stunning and is 90+ percent original from years ago when Warren and his wife Florence lived in the house.  The tour guides can answer any questions you have off the top of their heads.  The  Library & Museum was finished in the spring of 2021 and they have a nice gift shop in there too.  They spared no expense in the construction of the building - it is beautiful!!!!  If you are a history buff, this is a must do.

title: Overrated
text: Everything was edible. But thats about it. Scant hollandaise on the eggs benedict, ham costs extra. Salads were drowning in dressing. Just, not overall impressed. Vegetarian friendly but bit more limited if vegan.

title: Waiter
text: Jake was a fantastic waiter.  We usually look forward to George.  In this case Jake was a pleasant replacement.  Food always excellent.  We have been coming here since Fare opened.  A fantastic neighborhood restaurant.  A must “give it a try”.

title: Skip it. Touristy and overpriced
text: I’ve been walking past it for a few years and my sister wished to try it on her birthday. Dirty martini was made with black olives. Huh? And for $15! Sent that back. Flatbread was room temperature. Sent that back. What I won’t do is go back. Save your $$ and go elsewhere.

title: Delicious food served cold….
text: Fare is a cool restaurant with some pretty awesome food.  Only problem is that I’ve been there twice and both times my entrée was served cold.  I just don’t understand how a restaurant could do that.  Don’t they have a person to ensure meals are hot and immediately served when prepared?  Fix that, and you get a 5 from me!

title: Wouldn’t recommend
text: I went to FARE with my sisters for the first time ; I was excited to try the food ! The customer service was TRASH and the food wasn’t that good either ! We literally waited for the check for 20mins . The server was really rude ! I had to say it twice

title: Outstanding Place for Breakfast/Brunch
text: The Dutch has changed a bit since some of these pictures.  It has upgraded the atmosphere, and the food continues to be outstanding. The wait staff is fast, friendly and efficient.  We had a egg white omelet and 3-Egg breakfast.  I recommend the sausage; its some of the best I've have had in a while (but spicy).   Great local place, quiet and good for talking.

title: Stick to the ribs brunch but inconsistent
text: Came here for weekend brunch.  Right in the heart of east passyunk, it’s a popular place. Its theme is Amish influence which is nice for brunch.  On the one hand. My Amish bologna eggs Benedict with cream chip beef and was super yummy and our lattes were perfect.  But my wife’s Avacado toast was really too basic for the price.  Also the service felt young and untrained and very inconsistent.  So we drop a star for that inconsistency.

title: Day in Philly
text: Interesting little place in the heart of South Philly. we went with several very different items, The Veggie Dutch, the Lebanese Salami and cream chesse omelet, and the truffle mushroom omelet.  All was good and different and will come back to try the great looking pancakes! Service was a little slow as it is a small place and two front staff members. The bar out front takes a lot of space , if it was nice out, we would have sat in the outside space out front.

title: Casual and Comfortable
text: I love a spot where I can day drink with a glass of spritz or some equally light and lovely cocktail. This is a comforting neighborhood spot, serving nice sized portions of simple food using very good ingredients (the roasted mushroom omelet is super). Service is attentive without being obnoxious or overbearing and the guests range from families with toddlers to older couples to work colleagues enjoying a break together.  Would happily take anyone there for a good meal and the pleasant atmosphere

title: Dinner at The Dutch
text: Since The Dutch moved closer to my home I was eagerly anticipating a meal in this wonderful location. And I was not disappointed in the least. Nor was my ever crankier partner, who has narrowed his range of acceptable food choices to only a few items; which makes dining out a bit tricky. This is a well done nicely thought out casual menu served up in a light filled corner location with lots of windows, perfect for people watching.   For dinner, our party of four started with 3 appetizers, charred shishito peppers, some truffled Parmesan fries and small bowl of pickled vegetables. All were perfect finger food bites to go along with some really stellar cocktails- loved the Singing Fountain. For entrees, a double cheeseburger proclaimed excellent., a generous entree sized Cobb salad, zucchini spaghetti primavera, a light offering of summers best veggies and a chicken gravy - a sort of savory Dutch baby with egg sauce etc. Two desserts of a blueberry tart and some malted milk ice cream with homemade peanut brittle,  completed  the evening along with some delicious coffee and espresso.  For dinner, with moderate drinking and three courses  I would figure on spending $60 -75 per person with tax and tip. Though it would be quite easy to have a lovely meal here for half that price.   We are all looking forward to our next visit for breakfast/lunch.

title: Enjoyable stay with incredible views!
text: My husband and I stayed for three nights, and found this property to be in an excellent location to explore surrounding areas of Tasmania. We enjoyed waking up to the views and the quietness; we had a very relaxing stay! Hosts were friendly and helpful.   Room is clean, with a comfortable bed, modern bathroom and ample breakfast provisions included.   Our only feedback would be for ‘daytime’ curtains to be installed, to allow guests to enjoy the amazing views with privacy, and also we found we could hear lots of noise from the adjoining room.   Overall a thoroughly enjoyable stay and we would highly recommend!

title: A Great place to stay!
text: Arjuna Ridge is a beautiful place to stay close to Hobart. Luxury accommodation in peaceful rural surroundings. Close to The Bruny Island ferry , there are also many gourmet dining opportunities close by .

title: Quiet retreat.
text: Stayed a couple nights. View is very good and the couple of goats and three wadling ducks were happy to say hello in the paddock below. Some yummy local chocolates and apples provided were great. Was very nice to sit outside on table having a few wines and antipasto watching the sun go down. Quite modern open plan style. Bed wasn't the best but ok, probably just me. Host was very unobtrusive but still stuck in fresh provisions for breaky. Nice spot to just chill and short trip to the ferry for Bruny Island.

title: 1 night was not long enough!
text: A beautiful little place in a  magic location!  Quality accommodation and a wonderful host.  Generous breakfast provisions. Clean and well presented.  Central to Kettering and Bruny Island.  Couldn't ask for more.

title: Peace in the Hills
text: A lovely place to stay for anyone wanting complete peace and tranquility. The rabbits and wallabies at dawn and dusk added to the feeling of being well away from civilisation while Kettering was just down the hill.

title: Good place for wings
text: This is for the location on Beechmont ave. It’s been a few years since I’ve been to this location. We were there on a Saturday evening and it didn’t appear to be really busy, but steady. Our order of  wings were hot and done just right as were the onion rings. They had plenty of help and our waitress was attentive at the right times. So we had a really good experience. My only knock is this, it’s rather noisy to the point of making conversation a little tough.

title: Best Chain Wing Restaurant
text: Always satisfied with the wings!! Always fresh, never dry, and plenty of sauce!! Custom service is also a 5 star.

title: They have great blue cheese!
text: I am not a boneless wing person but the boneless wings here arenot a heavy breaded chicken nugget! They have a wide variety of sauces and flavors. Another one of my favorite things is the cauliflower wing!

title: My favorite wings
text: We’ve never eaten in the restaurant , normally we get our food to go. We were seated quickly and there seemed to be plenty of help. They took our drink order and then our order. Our food came out reasonably quick considering how busy they were. We were there Saturday early evening, all college football on all the screens. All in all I would definitely come back again. If there’s a drawback for me is how noisy it is, but I anticipated this and I’m not dinging the place for this.

title: Awesome Buffalo Chicken nachos
text: First visit and definitely not the last. We never went here because our thinking was it was just like all the other wings chains with a similar name. WRONG. We like this place. It will be a regular place for us. The nachos were so good - with real chicken. My husband got a burger. He is very picky about burgers but said he liked it and would order again. We sat at the bar and had a good time talking with Sarah. She made our visit fun.

title: GREAT DAME OF BROAD STREET
text: This restaurant was our go-to for Thanksgiving, prior to the pandemic. Every year, we would come for the luscious all-you-can-eat buffet. This year, we returned & it was great to be back! As always, the food was outstanding. (This year, they even had a duo that provided live instrumental music.)   We did encounter an issue with seating. We asked to be moved to a different room & our request was denied. A screaming baby kept us from fully enjoying the experience.

title: A bit of a disappointment
text: Having been recommended this as a treat for brunch we were looking forward to our visit.  Aware that most hotel lifts need a card to make them work we asked at the front desk and they just told us to go up to the 19th floor.  We went up as far as the 14th where a customer got in the lift and we started to descend again.  Luckily this customer used their room key to press for the 19th and once everyone got out in the lobby we went back up again.   The young lady serving was very polite and friendly but was on her own and the two people who were behind the desk did not attempt to help her.   We ordered starters and a main and after a half hour wait all the food came out together.  The main was warm but not hot as was the starter the toast had been hot at some point but was definitely cold by the time it got to us.   Having said all that the restaurant looked stunning, the food when it finally arrived although a little cold tasted good and the price was not unreasonable it’s just a shame that the customer experience was not what we would have expected

title: Wonderful Happy Hour at Bellevue!
text: Very elegant setting with welcoming and attentive servers.  The happy hour wine, crispy Brussel sprout medley, Parmesan truffle fries were all delicious!  Background music streaming from Spotify - various artists "Summer Barbeque"  was so much fun families of multiple generations felt compelled to jive along !  Please view the submitted photos that capture the essence of the lovely XIX BAR LOUNGE.

title: Lounge Has It All
text: Nicely crafted and creative drinks, delicious food served up in a historic and beautiful setting, with stellar views over the city. I enjoyed their cheeseburger as well as several other items during our stay at the Bellevue; all were excellent. They offer a sweet happy hour which includes some drinks and some food. The service is impeccable, but also very welcoming and friendly. I enjoyed the drinks, food and ambience so much, I kept going back; it was that great.

title: Pleasant place for drinks and dessert
text: During our stay, we stopped by the XIX lounge for drinks and dessert.  My wife and I were each treated to a generous pour of a good chardonnay, which had just a bit of residual sweetness.  We also shared a portion of the chocolate mousse, which was very satisfying.  Prices are a little on the high side, but that's to be expected when you're in a classy location like the Bellevue.

title: Excellent Tapas Spot
text: Was excited to see this tapas place near our hotel, especially as my colleagues had never tried tapas before. The standards (patatas bravas, pan con tomate, croquettes) were all great. The pork belly was so good we ordered it twice. Would come back again for sure.

title: How to ruin a great meal with bogus charges...
text: Let me explain my 2-star ratings by listing the pros and cons of my experience. I dined here with my girlfriend for our anniversary and it was a mixed experience for sure.  Pros: the food and service (by Katie) were 5-star as both were excellent, some of the best tapas I've ever had. The entire 5-course meal was excellent.  Cons: 1) If you're going to order the 5-course or chef's tasting menu DO NOT make a later reservation. We came in at 8:30, ordered the 5-course option and by our 2nd course we were the only table left and the staff was cleaning up around us making us feel very uncomfortable, like we were holding them up from closing. 2) Review your bill VERY carefully because there will be odd charges on it. First off, we were charged $70 for a bottle of wine listed for $65 on the menu. Secondly, we were charged a $13 "beverage tax" on the alcohol. When I said to the manager, "so between the sales tax and the beverage tax, you're taxing us twice on the alcohol, right?" He replied "yes". The Phila. beverage tax is intended to sweetened drinks like soda, energy drinks, etc. and is NOT intended for alcohol. We dine in Phila all the time and we've NEVER been charged such a silly charge. We were also charged $8 for using a credit card (which was already on the bill before we even paid). What if we paid with cash? When I told the manager that it's illegal to charge a fee for using a debit card and showed him proof on my phone, he merely looked at me. So we basically paid an extra $25 for nonsense after dropping $250 there.   Will we go back? No we won't. As I said the meal and service were fantastic but feeling rushed when you've ordered a multi-course meal and then being nickel-and-dimed with illegal charges basically ruined an excellent meal and our anniversary dinner. This is especially disappointing given that this is a Townsend Wentz restaurant.

title: Beware of charges on your bill...
text: First off, the food was amazing and the service fantastic which makes the rest such a shame.  1. If you make an 8:30 reservation DO NOT choose the 5 course option or chefs choice. You will not have time to fully enjoy the experience.  We weren't even at desert when the place was empty and everyone was cleaning up around us and the bartender left. The music got louder and we were told that if we were uncomfortable we could wrap up the final courses to go. If at the end you still plan going. Keep your choices Ala carte and not so many. 2. We get the bill. Now like most trusting people who aren't expecting to get ripped off we would have just paid but because our server forgot to add our bottle of wine (no problem, these things happen) I decided to look at the check to make sure the rest was right. First thing I see is the beverage tax. In Philly the beverage tax is applied to sweet drinks and energy drinks NOT alcoholic drinks. We did not have what the tax is intended for. We were also charged an $8 credit card fee. With this one-how did they know I'd use a charge card? What if I paid with cash. That aside I did use a DEBIT card. A debit card is the same as cash and cannot be charged a fee. We even googled these things when speaking to the manager to say hey, we're not making this up! When you say to a manager "you're taxing us twice for the bottle of wine?" and he says "YES", there's a problem.  He even removed the beverage tax. (The manager was great and unless the owner would prefer he lied and look stupid,  he did his job) at this point I wasn't going to argue the credit card charge, though he was aware that it was wrong, these people don't make the big money and wanted to go home. This is a Townsend Wentz restaurant. We have eaten at Townsend as well as Amano. We couldn't recall if these charges were applied there in the underhanded way they were applied here but again, we're people who trust and don't expect to get ripped off. I'm thinking the owners are putting their bets on that. Honestly, of the many, many restaurants we have dined at in Philly, this was a first. My son-in-law is a chef and restaurant owner. He'd never risk his reputation by putting a beverage tax on alcohol served or charge the customer $8 for the use of a debit card (let alone put it on the bill before knowing how the customer is paying).  Yes, the food and service was fantastic, so if you're ok with $25 in taxes-the majority of which should NOT be charged-and the knowledge you're being taken advantage of...Townsend Wentz will give you that.

title: Flavor party in every bite
text: One of the best restaurants ever! If you enjoy flavor and creativity and great service, this place hits all the marks! The chefs choice tasting menu was fantastic!

title: So so experience
text: Flavors are nice. Rations sizes  are tiny.  Octopus overcook and cold  Nice atmosphere in a snail place  You shall book your visit

title: Reminiscing
text: I was stationed in Berlin in the 80's and this was my favorite watering hole. At the time it was called the Old Dublin ran by a great friend named Klaus. Sorry to hear it's closed. One of the things I loved was the shelf above the bar had coins from all over the world plastered on with Guinness foam, never believed it til a buddy stuck a 5 mark piece up there! A little slice of the old world, apparently gone forever. I had to put a date, my last visit was actually in 1989.

title: Kings Pub closed
text: Kings Pub is no longer there, closed to make way for hotel and flats, very disappointing. Visited numerous times over the years, so sad to see it has gone.

title: Intrigued after reading the reviews....
text: We were looking for a small pub not a modern, chain type place and found it! The reviews pretty much slated a barmaid but we found them very attentive and friendly especially the dark haired lady. Yes 80's music is playing but it's a fun trip down memory lane as we heard a lot of music we haven't heard for years. If I am ever in Berlin again then I would definitely visit the King's Pub again. Try it x

title: Great little find
text: Great little bar tucked away behind shops but sign posted well 70s 80s music very friendly bar maid .great night and right next to our hotel. Would definitely recommend

title: Little hidden gem...
text: When I visit Berlin, I always have a beer or three in this little bar tucked away between shops. First time I came, it was packed, playing 80's music. Several times since and the bar staff have always been friendly and chatty. Great atmosphere and nice and small.

title: Do not go here
text: They are so unfriendly and so stuck on themselves. We could not get out of our RV spot because the way they did the roads and they’re blaming us because we drove over the grass. We have a 45 foot coach and that’s the spot they put us in where we could not get out. The woman came out yelling at us screaming so unprofessional. There’s a kind way to handle things and there is a bad way to handle things and this woman handle things extremely poorly. They have all these rules here and I am so unhappy with this park I would keep going. There’s other nice parks in the Durango area.

title: Terrible experience at expensive and over-hyped restaurant
text: One of our worst dining experiences ever. This fancy speakeasy has no name on the door, just a gold plaque with a rose on it. You have to ring the doorbell when you arrive and a secret panel opens in the door for the host to speak through. I found it on a list of “cozy and romantic” restaurants with great reviews. It is very dark, with bookshelves, and mismatched vintage plates (which fit the décor I guess, but I would have expected something more minimal.   It is very popular and by the time we made a reservation (on a Thursday night), the only available time was 8:45pm. This was already late for our preference, but we thought we’d try it since everyone raved about it. We arrived early at 8:30pm to see if our table was ready. They said it was not, and the people currently seated had just ordered dessert. They recommended we get a drink nearby and they would text us when the table was ready. We waited at our hotel lobby around the corner, thinking it wouldn’t be that long. We received a text at 9:06pm that said “Your table is now ready at Alpen Rose!” When we arrived a few minutes later, we rang the bell again, only for them to tell us it was still NOT ready. There was a rowdy party of 5 guys also at the door that were taken in before us.   It was almost 9:30pm by the time we were seated. Starving, we ordered oysters Rockefeller. Being so late we asked if we could put in our entrée orders but was told that “the chef likes to course it out”. We were surprised by (who we assumed was) a manager bringing us a complimentary appetizer of tuna carpaccio, however I do not eat raw fish. She left with it and came back to ask if we would like shrimp cocktail instead (which my husband is allergic to). We imagine they were trying to make up for being late, but never asked our preference. She finally brought out a wedge salad, like it or not (which was good, even though I don’t eat bacon).   It was very noisy and we were right on top of the people on either side of us – not romantic at all (the space is very small, seating maybe 40 people). The only good thing were the drinks (we had No. 3 and 21). Vegetables and starch sides do not come with the main dish, you must buy them separately (the asparagus was large but tender and tasty). I ordered the branzino, which she said would have some bones but were large and in almost every bite. We were shocked that my husband’s $56 filet was so tough it was hard to cut! Two small dessert bites showed up at the end of the meal, but they did not make up for the poor performance at this price point.   We were seated next to the noisy guys who came before us, so in the end we tried to make the best of it, joking and trading photos with them and being entertained by their drinks covered with smoke, massive Tomahawk cavemen bone steaks, and flaming baked Alaska with a sparkler. Maybe at 50 we are older than the typical crowd, and now we know not to make a reservation that late (especially when the times are not honored), but a pricey establishment like this should know better how to space out their reservations. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone, even given the hype.

title: There are much better choices for a 300 meal.
text: First time here, won’t be back. Dry aged is the house specialty and they didn’t get it right. I ordered the dry aged rib eye medium rare. First time out, the meat was a true medium. With appropriate apologies, they cooked another. This came out a true medium rare. However, there was so much char on the meat, I could not taste the subtle taste of a $78 piece of meat. Okay, not happy, but we wouldn’t come back. We were offered a free dessert. Now, at the table adjacent to us, the couple ordered a filet medium rare. Theirs too came out grey. And, like ours, the char was so heavy they said it over-powered the taste of the meat. Finally, our complimentary dessert. It’s prime peach time and they had warm peach pie with ice cream. It had a huge puff pastry crust that had no flavor. And worse, the peach cubes were cold, hard and tasteless. In the middle of peach season. Top all this off with tables so close together that when the server was pouring our neighbors wine, their ass was right in my face. Literally, right there. The only redeeming feature was the cocktails and whisky list. This was our third try of restaurants in this chain. Thy Mary and Pearl Oyster House was okay, but The Oyster House is much better. The Giusseppe restaurant was average; Villa Di Roma is a better choice. And Barkley Prime far outshines Alpen Rose.

title: Cannot wait to come back
text: Fabulous !! It was wonderful ! 2 couples - started with the seafood tower ! Perfection - but so do not miss the bone marrow toast - we each had a little something different - cannot wait to come back !!!!

title: Ambience the best - Food subpar
text: Ate there last night. Great ambience and decor but one of the worst steakhouses I’ve been to as far as food goes. Got a NY strip Pittsburgh medium rare, it was about an inch thick if that and very tough to cut. The creamed spinach side dish was served in what looked like a coffee cup - very small portion. Been to all the steakhouses often. The food here just doesn’t compare to any of them. Sorry.

title: Dinner in Philadelphia, PA
text: Came here for dinner Saturday night—had reservations so we were seated right away.  Cute small restaurant.  The bar area seems pretty energetic but we sat in the dining area.  Started off with Half Dozen Pink Moon Raw Oysters—so delicious!  Also tried the Roasted Oysters which were overloaded with breadcrumbs I could barely taste the oyster underneath—also has a spicy kick to it as well!  For entrees, we tried to Bucatini Cacio E Pepe and Mafaldine Alla Vodka—both pasta dishes were generous portions and overall were pretty good!  No issues with our cocktails and service was great.

title: Beyond Great Experience Wilder Philadelphia!
text: 2/26/25 Year End Celebration work lunch in semi-private space upstairs. Exceeded our expectations on all fronts! Food, staff, service, beautiful space. Worked closely with Brett who owns Wilder with his partner Nicole. I let Brett know that is was wonderful and we cannot wait to return for another work event and to bring family and friends.  Thanks for everything Brett!

title: Fun, relaxing, and pleasant. This is a great place to dine with your wife, family, or friends. It has a great ambiance feel to i
text: Me and my wife loved everything about this restaurant from the atmosphere,service, and the dishes. My wife ordered calamari, which was cooked to perfection. I ordered a cocktail called the South Philly, and it was really refreshing. we also ordered their pull apart rolls with softened butter it was warm and soft. And for the main course, we ordered a couple of their seafood dishes

title: Perfect Spot in Rittenhouse SQ
text: Food was exceptional. Staying in Center City / Rittenhouse SQ and Google Best Restaurants near me turns up lots of options. This place did not disappoint. Fig & Ricotta salad plus their Rotolo pasta dish were just right. Certainly give them a try. Had no reservation, I just sat at a bar side table, it was a Sunday however.

title: What a disappointment; they missed the mark on nearly everything.
text: We really wanted to like this place.  We live nearby but have never been.  We made a res for 1:45 (late for brunch). The place was 1/2 empty but we were seated at a table for 2 at a banquette squeezed between 2 noisy groups and very close to the front door which brought in icy air.  I looked at a long expanse of empty tables and asked if we could sit over there and was told no; they were expecting a big party.  Note:  the big party arrived one hour later when we were ready to leave.  Also 2 other couples arrived and were seated in the forbidden zone. Okay that was #1.  Then no wait person showed up for a longish period of time: #2: no water; no welcome.  Menu was okay.  We both ordered a different version of a salad with grilled salmon. Mine included a poached egg. #3 poached egg arrived hard boiled. I asked for a replacement t and they did bring me a softly poached, runny egg.  We waited a ridiculous amount of time for someone to refill our iced tea. #4: food was mediocre.  Edible but no where near the quality anticipated based on the prices.  I do not recommend this place and would not go back.  Plenty of far better places a short walk away.

title: Very good food, service
text: My husband and I made a last minute reservation. The only option on the app was outdoor seating. When we got there, outdoor seating looked comfortable even on a chilly fall evening but we were surprised to be offered the option of indoor seating which we accepted. The food was excellent, arrived quickly, and the service was very good. I also appreciated that the noise level wasn't bad. We'll gladly come back next time we're in town.

title: Cozy restaurant near Washington Square.
text: We were in town to celebrate my wife's birthday. We tried this restaurant on a recommendation from my boss. The food was delicious. I had the Branzino and Broccoli, my wife had the Roasted Chicken and Gnocchi. We shared the the Chocolate Pudding cake which was delicious also. My wife really like the bread plates on each table. Each plate was different from the next and look like someone went searching thru some antique shops to pick them out. We ate inside because it was a little to windy to try the patio but it looked really and cozy.

title: Best roasted potatos ever!
text: Beautiful place. Went for brunch. Food was great although my eggs could have been warmer. Service was good and friendly but as the place filled up—our reservation was at opening time—our waitress disappeared. However, really enjoyed it and would visit again.

title: Farm to Table Excellence
text: Perhaps the best meal I had in Philadelphia. Very large restaurant with big patio and several inside dining areas plus a large bar. Well appointed and elegant but still warm and welcoming atmosphere. We enjoyed a meal of roasted cauliflower with coconut curry, garbanzo beans and quinoa. Along with lamb bolognese Pappardelle with whipped ricotta. Their chive and cheddar biscuits are to die for.  Wine options are well chosen and multiple by the glass offerings

title: One of our favorite spots in Philly!
text: We live 50 miles from Philly. We were going to be in town for a show at the Walnut Street Theatre, celebrating our anniversary. I made reservations at Talula's Garden due to it's proximity to the theater. I believe this was our third or fourth time dining there. I had the Roasted Chicken with Gnocchi and my wife had the Handmade Ricotta Ravioli. To say they were both good would be an understatement. My wife usually never finishes her entree (she did), and it was the absolute best chicken I have ever eaten (anywhere). The only thing that would have made it any better would have been a nice piece of crusty bread to lap up the sauce, as licking the plate would have probably been in bad taste! Outstanding experience from start to finish.

title: DISGUSTING 🤢
text: DISGUSTING. The baked chicken smelled ROTTEN, rotten as in the meat went bad. Mac and cheese was VERY over seasoned, mashed potatoes were INSTANT potatoes. Just gross

title: Note worth the stop anymore.
text: This place has gone down hill since new ownership took over.  Chicken had been on the steam table until it dried out.  Peach cobbler sat empty the entire time we were there. Desserts by the salad bar we not as good as the old days. So sad.   We won't be back.

title: Great food!
text: Great home Cookin’ cheese grits amazing, great fried catfish with well seasoned cocktail sauce. Cabbage n beans were just like momma makes. Ty Callie for the great service!

title: Over priced for quality of food raw chicken,  shells in eggs rice not cooked.  All you could taste was SALT. JUST NASTY!
text: Will bypass this place! If this is country cooking  the closest thing they had going for them was the salt even that was too much. FYI FLYS

title: Good Neighborhoody Southern Buffet
text: The food was decent and the service staff was kind.  There's a lot of variety, it is a true southern buffet.  They even had chicken livers and gizzards!  I ate the fried chicken (good), the fried catfish (very good), and the mashed potatoes (not much flavor).  For dessert, I had some bread pudding and peach cobber which were both okay.  The salad wasn't that fresh though the sides were very good.    I'd eat here again if I'm in town.  I was especially pleased that they'd opened at 10 AM with the hotel checkout being 11.

title: Best dinner I ever had !!
text: I had the best dinner I ever had. The filet mignon was tender, cooked to perfection, and seasoned perfectly. The Greek salad dressing was amazing. The lemon ricotta cake awesome. Can't rave enough.

title: Romantic dinner
text: Wonderful dinner and service.  The lamb chops were delicious and the presentation was wonderful. Great wine selection!

title: Worth the Splurge
text: Marianna has almost no truly “good” choices for eating out. The Salt Block is a gift to this whole area of cheap eats and fried foods. The steaks are pricey but AMAZING-the restaurant is modest but clean. I am grateful for this restaurant and what they provide.

title: Skip the Dinner and Just have Dessert and Coffee
text: Sister and I went for dinner.  She ordered veal and I ordered the scallop and pasta special.  Her veal and potatoes were very good but the "vegetable medley" was a pile of mushy vegs. The best thing that could be said about my dish were the two blistered cherry tomatoes were tasty.  The bead size scallops were rubbery, the small amt of sauce was incredibly bland, and the dish was dry. The side garden salads were very nice size, fresh and good.  The salted caramel cheesecake was amazing and strangely enough, the decaf coffee  was truly terrific.  However, a $97 meal (we ordered no alcohol) with mushy vegetables and a non-edible entree was a big disappointment.  The reason I did not send back my entree was that it took 45 minutes for our meal to arrive.  There were 3 servers and 9 tables, so that was not the issue.

title: Good food but disappointing experience overall
text: 3 stars only because the food was good, otherwise an extremely disappointing dinner. Warning - Diner beware! The menu is exactly what you get, there are no options & there are no substitutions. Limited menu's are not a problem but I have found most restaurants offer at least a choice of vegetable & some bread & or side salad as part of the overall meal. Not this one. The night we were there, dinner came with garlic mashed potatoes & vegetable medley, no other options, no substitutions no exceptions. If you dislike something, like say, garlic or green beans too darned bad. I had the chicken Garcia, my partner had the 16 oz ribeye and a side salad, we both drank water. When the bill came we were shocked! Our meal came to almost $95! My chicken was $24, the side salad was $5, My partner's ribeye was $59!  Yes, it was listed as MP(Market Price), which means the price varies with the cost of the ingredients but really? I know the high price wasn't in the mashed potatoes or vegetable medley or my chicken dinner would have cost more so it must have been the steak.  It was tasty but it was not $59 worth of tasty. The staff, while friendly, were well versed in "we don't do that here".  We will not be going back.

title: Delicious
text: My Swai fish sandwich was delicious and our server was amazing. She made some great suggestions as she knew I had no clue what to order.  She even had us sign the wall.

title: Hungry Men
text: So another business trip..  So we have to eat!!!!  This the best..we always go here. Wish the Country was run like this place!  We love the owner. A no nonsense get it done lady!

title: Excellent experience and food at Spears
text: Spears Restaurant is one of a kind.  The owner and cook serves the best fried pork chops we have ever had.  His fresh hand cut french fries are excellent.  We have been there 3 times and each time it has been excellent.  We make extra effort to pass thru Marianna on our way to Southern Florida and stop at Spears when he is open.  We hope to be there next Friday, March 15, 2024.  We have told many of our friends of our great experiences at Spears and recommend they go there when passing thru the area.

title: Town Secret
text: Hidden gem! Great Mom & Pop owned business. Mom is out front greeting, smiling and taking orders and serving. After your order is taken, if necessary, Pop will talk to you from the kitchen to ask, " Would you like onions on that?"  "Did you watch the game yesterday?" "Hey there! I  haven't seen you in a while. How are you?" The food is as good as the owners! The fried spare ribs are the bomb!! I have seen the police, fire departments, teachers and students there. It was a Florida Caverns ranger who told me that I had to try their food.  I keep going back!

title: The food is homemade, cooked fresh & is very delicious for all ages to enjoy. Welcoming environment with Great Service!
text: The food is very delicious, cooked fresh and good to eat for all ages. Environment is welcoming and has excellent service.

title: Food was mediocre.
text: Food was mediocre and portions tiny. Wagyu beef and chicken skewers were chewy and very salty. Tempura cauliflower and dumplings were ok.

title: Check your bill
text: I was really disappointed with my recent visit to Sampan on 10/27. The food itself was delicious, but when I got home and looked over my receipt, I realized I was charged for two meals instead of one for several items. I double-checked to make sure it wasn't something I ordered by mistake--it definitely wasn't.  I am not sure how this is even possible since only one item of each was delivered to our table.  Is it a scam???  The total amount overcharged was $109.   I tried calling and emailing the restaurant to sort it out, but haven't been able to get a response yet. Mistakes happen, but overcharging a customer and not fixing it right away doesn't leave a good impression.   Please double-check your bill before you leave!  I hope management sees this and reaches out so this can be corrected.  Table 54

title: Asian fusion in downtown Philadelphia
text: Tasty food late in the evening. We had flown in for the work conference. Not everything’s open late on Sunday evening, so our choices were more limited. This is in a very vibrant area of the city with lots of people still walking around after 8 PM. The food choices were good. It is sort of served family style in that they bring a bowl of the entrée, rice, etc and you share it at the table.  The menu was small, but the food was tasty. Servers were responsive and helpful. It’s a small restaurant and a little bit loud, but I would definitely return again.

title: Unstuffy culinary hotspot
text: We came here for dinner while visiting friends who live in the area, and had a wonderful meal!  The ambiance is upscale and trendy without being stuffy, and it was very clear that this is a culinary hotspot. The staff were professional and friendly - our waitress was very helpful when we were struggling to decide what to order. The crispy duck, salmon satay, tempura cauliflower, and the general tso soup were outstanding! We ended up not leaving anything for leftovers, which doesn't generally happen with us. We'll definitely come back the next time we're in town.

title: Consistent excellence
text: This was our third visit to this always busy restaurant. The food was again excellent. Our wait person was excellent and provided valuable advice. Every dish was special and will return again soon!

title: Great food and service!
text: Good food and service.  We visited during the non peak time between lunch & dinner which can sometimes not be a good thing but the service was spot on and food was delicious.  My husband and I both had the Fajita burrito.  I even asked for some alterations to mine. Perfect!

title: Great Food and service!
text: Went by for first time last night with friends.I got the beef burrito supreme plate= excellent! Buddy got 6 tacos beef supreme= excellent! Now the other guy got pork carnitas,they werent so great.Just cooked pork, dry, most places have peppers and onions and such cooked with the pork.So my friend said next time he was getting the burritos! Lol- friendly folks- clean place- even the restrooms.I will go back!!

title: Hmm so so
text: Tamales had taken on a taste from the freezer or something, very odd not so good .  Beef meat is unseasoned just beef. Menu is misleading said it came with beans and rice too and they brought it out with a salad no dressing beans were right out of a can . Said meal was covered in cheese and it was white caso that should have been in the description on the menu. Guacamole was just avacados tomato and onion not flavored at all . Salsa and chips were great . Service was good but they failed to realize we hadn't ate our food but kept asking if we wanted boxes.

title: Loyal to my party.
text: After having lunch there, I was told by a friend they would not let the Democratic Party meet in their dining room.  I wish I would have known this.  Will not go there again.

title: Good Flautas - March 2021
text: So a solid three stars for this little restaurant. Now there are only two Mexican restaurants in town. But coworkers have told me they weren't impressed whatsoever with the other place   I really felt like having some flautas. They had them on the menu but clarified that they were made corn tortillas. In my book, those are taquitos...and it was indicated on the menu. So I asked the waiter if they would make them with flour tortillas. He said no at first but then said he'd check with the cook. He returned and said no problem. While waiting I was served some salsa & chips...which were pretty average. I also had a Modelo Especial. My flautas (3) were very good and I recommend you request them this way if you order them. I even told my waiter he should suggest the option to his restaurant patrons.  Because of the pandemic, they created a drive up window, but don't know if you're required to call in your order ahead. Prices were average and the staff was nice. There's a small bar but I believe they only sell beer. There's a couple TV monitors inside. No complaints and nothing to rave about. No objections to eating here again.

title: Family joint
text: Very friendly staff. Quick seating. Comfortable family oriented restaurant. Friday was fish and chips special. Very good and lots of food. Food was freshly cooked and hot. Grilled shrimp good. Would return if in that area.

title: Its been fixed
text: I compained about over salting the food.  In fairness, it's  no longer a problem.  Other than the  salmon being dry, everything was good, ,  and they hid the salt shaker.  Servers are great too

title: Neighborhoody Sports Bar
text: I like the neighborhoody feel and the large-screen TV’s to watch sports.  I was admittedly disturbed that one of the large screens was showing Fox News (this is a sports bar, for one thing!).  The Buffalo wings are okay, but I would t say great.  Service was very good late at night.

title: Worth a try
text: Food was generally OK, but nothing special.  Overpriced and oversalted. Since it has a bar,and there are very few in town, it was worth a try

title: Friendly staff
text: Went in with a group of 8 and waited for about 20 minutes. The staff was friendly and we were served pretty quickly with it being so packed. Everyone got what they ordered and the kids were occupied the whole time in the game room.  Staff was very friendly.

title: Limited and extremely overcooked food
text: There is little to choose from at this restaurant. The majority of the food had been there awhile or it was entirely overcooked. The only things I found that were worth eating were the green beans and the imitation crab. We will not be returning to this establishment.

title: Standard
text: We were seated quickly and the server was nice.  Very tasty cheese wontons, otherwise, for me the buffet was just ok...maybe I wasn't in the mood for it that day.  Husband enjoyed it more than I did, so we will return.

title: Why I will never go back
text: The lady was rude and non polite to customers and waitresses the cups and silverware were dirty and plates were nasty and they yelled at me because I was getting it grilled and she thought I was finna eat it raw

title: Thankful for Panda for opening up for us during the Coronavirus outbreak
text: After trying hard to find Chinese restaurants that will allow patrons to dine inside I was lucky to find Panda open and being careful to keep diners social distanced while serving a well stocked buffet of fresh tasty food.  This seems to be the least critical review of all written about Panda although most found the food good.  Sure the place doesn't look as fancy as others but it also isn't pretentious as some buffets and if it keeps costs down, I have absolutely no complaints and everyone agrees it is well worth the price.  I'm not foolish enough to think I can have it both ways, fancy decorations and extras with the lowest prices, especially because it was a clean place, the waiter brought our drinks three times, was courteous, wore a mask as all the staff and I felt safe and taken care of.  The watermelon was sweet and juicy, ice cream was the real kind, not soft serve and I enjoyed and finished every dish I took.  They were cooked and seasoned perfectly.  The vegetable dishes were fresh and crispy, never overcooked to a mush like some southern vegetables tend to be.  None of the food was old or lacked freshness.  It was all well done and very tasteful to me and my companion who was glad I found a place so nice, compared to another  that was not open for dining in.

title: This is not good food
text: The quality and taste of the food on the buffet is sub-par.  This probably explains why the place is virtually empty even at prime dining hours.

title: Rude!!!
text: I thought the customer service was fantastic.... at first. I ordered the trash plate which was hash browns with ham, bacon, veggies and cheese. It came with a biscuit and I asked for gravy on the side and a Pepsi. I asked to substitute ham and bacon on the hashbrowns with patty sausage. It came out quickly and it was delicious. On my ticket $3 was written beside patty sausage. When I went to pay I asked the lady if she charged me $3 for a patty sausage when I didn't get it extra, but I substituted. Because the $3 was beside the patty sausage it looked like I was charged extra for it. She says no that's for your Pepsi. (My Pepsi wasn't on the ticket at all)  I replied "ok" and handed her my card. She then proceeded to read to me the rest of my ticket and the prices. I told her I just wasn't sure about the $3 because it was written beside the patty sausage. She then states "It's not a calculator. I'm only human."  I was nothing short of polite as I asked, responded to, and accepted her explanation.  Looking at the other reviews I believe every one of them. Even her replies to the 1 star reviews are snarky. I understand that people can get stressed and have a rough day causing them to not be as polite as they usually would, but it's obvious that this lady's rudness is a character trait she seems to be proud of.  I do hope she has the day she deserves. 😉
Favorite breakfast and short order place.  Food,  service and price is great!  Best of all is the friendly "hometown" atmosphere.

Had  a great breakfast of eggs and a blueberry pancake. Everything was cooked to perfection. The bacon was crisp as ordered. I like going here for the food and the atmosphere reminds me of a family gathering. I also like the policy of NO animals. I'm a combat vet with PTSD, 100% permanent and total disability. I don't need a service dog to comfort my sorry ...

title: One of the best restaurants around
text: This restaurant is hands down one of the best places I've ever been for a meal. The service is impressive but the food, the food is absolutely some of the best I've ever eaten. I can't say enough about the entire place. If you are within a 50 mile range take the drive there. You will not be disappointed.

title: Great Cafe
text: A great American cafe, old school!  Mingle with the locals here because THEY know where the food is good.  You might have to wait a spell for a table, but around here life moves slower.  Eaten here twice, wonderful food always, The gravy that goes on the biscuits is excellent, unless you are not from the South/

title: Crappy service
text: The drive thru person was not getting order right. When I got to window I asked for 4 tarter sauce to go with my 2 piece fish dinner. She said I can hand out 3, I asked her again in case she was not understanding me as when I was giving my order, she said again "I can hand out 3". So I asked if I could buy one and she said again I can hand out 3. I offered again to buy one and she said they don't sell them anymore. Poor service. Such a rude kid

title: Nice small family restaurant
text: This is a nice fast sea food restaurant. Service is very friendly and quality of food is good. Prices are reasonable.

title: Good fast food fish
text: Nice, clean place. Very busy. It offers several different varieties of fish, along with the usual fast food fish items. Served hot, very tasty, friendly staff.

title: Never had a bad meal or experience here
text: I've probably eaten here a dozen times and it's always been a pleasant experience.  The staff is always friendly and they act like they take pride in their work and product they put out.  I wouldn't really characterize the process as FAST FOOD.  More of a cook to order deal, but that's just fine with me because the wait is well worth it and I like my food hot and fully cooked (which it always has been at this place).  Eating at this Captain D's, I almost feel like I'm eating at home.  They have a home-like atmosphere.  Welcoming and like I belong when I'm eating here.  The restaurant is clean with tables bused and wiped.  The condiments are easily accessible.  When I have to travel back to Marianna in August, re-visiting this restaurant will be at the top of my TO-DO list.  We always love visiting this Captain D's :-))  Their Tarter Sauce is the absolute best on the planet and my spouse likes their malt vinegar.

title: Great fast food seafood !!
text: Our captain d's has always had good seafood. Drive threw is fast and efficient and they get your order right. Always friendly service. Food is very good. Quality  is always good. As good as you will get for fast food seafood. Also newly remodeled.

title: Geat experience from now on I will call my husband Biggles!
text: My husband has always wanted to fly in a Spitfire but too costly, so we booked for him to try the simulator experience. He loved every minute of it! I enjoyed just watching and filming him. It cost £60 for the hour and was worth every penny. Many thanks to Colin who talked my husband through all the proceedures, I won't be surprised if we are going back again soon, it was brilliant!

title: Superb heritage centre river cruise with excellent commentary
text: I spent a most enjoyable 5 hours on the Thames, on this year's annual Maidenhead Heritage Centre cruise, and what a treat!  Apart from a little light rain, we enjoyed good weather and views between Maidenhead and Marlow.  But what really made it stand out was Richard Poad's informative, interesting and amusing commentary.  Do you know how many bathtubs it takes to fill Boulters Lock.  I though my answer "a lot" was pretty good, but not good enough.  I'm afraid you'll have to wait until September 2026 for the next chance.

title: Great birthday surprise
text: I booked a surprise birthday gift for my husband to 'fly' a simulator Spitfire. It was amazing. My husband was thrilled with this experience as his late mother built these planes during the war. Lovely welcoming staff who helped make this a remarkable memory.

title: It's Educational!
text: Maidenhead Heritage Centre is a small building on the edge of the town centre. It is close to the library and with the help of google was easy to find.  There is a small admission charge but well worth it. There is history of the area from ancient times and also more recently including a diorama of the railway in the area. There is also a bit of history about women politicians in the area. I did not realise that Theresa May was not the first lady politician in the area of note.  The most interesting thing to see in the centre is the ATA on the first floor. Colin shared a great deal about the men and women who served in this organisation. There is alot of information on display and it is impressive that this collection of exhibits is available to educate people like me.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

title: An interesting little museum with Spitfire simulator more suited to teens and adults
text: Before we visited I rang up to check the Spitfire simulator would be a suitable activity for our 4 grandchildren who were visiting us during Half Term. I explained that the youngest is only 8 (they recommend 9) but is almost 9 and is quite tall (to reach the pedals) The person I spoke to was friendly and helpful and reassured me it would be fine but suggested we book a 1 hour session which we did.
