This cost £70 which I thought was reasonable value for 4 of them to have a try.   On arriving at the centre, the person at the front desk was very helpful and suggested that we could park one of our cars for free in the drive at the side as they only had one staff car parked there that day. We parked the other one (as we had 4 children with us) in the  Pay car park at the other side.   The centre itself is small but with some interesting exhibits. There is also a video which they can put on and that is very informative about the role of the ADA during the war. And there’s a dressing up section which amused the children who weren’t on the simulator and which kept them out of the way as I was a bit concerned that the guy supervising  (Richard) was slightly flustered by the number of them!! He said quite sharply that he needed to know this in advance and I explained that I had called to check that would be ok.  In the event they did all have the opportunity to operate the simulator, to loop the loop, do a barrel role and land the plane. And they all said they enjoyed it but said later that they didn’t really feel they were doing it themselves as Richard had his hands on the controls at all times……..possibly in case they crashed it??!! And I don’t think he took to our youngest grandson who went last and was definitely over-confident which possibly annoyed Richard.  All in all, I think it’s probably more suited to older children or adults who may have had more experience with video games than ours have.  Our oldest grandson (at nearly 12) was the one who found it most interesting. The youngest was actually the most enthusiastic but was a bit too boisterous for Richard’s liking!! I also think that if I had been in charge I would probably have structured it differently. I think he could have explained the more general rules to all of them at the start and then allowed each of them to have a turn. Instead he went through with each individually which took more time and therefore reduced the time available for the flying.

title: Becareful
text: Unfortunately the shrimp gave my wife and I Botchulism. I had tacos and my wife had salad and my daughter had chicken salad.  Apparently. 6 hrs after eating there just me and the wife had the worst reaction that lasted 5 days

title: Great lunch
text: My wife ordered the fried green tomatoes for an appetizer, they were very good.  She ordered a hamburger with fried sweet potato fries, both were outstanding.  I ordered blackened shrimp with cheese grits and hushpuppies.  It was all delicious.  This was my first time eating here.  It will not be the last.  It was also served quickly.  Great job.

title: Will definitely go again if I find myself in Marianna
text: Awesome place if you are a fan of seafood. Catfish, shrimp, crab cakes and grits wete great. It’s a nice place with a chilled out vibe. Staff are friendly.

title: We wouldn't recommend it.
text: Casual is right...it's in a run-down plaza, very basic interior, and you have to order from the counter, although they do bring it to your table.  The "hostess" behind the counter was less than warm and cheerful, and that combined with the lack of ambiance almost made us leave.  However, they had fried oysters on the menu which I'd been craving so we stayed. I had the oysters and absolutely tasteless coleslaw.  The oysters themselves were plump and juicy, but the breading was too heavy and flavorless.  My husband had grilled shrimp wrapped in bacon and fries.  Bacon was basically raw and shrimp, which plump, were tasteless.   Prices were higher than they should be in a place like this.  If it was going for a seaside hut vibe, they definitely missed it.  We would not go back.

title: Great food Affordable prices
text: The food was delicious. Large portions  and affordable pricing. The employees were super friendly and helpful. I thoroughly enjoyed my meal and would love to eat there again if I am in the area!

title: Not good at all
text: Ask for my cheese to be scrambled with eggs didn’t add any cheese at all. I called and the manager argued me down that he did and I took pictures. Bad experience. Everyone makes mistakes but why not try to fix as a business owner.

title: Not great
text: Food was ok. Staff was rude. Customer service was terrible. Place desperately needed cleaning and updates. Definitely not a coffee shop as the name suggests.

title: Wonderful lunch treat
text: We had not visited the Gazebo in years, so while visiting Marianna, we stopped by .Our server was Kim, and she took great care of us. The food was delicious.

title: Downtown Secret
text: Local breakfast and lunch spot in town across from the old Chipola Hotel , gazebo out front , enter from the rear or the front door , grab a table , get more food than what you should pay.

title: Nothing amazing, but it was a good place to stop.
text: I got the shrimp caesar salad which was pretty tasty. The prices were extremely reasonable too. The restaurant was really busy and there was only 2 servers. It took forever to get our food. I may go back when they're not so busy.

title: Delicious food!
text: The food was delicious, and the prices are reasonable. Everyone enjoyed their food and most had some to take home. The service was great, and atmosphere is fun!

title: Angela experience
text: Great place. Loved Angela. Supper cool. Food was excellent. Thanks Angela. Food was delicious atmosphere wonderful we love the panini gouda grits and the mule.

title: Weekend getaway
text: Fast friendly service. Large portions and good food. We will be back the next time in the area. I recommend trying them out. Shrimp and grits were really good

title: Great service and good food
text: Found this gem for our lunch. It was hard to figure out what to order because prices were a bit high.  I ordered the Tuscany panini and my husband ordered a hamburger. We thoroughly enjoyed the sandwiches. Our French fries were hot and had great seasoning on them.  Service was incredible with very hardworking servers. The only negative for us was a radio that played in back. It was a tinny and loud and got irritating

title: Found this while passing thru town
text: Just a slight detour from our route and it was well worth it. Seems to be a very popular local place. My wife and I both ordered paninis. Hers was Italian and mine Southwest. Both were excellent. I, also, really enjoyed their cole slaw. Service was fast and efficient. They do have a full bar, as well. Great little place, especially if you're traveling and want something other than fast food.

title: Worse tasting overpriced chicken parm I ever had in my life
text: I just moved to this town and was dying for a chicken Parm sandwich, and did not feel like going through the trouble of making it myself. Well, I certainly should have because this was the worst tasting chicken Parmesan sandwich I’ve ever had. I asked for extra cheese there was no cheese no sauce and when I first looked at it, I thought they had given me eggplant by mistake. That’s how thin and burnt the chicken cutlet was. It was literally all bread no meat to thin hockey pucks just terrible and they charged me $16 for it. Very very upset never again will I ever eat here!

title: Lunch disaster
text: Stopped for lunch for our Anniversary. The inside appears clean and pleasant so that was nice. Very few patrons so we figured we would get our order in quickly and be served right away. Boy were we wrong.  Our server was pleasant but not very knowledgeable of any of the dishes. Our order took 25 minutes to be served and it was extremely overcooked. Burned even. I had the chicken parm meal. It was burned and the pasta had zero flavor. Just an awful dish all around. Ordered cannolis for desert and those were equally awful.  Adequate service but the food was well below sub par. I hope I don’t have to eat here again

title: Fantastic
text: We have been here a few times and the food is amazing, and cooked fresh. The  staff is very friendly and you get great service. We would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone.

title: Trying the new place
text: I love Italian food, so I finally got to visit this place. Owners are great and maybe I just was a little picky on this day but the bread seemed to be soaked in butter and there wasn't much garlic taste. The Caesar salad lacked something but the saving grace was the eggplant. I'll overlook the bread and salad and swear by the eggplant.

title: Friendly Restaurant
text: My wife, son and I came to Marianna for. Marathon. My son’s first. We needed pasta the night before. Not many options for Italian in Marianna.  Tried Pennelo’s and were extremely happy. Pasta sauce had a great flavor. Salad was crisp and fresh. New York Cheesecake was perfect texture. Plan to run the marathon here next year and will choose Penello’s again

title: Coffee was okay, bagels were delicious!
text: I got an iced coffee from there. There was nothing special about it, but it was good. The cups are super flimsy though.  The next day I had some of their fresh bagels and they were absolutely amazing! Could eat an asiago cheese one every morning for breakfast.  They also catered a dinner while we were there that was phenomenal. I ate so many brussel sprouts.

title: Excellent food and Service
text: Friends found this gem.   They raved about the food and service.   We went back with them the next day.   I ordered a BLT  and Hubs  ordered a chicken wrap both were excellent.  My BLT was actually  a stack of crispy bacon on toast with lettuce and tomato.    Not the usual lettuce and tomato bed with 2 strips of bacon.   Best BLT I’ve ever had offered for $7.   Or $ 10 with a side    Cheesecake for desert   Owner makes all the food  from scratch.  The cheesecake was heavenly.  The texture was a cross of cheese cake and mousse.veer light and creamy.  The owner came out and greeted us.    Will definitely return.

title: Excellent food and good service!
text: We tried this cute coffee shop and cafe for breakfast. The most delicious breakfasts are served here. The TikTok Sammie was delicious with sausage and cheese. The omelets were filled with fresh vegetables and a choice of meats. The grits were delicious and creamy. Service was excellent and the food was served promptly and piping hot. Coffee was good too. We will definitely be back!

title: Best breakfast with most awesome everything!
text: Great family experiencence with personalized treatment, awesome coffee choices and best grits plus home made fresh bagels. Stopping there on way back to get a take home order of bagels and lunch!

title: Friendly service
text: Enjoy the southern charm and country cooking.  Family friendly with an area for children to play.  Food is cooked when ordered with hand patted hamburgers .

title: This is why French cooking is world renowned.
text: My wife and I went to Orsay to celebrate our birthdays. Excellent choice! I ordered the Prince Edward mussels dish and my wife ordered the Beef Stroganoff.  Both were very tasty, well prepared, and plentiful. Our hostess Ayla was the best server we've ever had. She anticipated everything, made excellent suggestions, and brought us almond macaroons in a fluffy whipped cream, with a candle to blow out for our birthday. Five star dining with five star service. Reservations are recommended. Orsay is a popular place.

title: over priced and over rated
text: $5 per oyster is insane....especially for a Florida  restaurant...go anywhere for oysters besides here. I have way better oysters for far better price and ambience.

title: One of the best high-end culinary consistent experiences in Jacksonville, Florida
text: I’ve been eating at this establishment for over 15 years, and I was surprised I’ve never reviewed it on TripAdvisor, hands down one of the best restaurants in Jacksonville, they have a static menu, but it’s diverse, and all the entrées are excellent, I recommend the pork chop, the lobster pot pie, any of their fish dishes, solids, and appetizers are out standing, but you do need reservations, especially in the fall and winter, bathroom is exquisite, I’ve been blessed to travel the world, eating at some of the best restaurants, but this specific restaurant makes me proud of living in Jacksonville!

title: Never Again
text: Inside of restaurant was totally booked for reservations though most tables were empty. We were seated outside on a small sidewalk in some very uncomfortable metal chairs. Already getting off to a bad start. Then came the menus and the prices were outrageous. The value wasn’t there for us and we up and left. Glad we did as we found a nice restaurant not too far away. The place was a little pretentious and in my opinion very overrated. Can’t comment on the food quality, but the service and atmosphere were terrible in my opinion.

title: Service was Off
text: We have been longtime fans of Orsay and make it a regular stop when driving in from Hilton Head. They offer an extensive vegetarian menu and probably the best hamburger in the area according to my husband. The weekend brunch is really fine and happy hour runs all day on Saturday (11am to 6pm) with 1/2 price wines by the glass and bottle. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable m- they are normally quite attentive. This visit was a bit different. While my husband’s burger was perfectly prepared, his request for Dijon mustard went unfulfilled for more than 10 minutes and required requests to three separate servers before the condiment arrived. Our server provided a complimentary sparkling wine, a nice gesture but too little too late. His meal had cooled and I was well into my lunch by then. Very disappointing. We will eat here again. Do look at the petit desserts-for a small price you get a sample of one (or more) of their delicious sweet treats….I can attest to the crepe brûlée!

title: Left Feeling Unwelcome Despite the Good Food
text: Here’s a polished version that includes your new points and flows naturally in the review:  ---  Visited this restaurant with my husband for date night, but unfortunately our experience was disappointing. Right at the start, the waitress made a rude comment about my husband ordering tap water, which already set the wrong tone.  After ordering our drinks, we were told to grab salad from the salad bar. I wasn’t even halfway through my salad when, within about six minutes, they brought around six different types of meat. Everything felt extremely rushed, to the point where I had to turn my ticket to “no” because it was all coming too fast. I’ve been to Brazil, and even there the service is never this hurried.  My husband didn’t take any salad, so he was only eating meat. After about 45 minutes, they took away our plates, making it clear we wouldn’t receive any more food. The food and drinks themselves were actually good, and if we hadn’t felt rushed and unwelcome, we would’ve gladly ordered more drinks and even dessert.  They say they want to give you an “experience,” but unfortunately this was not a good one.

title: Finest Restaurant in Jacksonville, FL
text: This is one of the best Brazilian Steakhouses in the USA. With over 1900 restaurants of all types in the Jacksonville area, they are consistently in the top five. Their array of appetizers, soups, shrimp, salads, cold cuts, prosciutto, cheeses (you name it, they offer it) is spectacular. They also bring out fresh hot rolls (as many as you want) that are made from Yucca flour and cheese. One could make a meal out of these alone. Then comes the non-stop service with steaks, pork, lamb, roast beef, chicken, ribs, etc. that the waiters carve at your table. Everything is fresh, hot, and delicious. Also, their wine list is comprehensive and very fairly priced. Don't miss Terra Gaucha the next time you are in the Jacksonville area.

title: Ridiculous price for just ok food.
text: My granddaughter wished to go to the Terra Gaucha Brazilian Restaurant, Jacksonville, for her birthday celebration, so I took my family of six adults there. The restaurant does not provide menus with prices but it is essentially a buffet restaurant, so how pricey could it be? Very pricey! The final bill for six people, no alcoholic beverages and no special orders, including a mandatory tip, was $450.17. The food was good, but not even close to seventy-five-dollars-per-person-for-a-buffet, good. I did not want to cast shade on the event, so I swallowed hard and silently paid the bill. I will not return to Terra Gotcha.

title: 2 spilled drinks by waiter, no apologies
text: We’ve been here quite a few times and have always had really good service, friendly older, and great experience. We went this past Sunday after church with our two kids 20 and 11 years old.  Got seated, ordered our drinks and we went up to the salad bar. When we got back to the table sat down they brought our drinks. One guy sat down my son drink, and it spilled all over the table. They moved everything from the center of the table, put down a towel and blotted  up what they could of the Coke and then another or a girl came around to my side between me and my daughter and she picked the glass up off the tray and I guess the tray was not centered and a whole cup of beverage spilled between me and my daughter on the floor it splattered on her brand new UGG shoes.  Now with what happened you would have thought they were going to either offer free dessert or comp the meal. Nope. Nothing.  This is not the experience you want your customers to have is it?

title: The Jacksonville place for meat
text: Great dinner overall very friendly wait staff, hostess, and gauchos. We have visited several different Brazilian Steakhouses in several different cities and this one ranks in the middle. The salad area is top notch with great salad options, meats and cheeses. The tableside  meats were good too although there were a couple meats that could've used a little more seasoning (pretty bland) and no one ever came around with any ribs and there are both pork and beef ribs on the menu. Other than that a good experience

title: Food was mediocre.
text: Food was mediocre and portions tiny. Wagyu beef and chicken skewers were chewy and very salty. Tempura cauliflower and dumplings were ok.

title: Check your bill
text: I was really disappointed with my recent visit to Sampan on 10/27. The food itself was delicious, but when I got home and looked over my receipt, I realized I was charged for two meals instead of one for several items. I double-checked to make sure it wasn't something I ordered by mistake--it definitely wasn't.  I am not sure how this is even possible since only one item of each was delivered to our table.  Is it a scam???  The total amount overcharged was $109.   I tried calling and emailing the restaurant to sort it out, but haven't been able to get a response yet. Mistakes happen, but overcharging a customer and not fixing it right away doesn't leave a good impression.   Please double-check your bill before you leave!  I hope management sees this and reaches out so this can be corrected.  Table 54

title: Asian fusion in downtown Philadelphia
text: Tasty food late in the evening. We had flown in for the work conference. Not everything’s open late on Sunday evening, so our choices were more limited. This is in a very vibrant area of the city with lots of people still walking around after 8 PM. The food choices were good. It is sort of served family style in that they bring a bowl of the entrée, rice, etc and you share it at the table.  The menu was small, but the food was tasty. Servers were responsive and helpful. It’s a small restaurant and a little bit loud, but I would definitely return again.

title: Unstuffy culinary hotspot
text: We came here for dinner while visiting friends who live in the area, and had a wonderful meal!  The ambiance is upscale and trendy without being stuffy, and it was very clear that this is a culinary hotspot. The staff were professional and friendly - our waitress was very helpful when we were struggling to decide what to order. The crispy duck, salmon satay, tempura cauliflower, and the general tso soup were outstanding! We ended up not leaving anything for leftovers, which doesn't generally happen with us. We'll definitely come back the next time we're in town.

title: Consistent excellence
text: This was our third visit to this always busy restaurant. The food was again excellent. Our wait person was excellent and provided valuable advice. Every dish was special and will return again soon!

title: Harding Presidential Sites
text: We had a great visit to the Warren G Harding Presidential Library and Memorial. The Library (aka Museum) is quite small compared to other presidential libraries, but does a good job telling the story of Harding's short presidency. Tours of his home are only offered on the hour, so we had to miss that, but did take photos from the outside. We also visited the Harding Memorial in the cemetery, which was quite impressive. If you're passing by Marion, Ohio, take a break from your drive and stop by to see the presidential sites.

title: We watched a short film at the museum prior to the tour
text: Our guide was Theodore, he did an excellent job sharing his knowledge of Warren Harding and Florence- marriage, campaign and presidency. The tour started on the porch where his Porch Campaign took place. The house furnishings are over 90% original. NO Pictures allowed which is sad for my personal journey ablum. The museum has nice exhibits with a couple audios. Enjoyed watching the pictures taken on the Voyage of Understanding tour to the western states and Alaska. Purchase tickets on-line because we were shocked how the first 3 tours were fully booked. We changed our itinerary to make a late afternoon tour. Large parking lot. Restrooms on site.

title: Museum and House Tour Make this a fun Visit
text: A visit to this presidential library comprises three potential activities.  First, there is an hour long tour of his house.  Second, the main building includes a small exhibition of his time as President.  Lastly, a mile from the library is his memorial.  We spent just under two hours here.

title: Learning at the Warren G. Harding Presidential Sites
text: Great trip. We arrived at approximately 9:30 am and made our way towards the entrance of the museum. After paying the admission fee, we received a quick overview of the site and went on our way. We opted to view some of the outdoor exhibits first, which included the guard house and press house. The press house contained multiple informational plaques about President Hardings wife and her contributions to society. After viewing the press house, we made our way to the front porch of the house, where we waited for the 10 am guided hour tour to begin. There were guided tours of the presidents former house being held every hour throughout the day. The guided tour of the house was very informational, and the tour guide took us from room to room, while pointing out interesting features and artifacts out for display. The tour guide told us several personal stories related to the Hardings time at the house. The guided tour lasted roughly 1 hour.  After viewing the house, we went back inside to view the main exhibits. We opted to watch a short documentary about President Hardings life and some of the trials and tribulations he faced during his time as President. There were multiple informational plaques out for display, many of them quite text heavy, that went into detail about Hardings upbringing and roots as the owner of a newspaper company in Marion. The plaques also talked about election day, and several of the policy’s Harding implemented while in office. The last section of the museum dealt with his death and some controversial issues that surrounded his presidency. There were multiple artifacts out for display in the museum, along with short video clips that related to President Harding's time in office.  Tip: I recommend spending 3 hours here if you truly want to see everything.

title: Worth the visit!!!
text: I was very impressed with the Warren G. Harding Presidential Sites.  We took the tour of his house, and listened first hand from the tour guides all about when Harding gave speeches on the "front porch".  The house is stunning and is 90+ percent original from years ago when Warren and his wife Florence lived in the house.  The tour guides can answer any questions you have off the top of their heads.  The  Library & Museum was finished in the spring of 2021 and they have a nice gift shop in there too.  They spared no expense in the construction of the building - it is beautiful!!!!  If you are a history buff, this is a must do.

title: Fine dining excellence
text: Amazing dining experience from the drinks we had to start all the way to the decadent desert... flawless! We can't wait to return.

title: Too expensive for what you get!
text: For context, we have eaten at several of the top ranked restaurants in the world.  We’re very familiar with the idea of tasting menus.  The staff at the restaurant (ie. Valet, hostess, waiter, etc.) were all very good.  The artistry of the food was good.  The food quality was good.  The menu variety was good.  Having said that, the pace was a bit too slow and not because it was busy.  The major negative critique was that the food quantity was severely lacking.  After spending a few hundred on dinner, I left starving.  The same family owns other restaurants in Jax, one we really enjoy, but I would not recommend this one.  Way too expensive for what you get.

title: Delicious food in special occasion setting.
text: A perfect special occasion place. Great food with lovely presentation. I had duck with parsnip puree, apples, and fois gras pudding. Fabulous. Cooked as ordered, and the right size portion. Pre-entree arugula salad was eh, but hot potato leek soup with fried puffed noodle was delicious. Dessert was a white chocolate soufflé with pistachio crème and was wonderful: creamy, the right amount of egginess, not too sweet yet smooth and unctuous. My husband had the scallops, which he said were the best he has ever had, cooked perfectly, sweet and tender. He also ordered the wagu beef appetizer, which we all tried: raw but seared on a hot stone and served with soy, pickles and wasabi. Meat was very thinly sliced and tender but nothing to write home about despite the very substantial price. Daughter ordered the homemade pasta bolognese, which was yummy. Servers come to the table with a variety of breads, including ciabatta and focaccia. I tried both, and felt they were just good, but my daughter and son love the focaccia.  They offer several special cocktails. I asked for a chocolate martini ( their special was espresso martini) and it was very good.  Mathew’s is a small, attractive place where you don’t have to shout to have a conversation. Exemplary service from our waiter and his several assistants. Free valet parking out front. Small but well appointed bar when you walk in. Upscale but not stuffy.

title: Never disappoints
text: They always make us feel special.  We only dine here a couple times a year because it's a bit far from home, but it's worth the drive.  Our server this time was "Bow", and he is delightful - so knowledgeable and eloquent with his descriptions of the menu offerings, as well as making time to chat a little.  We love this place!

title: Family of 6 celebrating a special birthday dinner
text: We have been dining at this restaurant with our entire extended family many times over the years and the experience has generally been good. This visit was however most disappointing in terms of the food quality and service. It was a special birthday celebration and my steak dinner  entree came out barely warm so I asked for it to be redone or replaced with something else if that was easier. After a few minutes the very same plate reheated was served to me and passed off as fresh- I could immediately tell as id taken a bite of the potato piece earlier. The meat was obviously over cooked now that it had been reheated. I was so disappointed as it was not a fresh plate as one would expect from a fine dining restaurant.

title: Best Italian in JAX
text: Fresh pasta, fresh baked bread, amazing Italian wine list and delicious food!  I recommend the fresh fish prepared 11 ways, Livornese is my favorite!

title: Quality dining at a fair price.
text: Our fish dinners were excellent and skinny bread sticks fun. The included gorgonzola salad dressing hit the mark. We like eating fish out.

title: Some of the BEAT Italian food I have ever had!!!!
text: Highly recommend this place, Great food,  Great atmosphere & Great service!!!! The one draw back is lack of signage can make it a little hard to find but worth looking for!!!!

title: Quintessential Italian Fine Dining!!!!
text: We have eaten all over the greater Jacksonville area (and far beyond), and this remains our family’s favorite for good reason…owner Jerry’s passion for quality translates to a rich, immersive dining experience that you won’t soon forget.  Dress nicely, bring your favorite people, prepare for exceptional service and cuisine by the best in the business, and let the experience begin!

title: The ultimate Italian experience, La Cena!
text: La Cena is the perfect place for the ultimate Italian experience in food and wine! We had a “cousins” dinner in February and are returning this evening. I decided to write a review after reading in disbelief the small number of critical reviews. Our experience was amazing! The ambiance, decor, menu, and wine offerings equal or surpass the best you can find in Italy. Every one of us shared and were so impressed with our food selections and our server suggested perfect wines to accompany our choices. Everything was delicious and prepared perfectly. It’s difficult to find enough superlatives to describe La Cena! I highly recommend!

title: Fine dining excellence
text: Amazing dining experience from the drinks we had to start all the way to the decadent desert... flawless! We can't wait to return.

title: Too expensive for what you get!
text: For context, we have eaten at several of the top ranked restaurants in the world.  We’re very familiar with the idea of tasting menus.  The staff at the restaurant (ie. Our server this time was "Bow", and he is delightful - so knowledgeable and eloquent with his descriptions of the menu offerings, as well as making time to chat a little.  We love this place!

text: We have been dining at this restaurant with our entire extended family many times over the years and the experience has generally been good. This visit was however most disappointing in terms of the food quality and service. It was a special birthday celebration and my steak dinner  entree came out barely warm so I asked for it to be redone or replaced with something else if that was easier. After a few minutes the very same plate reheated was served to me and passed off as fresh- I could immediately tell as id taken a bite of the potato piece earlier. The meat was obviously over cooked now that it had been reheated. I was so disappointed as it was not a fresh plate as one would expect from a fine dining restaurant.

title: Best Happy Hour in town
text: This gorgeous restaurant is located in San Marco! Oceana serves a variety of unique dishes, and I highly recommend booking a reservation during happy hour. it’s the perfect time to sample a wide selection of their menu at amazing prices.    We tried several dishes, and each was incredible in its own way.    Oceana also offers delicious handcrafted cocktails and mocktails, making it a great spot for the whole family. We especially appreciated the large variety of gluten-free options.   The restaurant layout is another highlight. You can enjoy your meal on the outdoor patio, in the indoor dining area, at the bar, or at the  oyster bar. They also have a beautiful private room, perfect for group gatherings.    What We Tried - Blood Orange Margarita - Classic Martini - Kimchi Brussels Sprouts  - Oysters - Tuna Poke - Insalata di Mare - Lobster Burrata  - Caviar Service  In our opinion they have the: ⭐ Best oysters in Jacksonville    ⭐ Best Brussels sprouts in Jacksonville  A special shoutout to Mathew, who provided us with outstanding service. He knew the menu inside and out and gave us excellent recommendations.    We’ve already RSVP’d for our next visit—I can’t wait to try the mussels and clams dish!  📍 Oceana Tavern 1986 San Marco Blvd Jacksonville, FL  32207 United States

title: Very Noisy
text: Much too noisy. I enjoy loud restaurants but I feel the “cackling”  group at the adjacent table ruined our evening even though the food, wine and service was exceptional.  We wish management ask the five ladies next to us  to simply respect the other patrons and quiet down!

title: Fair Food, Extremely Poor Uncaring Management
text: The food here is fair, some dishes better than others. As well it’s a nice enough establishment in a very nice location  I came with a party 8 so I did get to see and taste several dishes, nothing special, a few less than special. But it’s fine if you are just having a night out. My issue was with the service, or lack of service or caring  My wife ordered the salmon, she specifically asked on how it would be served, as she did not want the quinoa for dietary reasons. Our waitress came back to our table to verify that the salmon would not be served with the quinoa. About a half hour later our dishes all came out, with the quinoa under the salmon. Mistakes happen, so it should have been no problem to correct. Our waitress took the plate back saying a new plate will be made. At that point the restaurant lack of service and caring showed. First no one from management came to our table to just say sorry for the mistake, and it's being corrected. Second while all 7 people were eating our dinner, no manager cared enough to ask if there was a problem that my wife had no food in front of her. Then the final insult to an already dismal dining experience my wife's salmon never came back to our table. All 7 of our friends and family finished our meals. At that point the waitress said oh she can make it to go, as even then it did not come out from the kitchen.  If you wonder what the manager told us at that time, after the waitress verified the dish would be served as requested, got sent back, never to be served again.  We will never know as no manager ever came

title: Birthday celebration!
text: Read all the wonderful reviews so gave it a try. Went early as read there are always lines. Yup! Not early enough, so we sat at the bar which was perfect! The bar tender Scott was amazing, friendly, attentive and fun! Kept our wine glasses full! Food was fantastic! We were having such a great time I didn’t take any pictures until after. We’ll be back!! Highly recommend!

title: We love this place!! We travel miles to get to OUR FAVORITE ITALIAN RESTAURANT.
text: Bestie came and we introduced them to our favorite Italian place. We also go every year for his birthday.  We tried: The goat cheese ball appetizer- Excellent sauce with the bread to dip with.🤌 The food truck favorite- good flavor ❤️ pesto. The limoncello "smooth & creamy"🤤. The orange cake tastes like a grandma made it with love & the pecans were lighty toasted/ crunchy & the carmel was smooth & sweet like honey OMG! The owner suggested the chocolate mousse. WOW!! 🙃 I instantly turned into the Kool-aid man "OH YEAH" it was so good. We all give it 5 stars.🤩😍

title: Best in Jacksonville
text: First time. Excellent food. Best Italian in Jacksonville. Long line to get it. Had a approximately a two hour wait to get in but food was well worth it. Small restaurant with only about 12 tables which is why the wait. Staff very friendly and great knowledge of the menu. Great service. Definitely will be back. Did ask but no reservations, first come, first served.

title: DELICIOUS
text: Food is great, service is great, our favorite date night place. The only catch is there’s no call ahead, no reservations, and no text to your phone when the table is ready so be patient (and get there early).

title: Most amazing italian restaurant ever
text: The pear pasta is so amazing it’s compelling me to write a good review.  This place never disappoints. The staff is very friendly and the food is absolutely delicious.  Once you come here you’ll never go to any other italian spot.  This is THE BEST in Jax. 100%  Get the Pear Fiocchi.  Ur welcome

title: Birthday celebration!
text: Read all the wonderful reviews so gave it a try. Went early as read there are always lines. Yup! Not early enough, so we sat at the bar which was perfect! The bar tender Scott was amazing, friendly, attentive and fun! Kept our wine glasses full! Food was fantastic! We were having such a great time I didn’t take any pictures until after. We’ll be back!! Highly recommend!

title: We love this place!! We travel miles to get to OUR FAVORITE ITALIAN RESTAURANT.
text: Bestie came and we introduced them to our favorite Italian place. We also go every year for his birthday.  We tried: The goat cheese ball appetizer- Excellent sauce with the bread to dip with.🤌 The food truck favorite- good flavor ❤️ pesto. The limoncello "smooth & creamy"🤤. The orange cake tastes like a grandma made it with love & the pecans were lighty toasted/ crunchy & the carmel was smooth & sweet like honey OMG! The owner suggested the chocolate mousse. WOW!! 🙃 I instantly turned into the Kool-aid man "OH YEAH" it was so good. We all give it 5 stars.🤩😍

title: Best in Jacksonville
text: First time. Excellent food. Best Italian in Jacksonville. Long line to get it. Had a approximately a two hour wait to get in but food was well worth it. Small restaurant with only about 12 tables which is why the wait. Staff very friendly and great knowledge of the menu. Great service. Definitely will be back. Did ask but no reservations, first come, first served.

title: DELICIOUS
text: Food is great, service is great, our favorite date night place. The only catch is there’s no call ahead, no reservations, and no text to your phone when the table is ready so be patient (and get there early).

title: Most amazing italian restaurant ever
text: The pear pasta is so amazing it’s compelling me to write a good review.  This place never disappoints. The staff is very friendly and the food is absolutely delicious.  Once you come here you’ll never go to any other italian spot.  This is THE BEST in Jax. 100%  Get the Pear Fiocchi.  Ur welcome

title: So disappointed
text: Went with some friends before a concert. This is one of our favorite places. I had chicken pad thai and my friend had another chicken dish. We both got sick several hours after. Very disappointment because I do love this place.

title: Great food in a good atmosphere
text: I ate here twice, both times at about 1900, first on a Sunday when it was very quiet and then on a Tuesday when it was much busier but soon quietened as early diners left. The service was good with a great choice of Asian cuisine and beers. The first time I had the spicy chicken bites for $10 followed by the duck curry at $22. The curry was just right in terms of heat though I would have preferred the duck to be trimmed. The second time I had the summer rolls (4) at $9 which were enough for two people followed by the Sea of Indochine - prawns, squid, etc. The squid was a bit chewy but otherwise it was delicious. Beers I had were Singha (bottled, $5 each) and Sapporo (draft, $6). A very enjoyable meal in warm surroundings. Anthony was a great waiter!

title: Delicious and very reasonably priced
text: The front door is a little hard to see, but glad we found it. The food was spectacular! I got the Sea of Indochine and it was loaded with fresh seafood . My husband got green curry and lived it. Spice level 4 was perfect for us. Great ambiance, great service.

title: Always delightful staff!
text: The food is delicious,  no doubt. What is extra special is the attentive, knowledgeable and really pleasant staff. Always makes us feel like we are the entire focus of our waiter's attention.

title: Very good food .. but 🚩 red flags !!!
text: A group of 5 went here for dinner. We picked this place as it was  near a function  we attended earlier. The vibe was pretty cool and had a pleasant look. I haven’t been downtown as they roll the sidewalks up at 5 PM so I was surprised to see folks in here on a weekend… but only 2 other tables. Service was efficient and fast. Appetizers and food came out very fast. The chicken cashew was delicious, although cashews were missing from my dish and our friend got 2. If you name it cashew chicken , it better have cashews. When we mentioned this to the server he shared he had heard that complaint MANY times before. Very unsettling that no one bothers to fix a recurring issue!!A friend got pad Thai , which was flavorful and on point. Another friend got Kafir chicken which was very similar to General Tso’s chicken. Nice portions  all around and reasonably priced. The restaurant was stifling hot however as the AC didn’t work . I was appalled to hear it has been for over a DECADE according to the server. If you don’t care about your guests comfort or your staff I CANNOT recommend.  Yes they had fans but if you’re too cheap to afford an essential comfort, we will go elsewhere. It’s a shame as our guests enjoyed food. Blue Orchud  has ice cold AC and Al fresco dining! .. no contest!

title: Sad night….
text: Stopped in because of the reviews. The appetizer was great. But both my wife and I had ordered the Fish & Chips. The fish was way over done. So over done I was surprised they even served it. My piece was actually burnt on the end.   And the fries were dark and chewy as if they had been re-heated many times. Very sad indeed when compared to the reviews. On a positive note, we were not charged for either dinner.

title: Great Brunch!
text: We have gone on several occasions for brunch on Sundays. The food is amazing! I recommend the fried greens tomatoes, blue cheese chips and  egg rolls! Yummmmm! Staff is always awesome!

title: Love in a beef blanket!
text: So we’ve been looking for a comfortable place to call “go to” with friendly faces and incredible home cooked food. Greeted by a sweet hostess/server Emma made us feel welcomed from the get go. Incredible Prime Rib on Friday and Saturday night cooked to perfection.  Don’t miss this place while in JAX.

title: Excellent experience.  My
text: Excellent experience.  My girlfriend and I were visiting for business and stayed at the hotel next to Whiskey Jax.  She called ahead to make a reservation to eat and listen to the live band.  When we arrived they were packed. The manager, Joe, apologized for not having a table but he went above and beyond to find unoccupied bar stools and helped make space for us to wait at the bar while he waited for a table to open up.  We started with one stool, he then held two when two patrons paid their bill.  Shortly thereafter ha came over, bought us a round and said he now had a table.  We decided to hang with a terrific crowd at the bar.  Everyone was incredibly friendly and accommodating.    We then enjoyed a great country rock band.  I ordered ribs and shrimp.  The food came right out and was spectacular.  I’ll definitely come back. Thanks to manager Joe for being a professional host.  That’s a great way to create repeat customers in a business.  See you again soon.

title: This place turns up the HEAT!
text: This place turns up the HEAT! Our group of gals danced the night away! Band was bangin’!!  Servers awesome, food and drinks were on point!  A fabulous Friday night!

title: Lunch in an office complex!
text: Great food,  service,  atmosphere nestled in an unlikely office complex.  Blacked cheese steak was delicious and very tender!

title: Best lunch meeting ever!
text: I finally asked the host of our monthly meeting, where they get the lunch.  It is always super fresh and delicious.  Today I chose a Greek vegetable and hummus sandwich(gyro).  Being a meat lover, I was a little apprehensive, but it was awesome. The flavors were blended perfectly. Only open for breakfast and lunch, so go early.  Looking forward to taking my wife.  She is a big hummus fan and is going to love it.

title: YUMMY GREEK FOOD
text: GREEK FOOD YUM: Spinach pie platter with Greek salad and Greek yogurt with honey& cinnamon. Come check this place out its so good #weightlossjourney #fitnessjourney #menshealth #fatloss

title: First time by chance
text: I’m actually at a training at the team center buildings so for my lunch break, I was looking for something close by and delicious. I was able to walk here, order, eat and relax and night I say this food is AMAZING. Everything I ordered was flavorful, delicious, fresh, homemade, and affordable! The staff was also very helpful in my decision making. I will definitely be back here tomorrow for lunch on day 2 of my training!!!!

title: Lunch break
text: The food is AMAZING. It was my first time there. I got the spinach pie platter OMGOSH IT WAS SOOOOO GOOOD. The staff were on point. Greek food/Mediterranean food is AWESOME. Eat here you will be very happy you did.

title: Hidden gem for travelers
text: Great everything bar and grill a block away from the Doubletree Hotel in Jacksonville. There is a huge menu from breakfast to dinner. Full bar. And very friendly people. We met Kristen there who was so nice and welcoming. Food was good. Fast and hot. Specials on the blackboard in addition to the menu. Drinks were good as well. Everyone seemed to have a good time. No complaints. Just glad to find a cool and friendly place to unwind while passing through.

title: Great atmosphere and food
text: Great atmosphere and food, loved it. Very busy (a good sign) but service was quick and the food came fast.  Live music was a real plus.

title: Worst experience won’t be going  back
text: Food was good Medical employees were at a table at 9am drunk saying swear words yelling laughing acting ignorant with kids in the restaurant as well as elderly couples and the staff did nothing but condone it because it was doctors and staff that had their scrubs and badges on they should be ashamed of themselves and they should all lose their jobs won’t be going back there and the other tables won’t either ppl like that shouldn’t be working for a hospital taking about patients. They were talking about sleeping with drs and name dropping patients and drs I was absolutely dumb founded at the ignorance of these ppl

title: Great Breakfast eats in Jacksonville!!
text: Very good experience!! I was in Jacksonville for a meeting and not fond of hotel breakfast..found this "Gem" .. Great friendly atmosphere , when you walk in it looks like a Sports bar.. you order at the counter and in a few short minutes.. food is on your table..I had the loaded omelette with home fries and this "outstanding Blueberry cobbler" coffee! Amazing!!

title: Loved it!
text: Delicious food along with reasonable prices and fast and friendly service! Can't wait to go back and try other entrees.

title: Inattentive time wasters
text: I sat at the bar but was not told that the hostess seats people at the bar.  I waited 10 minutes watching the bartender ignore me.  Then I asked for a table and had to wait longer.  I spent 15 minutes waiting for anyone to acknowledge me.  This used to be a nice place but they went downhill fast!  My waitress apologized and I finally got my order in, but now I know where not to go if I am looking for a place that does not treat customers like trash.

title: Everything was delicious
text: Wonderful experience. Great customer service and the food was amazing! I had the  oxtails and grits and it was a plentiful amount. Daughter got the salmon and grits with added shrimp. She was pleased as well.

title: It was a fantastic experience, and I will be coming back.
text: It was my family's first visit, and we were thrilled to find Uptown Kitchen after returning from our holiday trip and searching for a brunch spot. The service and hospitality were outstanding—Lancy, our server and several managers, warmly greeted our table. The food was exceptional; every dish was delicious and arrived in a timely manner. We experienced a brief wait of less than 10 minutes for our party of seven, but that just showed how popular the place is! I highly recommend Uptown Kitchen and am already planning my next visit.

title: Fabulous experience
text: It was a fantastic experience. I actually ordered my meal off the neighboring table because The presentation of the food was unbelievable. And our waitress oh my gosh she was fantastic. What a great friendly atmosphere. Can’t wait to go back again. In fact I’m sitting here writing this as we plan to run down there just to eat at the uptown kitchen!!!

title: An Amazing Meal!
text: This was our first time at this restaurant, and after reading the reviews, BRUNCH was a must, and it certainly didn't disappoint! I ordered the Shrimp and Grits with a side of Oxtail gravy!! OMG! Probably one of the best that I've had! My husband ordered pancakes, chicken sausage, and eggs, also very good! The wait staff is very pleasant and attentive despite the crowds! Speaking of the crowds, they don't take reservations, and depending on what time you arrive, there could be a LONG wait for Sat/Sun brunch!  I highly recommend this restaurant and we will certainly go back when we are in Jacksonville!

title: Riverside spot
text: Nice spot with a little bump in the road---good pricing on everything, really wanted to try the Shaksuka, which is a tomatoey concoction in which 2 eggs are baked inside---the Shaksuka was delicious but the dish looked like it had sat under the lights for a bit and the eggs solidified instead of being runny. Had to cut them with a knife!  Would give them another chance if we were nearby---The Cummers Museum is just across the road.

title: About the same price as a chain-restaurant, but 10x better!
text: We had a great dinner at River & Post. We booked through Resy, checked in, and were seated right away. Our waiter seemed new, but he was polite, tried hard, and kept things moving. We’re not high-maintenance, so no issues there.  We would rate the atmosphere as chill, not too lively but also not so quiet that it feels like you are at a library, you can actually talk without yelling across the table. The menu is on an iPad, and while the first one they handed us was dead, it was swapped out quickly.  For food, we ordered the burrata plate as an appetizer and the burger and the New York strip as dinner. The fresh burrata, with the heirloom tomatoes, pesto sauce and that bread was a great start and we knew we were not going to be disappointed with dinner. My significant other said the burger and onion rings were top notch. My steak came out a bit more cooked than I asked for, but after the first bite, I stopped caring. It was that good. The risotto was rich and creamy, and the steak portion size was way bigger than I expected from the menu photo (like significantly bigger).  Overall, it’s a solid place for dinner at a fair price. You’d probably spend about the same at a chain restaurant, but here you get real flavor, a nicer atmosphere, and a meal worth writing a TripAdvisor review for.

title: Great staff , food, and rooftop views
text: A hotel staff member recommended this restaurant to us, and it was a great recommendation. There is a rooftop bar for appetizers and drinks, with great views, facing the river. (Rooftop opened after 4 pm)  The restaurant on lower level was open earlier in the day and has a nice outdoor patio, as well as inside seating.  The dinner prices are a bit on the higher side but the food and staff are wonderful. The menu is varied. It was my birthday and the staff surprised me with a birthday card signed by the whole staff. Very sweet and appreciated.  Cee cee  of the hostess station is a beautiful and delightful person. She made sure we had a great table. Our server on the rooftop, Vanessa, was fantastic. And our restaurant server, Cora, were all great. Thank you for making it a great night. All of our food was fantastic. I had the salmon, and it was great. The restaurant is perfect for casual, business, and special dining  occasions. I look forward to returning.

title: Great customizations available
text: Stopped in recently for a late working lunch. Sat at the bar because I needed a charge. It was mostly quiet but steady due to the time.   Service was good - bartender was able to accommodate allergies easily and graciously.   I had the blackened shrimp - so good and very filling. I wasn’t able to finish all the fries which were also so yummy.   I can’t believe I haven’t tried this place yet - I will definitely be back.

title: Dont come
text: We had a reservation but sat over 40 minutes after, ran out of our menu choice then ran out of the beer we ordered and food took forever to come.  Will not come back

title: Great food and service!!
text: This place is a hidden gem and I can’t understand why it’s not packed!!!  Conch Fritters, smoked fish dip, red shrimp, shrimp po boy were all amazing!!!  Service is great!  Nice laid back place with amazing food!!!

title: Best fried shrimp ever and I do not like batter fried foods
text: Had driven into town for a vacation north of Jacksonville and needed to pick up someone at the airport.  Stopped into Chowder Ted’s the night before.  Wanted somewhere local and it had good reviews.  Only got to go, 3 things.  Chowder which was pretty good.  Fried shrimp order plain.  Fried shrimp order Cajun.  It was FANTASTIC.  Very lightly breaded.  Very lightly fried.  All the flavors and textures that come from frying something but not all the grease and batter that hides the actual shrimp.  I do not remember the last time I had fried shrimp.  It doesn’t even appeal to me.  I was the one that got the chowder.  But, when family flies into JAX next year for our annual beach trip, I will be going to Chowder Ted’s and buying several pounds of fried shrimp for all.  And I might stash a 1/2 lb for myself.

title: Delicious
text: So glad we stopped when passing through. Everything we ordered was delicious and the chowder was amazing. Will be back for sure.

title: Clam chowder not what you'd expect
text: Clam chowder was a red based chowder kind of a hot spicy stew. Not what we expected clam chowder to be  Food was good but expensive and small. Also service was slow.  Waitress was distracted just a few waitresses for a crowd. It's not a very big place. Probably only a dozen tables if you don't eat outside.   Try the palm fish camp about a mile away. It's excellent.

title: If the locals are always here, it’s got to be good. And it was great!
text: Rustic environment with excellent food and lots of options. We’ve driven by multiple times on our way to Jacksonville and were determined to stop this time. We got there around 11:45am, hoping to beat the rush, which we did. By the time we left, both the parking lot and restaurant were full. It was very obvious that the vast majority of the folks inside were locals. My wife had fried shrimp - about a dozen large shrimp with a very light coating of batter. Excellent! I wanted something not fried and opted for the full pot of the chowder. Also excellent! They say it’s made fresh daily, and it was. A medium sized pan filled with a tomato based, thick soup with fresh potatoes, celery and large chunks of tuna and diced shrimp. Highly recommend. Also available in a “half pot” if you’re not really hungry. Don’t drive by - go in and enjoy great food and service.

title: A rare disappointment by a reliable chain
text: On my way out of town stopped for lunch before 5 hours of I-10 was in my future.  Service was great as usual.  But food was only average and I probably should have sent it back.  Started with the Chili, only available on Saturday.  Pretty good but a bit thinner than I prefer.  Id had it a few weeks ago at J Alexander in Atlanta and it was more hearty and thicker. Just a preference.   The French Dip was my entree, it was not great.  Bread was borderline stale and the roast beef was loaded with gristle and fat.  I only ate half.  Maybe just a bad day and it was after 2pm so kitchen was not at full strength but the restaurant was at least half full so business was good.   I’ll go back but I’ll be more quick to reject a poor entree this time.

title: Good Ending
text: This dinner was redemption for a subpar lunch elsewhere. We both enjoyed the grilled salmon. Our server, Eve, must have realized we were tired after a tiring day and didn’t try to overwhelm us with too many “things,” for which I was grateful.  Worth a return visit when we come to Jax.

title: Very Nice Meal   A few small issues....
text: We met friends for lunch there yesterday and had a lovely time.   The server,  Steve,  was friendly and took good care of us.     There were some minor issues,  but we will definitely go here again.   Here are a couple of things that could have been better: We were shown to an area with booths  which is behind a divider.  Several of the tables along the wall have  very  little lighting -   I asked the lady who was seating us if we could sit at one of the other tables which was better lit,  and she was not particularly friendly about it.  I don't know why,  as there were several  available. Three of us got our drinks quickly, but one of us asked for a  Negroni.   That drink took a long time to prepare,  and  our wine orders were slow coming.    I  think this was down to the bar management,  not our server. I had flounder,  which was excellent.  My husband ordered a steak sandwich,  which he described as "average."

title: Fabulous
text: Excellent service like always. We have a restaurant close to our house (Plantation ,FL). The food was great as always.  We had the burger cut in half (my wife and I always share a plate) they served it in two plates well presented. My son order the same   We always ask to be prepared medium which it was done perfectly. And we close with a carrot cake (my favorite place for it ) and a key lime pie for my wife ( the only better place will be at the keys for this desert).  Enjoy. Most likely will return to the restaurant for my birthday in a couple of weeks.

title: delicious
text: As a local, J. Alexander’s is delicious, dependable brand. Today, we had Asian chicken salads, a bottle of Chardonnay and the spinach queso dip. Everything was so good: food, presentation, staff, environment, wine, noise level, temperature - everything!

title: If you love extreme noise and a rude waiter, this is a place for you
text: If you love, extreme noise, extremely loud music, and very tight seating arrangements, this might be the very place for you. Furthermore, if you’d love to be contradicted by a waiter in a most rude manner, this might also be perfect for you. The food was fine, small portions, big prices, but tapas restaurants seem to be like that anyway. That is not the point. When I asked for pulpo asado (octopus) they brought fried breaded calamari. Even an elementary school kid the difference between squid and octopus. The extremely rude waiter contradicted me when I mentioned that this was not octopus, it was calamari. Octopi do not have rings!! Squid have rings and octopi have tentacles with suction cups. It was so obvious to the point of pathetic that it was funny how the man was dead set on contradicting us and in the most rude fashion. If I were the manager, which we did not contact because we didn’t want to make a scene, this guy would have been in the street right away. When I confronted him and asked him why we got calamari instead of octopus, he said “the chef knows what he’s doing thank you” and he left the table in a huff. Obviously we are not coming back nor our large groups of friends.

title: Crowded, super noisy and garlicky
text: They pack the restaurant with so many people one can hardly breathe in there. Food is very good but terribly garlicky. They also charge a lot for each mini plate they offer… using the tapas system they get you into ordering many overpriced small garlic bombs. All in all we do not go back although we live nearby as the hassle of being jammed into the noise restaurant is not worth the food.

title: not my favourite
text: Very crowded, tables really close together - music so loud that you could not talk to your partner - tried several appetizers but we were not overwhelmed. Would not go again.

title: Left in 30 minutes
text: VERY loud with tables literally about 4-6 inches apart.  You could hear everything neighboring tables were saying but very little of your partner's comments.  I like a dry white wine with Mediterranean food but none available (excluding two bubbly options). Only one vodka brand available so you are limited to cocktails (mainly rum) or beer. While we left in about 30 minutes, flat bread pizza was overcooked by had good flavors and the octopus was tough but again, had a nice flavor.  Big crowd so appears popular, but we will not go back - too many other great options out there.

title: Top Top Tapas
text: We went with some local friends who have been multiple times and it was possibly the best Tapas I have had. Amazing knowledgeable staff who could not enough to help. Food sensational. So much flavour. We loved it.

title: A nice cafe, a good but simple menu, not too large, and not too noisy.
text: A friend went to Portland to visit family. They recommended that he and I meet at "The Observatory" on SE Stark Street. It is a small place, not at all noisy as I recall. I looked that the menu before I left to drive down to Portland. We got a booth by the front door, but it wasn't chilly (fall weather these days). My friend had an Elk Burger with cajin fries and an IPA beer. I had a Ruben sandwich with plain fries. Since I was driving home after lunch I stuck with water. I was quite pleased with my lunch, and the fries were the best fries that I have had in a long, long time. My friend praised the IPA on the first sip. He too liked his burger and fries.   We got there around 11:30 AM, and by noon all of the seating was occupied. The service was really great! There was not any kind of excess noise problem. I imagine some rowdy folks would come in from time to time, but the atmosphere was very nice during our visit.   Before we finished eating there was a small crowd gathered outside the door, waiting to get in. There was a crowd still there when we left. The servers didn't try to encourage us to leave, we left when we were ready.

title: Better than pub food
text: Fast friendly service. The waitress  was helpful with food descriptions and suggestions. I had a watermelon basil cocktail, an interesting combination of flavours and a salad with smoked trout. The salad had lots of fresh ingredients: new potatoes, crunchy green beans, roasted red pepper and lightly smoked trout but the olive dressing was a bit plain, not much taste. My husband had the macaroni and cheese with chunks of sausage. He said it was delicious and so creamy. My son’s fish (and chips) was very dry and tough. The food was delivered quickly.

title: Go for the meal, but stay for the cocktails
text: This was very great restaurant. I had the salmon that was very excellent. I have not had a good piece of salmon in a long time and I was not disappointed. Highlight experience was bartender made me a bourbon cocktail hecwas developing. For those that like manhattans or old fashions, step out of your comfort zone and try a that bourbon pineapple thing. You want be disappointed.

title: Very disappointed
text: I’ll start by saying I hate to leave reviews & usually don’t; so when u do it’s only when I’m very impressed or very disappointed. I’ve been here several times & never been disappointed. This time was different unfortunately. My first red flag was when our food came out in less than ten minutes. Fresh food takes longer than that to cook. My partner & I came by for dinner because she wanted the trout salad. Which she seemed to enjoy.  I was in the mood for white fish so I ordered the pan fried Idaho trout piccata, with broccolini & lemon mushroom risotto.  Sadly, the menu said nothing about the trout actually being farm raised steelhead (I hate steelhead) so that was my first disappointment.  Next, the risotto was complete mush. I asked the server to ask the kitchen when it was made. He said it was “prepped” yesterday. Having spent 20! Years in the culinary industry including culinary school I know what that means.   @ lastly, the broccoli was just unseasoned broccoli. Zero salt, pepper, or butter. The server was friendly enough & not rude at all, but when I made my disappointment visually & audibly known, he showed & offered zero in the way of fixing the situation. I did say that will take the remaining 2/3rds of the disappointing meal to go partner would have it at work later,  so I understand that. I despise people who complain just to get free stuff & so that’s why I try not to leave bad feedback.  I think the biggest disappointment was that from my very first sign of displeasure, there was no offer to fix the situation from beginning to end.  I left the couple stars because the staff were fine. But I won’t return.

title: A great lunch!
text: We visit Portland a couple of times a year.  Our daughter brought us to the Observatory.  Everyone had a great lunch...that is a feat when EVERYONE at our table is happy!   The price was reasonable.  I highly recommend.

title: Not what it used to be.
text: Coquine used to be great restaurant with a relaxing neighborhood vibe. After two visits in the last year, we noticed it has become a snooty restaurant, with greedy prices and portions. The last time we went with family from out of town and they couldn't believe how ridiculous the wine portions were - they barely served us 4 ounces and charged $20 per glass. The food is still great, but it would help to lose the attitude and the greediness.

title: Hidden 20% gratuity added to bill
text: Overall wonderful experience with regard to the food and service. Three stars only because a 20% gratuity was added to my bill without telling me. I tend not to look over the receipt in detail and came very close to missing this. I almost added 20% to the $200 bill (that already included a 20% gratuity). This felt very dishonest to me. I expect more from a restaurant like Coquine.

title: Amazing food
text: Amazing food, quaint and inviting location, and overall one of our best dinners while traveling ever!  We had the special Valentine's Day menu and it did not disappoint!

title: My new favorite restaurant.
text: Wow! What an absolute gem. This restaurant is a total winner. The food is delicious, the service superb, the ambience perfect. Everything you would need for a wonderful meal out.

title: Coffee with a Scowl
text: I thought it was a Good morning , until my Daughter snd I got the Evil eye and Coffee with a Scowl. Yikes. How about a smile from the Coffee server .

title: Great service
text: My friends and I met at Rue for drinks after a concert at Voodoo Doughnuts. The service was outstanding and we were allowed to just have drinks, though the menu looked quite intriguing. We ordered the almonds with rosemary and smoked beef fat, and they were to die for.

title: Jersey Burger
text: Go for the happy hour jersey burger which is grilled pate with american cheese on a potato bun. Drinks are discounted by $1 at happyhour and beers are good and varied. Nice inventive food with plates of different sized.

title: Amazing small plates
text: We visited for the second time.  I am a pretty picky eater and more of a traditionalist in terms of my food.  Last time I was a little more experimental but this time I did the cheeseburger (a new add to their menu) and frittes.  We also did the grilled little gems (a lettuce).  That burger was amazing!  It's not big and not loaded with stuff on top.  But it's the right size to allow you to sample other things and is one of my top favorite burgers in town!  The frittes are crisp, thin, salty - perfect.  The gems were very good.  My husband had the Culottes which was excellent.  He also had the trout which he said was great (I'm not a fish person).    The previous trip we tried dessert and were not impressed.  Nothing enticed this time either.  But I see online they have a strawberry dish and considering and hoping they may use hood strawberries it may be worth trying!  We will be back - a new neighborhood favorite for us!

title: Excellent cocktails
text: Came here around 4:30 on a Saturday to take advantage of the 4-6 happy hour. Perhaps it was the early hour or the fact that there seems to be a cocktail/brewery/wine bar on every corner but other than two other couples it was empty. All the better for us!  Our server was friendly and helpful. I had the Pine Street Sour and the Lagunita cocktails.  Both were tasty and refreshing. My husband and I shared the potato and leek croquettes and the slider. Both were delicious. We enjoy trying new places when we travel which often means repeat trips to the same place don't happen often but we will definitely return here in the future.

title: Great Bar experience and good Happy Hour Choices
text: Good selection of drinks with a very friendly atmosphere. Service was great for a large party and very accommodating.

title: We Really Like This Place
text: I read some of the reviews and am sorry some seem disappointed. We have been twice and sat at the bar for drinks and dinner. Both times have been exceptional. The second time we were served by the owner. Akhil has an incredible knowledge of food prep and wines. We loved everything we ordered. If they are out of something it is because they only stock fresh for the day. I'm good with that. I do admit we went on weeknights in the winter when things might be a bit slower and there are mostly locals there who all seem to know each other so it was very relaxed. We'll keep going back. Good food, good service and pleasant atmosphere.

title: Sunday Brunch
text: This is the second time I've been here for brunch and the food is pure comfort and delicious. The Cheddar Potato Cake was fantastic and the Mimosa is a must for Brunch.

title: Consistently Fantastic!
text: Ate outside under the trees and twinkly lights.  Beautiful. No reservation needed on a Sunday night for a great seat but it was still hopping.  Ordered from Happy Hour menu and the regular one, they have a great happy hour.  Polenta fries with marinara-Loved!  Steak bites-Loved!  Not a huge order but just right. Black bean soup-comes in a chicken type broth with veggies, was not what we expected but better-so delicious. Burger on lettuce with white cheddar, onion jam and avacado was excellent!   Consistently exceed expectations, not the usual run of the mill options so we always feel happily surprised, and you can't beat the great atmosphere and service.   This is a great first date place, casual dinner, group of friends or special event (smallish groups) location.  They fall somewhere between the cheap eats and the mid range.  You can get a good burger for $13.50 or a steak plate for between $19-26.

title: Very Nice Dinner Place on SE Milwaukie Ave
text: We have driven by this place numerous times including during the summer time where the outside patio is packed with people and always wondered what the attraction was. We finally stopped in for dinner recently and we were pleasantly surprised.   The interior seemed somewhat small but inviting and very nicely laid out. We were warmly greeted and promptly seated. We ordered some food items recommended by the waitress which was the fish and chips and the hand cut pasta with wild boar meat. Both items were very tasty with the fish and chips being some of the best I have had in the Portland area. We also ordered a desert that was a mint cheesecake with chocolate chips which was very tasty.   Between the great service and food, we will be back.

title: Exceptional!
text: Beautiful setting after dark with twinkly lights, candles and Christmas tree.  Cozy and warm when it was blustery outside.  Great staff.  I can always tell a good menu when there are a few things I really want and can't make up my mind.    Deviled eggs with smoked salmon were a little meh, but the potato croquettes were heavenly.   Two of our group settled on the happy hour burger with a salad, both were flavorful and delicious, two others had steak frites with a drizzly of chimichurri sauce, also delicious.    Good cocktails.  This was our second time and it was every bit as good as the first, just a different (and special) experience eating inside.  Great place for a romantic date.  Street parking.

title: A love letter to Kann
text: This place was an EXPERIENCE to say the least.  Let’s start with the service our server made our experience very unique to us, understanding my personal dietary restrictions and explaining the restaurant and it’s entirety to us and the culture how the food works and is intended to be eaten (that being shared of personal meals).   Now let’s talk about the food. The food itself felt like comfort all while still remaining sophisticated. It was extremely well portioned for you to be able to experience from starter meals to the actual entrées all the way to dessert. The best way to describe the food experience I had was the comfort of going to eat at my Nina’s and being served my favorite meal but at an elevated experience with great drinks and service.   One thing I normally don’t review is atmosphere because I love hole in the walls, but the atmosphere of the restaurant itself was organized without feeling so modern and also very busy while also feeling very warm and that says quite a bit, considering that we sat at the communal counter, which you would imagine would feel like like a very individualized experience, yet, it was! I felt as though I was in my own bubble and loved seeing what others were ordering (I’m nosey like that). So don’t shy away from the chef’s counter if you can’t get your own table. Oh and cleanliness was a 11/10.   The price point was fair.   I would 10000% recommend this as not only a restaurant but as an experience.

title: Alarming
text: This is the first restaurant to serve lab grown salmon.  It's called Wildlife .    They call it cultivated salmon .    I didn't order it so not sure how it tastes.

title: Well worth the pain of getting a reservation!
text: Kann is fantastic, every bite was delicious. Exceeded expectations. The restaurant is beautiful - bright, modern and warm at the same time. We made a reservation at the communal table which really is just a series of tables set closely together. Other restaurants wouldn’t even call it communal, was more private than expected. The menu is filled with delicious options, hard to choose! We went with the plantain brioche buns with a seasoned butter- so tasty; peanut creamed greens - a fav, spicy and rich; griyo twice cooked pork - National dish of Haiti that bursts with color and flavor (avocado, slaw, fried plantains included); and whole tai snapper - tender with a beautifully spiced sauce and not a bone in sight except down the middle to hold together. The fish is good to share for two. I also have to mention the an lo zero proof drink that was amazing, so refreshing with yellow pepper, ginger and pineapple. Best non alcoholic drink I’ve had. To finish it off we loved the baked Haiti dessert, a coconut sponge cake covered in charred meringue and stuffed with cream and pineapple. So good. The guava sticky toffee pudding with ice cream was also a good choice. I’ve seen some other reviews that weren’t happy with the food, hard to understand unless you don’t like seasoned, flavorful food with a bit of spice. This is not typical dining, it’s better.   Service was attentive and friendly yet quick with the plates and the check. Understandable given a reservation is tough to get. Expensive as expected but completely worth it. Restaurant was packed on a Wednesday night in March. Even the bar seating was full.  Would love to return one day….

title: Exceeded Our High Expectations
text: It's unusual to go to a restaurant with such high expectations, only to have all those expectations exceeded in every way.  That was our experience at Kann.  Service by Chris and his team was impeccable.  Timing of plates was perfect, we were never rushed, the table was kept spotless, everyone was attentive without hovering.  The meal itself was fantastic.  We over ordered so we could try more dishes, and ended up taking a bunch home.  To be honest, I think i enjoyed the appetizers and sides as much as the main courses, but everything was spectacular.  I am gluten and dairy free due to allergies, and I was in heaven, knowing I could order just about anything on the menu and be safe.  Thank you!  We will make another reservation and wait our three months to get in - it was just a perfect, perfect meal in every way.  Oh, and be sure to save room for dessert!

title: Would NOT recommend
text: Horrible service. Rude staff and manager. Would NOT recommend.   Additionally, my experience making a reservation was a nightmare. Book reservations with caution. I was charged $300 for a misunderstanding and a lack of clarification on Kann’s end.

title: Dinner with Marty
text: What a beautiful place here they got in Portland. Me and Marty had such a fun time when we stopped in to town. We always wanted to come up here for the view but holy cow everything was perfect. Mitchel the bartender was so sweet and knew every question we asked like a pro. The Lobster was so big! 10/10

title: Beautiful Venue
text: The view is spectacular.  The ambiance is classy.  The Chilean Sea Bass and Lobster Risotto were delicious.  This place is great for special occasions.

title: Great place for drinks and dining.
text: Great place for happy hour. Visited several times while in Portland. Great drinks, great food, great service, and wonderful views of the city.

title: What a dinner…
text: Excellent food, drink, ambience and service. Couple that with an old school vibe and an amazing view, and it makes for a great dinner.  We loved it and would return.

title: Portland City Grill Delivers
text: Best dining experience ever!  We wet for dinner and had the seafood tower, it was so good.  If you ever visit Portland, the City Grill is where you need to go!

title: Nice, but not great
text: It was a little out of the way from where we were staying.  Our initial waitress obviously did not know much about the menu.  She gave us incorrect responses to our questions.  Upon entering we were asked in a rather abrupt way to show our vaccination cards - we all 6 had these, but it was not done in a very nice manner.  Dinner was good - not great.  I would not tell someone to waste their dining experience here, especially given the wait staff.

title: Best brunch in years
text: The menu was very unique giving the 4 of us the opportunity to try new things and everything was excellent! The flavors just combined to make everything so tasty. Service was good and the total price very reasonable for the quality of the food and the time we were able to spend there as a small group.

title: Birthday burgers done...WRONG!😔
text: Please don't waste your $72.00 plus $11.00 tip, on 4 tepid cheeseburgers with greasy onion rings... one batch of onion rings were unbearably salty!! Such a bummer...I was so looking forward to the burger on my birthday...My birthday!!!  My Grandson and I went before ownership changed hands and burgers and onion rings were stellar!!!
