Today we ordered 2 medium well burgers and that were served well done! And 2 burgers well done. Bacon was so overcooked nearly burned and cold on all burgers..lettuce wilted..one burger was obviously old meat that tasted weird. I did want to make the owner aware, respectfully ...I didn't want to complain... However, if it were my business I would want to be informed!  Heidi the owner said she would bring it to the cooks attention...no sorry...no  apology, no attempts to make it right and was obviously uncaring and that's why I am submitting the review...(too busy taking pictures of what she was about to post)...We were sooo hungry !! No one was there except us!!! Over cooked and WAYYYY!!overpriced!!! Wish we had not tipped !!!

title: Just before the Covid 19
text: It was just before the Covid 19 lockdown that we were able to make the trek out for lunch.  I totally feel like a tourist taking pictures of my food.  What really stood out was the cinnamon roll.  Oh my.  Super light so not sure I would call it that.  It was more like a light French pastry.   I’d make the trip just for another one of those.   Ouch was good too as well as friendly service.  Nice experience.

title: Deserves 6 Stars!
text: Our friends raved about this place, so we had to go. And we’ll go back every time we’re in Portland.  My husband’s burger practically melted in his mouth, and he thought the catsup (is there bbq sauce mixed in?) was crazy good on his fries. The breakfast brisket I ordered was nothing like expected. Layers of sautéed kale and other veggies, tender meat, and crispy waffle topped with a perfectly fried egg. The fingerling potatoes were piping hot, sooo fresh and flavorful. My husband, a home brewer, thought the beer selection was diverse enough for hoppy lovers and brown ale fans. We were impressed with the local pilsner and ale we had.

title: Worst dining experience ever
text: I have never had such a regrettable dining experience anywhere. They did nothing to accommodate my nephews food dislikes and my wife’s  dairy allergy. There was no salad option offered other than one with cheese and sardine dressing. But the real clincher was the beef dish we ordered for $65….. At that price we figured it was a good quality NY strip. WRONG….no exaggeration, they brought a plate with THREE slices of beef- THREE!! And the measurements were probably- and again no exaggeration- 3 Inches long  by 1 inch wide and a quarter of an inch thick—I couldn’t believe it- $200 later, we left hungry and with the feeling we were ripped off

title: 5 bites for $200? Alrighty then ...
text: 5 tiny less-than-appetizer-sized "courses" for $200 not including drinks. Wife and I both needed snacks when we got home so as not to go to bed hungry. Maybe we just went on the wrong night, but really not sure why half a meal would be the thing to serve on Valentine's. I was super disappointed, especially after hearing great things about their usual fare. Yeah, it was mostly really tasty (couple off notes), the service was great, good cocktails, nice atmosphere and all...  but where's my f-ing dinner? At the end of the day it's a restaurant, and I came for dinner, and I paid a hefty price for it, and we cleaned our plates and walked away pretty damn hungry. I don't get it. And I probably never will...

title: Mostly very good
text: Our tasting menu dinner was very good, everything that was erved was sublime except the beef course and the dessert. The beef wasn't an especially tender cut, and the dessert tangerine sorbet had a rather bland flavor.  But I would defineatly go again, for a special occasion. The cocktails were really really good.

title: family gathering of 11, prix fixe 7-course seafood dinner
text: Food was mostly excellent, the only dish that was memorable for not being spot on was the swordfish which was too salty and overcooked. Two of us had the wine pairing and both were very pleased with both the wines and the descriptions provided. Sat outside in the covered outdoor patio, for folks seeking a romantic atmosphere it might have been better inside. Overall a terrific experience, very friendly and knowledgeable servers.

title: Highly recommend the 7 course chef’s tasting menu!
text: We 3 had the 7 course chef’s tasting menu and we shared a bottle of wine. The sommelier did a great job recommending a wine that would work well with the range of flavors. It did go very well with the meal which was outstanding. The food was wonderful and beautifully presented. The service was outstanding. We had a terrific evening.

title: Great ambiance  and food.
text: Had a wonderful time at Cassidy’s. We ordered off the specials menu … “Short ribs over Risotto” Divine! Tip; Always order off the specials menus as it is always revolving and delicious. The ambiance is classic old Portland with its oak bar, wood floors and wood paneled walls.

title: A Hidden Gem in NW Portland
text: On Saturday night, we were invited to dinner by a friend at Cassidy's Restaurant. What a nice surprise! After 26 years spending lots of living nearby in the Pearl, we discovered this place that has been there since 1979. The food was excellent, the dining room was peaceful, and the wood paneling and flooring provided a great NW atmosphere. The bar is as attractive as it looks on their website. The menu was very good and the cost was very reasonable. Try it out.

title: Hidden Gem in Downtown Portland, Oregon
text: Ok, this has to be some hidden gem in downtown Portland.   My wife and I stayed at the Crystal Hotel for her birthday and wanted a good steak for dinner. After researching through all of the ungodly expensive steakhouses in Portland we found Cassidy's and decided to give it a shot since it was a 5 minute walk away.  Walking in, the ambiance was great. The decor reminded me of a 40s or 50s era swanky restaurant with a gorgeous bar. The place is dimly lit with candles on the tables, which gave a very intimate feeling and was perfect for our date.  We went on a Friday night and it was just empty. I made us reservations expecting a busy restaurant and it wasn't necessary and totally surprising with how good this meal was. Like I said, total hidden gem in downtown Portland.   I'm vegan and my wife isn't so she NEVER gets a good steak anymore. She loves salad too so she ordered the Grilled Flank Steak Salad. Perfectly cooked and seasoned small piedmontese sirloin, organic greens, smoked blue cheese, pickled red onion, pear, candied hazelnuts with a blood orange truffle vinaigrette. She loved every bite!  The only mistake of the evening was she asked for no blue cheese and when she got the salad it was loaded with it. We sent it back and our server replaced it ASAP. However, they sent back the same steak that she originally got instead of remaking the entire dish. A little off-putting, but the steak was so good my wife loved it even when it was cold.   That series of mistakes would normally have taken away the 5th star but.....the heavens rejoiced when the chef created that Vegan Risotto!  The dish is arborio with roasted turnip, parsnip, and rutabaga, caramelized pear on top, and a vegan cashew brie stirred in.   I've always wanted to try risotto, but with my dietary restrictions I can't have cheese and dairy. I was super excited to see this on the menu for vegans and every bite was divine!! Creamy and cheesy, the rice was perfectly cooked and those roasted veggies were soooooooo good!!! I'll be honest, I wasn't sure what to think about the caramelized pear on top (I'm not usually a sweet dinner kind of guy) but the bite all together was complex rollercoaster of flavor that I never wanted to end. I was truly sad that the meal was gone and I couldn't have seconds!  We ended the night with a creme brule dessert that the server comped us for the salad mistake. It was an orange citrus creme brule and my wife enjoyed every last bite.  My only real critique and thing I felt lacking was there wasn't a dessert option for a vegan even though there is a vegan dish on the menu. I had to sit and watch my wife eat dessert while I sipped on my water. Even if it was just a light sorbet with some mint for a pallet cleanser, a vegan friendly dessert to wrap up the awesome vegan meal would be super appreciated.   Our server. I feel bad because I didn't get his name but he was a trooper! He was the host, the server AND the bartender. There was some other staff for sure, but the guy working the evening shift on 12/09/22 behind the bar deserves a raise!  We'll definitely be back next time we're in Portland!!!  #kudostothechef

So disappointed.  I brought my daughter here because I thought everything was fabulous before covid.  Unfortunately, nothing was amazing.   We ordered the Brussels sprouts for the appetizer and the raviolis and steak salad.    The Brussels sprouts did not have a lot of flavor.   The descriptions for the raviolis sounded amazing with the ingredients of beef, ricotta and honey.   I detected no ricotta or honey and all we received were 4 squares of ravioli for $26!   The salad was described as having blue cheese, pears, candied hazelnuts and onions.  This was a $25 salad.  The steak was very small and barely any toppings.   It's really too bad.

title: Nothing spectacular
text: The restaurant is in an older building that is looking tired inside (and that's different than vintage). It doesn't really have any identifiable appeal. However, the food was good and everyone seemed to enjoy their meals. Many people took advantage of the "dine in Portland" $33 - 3 course special. I had crab cakes that were very tasty. Brussel sprout appetizers and the fresh bread were both fabulous.

title: Trendy
text: A lovely, lively restaurant that is trendy in food options. Great service (from Julianne) and delicious entree, large plentiful fresh salads and good appetizers.  We enjoyed delicious wine and a drink. So glad we chose this restaurant!

title: Great place
text: Excellent food and excellent service. The menu had all the right notes and did it very well. The Osso buco and the salmon were perfect.

title: Great food and service
text: We did the food cart scene in Portland. Wanted to try something different so read the reviews on this restaurant and they were all excellent reviews. Went there and had a great dinner. We had two salmon dishes, and they were excellent our waitress was very attentive .

title: Wow, wow, wow
text: Wow, wow, wow.  Fabulous dinner, great service, cool / intimate setting. We were just walking by and stopped in, hadn’t no idea how great the experience would be. Outstanding meal.

title: Great food - very tasty!
text: Fantastic food - we had mushroom bruschetta and steamed buns and pork belly to start. They were so tasty and the two between three of us was perfect.  Then for mains we had the raviolini, halibut and a duck special. All of us were very happy!  The chunky monkey ice cream was also very tasty.  We tried this restaurant because if the great reviews and we weren’t disappointed. If we are back in Portland we would definitely return.

title: Lunch at Eem
text: Great friendly staff Efficient waiter Disappointing food Burnt ends white curry had very deccicated beef, and the curry was thin The Fried chicken was deftly fried, but had little flavor, either in Chicjen or spices

title: Bday Dinner
text: While visiting Portland for my wife's bday, we came here for dinner because it was recommended by a Lyft driver. Upon walking in, we were greeted very warmly with smiles. We were immediately seated. The waitress was very pleasant. I can't remember her name, but she was young with blonde hair and a facial piercing. She provided her recommendations by request. It took us a min to figure out what we wanted, but she was very patient.  We ordered the BBQ fried rice and boneless chicken thighs. It all came out hot and tasty. For dunks, we ordered Makers Mark whiskey with coke ave cherries and a tequila well drink. Both were delicious. We spoke to our waitress about how our time has been in Portland. She was very friendly. We ended the night with a special boozy slushy shot that she had made for my wife to help celebrate her bday. She put a candle in it and all. We loved that gesture!!!!  We highly reccomend this spot. Oh.. the ambiance was nice as well.

title: Beyond incredible, one of the best dining experiences ever!
text: There are not enough superlatives to describe our dining experience at Eem.  The White curry with Brisket Burnt-ends was absolutely superb, the Massaman curry with smoked lamb shoulder was beyond incredible, the Very Spicy Papaya Salad was delightful (and a good challenge to any pepper heads) and the Thai-style Ceviche provided an exemplary presentation and tasting of kanpachi.  You could really sense that the entire restaurant staff from greeters to servers to line cooks and chefs were committed to providing a memorable dining experience.   We can't wait to go back and try out the other menu items!

title: Memorable family experience - we all loved the food, the staff, the atmosphere!
text: Incredible restaurant - the atmosphere, the staff, the food are just excellent.  I was worried about what I could eat as I am not too wild about lots of spice, but a staff member spent time helping me.  Friendliest staff I have ever found at a restaurant.  I will definitely go back again and again.

title: Over rated don’t waste your your hard earn money
text: This was one of the worst experiences I’ve ever seen in portland. There’s a fantastic food scene in Portland and I would highly recommend checking out anything else. The food is yummy but very expensive and the service might be the worst I’ve ever come across. Save your money and check out anywhere else! Pretentious, entitled, and over rated! Do better!

title: Dinner after work
text: Great steaks and nice atmosphere. The bartender was nice as I sat at the bar and talked about Portland with the person who had just arrived. Would recommend for a special dinner or event as the restaurant is really nice. Oh yeah, good wine selection as well.

title: disappointed
text: This place is a gem in my book, exact during my last visit. My wife gets salmon every time we go which is more than 2 times a month. The place is expensive. My wife had to send her food back 3 times. The waitress basically was too busy to take my entire order every time I asked for something. My wife had to ask for a fork 3 times because the waitress forgot. They comped our meal, but after the sideshow with our loyalty account, it will be awhile before we return (we convinced our friends and now I regret it)

title: Delightful historic and traditional grill
text: Came for lunch. Old style grill that has been restored to former glory. Staff are kitted out in traditional French style with waistcoats and starched aprons. Greeted in a warm way. Sam took my order and looked after me very well. Started with a small cup of chowder, which was very creamy and thick. A nice small tasty starter. Followed this with an excellent seared beef tenderloin salad with delicious crispy toast covered with goats cheese. A most enjoyable lunch before leaving Portland to fly home. Recommend.

title: Nice job at what they do, ok location as well.
text: busy happy hour, nice vibe and decor.  server was friendly, not intrusive, but attentive enough.  Enjoyed what we ordered and it was what we were looking for.  American classic menu. Can be loud, but good for groups and families.  Dress code Portland casual.

title: Mouth watering prime rib and steak cooked to perfection
text: We decided to try Jake’s Grill and it did not disappoint!  We were in the mood for steak and prime rib and both meals were expertly prepared and absolutely delicious!  I highly recommend a Visit if you’re in downtown Portland.  Also the interior and exterior Tartarian architecture and craftsmanship was magnificent!

title: Above and Beyond: Food, Cocktails, Ambiance and Service
text: Many thanks to Chef Ryan Fox for preparing and serving such a wonderful meal for my family last evening! The food was wonderful, cocktails fabulous, and the ambiance and service made us feel as though we were dining in your home with your family. Thanks to you and your staff you made a family get together in Portland even more special - an evening we will remember for the meal and laughter for a long time to come.

title: What an experience!
text: I came here for my first ever solo dinner and was a little bit hesitant at doing so. I arrived and was shown to the kitchen, where all guests are seated and ended up being part of what was almost like a cozy dinner party. Seeing what all the chefs were doing, chatting with the head chef himself and getting to be totally immersed in a delicious meal was an experience that I won't soon forget. Thank you guys for an unforgettable night!

title: Amazing food, marginal ambiance, expensive evening
text: Ate here in November 2019 for our anniversary. We've enjoyed a number of tasting menus, so we were excited to try this one.  In the end, I felt it was pretty expensive for the overall experience. I wish I'd read the reviews more carefully before booking  Pros:  We all really enjoyed the food!  The serving sizes were perfect so we didn't feel stuffed by the 4th course.  The courses were all quite different & pleasing.  We all loved having 3 dessert courses (that might not be the case for everyone).  The staff was friendly & seemed to enjoy what they're doing. The wine pairings were nice with mostly regional producers (we had 2 pairings for 4 of us).   I received an email asking about food allergies two days before the reservation, which was nice.   If you enjoy watching the cooks in the kitchen, this would be a great choice - you are literally in the kitchen.  Cons:  We arrived rather dressed up for a special night out - shouldn't have bothered.  The ambiance is like having dinner with a bunch of strangers in someone's not so fancy garage.  I would have been happier & far more comfortable in a pair of jeans & a sweatshirt (like the guy next to me).  The communal table is very wide, so talking to our friends across the table was not great.  Considering we'd flown in for the day to have dinner with our friends, this was disappointing. I'd had prepaid for the dinner when I made the reservation but when we arrived there was a note saying that the tip was not included.

title: A Magnificent Evening!
text: While we were in town for a quick weekend getaway, we were looking for a solid tasting menu at a place we hadn't tried before. A number of different options presented themselves, and Nomad PDX kept popping up as a place we should take a look at. We decided to go with it and were, obviously, very happy with our decision!  The police is located in a pretty nondescript building that has some really cool space contained within it. You walk in and there's a very casual sitting area with tons of exposed brick, some fun lighting and some very modern looking Decour. It's an interesting mix of classic and modern styles.In doing so, they create a really nice area for people to come in and wind down. The adjacent bar is very cozy, and the dining area - which is literally a long table Just outside the kitchen - creates a very intimate dining experience and atmosphere.  This place apparently started as a pop-up restaurant they got so popular that they decided to open a standalone restaurant. Ryan Fox, the head chef, is doing some really cool stuff here!  There wasn't really a theme to the dinner, other than being delicious.There were a total of eight courses, all of which showed a lot of creativity as well as consideration of the patrons... Mostly because they had three dessert courses!  The variety of foods was pretty awesome, and range from a Peruvian inspired ceviche, to a trout collar serve with flatbread and different butters, to a celery root foam and desserts that included the use of liquid nitrogen (food science is fun!) The trout collar was an absolute hit, as it showcased a really nice portion of the fish that a lot of people don't often pay attention to. Another big hit was a squash soup served with pumpkin bread and chestnut butter. It ends up chestnut butter is awesome!  The favorite dessert was also the signature one. They call it the nest egg, and it is beautiful! Trying to describe and greens does not do this thing justice, but let it be known that this is one of the more beautiful and delicious desserts we've ever experienced!  The measure of a great meal isn’t only the food, but arguably more the entire experience- At the end of the night, we walked away knowing a new group of people who are also big fans of food, and having had a meal that we won't soon forget. If you have an opportunity to go dine at this place, you should absolutely take advantage of it!

title: Below expectations based on reviews on restaurants in East Portland
text: First of all, it is not associated with the NoMad hotel in vegas or any name similar. Tasting menu served at communal tables of about 15-16 guests. The 6:00 PM seating was almost full but some dinners were late, as late as 30 minutes past the hour and the on-time guests had to sit and wait, kind of unfair to the on-time guests. No complimentary drinks or apologies were offered. Kind of unwise. Food is generally good, but mainly a few slices of peaches, grapes etc mixed with various cream and sauces. Nothing particularly innovative. The best item was the mushroom stuffed with chicken; the other protein dish, halibut was pretty soupy and uninspiring. More expensive than comparable establishments offering tasting menu in   the neighborhood.

title: Amazing!
text: Excellent service. Amazing food! The servers treated us very well. And explained each course very good. All in all an amazing experience!

title: Holiday Tea at The Adolphus
text: Carlos, Jitendra, and their entire team provided our group of 14 with an amazing Holiday High Tea experience  The treats were delicious, and Carlos’s commentary added to the overall atmosphere—an absolutely perfect afternoon.

title: Beautiful
text: Our ladies had a wonderfuk time at the Holiday Afternoon Tea!  Great service from Carlos and Jitendra!  Great experience!

title: Holiday Tea was over the top!
text: Carlos and Jitendra were magnificent! The food was delicious. We had the Holiday Tea. Their service was impeccable. Would definitely recommend and plan to come back!!

title: French room experience
text: A Good experience and Carlos was super friendly and knowledgeable with everything. Def recommend trying this spot. Variety and good service

title: Great!!
text: Colin was great. Cheesecake and affogato perfect ending to a good meal! The veal was great and the filet has great flavor. Colin was friendly  and made us laugh!

title: Excellent
text: All the food was fantastic! And the service was amazing. We loved Colin as our waiter! The crabmeat appetizer was delicious and the veal medallions entree was incredible!

title: Amazing craft cocktails
text: I visited the Woolworth while on a business trip with my boss. We sat outside on the rooftop patio and enjoyed a nice view of the city. The ambience was nicely appreciated after a long day of work. We ordered a few small plates and some craft cocktails. Everything was delicious, and our service was top-notch and I would definitely go back if I were in the area again.

title: Ask for Colin!
text: We had the best time here thanks to Colin - he recommended a Mexican version of the espresso martini my husband wanted and he loved the amendment! Colin was super attentive and a lovely person. We will be back!

title: Exceeded expectations
text: Our first dining experience at the woolworth exceeded expectations. Both the food and drinks were excellent. Our server Brayan was fantastic both personable and attentive.

title: Nice apt, friendly staff, good value!!
text: The prior reviews are quite old, so we couldn't count on TripAdvisor reviews for Dunas Park Beach Club.   The reception staff (including Tania) were absolutely delightful and very helpful. The apt itself was a one bedroom on the ground floor. It was quite spacious for the two of us and had a patio/sitting area out back looking out on the garden.  The WiFi signal was good, the TV only had one English Channel (news). Never-ending hot water and great water pressure in the shower. The kitchen was nicely stocked - even w sponge and dish soap!   All 3 floors of the apt can use the rooftop terrace, which allows you to see the sunset - or just walk to the cliffs/beach trail.   We didn't use the nice pool (free) or other (paid) amenities like mini-golf, tennis, etc.   We really enjoyed the location and the apt!

title: not what you would expect from a 3-star
text: Minpoints: 1. dirty appartment and out-dated style. 2. There is a dirty-smelling watercleaning installation factory just on the corner. 3. Bad smelling and rocky beaches 4. You have to pay for wifi   Pluspoints:1. The nearby village is nice 2. The swimming pool is ok. 3. The view from the rooftop is nice  Personally, i would not book this hotel again. The beaches are also very windy and pretty cold

title: Average stay
text: Stayed here in 2005. Check in was ok. Room was ok with a kitchenette. Some cultery within the drawers needed clean, we didn't use them, Bought plastic forks from local shop. The pool area is lovely, although very busy in the evenings, i think they allow locals to use the pool, hard to find an empty sun lounger. The hotel is pretty much located next to the beach, which was nice if you wanted a change from the noise of the pool area. We didn't eat at the hotel, either ate out or made our own food in room.   Manta Rota is a very very quiet area in the algarve. Manta Rota is also a very small, quiet area. Not much to do. We spent most of our time further up the road in Monte Gordio, it's more liver with better selection of restaurants to choose from. Manta Rota is fine if your looking to sit and read a book all week. It was not the place that was sold to us, we were in mid tewnties, averge age was about 60 years!

title: Great food for date night
text: My husband and I had dinner here while on vacation. The decor is very “Dallas” if that makes sense to you. We reserved a table in the climate-controlled patio, which was a great choice. You get the city views while inside the cozy restaurant. Our server Pernod (forgive me if I’m butchering his name) was great, very attentive. And I can’t forget the pretty hostess that offered to take our picture (I didn’t get her name but we were there 10/27/25 if that helps and she wore black leather leggings and a red/black/tan flannel shirt, with longish black hair).  The food was amazing! I got the ribeye with tallow fries and my husband had the ribs with mac & cheese and cornbread. When I say all of it was good, I mean EVERYTHING was cooked just right-the steak was juicy and flavorful, the fries were hot with the right crisp balance, mac & cheese was creamy and seasoned, and the ribs were perfection! And the cornbread…I’m not even big on sweet cornbread but this here tasted like something from a deep south granny’s kitchen! I also had a classic margarita that was very well made, not too sweet or overwhelming. If you’re in the area, please check them out-great choice for date night. We will be back on our next trip to Dallas.

title: Great experience and a must-see place if in Dallas!
text: Great food, ambience and service! It was the first time I visited and would highly recommend if you are on business or pleasure.

title: Recommend to Everyone
text: Really enjoyed our dinner at Haywire! The atmosphere was great! Would recommend this to anyone. I got a special that was fish with some crab on it in a creamy sauce. Really enjoyed that! We also got the appetizer platter. Everything on it was great! Loved it.

title: Try the Venison Chili
text: I had a wonderful experience at Haywire. The staff was exceptionally friendly and polite, making me feel welcome from the moment I walked in. I tried the venison chili, which had the perfect amount of spice and was incredibly satisfying. I ordered the smaller cup was more than enough to fill me up. They certainly didn't skimp on the venison, which was tender and flavorful.

title: Why have a reservation?
text: I typically enjoy Haywire however, the past 2 times we have been awkwardly greeted by the hostess even with a reservation BOTH times.  The hostess seemed to be preoccupied and somewhat detached from greeting customers. The restaurant was maybe 30% capacity.  Slow Sunday around 1:30. The hostess tried to seat us at a tiny 2 top table on the patio. Our res was not for the patio. We asked if we could sit inside, and she hesitantly said "yes" and told us to have a seat and wait.....After waiting 10 minutes she took us past 6 open booths and 4 tables to sit us directly between two parties at another 2 top table.   We sat there for 7-8 minutes without being greeted by a server and decided to sit at the bar. When asked about all of the open booths and tables and we were told they were "reserved and for 4 or more guests".  We ordered two drinks at the bar and were handed menus.  The bartender was doing inventory and the service bartender stayed busy.   We had to flag down the bartender to order food after waiting 35 minutes.  The food was average.  My chicken was half breaded and the gravy was nonexistent which made eating it with the large biscuit dry and difficult. While sitting at the bar we noticed several of the booths were being sat with parties of 2. Upon leaving many of the tables and booths remained unoccupied.  The next time we Brunch in Dallas, this won't be high on our list.  The experience starts with the first face you see.

title: Not what it used t o be..................
text: First time to the new Suze.......they did a nice job with the new location; very pleasant and one of the few places that wasn't so dang loud that you could not carry on a conversation.  The server (Perry) did a great job.   The orkra special appetizer was certainly plentiful, hot, and  fresh however the dressing (Madras curry buttermilk ranch dressing)   "dip" lacked any hint of curry. The Porcini Pappardella Pasta was short on meat sauce unlike previous times my wife enjoyed that entrée.  The special seared dbl bone-in Heritage pork chop would have been great had it not been swimming in jus....the broth simply dissolved the polenta, wiped out the flavor of any apple chutney and soaked away the otherwise enjoyment of any distinct flavor of the "char" on the chop.  On the positive side was an outstanding Sticky Toffee Pudding.    Wish the overall meal could have been better as all the meals had been in the past.  Price was right at $140 for the two of us but considering all the restaurant choices available there really is no reason to go back.

title: Much Has Changed
text: It is sad to see what used to be our favorite restaurant change so much.   We used to go to Suze, when it was BYOB, at least 3 times per month ... pretty much almost every Friday.  We always requested and sat at the same table, and we always had the same server.  I think we ate there at least 50 times.  Interestingly, we met the owner and chef Gilbert during all of those visits just twice.  He wouldn’t recognize us if we were standing right in front of him.  Since Suze reopened in the new location, and opened a full bar, thus eliminating the BYOB option, we have only been back twice.  One of our favorite things to get on the old menu was their fantastic cheese plate.  But the last time we visited, that had been taken off the menu.  I guess when you get rid of the BYOB crowd, there is much less demand for cheese plates.  The rest of the menu seems pretty much unchanged, other than whatever the nightly special is.  Maybe the pastas are a little different.  Maybe a few more changes would be a good idea.  The argument that the loyal old crowd wants the same things may not be valid, my impression is that the crowd has changed.  The BYOB people were the foundation of the business, I remember seeing the majority of patrons arrive with their own personal wine bottle carriers.  That isn’t happening any more.  On one of our last visits, I won’t go into specifics, but my entree was inedible.  I took one bite and left the entire thing, and our server just picked it up and didn’t even bother to ask why I had not eaten any of it.  I didn’t want to bring it up myself or ask for something else, I just wanted to leave.    Despite these issues which have affected our interest in dining at Suze, I recently went online to opentable to make a reservation and was surprised to see that they no longer use opentable as a reservation service.  So I called the restaurant to make a reservation a week in advance, and got an answering machine.  I left a message with my call back number, and nobody ever called me back.    It’s a shame, but I imagine they are not doing very well if my recent experiences are representative of how things are handled these days.  But I wish them the best.  We have a lot of memories there.

title: Great restaurant in a new, larger, very nice location
text: Another excellent meal @ Suze on New Years Eve! One of our favorite places in Dallas. Can’t wait to go back again.

title: Overpriced
text: Small portions, not that great and high priced.    Kind of fancy for a strip mall, and just not what I expected.

title: Always great
text: My seventh time at Suze and they never disappoint.  The meal was spectacular and the service same.  Wine list is very strong and, as they used to be BYOB, they do not gouge you on the wine up charge so buying a bottle is reasonable.   My go to place for a special meal occasion as I can count on them to deliver!

title: Solid experience
text: Dinner was tremendous. The tuna tartare appetizer was unique and flavorful, and the short ribs and sweet potatoes (side) were great. VERY attentive wait staff & maître d’ across the board. I would highly recommend, and was available on short notice. Well worth any effort to visit.

title: Disappointment for date night
text: Disappointment. Tasting menu with great wine and terrible service. One entire dish was a huge miss. Does not happen at places deemed to be “future Michelin star” restaurants.

title: What a place!  Michelin star worthy
text: The culinary experience that we had at Georgie’s was absolutely spectacular.  From the greeting of the hostess to leaving the restaurant was 5 star.  The tuna tataki and French onion consommé were phenomenal starters.   I had the strip steak and my wife had the tortellini and they both were phenomenal.  We finished with the tart tartin and candy bar for dessert.  The depth of flavor that Curtis Stone has developed with his dishes is better than most Michelin star restaurants I have dined at.  Keep up the good work and we’re looking forward to seeing you again in the future.

title: Ridiculous Experience
text: Was excited to check this place out. We opened the restaurant for brunch with 10 ladies at 10:30 AM. Started off good and liked the waiter. We were celebrating an engagement. The bride to be didn’t get her food until 35-40 minutes after the rest of the party. We were seriously done eating and she still didn’t have her food. She ordered chicken & waffles and at first they stated that the chef didn’t like how her waffle turned out so the kitchen was remaking it - fine, right? - but then the chicken supposedly burned while the waffle was being remade. They brought out a mini plate of salad and 1/2 portion of salmon benedict with caviar which went to waste because our friend doesn’t like salmon or caviar. Her food finally came out and then we were told they were preparing a special dessert to make up for the mishaps and delivered out spoons to all. We waited another 15 minutes just to have two SMALL plates of sorbet delivered out to share. I was like, “That’s what we were waiting on?“ Geez. The waiter apologized for everything and said that they took some items off the bill, but they only adjusted the bill for the chicken and waffles. The manager was so disengaged throughout this whole 3 hour brunch. Good Lord! She acted indifferent. If I had been in charge, I would’ve asked the person if they wanted something else from the menu as clearly there was something going on in the kitchen behind the scenes. I also would have sent a round of champagne out to the group and took off not only the chicken and waffle entree but the two plates of shared scones. Cute place but probably won’t be back. Service is way too important to me. Food was good overall but not enough to make up for a bad manager and the terrible amount of time we waited for one thing or another.

title: A real gem of a place!
text: How is it possible that a restaurant of this calibre has a handful of reviews!!!   This is an amazingly beautiful restaurant with incredibly attentive staff and their food is to die for. Honestly by far the best restaurant experience (of this type) of our Texas trip and we will definitely make the point of returning here if we ever come back.

title: Average, At Best!
text: We went to Celebration for dinner with family during a recent trip to the Big D… venerable old school place, around for decades.  The place is cool in appearance, stone building, nice outside patio!  The appeal is nostalgia… not good quality food IMHO.    The table ordered soup, fried chicken, fried catfish, baked chicken, grilled salmon, and a handful of sides.  The lentil soup was very good, but everything else was just OK!  None of the food was particularly hot, and with fried food, it’s gotta be hot!  The veggie sides were warm at best… seemed most of the food was cooked in advance, which allowed for speedy delivery, but quality suffered.  Desserts were also just OK, even the kids didn’t finish them.  Service was great!  But, beyond that, our visit was disappointing.  The place had received a lot of hype from family.  We don’t need to go back.

title: Great food!
text: Food and servers excellent. We were seated quickly. We chose our food and we were served in a normal time. We were both pleased with the taste of our food. We will definitely be back on our next trip to Dallas.

title: The Best
text: This restaurant never fails to delight. Service is high quality. Food is fresh and tasty. Love the charm of the place. I take all our visitors there and everyone, family, friends, etc love it and ask to go again!

title: A great place for a celebration or a night out with family
text: This is a great spot for a locally sourced, delicious meal with lots of menu options in Dallas. It’s worth a stop if you’re visiting from out of town and looking for a family friendly, reasonably priced, unique dining experience. Celebration has been a local favorite for years, and we love trying the specials as well as eating from their standard menu. Their salads are always  fresh, the tea is strong and fresh brewed, and there is a good selection of entrees providing choices for everyone. The restaurant itself is quaint with photos on the walls depicting various stages of their history. There a little mini dining rooms with several booths and tables as they have had several space add-ons over the years. Definitely recommend stopping here if you haven’t already!

title: ok
text: last-minute choice for lunch. I had a turkey club, no cheese no sprouts. Oddly it was served with tortilla chips and salsa. The sandwich was actually quite good and I enjoyed it. Hubby had the grilled pork chop with mashed potatoes and roasted beets. They were also.

title: Beautiful Elegant Yet Fun Ambiance
text: I had dinner here tonight and give this place 5 stars due to the attentiveness and ambience. The decor, including a huge fish tank with a submarine inside catches your eye right away. Steak was amazing, and the staff gave me a surprise dessert when I told them I was celebrating a milestone accomplishment with work. They also promptly called me just as I was leaving the parking lot to inform me of an item left behind (at first I wondered how they even knew my number but figure they got it off of OpenDoor). Highly recommend this place and would definitely visit again.

title: A decent steakhouse with a decent vibe
text: Alright, so we went on a Friday night and had a res for 8:15. Valet was easy. The hosting staff was amazing and gave us recommendations and were super friendly. We waited about 15 minutes to be sat because she said she wanted us in the main dining room after we told her our monthly steakhouse review plans. Sweet girl. We talked with them almost the whole wait. The decor was cool, including a giant fish tank and car in the dining room. The atmosphere was loud and vibrant with a cool guy swagger. Our server was exceptional and made some suggestions as well. We ordered the filet mignon, cheeseburger and fries, (one of the recommendations by hostess), mac and cheese, fried brussel sprouts, and passion fruit kickers. Okay, so they cook their steaks over some cedar wood and I just wasn't the biggest fan as it tasted smokey and almost bbq'd and I guess I'm a bit of a traditionalist when it comes to steak. It was cooked perfectly but I had a hard time getting past the woodsy flavor. The voodoo sauce they served with it was SLAPPIN. Request it if you go. They told us the cheeseburger and fries were better than Hudson House. Nope, as it was really, really salty and you could feel the salt crystals in your mouth. The mac and cheese was okay but mine is better and the brussel sprouts were the star of the show with a tangy honey mustard flavor that we both looooved. We didn't do dessert, which is a travesty, but nothing really spoke to us. No tears overall (yes, I sometimes cry when i eat really good food). The meal was $150 and we left $60 for tip and $5 for valet for a total of $215. Food: 5/10 Ambience: 8/10 Service: 10/10 Next up is Pappas Brothers for anyone who cares, but I'm excited and this is fun. Much love.

title: MUST TRY IN THE ARTS DISTRICT
text: Had anniversary cocktails and apps here. SUCH amazing food and drinks. Service was EXEPTIONAL. I recommend everyone to go

title: Wonderful experience with a large group
text: We found this spot for a group of 20+ last minute on a busy weekend and they fit us in at a beautiful table and it was a wonderful experience.  The food was incredible but the service even better. They assigned us enough servers to make sure we were taken care of very well. The atmosphere was great, bathrooms clean...just a very well run restaurant.

title: Incredible Dining experience
text: My son who lives in Dallas had been bragging on this restaurant. We had reservations but still had a 20 minute wait to our table. The manager gave us an app on the house. The food was fabulous. Service was spot on.

title: Wonderful oysters and patio scene
text: Visited last weekend, sat outside on the patio and enjoyed a cocktail, oysters and pizza. It was delightful, the staff was attentive and the people watching was perfect. Best oysters I’ve had outside of dining in Maine!

title: Poor service.  Steak frites was too tough to eat.  Waiter and manager were not helpful.  They sat us outside when hot
text: Poor service from both manager and waiter.  Steak frites was too tough to eat.  It was very hot and they could not get the fans on us and would not seat us inside.  There were many open tables inside so could have been a racial thing

title: Stylish Ambiance, Top-Notch Service & Amazing Pizza!
text: Paradiso in Bishop Arts District is a fantastic spot! The decor and ambiance are incredibly fancy, creating a chic yet welcoming atmosphere. But beyond the beautiful setting, the service is truly professional, and the food is high quality. Every dish was well-prepared and flavorful, making for a great dining experience. A special mention goes to the pizzas—they were perfectly cooked, with a crispy crust and delicious toppings. Whether you’re looking for a stylish night out or just great food, this place is definitely worth a visit!

title: Pretty restaurant in bishop arts district known more by the locals.
text: This restaurant has a lovely interior decor and large fun patio in a lively area of Dallas, the Bishop Arts District. The place was very pretty for Christmas the holidays. Our server was nice but not super attentive and the food was pretty good not great and not above average. We ate early and it was still very loud in there so if it's a quiet meal you are seeking this place is on the loud side acoutiscally. I would like to go back for a drink on the patio in warmer weather. Lots of photo spots throughout.

title: RUN!!!
text: I rarely write negative reviews, but my recent experience at Paradiso Dallas was beyond disappointing. The AC was broken on a day when temperatures soared over 100 degrees, making for an unbearably hot and uncomfortable dining experience. To make matters worse, the restaurant was plagued with flies everywhere. They placed a broken fly fan on our table that was not only ineffective but also a potential safety hazard.  The steak frites were mediocre at best—the meat was a terrible cut and lacked flavor. Service was incredibly slow; we had to wait over 10 minutes just to get a drink or water refill. It felt like we were completely forgotten. Overall, this place was a letdown in every possible way. I wouldn’t recommend it to anyone.

title: AWFUL
text: I just left Ellen's and might I say it was the worst meal I have EVER had.  I am sure this review will fall on blind eyes and deaf ears. The food came out to fast and as I was looking at it I could tell it was NOT fresh.  When I told the waitress the biscuit was cold she gave me another COLD one.  The hash browns were cold and the the I know had been sitting there for awhile.  it looked pre made. When I got the new plate they just heated everything up in the microwave and by now everything was very rubbery.  I will not be returning to Ellen's,

title: Delicious Breakfast
text: I had a great breakfast here! I got the shrimp and grits and it was delicious! It was nice and hot temperature wise! The service was also great! Sarah was my server and she went above and beyond! I can’t wait to return when I visit Dallas again!

title: Perfect American breakfast joint
text: Our first experience of an American breakfast and it did not disappoint.  Great location, great food and great service and the price was reasonable for what we ordered and for the ambience of the place.

title: Go early to avoid the crowd. Get the Pancake Pot Pie!!!
text: Savory Southern delights. We started with coffee and water while we took a few minutes to read over the many breakfast options. We arrived early before a tour and avoided the crowds. We decide on the Pancake Pot Pie and Chicken Fried Benedict. The Pancake Pot Pie was absolutely delicious. Layers of fluffy pancakes stuffed between with eggs, bacon, sausage gravy and syrup. It was so fun to eat off of these breakfast items in a pot pie style. The Chicken fried benedict was good. I prefer my benedict with a lot of gravy. My egg was cooked perfectly, and the chicken crispy, I have no complaints but I think I would switch the salad side for a breakfast potato, I was so invested in the Pot Pie that the Benedict was over shadowed.

title: Very good Southern cooking
text: Ellen’s provides very good Southern style dishes from their flagship location in the West End area of Dallas.  We came here on a Tuesday for lunch and were immediately seated.  We ordered chicken fried steak with mashed potatoes and green beans.  The steak was great, the mashed potatoes were slightly bland but the green beans were excellent, mingled with tomatoes and bacon.   A by the glass Cabernet rounded off lunch.

title: Busy, delicious to-go options in the heart of downtown Philly
text: Crowded and bustling, between the tight fits amid the narrow aisles, you can find some amazing greasy-spoon lunch options frequented by tourists and locals alike.  There are several great options for cheesesteak and various Asian fare.  Best to get anything to-go, though, because tables are hard to come by and packed in tightly together where they do exist.

title: It was walking into a ToysRus store
text: I had read many reviews online and asked staff at my hotel all the food market. It was a 10-15 walk from my hotel and walking to the Reading Terminal Market was like walking into a toy store and not knowing what toy you want buy first.  There was so much  choices  of food available.  After walking round the market for around 10 minutes looking to see what I fancied I eventually chose a vender and had my first Philly cheesesteak.  Delicious, will defo go back again before I leave. Must do place for a visit.

title: More cities should have a Reading Terminal with its excellent regional food choices and great prices
text: I love coming to the Reading Terminal Market with the great selection of food stalls and the sights and smells as you walk around. I love their selections and the interaction between the locals and tourists when people are ordering.   Some of my favorite places to eat in Philly are here with Dutch Eating Place, Beilers Bakery and Bassetts Ice Cream. When Carmine’s was open, that used to be my favorite place for Cheesesteaks. After a meal, I like to walk around and look at the food displays. Everyone merchandises their food so nicely.  Don’t miss a visit here when you are visiting Philly.

title: Definitely recommend
text: Stop here when visiting Philly. Large variety of foods to choose from. Plenty of shop to look for souvenirs. Definitely with visiting especially if it’s your first time visiting.

title: Def worth a visit!
text: Well if you can’t find some food here, there is something wrong with you. All the local stuff you would expect plus bundles of ice cream, fresh meats and cheeses, and chocolate.  Well worth an hour of your time.

title: Worse tasting overpriced chicken parm I ever had in my life
text: I just moved to this town and was dying for a chicken Parm sandwich, and did not feel like going through the trouble of making it myself. Well, I certainly should have because this was the worst tasting chicken Parmesan sandwich I’ve ever had. I asked for extra cheese there was no cheese no sauce and when I first looked at it, I thought they had given me eggplant by mistake. That’s how thin and burnt the chicken cutlet was. It was literally all bread no meat to thin hockey pucks just terrible and they charged me $16 for it. Very very upset never again will I ever eat here!

title: Lunch disaster
text: Stopped for lunch for our Anniversary. The inside appears clean and pleasant so that was nice. Very few patrons so we figured we would get our order in quickly and be served right away. Boy were we wrong.  Our server was pleasant but not very knowledgeable of any of the dishes. Our order took 25 minutes to be served and it was extremely overcooked. Burned even. I had the chicken parm meal. It was burned and the pasta had zero flavor. Just an awful dish all around. Ordered cannolis for desert and those were equally awful.  Adequate service but the food was well below sub par. I hope I don’t have to eat here again

title: Fantastic
text: We have been here a few times and the food is amazing, and cooked fresh. The  staff is very friendly and you get great service. We would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone.

title: Trying the new place
text: I love Italian food, so I finally got to visit this place. Owners are great and maybe I just was a little picky on this day but the bread seemed to be soaked in butter and there wasn't much garlic taste. The Caesar salad lacked something but the saving grace was the eggplant. I'll overlook the bread and salad and swear by the eggplant.

title: Friendly Restaurant
text: My wife, son and I came to Marianna for. Marathon. My son’s first. We needed pasta the night before. Not many options for Italian in Marianna.  Tried Pennelo’s and were extremely happy. Pasta sauce had a great flavor. Salad was crisp and fresh. New York Cheesecake was perfect texture. Plan to run the marathon here next year and will choose Penello’s again

title: Harding Presidential Sites
text: We had a great visit to the Warren G Harding Presidential Library and Memorial. The Library (aka Museum) is quite small compared to other presidential libraries, but does a good job telling the story of Harding's short presidency. Tours of his home are only offered on the hour, so we had to miss that, but did take photos from the outside. We also visited the Harding Memorial in the cemetery, which was quite impressive. If you're passing by Marion, Ohio, take a break from your drive and stop by to see the presidential sites.

title: We watched a short film at the museum prior to the tour
text: Our guide was Theodore, he did an excellent job sharing his knowledge of Warren Harding and Florence- marriage, campaign and presidency. The tour started on the porch where his Porch Campaign took place. The house furnishings are over 90% original. NO Pictures allowed which is sad for my personal journey ablum. The museum has nice exhibits with a couple audios. Enjoyed watching the pictures taken on the Voyage of Understanding tour to the western states and Alaska. Purchase tickets on-line because we were shocked how the first 3 tours were fully booked. We changed our itinerary to make a late afternoon tour. Large parking lot. Restrooms on site.

title: Museum and House Tour Make this a fun Visit
text: A visit to this presidential library comprises three potential activities.  First, there is an hour long tour of his house.  Second, the main building includes a small exhibition of his time as President.  Lastly, a mile from the library is his memorial.  We spent just under two hours here.

title: Learning at the Warren G. Harding Presidential Sites
text: Great trip. We arrived at approximately 9:30 am and made our way towards the entrance of the museum. After paying the admission fee, we received a quick overview of the site and went on our way. We opted to view some of the outdoor exhibits first, which included the guard house and press house. The press house contained multiple informational plaques about President Hardings wife and her contributions to society. After viewing the press house, we made our way to the front porch of the house, where we waited for the 10 am guided hour tour to begin. There were guided tours of the presidents former house being held every hour throughout the day. The guided tour of the house was very informational, and the tour guide took us from room to room, while pointing out interesting features and artifacts out for display. The tour guide told us several personal stories related to the Hardings time at the house. The guided tour lasted roughly 1 hour.  After viewing the house, we went back inside to view the main exhibits. We opted to watch a short documentary about President Hardings life and some of the trials and tribulations he faced during his time as President. There were multiple informational plaques out for display, many of them quite text heavy, that went into detail about Hardings upbringing and roots as the owner of a newspaper company in Marion. The plaques also talked about election day, and several of the policy’s Harding implemented while in office. The last section of the museum dealt with his death and some controversial issues that surrounded his presidency. There were multiple artifacts out for display in the museum, along with short video clips that related to President Harding's time in office.  Tip: I recommend spending 3 hours here if you truly want to see everything.

title: Worth the visit!!!
text: I was very impressed with the Warren G. Harding Presidential Sites.  We took the tour of his house, and listened first hand from the tour guides all about when Harding gave speeches on the "front porch".  The house is stunning and is 90+ percent original from years ago when Warren and his wife Florence lived in the house.  The tour guides can answer any questions you have off the top of their heads.  The  Library & Museum was finished in the spring of 2021 and they have a nice gift shop in there too.  They spared no expense in the construction of the building - it is beautiful!!!!  If you are a history buff, this is a must do.

title: Nice apt, friendly staff, good value!!
text: The prior reviews are quite old, so we couldn't count on TripAdvisor reviews for Dunas Park Beach Club.   The reception staff (including Tania) were absolutely delightful and very helpful. The apt itself was a one bedroom on the ground floor. It was quite spacious for the two of us and had a patio/sitting area out back looking out on the garden.  The WiFi signal was good, the TV only had one English Channel (news). Never-ending hot water and great water pressure in the shower. The kitchen was nicely stocked - even w sponge and dish soap!   All 3 floors of the apt can use the rooftop terrace, which allows you to see the sunset - or just walk to the cliffs/beach trail.   We didn't use the nice pool (free) or other (paid) amenities like mini-golf, tennis, etc.   We really enjoyed the location and the apt!

title: not what you would expect from a 3-star
text: Minpoints: 1. dirty appartment and out-dated style. 2. There is a dirty-smelling watercleaning installation factory just on the corner. 3. Bad smelling and rocky beaches 4. You have to pay for wifi   Pluspoints:1. The nearby village is nice 2. The swimming pool is ok. 3. The view from the rooftop is nice  Personally, i would not book this hotel again. The beaches are also very windy and pretty cold

title: Average stay
text: Stayed here in 2005. Check in was ok. Room was ok with a kitchenette. Some cultery within the drawers needed clean, we didn't use them, Bought plastic forks from local shop. The pool area is lovely, although very busy in the evenings, i think they allow locals to use the pool, hard to find an empty sun lounger. The hotel is pretty much located next to the beach, which was nice if you wanted a change from the noise of the pool area. We didn't eat at the hotel, either ate out or made our own food in room.   Manta Rota is a very very quiet area in the algarve. Manta Rota is also a very small, quiet area. Not much to do. We spent most of our time further up the road in Monte Gordio, it's more liver with better selection of restaurants to choose from. Manta Rota is fine if your looking to sit and read a book all week. It was not the place that was sold to us, we were in mid tewnties, averge age was about 60 years!

title: WELL WORTH A VISIT! PRO TIP: THE RESTAURANT IS FANTASTIC!
text: This is a great way to spend 1 to 3 hours looking at some really unique art and learning about their creators. When we were there they had 100+ wildlife “action” photos on loan from the London museum of Natural History and it was fantastic. As an added bonus, the on-site restaurant had really good high-end food and live music at lunch time.

title: Awesome place
text: Heading to hike in the Grand Tetons we saw this place and decided to stop by after our hike, so glad we did! The art installations outside were great! (Loved the origami style statues). We ate lunch in the museum and the food there was delicious! They had vegetarian options also, I loved their soup (their soup is always vegetarian). Very happy with this stop and would check it out again

title: A "Must See" Museum!
text: The National Museum of Wildlife Art is located about 10 mins. outside of Jackson Spectacular monumental bronze sculptures are located thru out the museums outdoor campus, not to mention incredible views of the valley. Inside, a fabulous collections of paintings & sculptures  from the 1800's - present day and a really good Cafe' for lunch, snacks or just a few moments to sit. This museum's not to be missed.

title: Don’t Miss this Indoor Outdoor Museum on the Hill!
text: Most of our itenerary for Jackson was outdoors, but we kept passing the hillside with the museum’s quartzite walls cutting into the slope and drove up. I love sculpture and have a minor in art, so the sculpture trail hooked me and also brought me inside. The placement of each animal across from the Elk Refuge is so perfect and acts like a canvas in complimenting each sculpture. I especially loved “Great Northern” and “The Emperor” on the walk. We had a delicious lunch at the museum then enjoyed the interior art. “Chief” was magnificent. The museum is first class!

title: Spectacular Wildlife Photography
text: The art, sculptures, and photographs were interesting and the cafe fare was delicious with great views and friendly efficient service.

title: Great food and service!!
text: This place is a hidden gem and I can’t understand why it’s not packed!!!  Conch Fritters, smoked fish dip, red shrimp, shrimp po boy were all amazing!!!  Service is great!  Nice laid back place with amazing food!!!

title: Best fried shrimp ever and I do not like batter fried foods
text: Had driven into town for a vacation north of Jacksonville and needed to pick up someone at the airport.  Stopped into Chowder Ted’s the night before.  Wanted somewhere local and it had good reviews.  Only got to go, 3 things.  Chowder which was pretty good.  Fried shrimp order plain.  Fried shrimp order Cajun.  It was FANTASTIC.  Very lightly breaded.  Very lightly fried.  All the flavors and textures that come from frying something but not all the grease and batter that hides the actual shrimp.  I do not remember the last time I had fried shrimp.  It doesn’t even appeal to me.  I was the one that got the chowder.  But, when family flies into JAX next year for our annual beach trip, I will be going to Chowder Ted’s and buying several pounds of fried shrimp for all.  And I might stash a 1/2 lb for myself.

title: Delicious
text: So glad we stopped when passing through. Everything we ordered was delicious and the chowder was amazing. Will be back for sure.

title: Clam chowder not what you'd expect
text: Clam chowder was a red based chowder kind of a hot spicy stew. Not what we expected clam chowder to be  Food was good but expensive and small. Also service was slow.  Waitress was distracted just a few waitresses for a crowd. It's not a very big place. Probably only a dozen tables if you don't eat outside.   Try the palm fish camp about a mile away. It's excellent.

title: If the locals are always here, it’s got to be good. And it was great!
text: Rustic environment with excellent food and lots of options. We’ve driven by multiple times on our way to Jacksonville and were determined to stop this time. We got there around 11:45am, hoping to beat the rush, which we did. By the time we left, both the parking lot and restaurant were full. It was very obvious that the vast majority of the folks inside were locals. My wife had fried shrimp - about a dozen large shrimp with a very light coating of batter. Excellent! I wanted something not fried and opted for the full pot of the chowder. Also excellent! They say it’s made fresh daily, and it was. A medium sized pan filled with a tomato based, thick soup with fresh potatoes, celery and large chunks of tuna and diced shrimp. Highly recommend. Also available in a “half pot” if you’re not really hungry. Don’t drive by - go in and enjoy great food and service.

title: Good location and friendly staff….
text: This hotel is in a good location, a short walk to Bayswater tube station. It’s a safe location for a solo traveller. The  staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful. The single room was very cramped and the bathroom was so small it was almost impossible to use. Eventually I gave up on the shower, as, even for a normal sized person, it was a struggle to manoeuvre in and out. The breakfast room which I tried  only  once, was small and cramped as were the hallways and passageways. There’s a good cafe just around the corner. Some rooms may be bigger, so might be worth checking those out.

title: Excellent
text: Very pleasant and cozy, good location, helpful staff, very good breakfast. Be sure that I will reccomend it to my friends

title: Wouldn't stay here again
text: Stayed here from Sunday to Wednesday, arrived too early for keys but they allowed us to leave our cases until later when we came back, the staff were nice and told us they had upgraded our room, the room was nice but it was too small for 2 adults, one side of the bed and the bottom of the bed was less than a foot from the walls, there was a luggage rack but there was no room to use it, the air conditioning unit was on the wall in a little square by the door so the room didn't get any benefit from it, the bathroom was nice with a good size shower, all I could think was that I'd hate to see what room we were originally getting if this was an upgrade, they do have bigger rooms, I cant comment on the breakfast as we ate out, as nice as it was I wouldn't stay here again and I wouldn't recommend it, the only good thing was that it was a nice area and was easy to get around by bus, there was a tube strike while we were there.

title: Best dinner I ever had !!
text: I had the best dinner I ever had. The filet mignon was tender, cooked to perfection, and seasoned perfectly. The Greek salad dressing was amazing. The lemon ricotta cake awesome. Can't rave enough.

title: Romantic dinner
text: Wonderful dinner and service.  The lamb chops were delicious and the presentation was wonderful. Great wine selection!

title: Worth the Splurge
text: Marianna has almost no truly “good” choices for eating out. The Salt Block is a gift to this whole area of cheap eats and fried foods. The steaks are pricey but AMAZING-the restaurant is modest but clean. I am grateful for this restaurant and what they provide.

title: Skip the Dinner and Just have Dessert and Coffee
text: Sister and I went for dinner.  She ordered veal and I ordered the scallop and pasta special.  Her veal and potatoes were very good but the "vegetable medley" was a pile of mushy vegs. The best thing that could be said about my dish were the two blistered cherry tomatoes were tasty.  The bead size scallops were rubbery, the small amt of sauce was incredibly bland, and the dish was dry. The side garden salads were very nice size, fresh and good.  The salted caramel cheesecake was amazing and strangely enough, the decaf coffee  was truly terrific.  However, a $97 meal (we ordered no alcohol) with mushy vegetables and a non-edible entree was a big disappointment.  The reason I did not send back my entree was that it took 45 minutes for our meal to arrive.  There were 3 servers and 9 tables, so that was not the issue.

title: Good food but disappointing experience overall
text: 3 stars only because the food was good, otherwise an extremely disappointing dinner. Warning - Diner beware! The menu is exactly what you get, there are no options & there are no substitutions. Limited menu's are not a problem but I have found most restaurants offer at least a choice of vegetable & some bread & or side salad as part of the overall meal. Not this one. The night we were there, dinner came with garlic mashed potatoes & vegetable medley, no other options, no substitutions no exceptions. If you dislike something, like say, garlic or green beans too darned bad. I had the chicken Garcia, my partner had the 16 oz ribeye and a side salad, we both drank water. When the bill came we were shocked! Our meal came to almost $95! My chicken was $24, the side salad was $5, My partner's ribeye was $59!  Yes, it was listed as MP(Market Price), which means the price varies with the cost of the ingredients but really? I know the high price wasn't in the mashed potatoes or vegetable medley or my chicken dinner would have cost more so it must have been the steak.  It was tasty but it was not $59 worth of tasty. The staff, while friendly, were well versed in "we don't do that here".  We will not be going back.

title: The worst experience
text: .This has been the only bad experience I’ve had so far, even though I’ve visited many places. The level of disregard and poor treatment was extremely high. I do not recommend this place. Terrible customer service from the moment you walk in

title: The Cellar Boys on Tuesday nights are amazing; Green Mill service is lacking
text: This is said to be the oldest club in Chicago! We were here on a Tuesday night to see the Cellar Boys, and it was wonderful! We were disappointed to have to share a table, especially given that it was the night of our 30th anniversary and we are both introverts, but I do get it - it is a small venue. I cannot say enough good things about the Cellar Boys - wow, they were awesome! Service at the club was not great. I went up to the bar to ask for water as I was parched, and two people were behind the bar watching the band. I am easy to miss being only five feet tall, so I waved to the lady and she headed my way and looked really angry. Alas, sorry but I really needed water badly, and my server had not been around in ages! I left a tip on the bar and hoped for better days for her. Regardless of the service, I highly recommend stopping in to see the Cellar Boys!

title: Absolutely loved this iconic place
text: If you like Jazz this is an essential bar to visit.  The decor is amazing dating from 1934 and the jazz music was incredible. The drink prices were excellent too.  Very good cocktails for just $8.  Also really liked the bar staff.  This is definitely worth a visit

title: Probably not worth it unless you want to go to a true standing room only jazz recital
text: The atmosphere is awesome the service is decent, the jazz is usually excellent. One should know you are going to see a fine arts recital like an opera or Broadway show but it’s  $20 cover per person in a packed facility where you are lucky if you find a seat and you listen to 75% -80%  jazz and 25% - 20% of the staff saying “shhh” to everyone constantly. For a little bit coming out of covid they took it easy with the “shhhhh” but it’s back and in full force lol… I mean I was not alive one-hundred years ago but I am willing to bet the staff wasn’t running around “shhhhhhh” to everyone around you (except themselves of course) or charging $20 per person to walk into the door lol

title: Good artist but.....
text: The bar is rather dirty - lots of sticky stuff around.  I also found the staff fairly indifferent to the customers.  After reading their FAQ on their website I should have anticipated the service.  Other bars in Chicago have good shows, in clean places with attentive staff.

title: Worst Room Ever
text: When I checked in, the first key didn't work so the host moved us to another room. The TV did not work at all in that room so she moved us to another room. That room was atrocious. The security lock on the door was broken. The stopper for the tub was laying on the edge of the tub whether it worked at all, I don't know. There was a Q-tip on the floor in the closet. The bed had no full size pillows. It had 5 half size pillows. The TV was hit or miss. Some of the channels worked but they did not correspond to the guide sheet for the room. More channels did not work than did work, they came on but the picture was unviewable as if the signal was garbled. I will say, the host did all she could to give us a good room but I don't think she had one. I will never stay at that motel again. It is the worst room I have ever stayed in with Comfort Inns. It was noisy in the halls and we just didn't feel safe. The breakfast area was perfect and the lady that hosted that was very personable.

title: Do Not Stay Here!
text: Hotel is old, in a terrible part of town.  Rooms not cleaned , trash on floors, mold in windows and curtains raggedy and unable to close.  It appears homeless people are living there and hanging outside. Very unsafe and not worth the money  at all.   Could not wait to leave.  Best thing there is the front desk employees.

title: Big Poop Hole
text: What poo-hole.   Non smoking room stinks of cigarettes. Nasty bathroom has stains, holes in the walls and more.  No trash can in the room.  Staff is not interested in making one comfortable.

title: Awful Stay and Hotel in Poor Condition
text: DO NOT STAY AT THIS COMFORT INN! First it’s deceptive to say it’s at Main Gate at Ft Jackson (exit 12) when it’s several miles away st Exit 9. This hotel is old and dated and carpets are extremely dirty, paint issues everywhere and deferred maintenance. We checked in and had to be moved 3 times due to room issues. Room 200 had a leak in the ceiling with water dripping on floor and plaster falling from the season! While they are in the process of updating rooms on the first floor it still has major issues and not a Comfort Inn expectation. We also had someone outside our room in the parking lot from 9pm- 1am with car stereo playing loud and thumping while they smoked pot. No security and didn’t feel safe. Other options like Springhill Suites or Holiday Inn Express was priced the same and would have been better options. We would have checked out and moved but had a Nonrefundable reservation! This property needs to be closed and reopened when totally remodeled!

title: Convenient for Fort Jackson.
text: This is a nice place to stay if you are going to some activities at Fort Jackson.    The hotel is comfortable and convenient to several of the Fort gates.     It is near the interstate and access is very easy.      The hotel staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms are very nice.

title: Odd Duck Austin, at the Chef’s Counter: A Night of Personal, Palate-Driven Play.
text: From the moment you sidle into Odd Duck and slide into the chef’s counter, the meal feels less like a dinner and more like an edible conversation with the kitchen. The kitchen’s intimate choreography—flame, fork, and ferocious curiosity—sets a high bar for tasting-menu storytelling.  This night, seated inches from the heat and bustle, offered a stream of inventive bites that balanced seasonal audacity with comforting textures and precise technique.  The setting amplifies the meal: you’re not just observing the plate, you’re watching how intention becomes taste in real time. The energy from the cooks, the quick taste checks, and the moment-to-moment adjustments lend the tasting a live, improvisational rhythm.  Fresh draft watermelon fresca: A refreshing opener that primes the palate with bright acidity and fruit-forward brightness. The texture contrast and cooling finish likely set a playful, summery tone for the night.  Texas pickles: Expect a bold, tangy punctuation—crisp texture, assertive acidity, and perhaps a touch of sweetness. Pickles here are not an afterthought but a defining bite that signals the kitchen’s love for zesty contrast.  Pork belly slider: A classic anchor that often serves as the night’s emotional anchor—rich, satisfying, and balanced by a crisp exterior and perhaps a sharp pickled accent or herb pop. The slider format promises immediacy and comfort while still leaving room for technique to show.  Cast iron cheddar cornbread: This likely delivers a toasty, caramelized crust with a rich, melty cheddar inside. The cast-iron finish usually adds depth and a slight smokiness, offering a grounded counterpoint to lighter courses.  Redfish ceviche: A bright, citrusy, seafood-forward note that showcases freshness and technique in curing. The ceviche should feel clean, with a nuanced balance of acidity and a touch of brightness to keep things lively.  Thai apple salad: A bright, aromatic interlude—crisp apples, maybe herbs, heat, and a balancing acidity. Expect a playful balance of sweet, sour, and fresh heat, lifting the meal with herbal lift.  Fettuccine shrimp: A pasta course that blends succulent shrimp with a likely buttered, perhaps slightly citrusy sauce. Textural contrast and a clean, seafood-forward core would anchor this plate in comfort while letting seafood flavor shine.  Blackened redfish with mesquite and vanilla bean scoop: This sounds like a bold, smoky main that leans into spice, wood-fire aroma, and a surprising vanilla note—an inventive sweet-smoky finish that creates a memorable, almost mischievous twist.  Final note—Mesquite vanilla bean scoop: Expect a creamy, aromatic end that complements the savory notes with a gentle sweetness, leaving you on a soft, satisfying close.  Odd Duck Austin, experienced from the chef’s counter, delivers a distinctive tasting experience that blends seasonal clarity with adventurous flavor experiments. It rewards diners who embrace curiosity and savor the storytelling arc of a well-curated menu. If you’re craving a night where the kitchen feels like a collaborative partner rather than a distant authority, this counter-seat experience is worth seeking out.

title: One of the best in Austin!
text: We have eaten here many times. We always return. Why? Because it is one of the best in Austin. The service is excellent. The food is amazing!! We haven’t found any place here or in the DFW metroplex that compares! You will not be disappointed. Even if something sounds questionable, it is usually the best ever!!

title: Amazing staff!
text: We met with a friend to enjoy some bites at Odd Duck, happily surprised that valet parking is free (tip-based). Our waiter was beyond accommodating to our needs. When my fiancé told her his dietary needs, she returned with the seasonal menu marked up to help him know exactly what to order—wow! We sat in the enclosed porch space and it wasn't too loud or cold. Our meal was great and the staff is exceptional.

title: Best restaurant in Austin, consistently
text: We eat at Odd Duck a few times a year; they occasionally miss the mark with a dish or two, but generally over 2-3 visits a year for the past 5 years, they are consistent, with delicious food and friendly service, at prices that we feel good about, for the value. Cocktails are complex, layered, and super tasty.   We've tried a lot of other hyped up restaurants in Austin and been disappointed often. We'll come back to Odd Duck again and again.

title: Farm to table done right
text: Amazing farm to table restaurant with rotating menu based on seasonal ingredients. You can’t go wrong with the pork chop and ceviche but the real star was the cast iron corn bread. Drinks on great as well, highly recommend

title: Odd setting, service good, food and coffee poor
text: We had breakfast here as staying in The Fairnont, this restaurant is located inside it. Odd setting for a breakfast within a smart classic hotel, it felt like we were sat in a theme park. The service was attentive and friendly.  The coffee was terrible. A very poor cappuccino which tasted and looked like from an automatic machine for $6.  My omelette was ok and perfectly acceptable. The side of fingerling potatoes were very simple, lacked seasoning, a bit under cooked and slightly dry. I was disappointed to receive pre-prepared, deep fried hash browns rather than the classic American diner version. The sausage side was tasty, the highlight of the meal.  With tip, $60 was overpriced for the quality of the coffee and dishes received.

title: Nice Italian restaurant in the Fairmont
text: We had a very nice Italian meal at this resturant. Upbeat vibe, good food, adequate wine list and excellent service. Attire was dressy casual.  We dined at about 7 pm on a Sunday night and it was not a problem to get a table. That said,  best to make a reservation.

title: Ok but not great
