text: We saw that the restaurant had good reviews so we gave it a shot. Have nothing negative to say, but not anything good either. So 3 stars as I consider it average. Had dumplings and Fried rice with mushrooms. Price a little high for average food

title: Review of Revue
text: Revue captures the imagination and breaks the boundaries of what you would expect from a traditional restaurant experience. With multiple themed areas scattered throughout you are sure to have a different “view” each time you visit. Our family of four was seated on “Garrisons” family porch overlooking the “courtyard” bar as dusk beamed through the surrounding “tree” foliage. Needless to say the theming of the entire space was on the level of a Broadway stage. The food here is absolutely delicious! Every dish we tried was bursting with flavor and cooked to perfection. The portions were appropriate and everyone left satisfied. I highly recommend the Pea Risotto and Prosciutto Pizza. The sourdough pizza base made my partner question their loyalty to our local pizza shop! The night was made complete with our amazing server Tugce. She was friendly, attentive, and went above and beyond to ensure a memorable dining experience. She was incredibly knowledgeable about the menu and offered excellent recommendations as we navigated the mouthwatering menu. She was attentive without being intrusive and made us feel like family. Truly outstanding service from start to finish. Don’t walk, RUN to this amazing establishment inside The Fairmont Austin.

title: Delish
text: Tugce was amazing (our server). I highly recommend the garlic bread (big surprise), pizza, oysters, and shrimp cocktail. All was sooo good!

title: If You Love Salt...
text: The atmosphere?  Great!  Service? Exceptional!  Cleanliness?  Terrific!  The food?  SALTY!!  Overly so too.  The queso was the best part of the whole meal.  Could've been an off night but we were disappointed...

title: Fantastic Restaurant for Dine-In or Catering
text: We hired Verdes Restaurant for catering at our recent event and were absolutely blown away! The food was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented — every guest raved about it. The service was just as impressive: professional, organized, and so easy to work with. They made the entire experience stress-free and elevated our event in every way. If you're looking for top-tier catering with unforgettable food and seamless service, Verdes is the way to go! Highly recommended.

title: Good Tex-Mex in Dripping Springs, TX
text: Verde's delivers quality Tex-Mex food.  Another good meal enjoyed recently...  the complimentary chips and salsa are da bomb!  Light crisp chips, and the salsa tastes like it just came out of the garden... super fresh ingredients!   We had a couple of the "Lime in the Coconut" cocktails, reminiscent of a pina colada, but better, and not too sweet.  Very good.  For food, we settled on the  pollo flautas (chicken flautas) and the fish tacos.  Both were very good, and the flautas were some of the best we've ever had.  The tacos were stuffed full of fish and fresh veggies.  We sat at the bar this visit, and the bartender was super-busy, so not much time to visit.  Recommend Verde's for good Tex-Mex in the Dripping Springs area.

title: Poor business practices.
text: Went in for lunch. Person behind bar told us 20 minute wait. 3/4 of restaurants empty. Ignored us. Just left. Can find another place easily. At least sit us down with drinks.

title: "Great People, Great Food"
text: ​Stopped by Verde’s for dinner this past Saturday.  We decided to dine at the bar, as the STL Cardinals game was just starting on the TV behind the bar!!!  Met Brandon working behind the bar, who turned out to be one of the owners, and originally from my home state of MO, and also a HUGE Cardinals fan!  His Cardinals baseball cap was a giveaway!  LOL   It felt like it was going to be a good night… and it was!    We started with complimentary chips and salsa, which was delicious​:  super crispy ​corn tortilla ​chips, lightly salted, and a very fresh, salsa with just the right amount of heat.   We ordered a couple of appetizers, the ceviche and the calabaza cakes.  The ceviche was super fresh, and the fried flour tortilla chips served alongside made a good pairing.  The liquid wasabi ​drizzled beneath the chips was a bit of a surprise, but​, alongside the mango drizzle, it was good.  The calabaza cakes are spaghetti squash and stewed chicken atop a poblano cream sauce.  A tasty and delicious combination, and the cream sauce was sublime!  For entrees, we enjoyed ​t​he fish tacos and shrimp ​​mojo dishes. The ingredients in both dishes were super fresh, freshly prepared, and seasonings were on point.  Simply put, both entrées were outstanding!  We tried several margaritas during​ ​our meal, and we would have to say that the Skinny Holly was our favorite.  We were too full to even think about dessert, so we will have to save that for next time.  Ending the evening on an incredibly high note, Brandon allowed us to take an empty bottle of one of our favorite tequilas served at the restaurant, Clase Azul Reposado.  Excellent tequila, in a hand-painted pottery bottle.  I can also vouch for the Verde’s grilling seasoning sold at the bar. ​ I used it the following night at home, and it is outstanding…​  Great people, great food!  A bit pricey, but not bad.   We’ll definitely be back!!!  I do need to apologize for some of the photos included with this review​; as noted above, there was a ​Cardinals' ​baseball game on​,​ so I did not get pictures of some of the dishes until they were partially eaten!  LOL

title: Excellent Dinner
text: This is a large and first rate restaurant in the heart of downtown. My food was excellent-I had the Chipotle Honey Salmon and a side salad, and my cocktail was good and strong. Service was friendly and quick.  One note: I sat outside in decent weather and it was very nice.

title: Service bad / food good.
text: Got a reservation within minutes of arrival ( it was 11:55am we wanted and were able to secure a noon reservation without issue).   We sat at the bar, we were told 3 times we’d get water ( never arrived ).  Had it not been for a manager who I flagged down, I’m certain I’d still be waiting to place an order.    The spicy guacamole was top notch - do order this.    The steak and eggs was good.   The house salad was very good - do order this.   Spicy Bloody Mary is very spice - do order this.

title: Nice vibe, food was disappointing
text: The vibe is really lovely in the restaurant, and it’s one of the busiest in Austin too. However we felt that the food was average at best - we had to send back both of our sides as they arrived before the entrees and were both cold! The service was also very slow, and food took ages to come. Nice vibe, but not worth it for the price and the wait.

title: Brunch burger
text: Salad delicious and burger great but came out well done when asked for medium rare - reordered and came out juicy! Attentive service. Nice bar scene.

title: “Like a Chili’s”
text: We went here because it had pretty good reviews and I would say we found it to be average. The host said that of the hotel restaurants this one was like a “chilis” vs the steakhouse being like a “Ruth’s Chris”. That set the tone for us to expect average. Our waiter was very good and attentive. The restaurant has several different areas for seating and we were near the outdoor bar.  I would not go back.

title: Great service but preferred food next door
text: I loved my lasagna at Vespaio so decided to try their sister restaurant next door. At least I think it’s a sister restaurant - it sometimes is known as Enoteca Vespaio in articles I’ve read. Service at the bar was very good and the food was decent. I had the Caesar salad (should have declined the anchovies) and the rigatoni with arrabiata sauce and pork meatballs. The menus were very similar. I just preferred my meal and the cozy ambiance at Vespaio next door.

title: Nice place in the heart of Texas.
text: You are in the heart of Texas when you are in the city of Austin.  Many things to see and do and many great places to eat and drink.

title: DON’T Do it.
text: Awful food. Overpriced.  Their chicken Parmesan is easy to replicate.  Take a chicken breast, bread it, burn it in a pan (yes. Extra crispy), throw a can of tomato paste on it (generic can damaged from multiple floor drops) over cheese the top, add some spaghetti on the sides (like 1/2 the normal side portion), and BAMM—you saved 24 bucks.  Oh...make sure you have TUMS for the blowback later that night.   Mic drop!

title: Fabulous Happy Hour!
text: Fabulous Happy Hour with many choices and great pricing. The food was so delicious! Our server Ana was the best-very attentive and friendly. It was a great choice while on our vacation.

title: Good food, quite restaurant
text: We went on a Monday night so it wasn't to busy, sat at bar.  Had calamari not bad, could have been cooked longer.  Pork saltimbocca was very good served with spinach.  Bill was $50 without any drinks!

title: Nice place to eat off the beaten path
text: We arrived at the restaurant after 9pm (it closes at 10pm). We had a nice seat outside and a very friendly/good server named, Carlos.   We had a Cesar salad with salmon and the baby gems salad with shrimp added.  They were both really good!  It was a nice, easy and enjoyable experience.

title: Quick bite
text: A quick bite and drinks in the bar area. Service was top notch. No issues.  Nothing special but easy if you are a guest of the hotel.

title: Fabulous Drag Brunch!
text: We had a fabulous Drag Brunch! Performers were really amazing and absolutely stunning and the food & service was superb! Will definitely recommending it to all my friends! Shared this fun experience on my YouTube Channel @Rob Mahor if anyone wanna see it:) It was the best!

title: Huge disappointment
text: Went here with dogs.  Sat at outdoor patio service was fine but food not.  One of the recommended dishes was biscuits and gravy.  Did not finish and return to kitchen.  Got chicken and waffles.  Not much of improvement.  Wife got Benedict and not good at all.  Don't understand how this place is at top hotel and subpar food.  But I see many reviews below average

title: Don’t bother
text: The service was subpar, we waited for our drinks to be made for 15 minutes and they were not busy. When they came they were warm.  Apps were good.  My husband had the octopus which was fantastic and my arugula and avocado salad was good.  But our main meals were not good.  The steaks were under cooked, we sent them back and they came back just as under cooked.  The only saving grace was the music.  I would not go there again.

title: Delicious food, great service and comfortable atmosphere
text: We had an excellent dining experience and were well looked after from the moment we arrived. The food was delicious at a reasonable price. The atmosphere was relaxed and enjoyable

title: Good but not over the top
text: Food was good, but I expected much more from this famous restaurant…service was also very slow and not at the level it should have been

title: Salt bombs
text: Creative menu. Ordered halibut and ceviche and quesadilla and guacamole and several other items. The sea bass looked fantastic and flavors were promising. Big issue: everything was oversalted but a substantial amount. Most items were barely edible due to this. I came home and my heart was pounding. Avoid this place.  They seem to aim to kill you with salt.

title: Overpriced and over fried
text: Meh, not worth the very handsome price. Everything seems over fried and more like a mess of appetizers than a meal. If it was $15 a person I’d give it a higher rating but  at $70+ a person they leave a LOT to be desired.

title: Fantastic Dinner
text: We loved this except for one dish.  The margarita, chips and salsa, guac, ceviche, quesadilla were all amazing.  The tuna taco was surprisingly not good.  However, I would definitely go back.  Overall, loved it!

title: Very tasty and Great service!
text: Came across the sign online and followed for a while, laughed a lot. While visiting Austin said how about El Aroyo and was disappointed to see the trip advisor rating of 3.5– especially after tasting the Cancun Avocado Plate and the Mezcalita. Great service from Laura! Unpretentious place with good food and clever wit. I’m here to lift that rating and tell you go have fun and eat good there!

title: Funny quotes great service
text: This is a quirky restaurant with funny quotes.  You will want to look up the quotes online.   We went for a weekend lunch and got a table quickly.   The service is prompt and the chips and salsa was good with the a nice heat to the salsa.   We ordered a couple dishes.  One of the dishes was switched with another diner so it had bacon in it.  The wait staff recognized on their own that they had made an error and apologized profusely and offered to it right by bringing out the dish made without the bacon.  It is rare to have that caring and hospitality any more in casual dining.   I was super impressed and would recommend this restaurant without hesitation.  The food itself was very good.  And, yes their quotes on the walls and boards are funny.

title: Bring your appetite
text: Stopped for lunch and was stuffed for the rest of the day! Huge portions, good food, friendly staff. The chicken enchilada soup was my favorite.

title: You just have to see the sign in person!
text: This is literally a small restaurant with a BIG sign! Allow 30-60 min if you plan to eat. Everyone was very friendly. Note: There is no gift shop here. Just a couple of showcases with merch!

title: Fun and Funky Tex Mex
text: The sign is hilarious.  The location has two patios and an interior dining room.  Lots of open air seating for those concerned about disease prevention.  The menu is typical tex mex, with some surprises.  I really enjoyed the green mole and enchiladas.  Zoe was helpful, efficient and eager to be of assistance.  The prices were very reasonable for downtown Austin.

title: Skip Lenoir
text: Take a pass on this venue. We had real looked forward to a very special, upscale, what a big disappointment. First although they said they had a dress code all staff were in jeans. I guess it was supposed to be eclectic but the interior seemed very tired. We wanted to try one of the menu items we saw online but all the menu was the same as the price fixed,but was restaurant week and the entree we wanted was not listed. To start they offered a  half glass of sparkling wine which we declined. My husband asked for Pinot Grigio but they didn't have it. I ordered a blonde in lilet and it arrived, not in the customary highball glass with a slice of orange but in a champagne glass with a slice of lemon. New to me. The crab fingers were good. The squash salad was too spicy and oily for me . The main course tritip  steak they charge $51 for on the menu  was so  tough! The sauce was delicious. The dessert of peaches and sort of a yogurt was overpowered by the mint. Needless to say that 9over $200 dinner could not hold a candle to the many restaurants we have been to in the last month.

title: Wonderful!
text: Absolutely wonderful, staff, wine garden & food all above and beyond. Big thanks to Todd and Jess for making this an exceptional birthday!

title: Strange food, strange people, and even weirder vibe.
text: This place is just strange.  I'm not quite sure what they are going for but unless it's just "weird" they missed the mark.  There were strawberry fritters which were just odd and borderline inedible.  Who serves coffee but only has "whole milk" or "oat milk?  This is just the basics to have down.

title: Trying too hard to be something…
text: The ingredient list on the “shared” plates was so overly complicated that the flavors hit wrong on the palate. Whoever cooked the steak had to have worked in a steakhouse, it was perfectly cooked, perfectly sauced and came out hot. The “best selling” bread with pimento cheese was deconstructed with pimento in one pile and cheese in another. Guys really? We ordered the crudo which was sauced well but the fish was bland. The noodle dish which was so embarrassingly small, luke warm and brown. This your best offering for a vegetarian dish at $14? We sent it back. We eat all over the world, the constant changing of the cutlery and dishes seemed like a cup game to dazzle.

title: Horrible customer service
text: This restaurant should be renamed to BULLY Pizza. I have never witnessed a restaurant owner treat his customers in such an unprofessional and demeaning manner. I had heard rumors about him but got to witness his behavior and bad attitude first hand. The restaurant was completely empty on Saturday afternoon when a group of around 15 high school athletes came in for post tournament meal. He was rude to them and made them stand outside in the cold and rain while he got a table ready. There was plenty of room for them to stand out of the way inside the restaurant. He clearly does not care about his customers. Disgusting leadership.

title: Frog bull
text: Try and try as I  may--this place just has horrible customer service. We have attempted them 3 times! Just not warm and welcoming at all, which is sad and disappointing because they are within walking distance for us.

title: Good Food, Good Vibe
text: We stopped by Frog and the Bull this evening for a quick bite after an event close by...  totally picked the place off of Yelp and my confidence in my fellow Yelpers to be on point.  We were not disappointed!  Frog and the Bull is a modest sized place in a strip mall, nice vibe, folks having a good time at the bar.  Destiny was our waitress, she did a great job, attentive but not intrusive.  Thanks Destiny!  We started the meal with the brussels sprouts on the recommendation of Destiny.  What a winner that dish is!  Sprouts, apples, Manchego cheese, sherry vinegarette reduction and some awesome bacon bits... heaven on a plate!   For entrees, we opted for the pepper-crusted filet, medium rare, and the fish and chips.  Both plates were good.  The filet was cooked perfectly, spot on temperature, and the pepper-crust was a bit overpowering.  Not bad, interesting.  We're more purists when it comes to meat, so the filet itself would likely have been even more delicious.  The sides of asparagus and pasta were okay, a Basque-style potato on the side would have outshined the pasta.    The fish and chips were good.  The fish was fresh, nice batter, served piping hot as it should be.  The fish portion was modest, especially given the price tag.  At that price point ($25), the fish serving should have been twice the size.  The initial serving of "chips" were room temperature at best, but that was quickly remedied by Destiny when brought to her attention.  The truffle fries are darn good when hot!  All in all, a good meal.  A 4-star experience.  The above observations are intended to suggest options for improvements, not criticize.  The "Frog" portion of the restaurant's name is an homage by the owner (a former Navy Seal) to his fallen Navy brethren.  (Note the Navy Seal Trident above the entrance to the kitchen).  Thank you for your service!  We will be back, lots of other stuff to try on the menu.  Recommend Frog and the Bull, nice vibe, good food.

title: Agree with the poor customer service reviews
text: Can’t comment on the food, however, our party of 6 was just told ( perhaps 10-15 minutes ago) that it would be an hour wait, with a shrug. We asked if the 3 four tops were available, , told no.  They did not seem interested in our business, confused and disappointed. Our family  members have lived in Steiner and been members of UT golf club for many years. Won’t be back.

title: Overpriced. Poor service.
text: Service poor- waited 15 minutes for dessert and it was a TINY 2”diameter cheesecake and cost $15.00!!! Ridiculous.  Water glasses never refilled.  Charged full price for cola refills.  Rip off

title: Great Dinner! Great Server!
text: Wonderful Meal, Great Server, and We Enjoyed the Outdoor Seating …  Had dinner here last night, did not have a reservation and the bar area was full. However, we were seated promptly outside, which was our preference. Delightfully friendly server, Anthony (see photo) greeted us and was a definite add to the dining experience — as he knew the menu well, made great recommendations, and was genuinely friendly and eager to please. Thanks Anthony!  Food at this restaurant was well prepared, very tasty, and portion size was satisfying. We started with the grilled artichokes which we had had before and they are fantastic, with a nice aïoli dip. My wife had a vegetable plate and a crab cake. She makes a great crab cake, but admitted that this crab cake may have been better than hers. All crab, no filling. Outstanding! I had a marinated ribeye and baked potato. Both were delicious. Both of us had enough food that we brought home leftovers which I enjoyed for lunch.   Had a latte for dessert which was an exceptionally good cup of coffee, and the Key lime pie was memorable.  A great meal. This is a restaurant we need to go to more often.

title: Birthday treats
text: Delicious artichoke and spinach dip fab rib eye and brownie dessert did not disappoint our friends friends server Stephan was a joy thankyou

title: Birthday luncheon
text: With an old coworker was a wonderful time because the food here is so delicious & the atmosphere lively. We want to thank Jordan M who was truly lovely & made our time even more joyful,

title: Decent food and service, neither are special.
text: Decent food and service, neither are special.   We arrived at 6 PM with a 6 PM reservation and were asked to wait.  At 6:15 we were seated.  Service was fast and cordial, but not rushed.    I ordered a Cheeseburger ($22) without mayo and my Wife had the Sashimi Tuna Salad ($29).  The burger was actually good and cooked as requested.  It is served with a plate full of fries which are probably good if hot but mine were cold.   My Wife enjoyed the Tuna which is seared on the sides so not technically Sashimi but rather Seared Tuna.   We shared a Key Lime Pie ($10) which was good but small so we should have gotten two.  All of the food is overpriced but most restaurants are these days.

title: Amazing Evening
text: I want to tell you about an amazing evening I had at Bartlett's Restaurant.        My husband and I have been going to Bartlett's for years, so when he died I wanted to spend a quiet evening by myself ordering our favorite menu.  The food was its usual delicious!      The wait staff Paul, Patrick, Dave and Gabe were wonderful!!  They didn't hover but seemed to be there serving at exactly the right time and say the right things.  The manager was quietly aware...      At the end of my evening I felt blessed.  I got a hug from Gabe and a wonderful memory for life!!   The managers were Eric, Aric and Brent.                                                                                                 Thanks so much for the memories!                                                                                               Susan Lowell, May 1, 2023

title: Harding Presidential Sites
text: We had a great visit to the Warren G Harding Presidential Library and Memorial. The Library (aka Museum) is quite small compared to other presidential libraries, but does a good job telling the story of Harding's short presidency. Tours of his home are only offered on the hour, so we had to miss that, but did take photos from the outside. We also visited the Harding Memorial in the cemetery, which was quite impressive. If you're passing by Marion, Ohio, take a break from your drive and stop by to see the presidential sites.

title: We watched a short film at the museum prior to the tour
text: Our guide was Theodore, he did an excellent job sharing his knowledge of Warren Harding and Florence- marriage, campaign and presidency. The tour started on the porch where his Porch Campaign took place. The house furnishings are over 90% original. NO Pictures allowed which is sad for my personal journey ablum. The museum has nice exhibits with a couple audios. Enjoyed watching the pictures taken on the Voyage of Understanding tour to the western states and Alaska. Purchase tickets on-line because we were shocked how the first 3 tours were fully booked. We changed our itinerary to make a late afternoon tour. Large parking lot. Restrooms on site.

title: Museum and House Tour Make this a fun Visit
text: A visit to this presidential library comprises three potential activities.  First, there is an hour long tour of his house.  Second, the main building includes a small exhibition of his time as President.  Lastly, a mile from the library is his memorial.  We spent just under two hours here.

title: Learning at the Warren G. Harding Presidential Sites
text: Great trip. We arrived at approximately 9:30 am and made our way towards the entrance of the museum. After paying the admission fee, we received a quick overview of the site and went on our way. We opted to view some of the outdoor exhibits first, which included the guard house and press house. The press house contained multiple informational plaques about President Hardings wife and her contributions to society. After viewing the press house, we made our way to the front porch of the house, where we waited for the 10 am guided hour tour to begin. There were guided tours of the presidents former house being held every hour throughout the day. The guided tour of the house was very informational, and the tour guide took us from room to room, while pointing out interesting features and artifacts out for display. The tour guide told us several personal stories related to the Hardings time at the house. The guided tour lasted roughly 1 hour.  After viewing the house, we went back inside to view the main exhibits. We opted to watch a short documentary about President Hardings life and some of the trials and tribulations he faced during his time as President. There were multiple informational plaques out for display, many of them quite text heavy, that went into detail about Hardings upbringing and roots as the owner of a newspaper company in Marion. The plaques also talked about election day, and several of the policy’s Harding implemented while in office. The last section of the museum dealt with his death and some controversial issues that surrounded his presidency. There were multiple artifacts out for display in the museum, along with short video clips that related to President Harding's time in office.  Tip: I recommend spending 3 hours here if you truly want to see everything.

title: Worth the visit!!!
text: I was very impressed with the Warren G. Harding Presidential Sites.  We took the tour of his house, and listened first hand from the tour guides all about when Harding gave speeches on the "front porch".  The house is stunning and is 90+ percent original from years ago when Warren and his wife Florence lived in the house.  The tour guides can answer any questions you have off the top of their heads.  The  Library & Museum was finished in the spring of 2021 and they have a nice gift shop in there too.  They spared no expense in the construction of the building - it is beautiful!!!!  If you are a history buff, this is a must do.
